column6: Excellent! Loved the atmosphere, simplicity, and elegance of the small space. The food was excellent and the hostess pleasant and endearing.

Loved the whole experience! Worth the price - and a different kind of omakase experience. Very friendly staff too!

I would have given this place a 5 star. But me and my friend did have a stomachache after dinner. Wished that didn't happen. Besides that Everything was great! It's super simple. Each piece of the meat they seasoned it differently. If you do not like meat then this place is not for you. They cook it like a hot pot in front of you and then they dip it in a sauce for you to eat.

A great experience having shabushabu cooked and served one bite at a time. The beef melts in the mouth. High quality meat and yummy!!
No comment

No comment

Food was decent with many sauce. The beef was good from Miyazaki. Uni wasn't too fresh. Wonton was very standard. The tea was $4 and there isn't a refilled. Seaweed wasn't crispy. The environment is good. Expect to spend $148 per person, plus tax and tip, you should expect to spend $200. I came as a party of 2 so total spending is $400
No comment

The wagyu beef and sauce pairings were delicious - so succulent and juicy. You just want more of each bite. Whether it was the a5 wagyu beef, the American style wagyu or the pork belly, each bite was well thought out and worth savoring. The one reason this didn't merit 5 stars was the service. I mentioned my egg allergy at the start of the meal, and they highlighted the two dishes that could be an issue. They didn't really offer substitutions - just provided me with the dish sans egg. That was fine - until we got to the dessert, which was ice cream. It was one small scoop, and I ate most of it when the telltale tingling and swelling in my throat started. I asked the server if there was egg in the ice cream and she said yes. Suffice it to say, this was not the best way to end the meal. My husband was upset because this was our anniversary dinner, but fortunately, I was able to throw up my most recent bites. The servers expressed very little concern or remorse. And we paid and left. It's fortunate for them that I don't have a more severe allergy (worst is an upset stomach and hives). They had no way of knowing that, but for the amount you're paying and experience they're aiming to give you, you'd think they'd do a little more on the service side of things, especially when they made an error that could have ruined a celebratory evening.
No comment
No comment
This is the most innovative and fun Shabu Shabu experience by far. The quality and favors are magnificent. Being the first Shabu Shabu Omakase and to have this quality of execution is just superb.

Like the other review mention, service was great but it didn't have much variety.  It felt repetitive after the 5th dish.  I was expecting some fish or odd meat in between.. it's worth a try nonetheless
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This 20 course omakase is $150 a head and super delicious but somewhat overwhelming. Each course is delicately prepared in front of you and is the perfect bite each time. I got super full and fatigued near the end though with the amount of wagyu. It's honestly a lot of food for omakase but $150 seems a bit steep if you compare it to Hyun, which is ayce wagyu bbq at $135 pp. Very cool experience though, worth a try!

Overall, I liked this restaurant, but I thought it was overpriced for what it is.   The Omakase style for shabu shabu is an interesting approach, but, again, I am not sure the level of artistry was there to justify $145 per person.  For example the Uni appetizer was a little one-note and needed a little brightness to balance it out.  Same comment with the shabu shabu hand roll.  The noodles at the end of the meal would have been better if served with a broth.

Shabu shabu omakase! Get your wagyu, washugyu, pork, all served with different flavors in 2.5 hours. They serve each piece individually so you get to really taste the flavors. Service is attentive and the counter is so clean and spacious. I love places with set menus so you don't have to think about what you want. Just go.
No comment
great service! The food was amazing! Would definitely recommend if you'd like to treat yourself and your loved one for a nice treat :)

Tasting menu + Shabushabu don't usually run in the same sentence. I've come here multiple times and have to say it's one of the most unique and best meals on New York. Have taken multiple friends and they love it! Highly recommend.

So far it's my favorite restaurant this year. If you love wagyu, 100% recommended. Just look at the texture of their wagyu, it's really A5 quality. Also the tasting experience is very unique. They prepare each single course so you don't need to worry if the beef will be overcooked. It was an amazing dinner
Perfect from beginning to end! A lovely and unique menu and excellent service! It was our second time there and it did not disappoint!

Very unpleasure experience. Waitress are rude and unprofessional. There are one hour remaining between two section. They were just keep telling you that you are fell behind and give you whatever they are finished.They don't care if you are ready for the next dish or not. Customer won't like to have a unpleasure meal for $200+.
No comment

Hands down MY FAVORITE shabu spot ever!!! The whole experience was super unique and personal. The place is very clean and due to covid they are only doing 2 seatings for dinner with 3 ppl max per night. Make sure you make a reservation!! Our waitress served and cooked us every single dish right in front of us. The quality is superb. All beef are wagyu and they feed you in 14 different ways! I have had a lot of shabu but I never had a shabu omakase like this! You also get a homemade soba in the end and omg that ice cream... everything was made to perfection. We left with a full stomach and felt like we were in Japan! Thanks for the top notch service. Can't wait to come back already!!

Such a unique experience. It is very expensive so I don't know how often I'll be coming again, but it is certainly worthwhile to try it at least once. The meat was absolutely sublime. The Japanese omelette in broth was another standout dish. Truly a dining experience unlike any other!
No comment
No comment

One of the best dining experiences out there. Each piece is crafted with such care and everything tastes out of this world. The amount of flavors you will experience in this meal is insane. All around a great treat for a celebration of any kind since the price is a bit steep but COMPLETELY worth it. Run. Don't walk.
It was a pleasant surprise, the food was exquisite and service was excellent  - I'd preferred a table seating than counter seating
Each bite is fantastic. Wagyu melts in your mouth. A very intimate dining experience, overall worth the price for a special night.

All around amazing experience. Both wagyu was amazing, loved the innovative take on serving shabu shabu. Service was amazing, only 2 seatings per time slot. A very intimate setting, great place for a date!

One of a kind shabu shabu restaurant in NYC and I'm so glad I discovered it and gave it a shot. Very unique experience and top of the line quality cuts of meat. During Covid, they are taking 1 private party at a time so you get a very personal experience as the waitress prepares the whole meal piece by piece. All the different courses were full of unami flavor. The pictures don't do it justice; you will leave full and very satisfied.  Highly recommend you visit, if you are a fan of shabu!

I'm so lucky because in this period of time I am the only customer, and we have table service only for us! The table service is there has a waitress helps you to cook for your Shabu-Shabu ! Totally has 20 dishes, and each of the dish has their own tastes. Very nice and full after the meal. 165 dollars per person is totally worthy to try because the service and dishes are so nice. Overall it's a very nice experience!
No comment

FANCY SHABU SHABU! I came here to celebrate my boyfriends birthday and the meal was phenomenal. We've been wanting to try this place for a while now and I'm so glad we did. So it's a whole course where the chef prepares the meat and food for you and then puts it into your plate so all you have to do is bring it to your mouth. They do it in front of you and you get to watch them swishing the meat into the water. The first piece of rib eye was mouth watering. It melts in your mouth and they cook it at a low temperature so it's not hot when you put it in your mouth but just right. Literally my eyes widened when I had the first piece and I was just craving for more. Every piece was amazing and went above my expectations. They started us off with a cup of sake and then moved into the salmon shiokara which was a little too fermented for my taste and i had 2 pieces of bone in it but after that it was a straight highway of heaven. My favorite piece was the first meat one with the A5 Miyazaki wagyu rib eye and then my second favorite is the washugyu rib eye with the blue cheese, fig sauce, balsamic sauce. This piece was very interesting because the combination worked so well and really left my mouth salivating even afterwards. I left the meal full and so satisfied. Would definitely recommend to try this place out and they do indoor dining so reserve and enjoy being taken care of!

Came back again and tried their winter 2019 menu. It's pretty much the same shabu shabu items but the appetizers changed slightly. Service is suser attentive and Mayu and her staff are very friendly. Food is amazing and they just put so much care and thought into their menu.

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: New Yorkers are blessed with the excellence of the beef and service at this quiet and small shabu shabu experience. From the delicate presentation of the 'goods' to the single serve bites of Heaven. What a treat to be served every single mouthful of a shabu shabu meal. I would've called it crazy but I am absolutely enjoying myself as I write this review only halfway through the service. The properly measured out temperature of each beef 'bite' is truly a science worth studying which Mayumon clearly has perfected. The in-between dishes of enoki mushrooms, or mozzarella wonton show the creativity and care that has gone into the preparation of this meal, not to mention the flavorful blue cheese and balsamic Wagyu sauce. My favorite 'unique' item being the Wagyu temaki, a rice roll with seaweed and the best beef. Each bite is calculated and balanced. How does one make a bite last longer? You will find yourself asking this very question as you taste the tender Miyazaki Wagyu melt in your mouth at the perfect temperature of bliss. Don't take my word for it and come treat yourself to a journey of exploration for your taste buds.
Honestly, one of the best meals of life. Every piece of the meal blew my mind and the service was great. Certainly a one of a kind experience.
Absolutely fenomenal. One of my favorite places to go. Will not disappont! The chef is attentive and food is superb.

A truly spiritual experience, she has proven that even during these times we can still enjoy food that is cooked with love and passion, transporting us to an hour and a half of bliss. Could not recommend this place more. Thank you!
Amazing orchestrated experience and an adventurous journey of creative flavor combinations all beautiful and soft and plated artfully.

It was an extremely unpleasant experience. The waitress was very rude and gave incorrect cancellation info compared with what is presented on their website. When we made the reservation via Yelp, there was nothing about full charge for cancellation. We got there late for 18 minutes and we were told if it passed 15 minutes they would not serve any of the appetizers on the menu but we would be charged for the full amounts in a very harsh tone. They also said since we were late, they had the right to charge full and didn't serve at all but they were showing empathy to let us dine in. The truth is I didn't even have any card to hold the reservation, which basically means they couldn't charge me if I cancelled. Also, I checked back their website after dining with them, it was 20 minutes in stead of 15 minutes late that there would be chance they wouldn't serve the appetizers. After 30 minutes, they would charge full for no show. I understand the no show/late policy, but their attitude made me feel I did something extremely wrong and should be punished for it. The food was okay and like most of other comments here OVERPRICED. If you are interested in Wagyu beef, there are lots of options in town with better service and price. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone and would ask anyone to avoid at any cost.
Love this place, it's a different take on shabushabu.  It's a lot more fusion than I thought it would be, but it was still very good. Great staffs! Super friendly

Wow, shabushabu Mayumon was truly brilliant. It was very reasonably priced. After going through the reviews I bought Salmon Shiokara, and it was so terrific, it is now my favorite dish. The team was really pleasant and service is fabulous. shabushabu Mayumon is hands down the best of the best in this area.
No comment
Personally I am a fan of Sukiyaki, but this Shabu Shabu is really a unique experience.  The Beef, the sauce, the rice, they are all excellent!
Such ethereal food.  Different menu than the original but apparently just as good.  Quite the experience.
A perfect experience. The setting, the ambiance, the service, and OF COURSE the food, were all amazing. Could not recommend this place enough. Will be back again soon!

We chose this restaurant to celebrate our 29th wedding anniversary.  It was the best decision!  Chef Mayu welcomed us by name and offered a delicious glass of champagne on the house to start us off on an exceptional dining experience.  The personal attention we received from her and her assistant as they prepared each dish in front of us was an added delight.  Each item on the menu was delicious and beautifully presented.  I loved the dishes and glasses that were used to serve our meal.  Mayumon's loveliness just emanated and added additional "umami" to the food.  We also enjoyed the Japanese rice beer and sake drinks that were offered on the menu.  We've been to other fine dining restaurants around the world, but I would have to say this was definitely one of our top experiences.  If you are wondering if you should make a reservation, stop overthinking it and just do it.  This is a unique Omakase-style Shabu Shabu experience that I highly recommend without hesitation.
This was an amazing experience! Every course was really special, the atmosphere was superb and the service was 5 stars. Worth every dollar! Highly recommend!
The service is excellent. We were the only table at the time and the food was excellent. Willing to go back again
Very satisfying meat eating experience. Excellent cooking skill. The chef noticed my low tolerance of wasabi from the appetizer and asked me how much I want every time afterwards.

Family had a unique, delicious dinner experience at this wonderful, quaint, intimate restaurant.  Each delicate piece of food (!) was prepared and presented to us with great attention to detail, taste, and service.  Limited seating so very very special.  Definately recommend and will be back!

I came here with a friend and we nearly cried at how amazing every single bite of the food was. It was so good that not even a month later, I made my partner come with me so that I could come eat it again. From the first bite of the first appetizer item to the extensive shabu shabu to the ice cream at the end, truly one of the best dining experiences I've ever had. I'll say it for the third time - I fervently wish Chef Mayu's hojicha ice cream was for sale, because I would hoard it and eat it every day.

Had a thoroughly enjoyable experience at this restaurant for my wife's birthday last week. This is a new location which we chose due to the impossibility of getting into their first restaurant. We were one of only two couples there, I think because the first seating is. early, 5:30PM. Two women prepared dishes for the four of us behind the counter--fun food theatre. It's a somewhat leisurely process due to some of the prep times for certain items on the omakase menu. Fresh, very high quality ingredients. Really was a nice, different dining experience. Highly recommended!

Incredible food, friendly and warm yet sophisticated service by Mayu and her trained stuff! Simply yet deeply flavored mushroom, Yuba uni appetizer are outstanding, A5 wagyu beef and washu gyu are extremely silky and juicy, especially A5 Miyazaki hand roll is just awesome... Even I have never experienced this Shabushabu OMAKASE style in Japan, everybody should have this amazing experience, Highly recomend!!

Amazing restaurant. Really love the vibe of the place. The food is really awesome like GOEMON(Alternative juicy healthy curry spot) it is really healthy with the ingredients on it being put. The staff really works well because of their positive attitudes towards it's customers. Very vibrant place.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Very appreciative of having this gem in the neighborhood! I've eaten many pierogis in my lifetime, and also made some myself. This place just makes the best pierogis. The dough is rolled out so thin, they are very delicate. Love the simple potato and always add in either sauerkraut or onions. A real treat.
No comment
This place turned out to be a very very happy accident.  I absolutely loved everything ordered.  We tried a variety of pierogies and loved them all.  Cannot wait to go back!

Great spot for lunch! My boyfriend and I came on a weekend and tried the pan fried baba's potato pierogis with smoked bacon bits, jalapeño pierogis (which were actually my favorite) and kielbasy sliders with cucumber salad. Everything was delicious.
No comment

No comment
No comment

Order was almost an hour late. No call. I call and she tells me there was a mix up. Sorrry. Now im eating dinner at 10 and the poor delivery person had to wait an hour for their mistake. I said , " did you at least feed the poor guy." Of all the restaurants in Brooklyn, chose a different one.
Excellent pierogies & kielbasy. The wine was bad wine. Nice atmosphere. Service was great!

Amazing pierogies! Must try the truffle one! All of them are delicious? My problem is I can't decide on which one I like better! And they offer a fried option as well! I forgot to take photos but definitely a must try!
No comment
Simply YUM!  The perogies were delicious and the service was great.
Everything was amazing and the staff was so warm and friendly. If we're in the area, will probably stop and grab some pierogies
No comment
No comment
Delicious. Love the Spinach and Feta with caramelized onion and the sweet Chocolate Pierogies.

The food was cold when it arrived...The waiter has filthy long dirty nails and it makes eating there a relatively disgusting experience. I would encourage staff to practice all safety measures, shower clean and cut nails and to wear gloves. The bathroom is absolutely beyond a public gas station. Filthy and I am sure poop stains on the floor violate health codes. Once served, the food was tasty but cold.
No comment
No comment

A small restaurant specializing in pierogis. Outside seating only; limited to three tables. Choose your choice of pierogis done one of two ways: boiled with brown butter and chives OR fried.  My friend and I had the bacon cheddar boiled and jalapeno fried. Great tasting pierogis; creamy smooth mashed potatos inside with chunks of jalapeños or bacon in them. Numerous toppings and dips to top off your pierogis. However, we really wanted the pierogis to shine for themselves for a first time order. I could see myself returning frequently to try more and indulge in timeless choices.
Delicious! An easy, casual spot for lunch or dinner with top notch pierogies. The staff is always super friendly too.
No comment
Great online ordering system. I really enjoyed the bacon and cheddar pierogies with sour cream while my husband liked the spinach with feta. Parking was easy to find outside.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Such great pierogies! Loved that they had so many vegan options and were very accommodating with food allergies. Will be going back to get some frozen pierogies to bring them home!

I stopped in 5 minutes before closing (not knowing they were closing) and the gentleman (Nick) at the door kindly informed me of my timing but offered me takeout which I accepted. I ordered the pan fried Bacon Cheddar pierogies and they came out about 10-15 minutes later. I took them back to my hotel about 5 minutes away and they were still nice and hot. They were ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. The flavor profile is what I was looking for so I am satisfied. Thank you so much! Amazing little hole in the wall gem. I'll be back next time I am in town (hopefully in a couple weeks)
No comment
Hidden gem!!! Went there with my partner when we were staying in Brooklyn. Got two orders of pierogis and a sloppy kielbasa sandwich. Both were excellent.
No comment
Doing a great job w outdoor seating! Feels like a German beer garden but with awesome food! Highly recommend boiled potato or fried spinach feta Pierogies! Yumm!!

5 stars for the best perogies I've ever tasted and I'm of Ukrainian heritage. Some of the other food is good but not quite as fabulous but it doesn't matter because those perogies could make up for anything. Don't bother with the fancy toppings, they just cover up the tender dough and delicious fillings. I like the farmers cheese and potato, the spinach and feta and the blueberry dessert perogies are delicious too!
Delicious pierogies! Food is great för takeout and the place is also really cute for dining in. Staff was friendly. Not the cheapest but worth it. My favorite was the boiled jalapeño pierogies.
Very bland food. Not bad, but no flavor. Nice people though. Cute place to eat, if you like neutral food.

I'm so thankful that I was able to go support this local business today. The pierogis were so wonderful and delicious. I'd definitely recommend getting them boiled over fried since I think you were able to taste the flavors more when boiled. The service was also excellent. Definitely hope to return again soon!
I think there are the best pierogis in Brooklyn! Super fresh and orders ready quickly.
No comment
Stopped here on a whim, and so glad we did. The pierogies were by far the best we've ever had (and we've had a lot). Such a great place and can't wait to come back.
No comment

Best pierogies I have ever had. I dream about the pan fried potato and cheddar topped with caramelized onion.  It makes me sad I do not live closer. Other options are also quite tasty.  My husband loves the bacon ones. Try it. You will be glad you did.

Sooooo good every time!!!! Deffff love coming here anytime I'm in the neighborhood great to eat and sit down or even to go. Their pierogies are my fav. Love the jalapeño and cheese fried. Soooooooo good. Highly recommend
Perfect lunch spot! Quick service and pierogis were nice and crisp with lots of filling.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really enjoyed these pierogies, as did my picky Russian wife. Looking forward to going back and trying a few more varieties. Did an online order for pickup and it was ready really quickly. Highly recommend.
I am so grateful I came here today, everything is so incredible! I can sum it up in two words. GO HERE!!!
No comment
No comment
Freaking amazing. Tried them all loved them all. Especially the blueberry. I highly recommend this place just like grandma used to make.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Baba's was SO good. Exceeded my expectation. The food was good, service was good, and great prices. They also have great outdoor seating. Can't wait to come back.

I had pierogies a few times and was never impressed but those were amazing. Super fresh and hot, filled with one of the best Mac and cheese I've ever had. Great combined with Creme fraiche as well. You need to try!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I think this is my first 5 Star rating and it is specifically for the fresh potato and cheese pierogi. Hand made per order with a light and cheesy filling, they are the...  BEST PIEROGIES IN BROOKLYN!  I will write more about these pierogis and why I am qualified to rate them
Kielbasy sliders are to die for. Bacon n cheddar fried pierogi great. Service excellent, so nice. Great local feel and spotlessly clean restaurant.

This spot is amazing. Been planning on coming for years and finally made it - their outdoor dining set up is GREAT, very sturdy and offers privacy from traffic. I was blown away by the Pierogies. We ordered the Mac and cheese, bacon and cheddar, spinach and ricotta pan fried and potato cheese boiled and finished in 10 minutes flat. Finally, we ordered the crunchy chocolate Pierogies and it blew my socks off. The most scrumptious combination of Nutella and homemade whipped cream. I literally can't remember when I was totally satisfied from a meal but Baba's definitely hit the spot. Cannot wait to come back!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Baba's is one of my favorite spots for comfort food in the city. The service is always super friendly and the pierogies are incredible. Perfect filling to wrapper ratio! A tad pricey, but you won't mind it once you taste the food...The potato & cheese is the best, IMO. Tasty beer, too.
No comment

I have been wanting to try Baba's for a while and was finally in the area on a Saturday night. It was busier than I would have thought and we waited about 10-15 minutes for a table for two (ending up sitting at the counter tops in the back). We ordered three 5-piece pierogies - bacon, cheese, potato; sauerkraut and mom's favorite (ricotta), all pan fried. Our favorite was the bacon cheese potato but what really made them was the onions and sour cream - so good!!! The dough was thinner than I'm used to and some of the fillings were coming out when they were served. Overall not my favorite pierogi I've had in the city, but there are some fun flavors that make me want to come back and try more. We wanted to try to dessert ones but we're too full so we'll definitely have to come back for those. Service was good and food was served quickly and we were on our way!
No comment
No comment

Worthy of infinite revisits! Well, if you are watching your waistline maybe not.... These freshly made pockets of deliciousness are consistently flavorful and filling. Stuffed with potatoes, cheese, bacon, jalapenos - all kinds of goodies - they are not particularly healthy but man are they great! As others have indicated, best to opt for the larger portion, more bang for your buck. And while all of the fried orders arrive with sour cream, I recommend you splurge and get yourself BOTH the homemade applesauce as well as Helen's sauce as side dipping options (both are excellent and compliment the pierogies differently). I've been twice, once packed (had to wait over an hour to sit) and once empty (seated immediately). So it seems it's best to just try your luck. Staff was very friendly and accommodating both times. The ambiance is also lovely, very clean. The walls are decorated with maps, photos and historical information and you can actually see into the kitchen and watch the dumplings being crafted. Very cool.

I came here for dinner on a Sunday.  The place is on 3rd Avenue so there's not much foot traffic.  The place seemed cute and there's a lot of seating if you want to dine in.  I wanted to do take out.  They cook them to order so it took about 5-10 min. I ordered a large order of boiled spinach and feta pierogies.  You can order regular (5 pierogies) or large (9 pierogies).  Also, you can order the pierogies fried or boiled.  It was still warm when I opened it at home.  I really appreciated the fresh chives they sprinkled on top.  The pierogies were delicious and very filling.  I would come back and try their other flavors.
No comment

Rude service, unwelcoming but good food if you can tolerate bad service. Spent $200 and was barely offered water. Asking what kind of lemonade was pushing it too far. Was in to celebrate my daughters graduation and were treated horribly. We were the only ones in the restaurant.
No comment
No comment

Ordered some pierogies to go with a side of onion and sour cream and almost cried while eating them. It brought back some much childhood memories from when my neighbor used to give them to me. They are freshly made and very enjoyable I definitely will be back for more!!! The staff is super friendly and very professional

If you are in Brooklyn and want a good Slovakian meal, this is the place to go. The perogies were amazing. We tried the feta spinach, potato cheese, jalepeno cheese, sauerkraut, and chocolate! All of them were great. We bought a side of horseradish and carmelized onions to go with everything, they added so much flavor. The beer and cider were great too. Everything is fresh and delicious.  We even had to come a second day we liked them so much. Don't be fooled by how small the menu seems. Each perogie is very different and has its own unique flavor. I wish I could go back and try all the perogies they had, but it'll have to wait till next time I'm in New York!

Friendly family owned spot! Pierogies were super good! We got the spinach ones boiled and mac n cheese ones pan fried! We preferred the spinach ones! Love that they specialize in pierogies! We want to try the other flavors!
No comment

This review is for vegetarians and vegans. Babas is ultra vegetarian friendly with 7 of 8 main pierogi dishes being vegetarian friendly. I got the jalepeno cheddar and cheese as well as the spinach feta and they were amazing. Both the boiled and fried versions were ultra flavorful and tasty. The carmalized onion and mushroom toppings are also a must try! The prices are also pretty affordable for NYC and service was ultra fast. For vegans Babas may not be as friendly as I believe only the saurkraut is vegan friendly (you may have to ask to make sure it is not cooked with animal products).
The best pierogis ever! They are so light and delicate, yum yum yum! The service is excellent as well.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Since I no longer live in the East Village, I don't get to Veselka as often. So, this is where I get my pierogi fix. Try yours w/ the homemade apple sauce, fried onions and Helen's dip...you'll thank me. Cute, light, airy interior. Don't go though, the place is already popular enough.
I'm a fan of the jalapeño cheddar and mac n cheese. But it certainly feels like an unhealthy diet, primarily serving as munchy food for me.

I can't find the yelp page for their Williamsburg food court location. Came here for the first time a few days ago. I was super impressed watching them make the handmade pierogi. I haven't seen someone make it work like that since my Polish 'babcia' grandmother back in the 90's. These pierogi aren't too thick, which I find can be an issue a lot of the time. Fried to perfection, oh my god. We tried the Spinach feta, bacon cheddar, vegan jalapeño, classic potato, and those schnitzel balls!!! Wow wow wow I have no words- so delicious, all of it. The service is exceptional too, the guy who was behind the counter and made all of the pierogi was so kind- we even got to try the dessert chocolate pierogi complimentary! I'm gonna be back. Will totally be coming to the Carol Gardens location soon.
No comment

This was my first experience for pierogies so i didnt have a benchmark to compare them against as, loved them. We ordered the spinach feta, with mushroom on the side, potato one and few other ones, service was quick and order was perfectly cook. I have already visited this location thrice, will be coming again soon if it wasnt too out of my way.

Super cute decor, very friendly service, and delicious pierogies. Tried the jalapeño (mashed with potatoes and cheddar) and the spinach & feta pierogies -- both delicious, especially with a big pint of Czechvar.
No comment
The perogies are delicious! They even have chocolate filled perogies with fresh made whip cream. I could of kept eating them.

This is by far the best pierogies I've had in the US. I got some for an event, and we got one tray each of potato and cheese, spinach and feta, and chocolate. The chocolate came with whipped cream which was awesome, and I really enjoyed the potato and cheese. I like these pierogies because the skin is chewy and the inside is creamy, and it's really tasty. The chocolate one was fried, and since we got it delivered, the skin unfortunately was hard by the time we got it; I'd imagine it's much better if I had it at the restaurant itself. The chocolate one wasn't too sweet either which I appreciated. The potato and cheese was really creamy inside, and it was super tasty, a crowd favorite. The spinach and feta flavor was quite strong, but the balance between the spinach and feta was good. These three trays along with delivery was $130, and each tray had 25 pierogies. Price is a bit high, but quality was good; I would definitely consider them again for catering!
No comment
Awesome blueberry pierogis. Potato pancakes were just okay...too much onion I'd say. Mac and cheese fries pierogis are always amazing. What a great idea.
No comment

Ordered the boiled potato and cheese pierogies, pan fried spinach and feta pierogies, and grilled kielbasy.  The potato and cheese ones were excellent tasting, as boiled was probably the better option for my liking.  Kielbasy was great and the sauerkraut was a good complement.  Service was quick and helpful with menu questions.
Yummy. Clean simple inside, good service, freshly made pierogies.  Delicious- even the dessert ones!
Really enjoyed the Pierogies. I got Sauerkraut Pierogies boiled  with mushrooms and potato and cheese pan fried. They were delicious and the service was great.

I came here on a Thursday night about an hour before it closed. They had a pretty cool assortment of Pierogies and I was happy the staff was helpful in my making a decision. We wound up with the cheese and jalapeño versions, both delicious. I have never had a pierogie made with so much care. The outside pasta shell was soft without being too firm or mushy. The presentation was also nice with some slivered scallions. They weren't cheap, but they were delicious. It cost around $20 for 10 pirogues and the additional sees of sour cream and applesauce. They were both the most expensive as well as the most delicious pirogues I have ever had!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Omgg this place is heaven! My friend and I were craving Pierogies and this place did not disappoint! We got the pan seared potato and cheese as well as the jalapeño cheddar. And then we got the Nutella filled ones for desserts. SO good and they were generous with the caramelized onion topping.

Tasty pierogies in a cute space in Brooklyn. For two people sharing, we went with two small orders of pierogies (5 in each order) - one more classic flavor, the sauerkraut, and one more unusual, the jalapeño cheddar. Both were delicious and I recommend smothering one in caramelized onions and also trying the dip (with sriracha) on the side. Side of beet salad made me feel a tiny bit better getting some veggies in. All in all, a fun place to try some unique, homemade pierogies although prices are high and I'd still rather hit up the Polish restaurants in Greenpoint.
Great spot. I've never been, just ordered delivery. The food is consistent and very yummy. Try the jalapeño ones. Also... service is super super friendly.
No comment

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! What else is there to say. The staff is friendly and the damn pierogies must be made by ANGELS! The only down side is I probably gained another 15 pounds by shoving these in my mouth twice a week.
I really love Pierogies.  While I found it pricy, I tried to keep perspective and remember that this is NYC... er Brooklyn.  Great people, with great smiles from the kitchen!

I'm sitting here with Fleetwood Mac softly playing in the clean and bright dining area of this little restaurant. It's snowing outside and the restaurant is perfectly cozy.  I ordered fried jalapeno and cheddar Perogis with horseradish dip, creamy delicious with just the right amount of crispy chew!  The boys in the young family across from me are loving the mac and cheese Perogis!  Their mom is happy with the classic potato and cheese.  So glad I stopped in.  Perfect late afternoon lunch, thank you Baba!  I have to come back and try the feta spinach.  I also hear the blueberry Perogis are delicious for dessert.  I'll be back soon.  Give them a try! You'll be glad you did.
Honestly I loved all of them. Favorite was maybe max and cheese fried and spinach boiled. Good service too. I was filled after eating 5. Reasonable prices. Would return!!

column3: Old Bridge, Old Bridge Township, NJ
column6: Best pierogies 100% and Im definitely not biased because my cousin owns it. Get the bacon cheddar pierogies and make sure to come in when the pumpkin and birthday cake ones are in season!!!

Ummmm, I don't want to leave! I have never been a Pierogies fan.... buuuuuuut these taste like heaven. We had the jalapeño, sauerkraut, spinach & feta and the potato..... pluuuus the kielbasa.... SO DAMN GOOD!

What a blessing to have comfort food so close to my lodging! Their Pierogies are perfection. This trip I tried Mom's Fav, Bacon Ceddar, Chocoalte and the limited edition Birthday cake. Take out only due to the pandemic but to eat in must feel like you are right at home. In the short time it took to pick up my order they made me feel right at home and so taken care of! The owner gifted me with an adorable pierogie magnet since I was in town as a nurse. No chance this will be my only visit while stationed here!
No comment
A really fun and delicious spot. I had the Sauerkraut Pierogies and the Jalapeño Pierogies. Both so tasty!

Super cute place and restaurant concept. Fun variety of fillings for pierogies-- loved the mac and cheese one. Their golden beet salad and cucumber salad are tasty and refreshing pairings. Their sliders with sausage are so stinking cute and delicious. Waitress was very nice as well. I look forward to coming back and trying their other options.
So yummy! Growing up with my Slovakian grandparents, pierogies were a part of dinner. These were delicious and authentic. Try the non-traditional ones too! You can't go wrong with any of them!
No comment

Delicious! Not the traditional Eastern European pierogi flavors but they're really great! Tried spinach and feta, bacon and cheddar and crunchy chocolate. The kielbasa was good as well (for some reason they called it grilled kielbasy (?) which is plural but you only get one :)
No comment

Mmmm just thinking of their perogies makes me hungry. They are little pockets of happiness. I like them pan fried more than boiled and love their spinach feta most. For a potato filling the bacon and jalapeno are both good choices too! The people that work here are the sweetest.
No comment

Spinach and feta cheese pierogies are so so so good! Cucumber salad was also delicious. The environment is very pleasant, the design is thoughtful; totally a nice place to sit for a quick lunch or to just stop in and grab great food.
Ohhhhhhh this place is delicious. Must go for dine in or take out pierogies in Brooklyn.

Holy Pierogie. Every time I go to Baba's I am delightfully surprised by the level of exceptionality that their crispy capsule of dough with enriched gooey filling has. Each flavor of pierogie is absolutely astounding (I mean I've only tried 3 flavors, but each is like a flavor BOMB). I recommend getting every style fried, and getting apple sauce and sauerkraut as toppings. When dessert rolls around you must order the chocolate 'rogies. The chocolate, which I presume is Nutella oozes out and is delightfully warm. The savory quality of the dough balances out the sweetness of the Nutella. The coolness of the whipped cream pairs perfectly with the warm bundle of joy. I'm sure the blueberry pierogies are just as yummy, but I do not like cooked fruit, so I tend to steer clear.
No comment
Need to stop for some of Helen's Pierogies if you are nearby ... or in Bay Ridge & want pierogies. Ahh. Baba's.
No comment
No comment

Best pierogies I've ever had (and I used to live in Greenpoint). Light years above and beyond anywhere else I've been in the city. So delicious and a cute little shop to enjoy them in. I go every time I'm in the neighborhood.
No comment
No comment

Ah, Pierogies. I only ever had them from a polish friend of mine years ago. One weeknight I happen to have free time in Brooklyn and ended up finding this place on yelp so I decided to give it a try. The place is warm and inviting and has cute photos hanging on the walls, they probably have a story behind them but I had no time to ask. The man who took my order was very welcoming and gave me a few ideas on what to get. I wanted to try as much as I could so I got their jalapeño and potato & cheese pierogies. You could get them boiled or pan fried. Then I went ahead and got the chocolate dessert piergoie. All of them to go. A lady there let me taste her pan fried mac & cheese piergoie and that actually ended up being my favorite! Haha. All of them were amazing and had such a nice buttery taste when you take that first bite and then all that yummy cheesiness follows. The jalapeño came with sour cream, which was bomb. Also the chocolate piergoie I inhaled in 5 seconds, already craving it as I write this. Such friendly staff & even more amazing piergoies. You can even order wine! Highly recommended!

Finally made it here! Love the simplicity and the comfort of this place! By far my favorite - potato and cheese boiled pierogies with bacon bits (omg! those bits!).  Definitely a deliciously filling treat.  Wasn't terribly crazy about the mac-n-cheese fried pierogies - kinda got my taste buds all confused but my friend definitely enjoyed these (will also skip the salad next time - haha)  Love a place that reminds me of grandma's cooking! Thank you!
Order take out, so good! I had Jalapeño - cheddar & potato. They have dessert pierogies too, but I didn't try.
No comment

Pirogies perfected. I have been looking for a place just like this for the past few years. Great authentic pierogies hand made each order. The bacon cheddar is phenomenal. A must go for any polish food enthusiast!  The prices are fair and the service is good. Going twice in one week would never make me feel guilty as the food is just so good!
Cute place with outdoor seating. Got the bacon and cheddar pierogies and they were incredibly gooey and delicious
A+++++ Amazing!! Great service and delicious food. Well worth the trip to Bk. Nothing on the menu is bad.
No comment
I have to admit, I ordered Baba's from Caviar TWO nights in a row. It's always delicious, always fresh. Get both boiled and pan fried, latkes, dessert perogies, oh and the kielbasa bites!
No comment
No comment
Delicious. Got a selection to go and they were a hit. Will absolutely be ordering now that I know they deliver! Also like the (very) small bar area to pop in for a solo snack.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Delicious food. Very friendly service. Extremely tasty draft beer from Czech Republic, and a great playlist to boot! A new neighbourhood favourite!
No comment
No comment

Delicious! Went alone and got some classic potato pierogies- Pan fried, a side of applesauce (made in house and delicious), a cucumber salad, and a jasminade. Treat- yo - self! Super nice place, clean run by friendly people that checked on you and your meal! Wish it were closer to where I lived! And wish they had a mixed pierogi option! Nom nom! Will be back! Must try all the flavors!
No comment
No comment
Holy cow- I thought I made the best pirogies. But clearly these guys do!! I may eat myself to death!
No comment
No comment
No comment

This review is based on only one visit, but it was an enjoyable one. Service was super friendly and helpful in trying to decide if our pierogi  order should be boiled or fried. We tried the jalepeno, potato & cheese with sautéed onions and bacon toppings, boiled as recommended; schnitzel bites; and golden beet salad. The pierogis were outstanding - light and flavorful, although I didn't get much jalepeno. The schnitzel bites were crunchy and not at all greasy, but I only thought they were okay; my husband loved them. The beet salad was a bit of a let-down. I was hoping it would be crunchy and it wasn't but it was a good vinegary foil to the other dishes. Not sure what took me so long to get to Baba's, but I'll be back soon to try some of the other fillings and the kielbasa sliders the table next to us had. And I'll try to save room for the crunchy chocolate pierogis too.

I believe in one thing when it comes to restaurants. Keep it simple, stick to what you know, do one thing, and do it right. This place fits the bill. It is a family run place that offers pierogies with a mix of traditional and non traditional fillings, prepared boiled or fried. A small, modern space, that still feels bright and airy. The fillings are fresh, flavorful, and in many cases inventive. If you love pierogies and you are in the area, stop by. You won't be disappointed!
No comment

My first thought was honestly why the heck are these dumplings so darn expensive?  Call me ghetto, but you can get a bag of 50 frozen ones in Chinatown for the same price as 9 cooked ones here.  It's quality.  The spinach and feta was filled freshly into the nice springy dough - not as small as traditional pierogies.  Perhaps I'll try fried next time but the boiled ones pretty good - tossed with butter to give it some richness, and topped with chives for some freshness.
No comment

Really great straight to the point pierogis place with the nicest staff. I had the jalapeño pierogis and they didn't disappoint. Highly recommend this place if you're in the mood for pierogis at reasonable prices. For one person I recommend the 9 pieces if you're hungry!

This is the best place.  I can't say enough about their delicious homemade pierogies.  My absolute favorite is the jalapeno cheddar pierogies.  Pierogies made to order - this is not fast food - this is food that is made lovingly by hand.  It is worth every second of the wait.  Why are these the best pierogies?  The dough is so fresh and so thin and lets the delicious, generous, creamy potato filling and flavors shine.  I also tried their cucumber salad the last time I went and it was a perfect compliment to the pierogies.  The owners and workers are so kind and I wish I could eat here all the time.
No comment
No comment

We come here with our son after school every week. The pierogies are filling and delicious!  Our son loves the boiled macaroni and cheese while I usually get the boiled bacon and cheddar. Don't forget to top it off with caramelized onions!  The staff is always super friendly and helpful!
No comment

The BEST pierogies!! These are truly delicious, done so well. The dough is light and the fillings are plenty! Great selection of flavors too. Cucumber salad is a perfect compliment to these pockets of flavor. The story behind this business is also inspirational and the staff is incredibly friendly.

Amazing!!! As soon as you enter the ambiance is warm and welcoming with small potted plants and wooden paneling. You order at the counter then you find a seat for the food to be served to you. The employee offered her favorites, we went with the Mac and cheese fried with sour cream and the jalapeño one with onions boiled. I loved the jalapeño ones, I would not order the Mac and cheese again. It tasted like Kraft Mac and cheese. To complete the meal we got the Crunchy chocolate fried pierogies with what I think is home made whipped cream. WOW! Get these! If it was closer I would be back all the time. Since it's not, I'll still find myself there a few more times I'm sure ;)
No comment
Still looking for better pierogies in town than Baba's. Spinach and ricotta is my all time favorite. Can't order anything else!

Let me start with the service : the owner and her staff are so sweet and welcoming. I felt like I was at home. The decor on the wall brought me back to Central Europe and made me reminisce of my summer vacations as a child in the green fields overlooking the mountains. Major props to the vintage family photos. My party and I had the cheese, jalapeño, and blueberry pierogi. Oh man, already daydreaming of when I can find some time to come back here. 100% natural and MADE WITH LOVE!!!! Great flavor. I could eat pierogi 24/7. Very happy to see that this place exists. See you soon!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Overall a great place.  It's owned and operated by Slovak folks who's grandmas' recipes are interpreted in their pierogies.   I loved every bite. The place is small but cute and the service is top notch.  It's abbot pricey for the food offered but know that each dumpling is hand made to order.
No comment
Amazing Pierogies, especially the Mac and cheese ones. Five stars just for the food. But on top of that, the staff is unbelievably warm and I love that this place is family run.

Ok, I had never even heard of Baba's but oh so glad I did. I messaged them on IG and they got back to me ASAP. I called and placed an order with the most lovely person. She talked me through all of the options vegan and regular. She did not rush me and gave me great advice. I ordered 3 orders of Pierogies for delivery. They came hot and omg where they good. I'm embarrassed to say how many I ate in one sitting. I've found my new go to place. Love them.

Giving them 4 stars cause the place was way too loud. Waitress didn't really know what she was serving obviously repeated what she was told. Very Good Pierogies Not the best but then again it's a restaurant and I grew up on this stuff and an somewhat spoiled. I would recommend and go back but won't go back if I'm super hungry. It would cost a small portion to fill me up
Consistently awesome. You could really feel and taste the love in this place.  Spinach and feta (fried) and mom's fav (boiled) are my go to. Oh and dessert pierogies? Yes!! Do it!

The Potato cheese fried pierogies were great, but definitely steep at $9.25 (rather than the mathematically correct $9.24). Friendly enough staff and fast enough service given a bit of a rush (place seems packed since they opened) for some Slovenian fare.

I had a great talk with the owner and he explained how his family was involved with the creation of different menu items and the feel of the restaurant. It really enhanced the experience but the pierogies were also straight delicious. It took me lunch and dinner to complete the large size and a side salad. You should go here.
Amazing!! Classic Pierogies. Staff was so sweet. Reminded me of my grandmothers food. Was so worth it!!!

This is my first time here and I have to say this place rocks. The pierogies will not disappoint. They use Yukon potatoes for their filling. I got the cheese and potatoes naturally and the beet salad. On my next visit I'll definitely try mac n cheese.

Great place to eat pierogis. These are delicious and authentic (being Polish native I can say that). We've had boiled Feta & Spinach and pan fried Sourkraut. Both were delicious, dough was very light, and pierogis were shaped expertly. We liked the fact that there was a lot of filling inside, these are handmade, because there would be nothing worse than pierogis with more dough than filling. For the dessert we had blueberry pierogis which are absolute must! Butter/honey glaze and sweet whipped cream was on point. We would recommend this place.
This was PHENOMENAL! An average adult I think would have a hard time eating more than 5-6 of these. Save room for dessert!!!! Do it..... Go to this place. Good space, sweet people, amazing food.
One of the best pierogi I've had ever! Great service and good beer! The schnitzel bites were also amazing. Highly recommend this place to anyone in the neighborhood!
Great pierogies and salads and very cozy nice set up to enjoy the tasty food. I am not a huge pierogie fan but I love this place.
No comment
No comment

I've lived around the corner from this restaurant for years. Finally walked in to try it out a few weeks back. Wow! Jalapeño pierogies and a glass of wine. Awesome! Definitely not my work cafeteria's pierogies. Will make it a habit going forward. Cool vibe and good grub.

Amazingly good!! Like holy mother of small babies those pierogies are the bomb! We got the mac and cheese love nuggets... And the caramelized onions... what! Helena is a treasure!!! Please give us more of those heaven pieces!!

Nothing bad to say at all. Walking in the place it was clean and friendly. We ordered a bunch of different pierogi's. The Mac and cheese, hazelnut, farm cheese and potatoes and the bacon pierogi's. You can tell there was a lot of love put into this food. I am in love with these pierogi's and seriously wish I had a never ending stomach to eat them over and over again. Seriously this place is a gem and I can't wait to go back!!!! Also they have vegan options too which I love about them as well. Just go here!!!! You will not regret it!

Was in the neighborhood, and wanted a quick bite but not too heavy.. Baba's fit the bill.. Growing up on polish food, I'm familiar with the fare. Babas takes the classic pierogi and goes a step further, offering them a bit of a gourmet twist. They offer pierogi boiled or pan fried, in various flavors. I went with the bacon cheddar potato pan fried, and a keibassa platter. It consisted of a nice link of keibassa, some krout, a horseradish dip, and some bread. The pierogi was excellent.  Pan fried, akin to a good chinese dumpling should be, yet stayed soft, tender. Very flavorful. The keibassa was equally tasty, but the accompanying dip and krout were not as bold tasting as I would have liked.. Hearty sausages need big flavor to balance against IMHO. I'll definitely be back, the thought of those dessert blueberry pierogi are lingering in my mind...
No comment

Such a great spot- you can legit watch Baba making the pierogis from scratch for each order! The food is delicious. We came with a big hungry group and pretty much tried all of the options, our favorites were potato and cheese (boiled) and the chocolate dessert pierogies. Staff was super helpful and patient, I would highly recommend this place!!
No comment
No comment

Kinda let down.  Especially with the name Babas. Ordered the potato cheese and jalepeno that they didn't put in bag they just gave me  a double order of potato cheese (unless that's what they taste like) .  As for the perogi they were kinda bland and filling didbt ha e enough texture to it..kinda liquidy...My Baba would not approve

We stumbled across this spot while going for a walk around Park Slope. They are doing takeout orders in times of covid so we thought we'd give it a shot.  We were not disappointed. We ordered 2 orders of 5 pierogies including the spinach and feta and potato and cheese pierogies and they were excellent!  The boast themselves as the best pierogies in the city and given i don't know of many other places and how satisfied we were with our order, I cannot argue with that. Staff was also very friendly and we look forward to visiting again for more. Highly Recommended.

I was blown away with my experience at Baba's. The pierogies are genuinely delicious. I visited Manhattan for work and one night took a 40 minute subway ride (each way) just to grab some of these little guys. I was not let down. The food is incredible and authentic, the service is amazingly friendly, and the restaurant's story is very cool. I'm super thankful I came here. Next time I'm in NYC, Baba's will for sure get a visit.

Definitely the best pierogies I've had. The traditional potato and cheese were perfect. The side tops are exactly what you want to compliment these delicious morsels of food. To round it out they have a crisp pilsner on draft.
Absolutely delicious. Cooked quickly & fresh - amazing sauces too. Will be returning to try all the flavours but I can't imagine anything better than the pork ragu!

Absolutely love this place! Very friendly and prompt service. Everything on the menu is delicious and deserve 5 star review! It's a family owned and operated restaurant - we will definitely go back there again! LOVE IT!

My absolute FAVORITE place I make sure I go to every time I'm in New York. In fact I book all of my New York trips revolving around a lunch or two at Baba's. Everything is spectacular. You can tell how much culture and love is put into their food. It's always fresh and always hits the spot. Plus the staff is always more than pleasant to deal with. I highly recommend going to Baba's if you are in Brooklyn!!
Delicious handmade pierogies! Very simple and cute restaurant. Staff is pleasant and nice, best pierogies in NYC!
No comment

I went here with a group from work and we order one of each of the pierogies including dessert.  The service was great and quick.  The good was really good the spinach and feta one was amazing.  But I can't say there are any that I didn't like they were all really tasty, flavorful and really well made.  I definitely recommend this place and will go back when I get back to Brooklyn.
No comment

We came upon this quaint little restaurant when we ventured from Manhattan out to Brooklyn for an event at the Barclay's Ctr.  A fantastic family run business. Very clean, very comfortable for dining in. They also had a good deal of take away while we were there. We had 5 pan fried sauerkraut and 5 boiled bacon & cheddar. Everything prepared from scratch while we waited. (Less than 10 min). Sour cream & horseradish dipping sauce made our succulent, puffy, potato wrapped pirogues  plum irresistible. We saved just enough room for chocolate pirogues with fresh whipped cream. Yum!  We left with smiles on our faces; satisfied but not bloated. Family photos on the wall show their devotion to their craft. Can't say enough about this gem situated in this revitalized neighborhood.

I was born in Ukraine and so grew up eating pierogies. When I heard about this place I got pretty excited and decided to go check it out with my parents and I was not disappointed. The staff is super friendly and this is very clearly a labor of love. The restaurant is small but bright and open. We tried the sauerkraut boiled w/ onions, potato and cheese pan fried w/ onions and the jalapeno boiled topped with bacon bits. We also got kielbasy sliders and then blueberry pierogi for dessert. All of the pierogies were delicious - although your favorite will depend a lot on whether you like them more boiled of fried. We were disappointed in the onions because we usually chop them up into little squares and fry them to a crisp to be a topping - here it seems they were boiled in strands and I'd tell you to pass on them. The Jalapeno pierogi are absolutely inspired - they had a nice kick without being overwhelming and topping them with bacon brought them to a whole new level. The fattiness of the pork and the kick of the peppers worked really well together. I'm glad to see them experimenting with new fillings and pushing the pierogi forward as a dish. If you've never had pierogies or your baba made them every week you should come out here and try some - you'll be glad you did!

Stopped by this place because a friend recommended it. Even though I've never had pierogies they were a pretty great snack. I prefer the bacon cheddar and the Mac and cheese to share. The bacon cheddar was the best out of the two. The staff there was very friendly.

These are the best pierogies I've ever had, and it's nice that they have a vegan menu as well.  There is a slight upcharge for getting the pierogies off the vegan menu and I assume that is because it costs more for the vegan sour-cream and such that they need to serve.  I've also tried the boiled and fried styles and while that comes down to personal preference,  I would recommend choosing pan fried. I also recently tried the chocolate dessert pierogies and those are fantastic.  The only thing I find odd about this place (and it's not really a complaint) is why do all the order sizes come in odd numbers?  These are a natural food to share around the table, and it would just be easier split up and share if they came in even numbers.

Food was so good... Staff was super friendly.  My husband and I came in and ordered a bunch of different perogies to share as well as the chocolate desert ones... Nothing left us disappointed.  The homemade teas were very good as well.

Beautiful, minimalist restaurant serving excellent pierogis and other Slavic cuisine. The portions and pricing are reasonable, and the selections are eclectic. We had the sauerkraut, mac and cheese, potato and cheese, jalapeño, and blueberry pierogis with some kielbasa sliders. All were delicious. Definitely get some apple sauce for dipping.

Best pierogies in New York. The only thing better than the food is their staff - always friendly and professional. You can tell that they don't just appreciate your business, they are genuinely happy you chose to eat there and want you to enjoy your meal. They are currently doing cross borough deliveries due to covid-19, so definitely give them a shot when they're coming to your part of the city!
No comment

Best Pierogies hands down! Been here several times and everything is always so consistent and delicious.  A ton of attention to detail.  It's a tough decision as to which filling to choose because they are all so tasty.  The bacon & cheddar are amazing as well as the jalapeño which has a very mild hint of jalapeño so it's not spicy! The staff is very friendly & accommodating & the owners are very nice.  Very Fast service
No comment
No comment

Had the boiled bacon and cheddar pierogies with mushroom and it was excellent, moist on the inside, and not heavy or oily. Will definitely be back to try the other dishes and the pan fried pierogies. Staff was really friendly, and the interior is bright and clean, making for great food picture lighting!

Pierogi places are few and far between so I don't have anything to really compare it to. With that being said the food here is always great. I prefer the boiled pierogis over the fried ones but you can't really go wrong with either. Price is a little steep but nonetheless it's a good spot to hit up occasionally for non-keto goodness.

OMG this place is BOMB. The food is super good I live near their restaurant near Gowanus and the vegan Pierogies are out of this world. People who work here are absolutely amazing and are super nice. The location in Williamsburg is in the back of the food hall, fantastic people there too!!
Pieroges are Amazing. The place is chill. Helen , Bob  and staff are warm and friendly.
Best pierogies I've had in the US! Generous toppings, excellent selection, lots of veggie-friendly options, cozy atmosphere.
This place is great. Tried the Mac and Cheese pirogies and was surprised by how delicious they were. Service was great, the waitress really cared about our experience. Definitely coming back here
No comment
Great place, pierogies are perfect. We shared boiled spinach and feta and fried jalapeño ones with bacon on top. Will return  soon. Everyone working there was very nice too.
Best Pierogies I have ever eaten. Order a Czechvor, .5 liter, get it going. Eat them polish hot pockets. Do work. Five stars.
No comment
Hands down the best homemade applesauce and Pierogies ,the service was amazing . The cutest decor also. Will be seeing me again for sure ...

Go here! Best pierogies I have ever had.  We had the potato, jalapeño with cheddar, and mac and cheese, and all were delicious.  The classic potato was my favorite, and my husband loved the jalapeño.  I would also recommend the chocolate pierogies for dessert, delicious.  Service was awesome, they even stayed late so we could have dessert.  We traveled from the upper west side and will definitely be back!  Thank for a great meal!

Absolutely, hands-down, the best pierogi experience in New York! Gowanus is incredibly lucky to have this family owned and run gem. We had the feta and spinach boiled, bacon and cheese fried, and jalapeño and potato fried. A side of Helen's sauce is a must as well as the caramelized onions. Czechbar is the only beverage to order. The service was warm, inviting (met the mom and her cousin), and incredibly gracious. Can't wait to try everything else on the menu. Thank you for a fantastic dining experience.
Delicious pierogies, great atmosphere -- laid back yet sophisticated. I got the spinach and feta, will be back to try more
Delicious!! Came here for lunch, such a cute little spot everyone's as super friendly and the food was amazing. Drove 45 mins and will absolutely be coming back
Delicious. Way better than other comparably priced restaurants in the area. Sauerkraut was our favorite.
Great food. Great service. Great prices. Love this place! The classic pierogie was my favorite, I highly recommend it.

This place just opened and I'm impressed. The sliders are very good, but the Pierogies are the real highlight. I really liked the spinach and feta Pierogies and the traditional potato and cheese ones as well. Lastly, the caramelized onions are delicious. The service was a bit over attentive, but I'm sure it will get smoother as time goes on.
No comment

WHAT CAN I SAY ABOUT THIS LITTLE GEM IN BROOKLYN????? I drove from Astoria Queens on a hunt for a GREAT  pierogi... I past polish central in Greenpoint Brooklyn to get to Baba's... After reading a couple of reviews I had to get there.  Upon entering we noticed that all available seats were taken but were greeted by "NICK " whom asked it we were dining in or to go.  Nick made us a cozy spot in the center of the place and retrieved a chair from the back to complete a table for 3... After reviewing the menu we ordered three types of pan fried pierogis , Bacon-Cheddar, Jalapeno and Potato & cheese,  a side of bacon bits and the Kielbasa platter.... OMG... Those little bites of pillow heaven were EVERYTHING!!!!!! After that first bite with a small dollop of sour cream and sprinkle of those PERFECTLY cooked bacon bits I could have sworn I felt a tear roll down my face,  LOL.... That kielbasa was also grilled to perfection, crispy casing and juicy and flavorful center...  The Baba special, Hibiscus infused lemonade & The Jasmine lemonade were very cute iced drinks. The staff here were totally welcoming and eager to answer ANY question you may have.  I CANNOT WAIT TO RETURN.
No comment

The food was fantastic. Went there with my cousin and we shared several different types of pierogis.'Each one better than the other. For dessert, chocolate pierogi with homemade whipped cream.. I highly recommend it.. Will definitely go again...

This place was amazing! we got the potato and cheese and jalapeño pierogis and they were both delicious. We also got dessert pierogis with whipped cream that were to die for. on top of the great food, the staff was very nice and provided great service!
Best pierogies I've ever had. Side note: I was raised in Poland so I've had a lot in my life.

The pierogies were incredible and reasonably priced for all the food you get. The overall atmosphere was so inviting and our server made sure we understood everything and gave great recommendations! Looking forward to making this my go-to pierogi spot
No comment
Tiny place with great atmosphere and extremely delicious varenyky (or you might call it "pierogi"). Their feta&spinach filling is to die for!

Really good pierogies and sides. The prices are good too and they have an excellent Slovakian beer on tap. The pierogies aren't terribly filling (I could easily eat 20) but I can't hold that against them. My only criticism is the service can be a bit slow. Last time we waited a good 25 minutes for a straightforward order for 4. At least they're homemade.....
This place was an amazing find! I split the mac and cheese pierogies with my boyfriend and they were fantastic! Great service and great food. You owe it to yourself to go here if your in brooklyn!

We came for take-out pierogies to enjoy at the shuffleboard club around the block. My only regret is not getting orders of 9 instead of the 5 that we got! All of the different varieties of pirogues were delicious (one had spinach and I think feta, which was particularly amazing) and we enjoyed some Czech beer while waiting for the order. We could have ordered over the phone and picked them up to head straight out to shuffleboard, but I really enjoyed getting to sit in the little shop and talk to the staff about their passion for the place while having a beer and waiting.
This is the best pierogie spot in brooklyn! I must have! Great service, consistent with each employee. Leaving this place with my belly full and a smile on my face.

came here for dinner yesterday. Nice little place. Great service. Loved the pierogies. We had the mac and cheese, cheddar and bacon, jalapeno and cheddar and the chocolate for desert. All were great. Complimentary cucumber water is a huge plus.

Two thumbs up for Baba's! The smoked bacon pierogies will change your life. Had the mac & cheese ones and the schnitzel bites. All were good. Great service. Very good beer on draft. Don't miss out on the crunchy chocolate dessert pierogies, they were awesome. We will be back to eat our way thru the menu!
If pierogies are what you're craving, Baba's is your stop. Classic flavors plus a few surprises. Kielbasa sliders are fun and delicious.
Delicious. We had the bacon cheddar, fried, and cheese, boiled. Really, really good. We also tried both dessert option and they were also great.

Wow this place is fantastic!! I'm new to the neighborhood and stumbled upon it accidentally. Nick is awesome--informative, helpful and gracious. The pierogis are AMAZING! I had pan friend feta & cheese and potato & cheese. Lovely ambiance, very clean and beautifully lit. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

What a wonderful little restaurant! Delicious pierogi, which you can customize with extra toppings like caramelized onions, bacon, etc., and a lot of other menu options (many involving kielbasy) that I haven't had a chance to try yet. The staff were all friendly and helpful and seemed genuinely glad that every customer was there; they helped make accommodations for a couple with a 2-baby stroller. Service was quick, too. There are only a few tables but also a few seats at the counter so you might want to avoid peak times, although you can also take-out. If they'd open a branch in San Diego (I was just visiting Brooklyn), I'd probably have lunch there every day!

This place blows Veselka out of the water. I'm hesitant to leave a review because I selfishly want to keep it a secret, but family-run shops like this deserve the love. Get your pierogis pan-fried - they do it so well here! The staff is welcoming, the food is served piping hot, and their insanely reasonable prices are just the cherry on top. A go-to spot in Gowanus!
No comment

Delicious food in a family friendly  atmosphere. ordered mac n cheese and bacon n cheese perogies, also schnitzel balls for 7 hungry boys.  Had to re order twice.  i had kalbasa and my friend had jalapaeno and cheese perogies. everything tasted amazing with the friendliest service

Really enjoyed this place! Got the potato and cheese pierogis and the spinach and feta pierogis. They were sooo good, the fillings were very savory. I enjoyed the potato and cheese one more but they were both very satisfying, a little tangy and full of flavor. And the dough itself wasn't too soft, had a little give to it. I've been so used to frozen pierogis but now I can never go back! And i changed my order after they starting making it but the waitress was so nice and accommodating and  changed my order. Def going back!

I can't believe I haven't left a review yet. The pierogies here are delightful. Boiled. Fried. With or without the toppings, you're going to love these lovely dumplings. The storefront is bright and clean and tastefully decorated. The staff are welcoming and friendly. 5 will certainly fill you up just right. 10 will get you stuffed. I've tried virtually everything on the menu. The bacon/cheese/potato is incredibly rich. The potato/American cheese really sets the standard and is a good launch point. I'd recommend starting with 5 and finishing with one of their sweet varieties. I love the blueberry ones. I always leave with a craving for borscht. Life isn't perfect. That's ok.
No comment

Love this place wish I lived closer it would be a weekly trip. Small place only a few tables expect to wait . Order at the counter and waitress comes to table with food. They have different types of pierogis to choose from and other options as well on their menu. We got the kielbasa sliders which were seriously amazing and jalapeño fried pierogis, and bacon cheddar fried pierogis. Staff was friendly would highly recommend!
No comment
No comment

Swung by here for a quick, light lunch after and events at Royal Palms and very glad we did. My favorite thing was actually the chicken noodle soup we ordered on special, though I think they'll have it throughout the winter. We also ordered the potato Pierogies boiled which were great, and the mac & cheese pierogies fried which were a bit bready/heavy but still good. Also the pierogies all come with little cute labels indicating which kind they are which is a nice touch. Staff is also super friendly. Great neighborhood find, highly recommend for a quick bite!
No comment
No comment

Went before a concert at the bell house with a bunch of friends.  The classic potato one was definitely the best one IMO.  The others were good, the mac and cheese - just okay...didn't stand out to me at all.  If I'm in the area, I would go back and get the potato one hands down!!  The staff was also super patient with explaining each one and gave some recommendations.  It's a small space, so it's not so great for large groups - but definitely got a friendly atmosphere!
No comment
This dedicated spot is delicious, without a doubt. The service is incredibly warm and friendly too.
Yum yum yum. So delicious on a wet afternoon. The chicken soup was divine and served very hot. Delightful interior casual small but light bright and friendly.

I came across this spot due to a scheduled work-related visit. But before I left, got curious and decided to try the sample-size, five cheese pierogis, to go.  Soon after I realized I should have gotten the larger 10-pierogis one.  The location is small but very clean, cozy and inviting.  The staff is friendly and courteous, especially the lovely young lady behind the counter  :)   I will definitely visit again when I'm in that area.  A very pleasant surprise!
I tried their "original" and it was very spicy. i am a huge fan of spicy food so i loved it. i would recommend it to anyone who likes spicy food.

Great food, great service in Brooklyn!  I was looking for somewhere to grab a quick bite during my last business trip while staying in Brooklyn.  I discovered this place.  The unique offerings were amazing and the treatment and service were world class.  Great neighborhood restaurant with a nice atmosphere and friendly staff.  I'll definitely be back next time I'm in NYC.
This place is amazing. The pierogies are fantastic, and the service is fast & friendly. Very authentic, and comfy inside.

We were in the hunt for some real Pierogies ever since we had them at Stanton Social. Baba's is the closest you can get to authenticity. The place is super clean but small. Nice decor, tons of wood everywhere. Now. The food is incredible. We got the potato and cheese as well as the jalapeño and they did not disappoint. Please come on UberEATS so I can order more often.

My husband and I arranged a cooking class at Baba's for my father-in-law and grandmother. The cooking class was intimate and extremely informative. Helen and Bob were incredible instructors. They answered all of our questions, and showed us how to make their famous pierogies. It was wonderful to see Grandma interacting with Helen. Together, they were able to share family stories, bringing up many old memories for Grandma. Not only is the food delicious, but the atmosphere of the restaurant is warm and inviting. Helen and Bob were generous hosts. This was the best cooking class we ever took! We cannot wait to go back and highly recommend it for anyone who is looking for a smaller, private cooking class.
Great service, tasty pierogies, but place is tiny and serving size is quite small and expensive.  For a once-in-a-while treat though, certainly a fun place.

Great food! Stoped by bc we were in the area but would definitely come back even travel here for the pierogies. Also the manager/I think the owner was super friendly and helpful in deciding what to get.
Here is a great selection of food. The staff is super friendly. Split a few varieties with your friends and don't skip the dessert.

I have been here twice and i always feel so welcome. Not only do the workers make the restaurant feel homy and fun, but the pierogies are amazing. They are the best in New York and I recommend everyone to try them, you wont be disappointed. The spinach and feta, as well as the mac and cheese are my favorite!! And the crunchy chocolate dessert pierogies is to die for!! No complaints and I WILL be back hehe

The staff is highly attentive and very nice, the food is always made quickly, and everything on the menu is extremely delicious! Definitely worth the 50 minute train ride for me to get there. Highly recommend!
Great food, nice atmosphere, friendly staff. The jalapeno and mac & cheese pierogies are my favorite things on their menu. Sauteed Mushrooms are a must.

The pierogies was absolutely wonderful, from preparation to presentation, very pleasing. We especially enjoyed the way how they improved old traditional Slovakian food into something special!Can't wait to get back!!!!!   I'm very proud of you guys!!!!
Feels very comfortable to sit down and eat there. Very friendly and the pierogies there are something that I think about all the time.
No comment
No comment
I was looking forward to my visit here and it was better than I expected. Food: delicious. Service: helpful and friendly. Overall: enjoyable, affordable and unique.
No comment

AMAZING pierogies and great service! We had the spinach & feta and the potato & cheese pierogies boiled and served with brown butter and chives - they were incredible. Our server was incredibly friendly and the service was really fast. We can't wait to go back again and try more of the menu!
The jalapeño and the Bacon cheddar Pierogies were the best Pierogies I've ever had.  Also, the inside is cozy and the owner was incredibly friendly.   Loved everything about this place!!

Those pierogis were the bomb. Unlike most of the pierogis I ate in the past that were most likely boiled in hot water until they are cooked, those were nicely seared on the pan, giving them this crispy coating. I am definitely visiting this place again and again.
No comment
These pierogies were so delicious, we took another order home with us. Not a large space but has several tables for eating in.
