Simply yum! I am so glad we found this jewel in Gowanus. A welcoming place. We tasted bacon cheddar and sauerkraut pierogies. They were amazing. Make sure you get the Nutella ones for a desert!
We tried some of all the pierogi fillings and all we're good (potato and onion my fave). Wife had kielbasa and she liked it very much.
We got 5 sauerkraut and added bacon and then 5 bacon and cheddar and added caramelized onion. So delicious and fresh and you can see them making them fresh in the back. New favorite spot.

Love PIEROGIES!!!!! The staff here are so knowledgable and friendly, you will not feel bad for asking about the history or anything about the menu. He graciously offers the history of the restaurant and that is what really warms my heart. Not only the food was delicious, it was such a delightful experience to dine in the clean, modern, homey dining area. The menu and the little flags as labels were so cute with their own branding font and logos. My favorite was the jalapeno pierogies + then the second fav was the bacon cheddar. Yum!!! I would definitely come back to eat more again! Don't be too fooled by the size of these little suckers, they can fill you up real quick.
Delicious pirogies and a friendly staff. The price is a little high if you're used to getting your Polish fix in Greenpoint or Brighton Beach.

IF YOU NEED A SIGN: THIS IS IT!!! I've been coming here for almost 10 months and it's the most amazing place ever. There's so many different options, and we've tried 7 of 8 and both desserts. I'm telling you, ya can't go wrong they are all amazing and freshly served when you order. On top of that the staff are absolute amazing people, so easy to talk to and so friendly. Please please come here they're incredible and go above and beyond!!

Stopped in again after awhile. They haven't started offering sampler platters so that's disappointing. I got bacon cheddar, sauerkraut, and a blueberry bunch, all pan fried. They were delicious along with the special sauce you can get. I find it to be pretty expensive for the amount you get. I could spend $20 on pierogis(a traditional peasant food) and not be full.

Baba's is one of our neighborhood favorites so when we were planning our 10-year anniversary party, we knew we wanted to serve their piergoies. Helena was extremely helpful and responsive in helping us plan out a catering order. The delivery was seamless and they set everything up - including sternos - quickly and happily. Helena even remembered us the next time we came by the restaurant for dinner! Everyone raved about the food and we would 100% order from them again. Come here if you want THE BEST pierogies made by some of the nicest people.

These are some seriously delicious perogies with decent beer and excellent service! It is a bit pricey, though, but worth the experience. A couple friends insisted on taking me here and I did not regret it at all.
Just YUM. I ordered the standard pierogies and yum, yum, yum. The staff was really nice and asked to surprise me when it came to ordering. lad they did. Super happy and would go back.

Tastes like grandma's! They have a fun variety of pierogies, the classic potato and cheese is amazing but so are all the others! We love the Mac and cheese, the bacon cheddar, the blueberry, all of them really. This is becoming our favorite go-to.

Such a sweet spot. The service is fantastic, the food is thoughtfully made. We ordered the jalapeño and the spinach feta, then the blueberry for dessert. They were all delicious. Side of sauerkraut is perfect too. They have mushroom topping - I would love to see a mushroom & sauerkraut filling, and some (vegetarian) borscht. Will be back again when in Gowanus.

I've passed by the Baba's Pierogies a couple of times and have always admired the decor from outside. I finally had the chance to try out the food and was not disappointed. The pan-fried jalapeno pierogies were my favorite. They had a mini kick to it and it was very flavorful. The Schnitzel bites were better than I expected, they were crispy and so freaking good. The staff was very nice and they answered all the questions we had on the menu.
Authentic, delicious, great variety, friendly people and beautiful space!

10/10 Will order from here again. Ordered simple fried potato pierogies with mushrooms and onions and was delighted. The food was fresh, tasty, and they were very generous with the portion of toppings. YUM!
No comment
This Polish girl is sooooo happy! Go here. Get the traditional potato and cheese (and a specialty!) And have the chocolate on for dessert! The restaurant is bright, clean and welcoming! Amazing!

Absolute heaven on earth.  Came with a few friends to Baba's for the first time before knife throwing.  The food was superb - so fresh and delicious.  The staff were wonderful, and accommodated our every need.  Highly recommended!
Nothing special.  Salads were boring.  Poor value.  Intrussive service.  A real dissapointment.

Delicious handmade pierogis!!!! I LOVE pierogis and it was nice to find this place with a great assortment!! It's very cute inside but also a little small.  Lucky for us we arrived around 4pm, so it was empty! You can grab a spot to sit or order right away at the counter and then they will bring the food to you.  They have a nice variety of pierogis to choose from and you can pick fried or boiled.  They come in sizes of 5 or 9 pierogis.  We ordered potato and cheese, mac and cheese, jalapeño, bacon cheddar and spinach and feta.  My favorite was the bacon cheddar and the spinach and feta was delicious.  My boyfriend enjoyed the jalapeño and spinach and feta the most.  But we truly enjoyed them all! We also ordered the blueberry dessert pierogi which was nice! My boyfriend and me finished all of them, sizes of 5 of course! We also added caramelized onions and smoked bacon bits (delicious!).  For the extra toppings, you do get a good amount of them and then can add it onto whatever you would like.  We also overheard their salads are really good.  The only complaint was it was a hot summer day and we were all quite warm inside even though the AC appeared to be on.   Staff was friendly and the pierogis are handmade to order.  They do take some time to prepare and cook them so don't expect them to come out right away.  There was plenty of parking nearby as well when we got there.    It appears they also deliver in the neighborhood with a $15 minimum.  If you love pierogis, this is place is a must!!

LOVE this place. A clean, quick, and friendly spot in an industrial section of Gowanus that needs the love. They really have fun with pierogies in a way I've never seen anyone else do, incorporating flavors from other cultures into the classic Polish dumpling. It's not traditional, but it's original and unique. Jalapeno is the best.

Coming from a polish family who loves pierogies, my sister and I absolutely adore this place! After reading about them on the internet last year, we were excited to finally try Baba's, and they definitely lived up to our expectations! So far we have tried 3 different kinds of pierogies: potato and cheese (boiled), mac and cheese (fried), and spinach and feta (fried), but it's hard to choose a favorite. The staff is always very friendly and the overall place is very cute. They will not dissapoint!

Very flavorful.  I had the bacon and cheese pan fried and my friend had the spinach and cheese boiled. Add-ons are nice but should honestly be included in the price. You shouldn't be charged to change your sour cream to sour cream and chives which I recommend with the pan fried. We went an hour before closing so we had seating but there is very little so don't plan on dining in if it's busy.

Babas pierogies are expensive. Expensive, but VERY DELICIOUS. My group tried almost all of the variations and were extremely pleased with each one. The decor and ambiance of the shop is super cute and family-friendly. I WILL say the wait for an order of pierogies is close to 30 min, which is kind of bananas. Perhaps they're just getting the hang of things in the kitchen, but for right now, if you're in a rush, be prepared to wait. Overall tho, I will be back! The pierogies are really, really tasty.

Abandon hope, dieters, for you won't find any salads here, just delicious little pillows of happiness filled with cheese, meat, or potato. This place is family run and pretty delicious in my opinion. You can choose boiled or fried but boiled is the way to go, dripping in butter - hey, you might as well do this all the way!

Can't wait to go back again. I tried the jalapeno filled pierogies and loved them. The only mistake was not getting more but those bad boys were filling for me. The jalapeno pierogies is great with the bacon topping and the Helen's dip. Definitely worth trying this place out if you haven't yet.

The modern and light interior really doesn't give you a sense for how good the food is. These pierogies are amazing. I like the classic potato ones the best, closely followed by the sauerkraut ones. Baba's is an optimal place to take friends or family for lunch or a late night snack since you can get a bunch and share. I went last week with my cousins and we must have devoured five orders like they were nothing. Perfect and delicious.

Delicious pierogies and super-friendly, welcoming service.  I would write more, but I think the other reviews say it all very well.  I will add that today we tried the boiled potato and cheese with caramelized onions and the fried bacon cheddar.  We can't wait to go back to try the rest of the menu.

This place is great and the pierogies are super yummy! I went in on a Saturday evening and all the tables were busy so I decided to get it to go. It took 20 minutes for my order to be ready but I'm not complaining because it was worth the wait. I ordered spinach and feta, potatoes and blueberry pierogies. I really like that they don't skimp on the filling for the pierogies. I ordered mine fried and it came with sour cream and the sweet one came with whipped cream. For the extra toppings, I chose the sautéed mushrooms and the caramelized onions. They added more flavor to the already great tasting pierogies. The staff is attentive to their customers and they really want you to enjoy your time and of course the food. They have other items on the menu such as sandwiches and salads but that's for a different time. Overall it's definitely worth a visit, you won't be disappointed!

The restaurant was bright and clean. I liked the wait staff, they were very friendly. I think the pierogies were pretty good. We had the pan fried potato and cheese, and smoked bacon. The side salad was ok, not well seasoned at all.
Cute place, very nice experience, good food! Little bit pricey. Got 5 pan fried bacon cheddar pierogis with a small home made lemonade and it costed 15 and change. Will be back and recommend it!
This place is amazing!  Hand made, fresh, the bacon is so well done.  Do yourself a favor and go to flavor heaven here.

Excellent pierogis and an even nicer family running the place. Will continue to come back again and again and send my friends. Love the family history intertwined in this place and the fresh, modern look.
No comment
really tasty!! Got the spinach ones and the mac and cheese ones, incredibly tasty with the sour cream. The decor is lovely as well, and the staff is super friendly. I will definitely be going back.

A hidden gem in Park Slope Baba's Pierogies it's a great addition to the Slope. They have a awesome selection of Pierogies made fresh to order, I had the Bacon & Cheese served with fresh sour cream and an ice cold mug of beer dosen't get any better. Staff was super friendly Brooklyn natives that make your visit very comfortable. This is a place definitely worth a visit you won't be disappointed .
Just sort of wandered in wanting to try a new place. Best random choice I've made in a long time. Perogies were incredibly flavorful and fresh. Will be back soon.
Honestly, this place is exactly what I'm looking for. All the time. Must try! Must eat, and then try it boiled, and enjoy
I really wanted this restaurant to be awesome.  It's just ordinary and the food is really bland.  There are better pierogi in the City.

Baba's Pierogies is an exceptional new Gowanus restaurant!  These guys have the Eastern European treat perfected and it's available in a whole slew of great flavors.  I tried the Spinach & Feta last night and was not disappointed.  They made them to order but it did not take long at all: 5 minutes, tops.  The carrot salad actually came out last!  My wife had the only vegan option available, sauerkraut, which she completely devoured.  While she chose to have her's boiled (tossed in butter and chives) I decided to go pan fried.  They seemed to be equally greasy (the boiled ones were drenched in butter), diminishing the health benefit of choosing one over the other.  The carrot salad tasted a lot like the Passover dish charoset, which was a pleasant surprise (gotta love those Eastern European traditions). What I found equally impressive about the establishment was the friendly service by people who you could tell truly cared about your experience at their establishment.  It's also worth mentioning the beautiful, bright decor, overall cleanliness (including a great restroom) and lemon lime water available at the front counter. Top it all off with environmentally friendly table ware and a menu that also features some authentic, non-pierogi items and you have yet another fine Brooklyn establishment you can't miss!

Guy behind the counter is the nicest, ambiance is clean and clutter free, and the menu is not too big, just right. Will definitely come back for lunch. Don't be a fool- get the large (9) and splurge for the caramelized onions. Enjoy!

I'm a bit jealous, I must admit, because I had the idea years ago to open a pierogi shop in the park slope area. However, I doubt it'd be anywhere nearly as good as Baba's, so all is forgiven. The pierogis are made fresh to order, and the space is beautiful and clean. This is one of my favorite places to go for a quick, delicious, high quality meal for a good price.
No comment

Amazing food in my opinion. I was most looking forward to the mac and cheese (and they did not disappoint) but the jalapeño ones were out of this world. The desserts were even amazing. Really friendly staff as well and the place had such a great vibe. I would gladly recommend this place to anyone.
Super delicious and a great eat-in place for lunch with 5 tables. I had the pan-fried jalepeño ones and they are delicious. Made to order! Yum

One bite into those luscious soft potato filled or spinach filled pierogies and I'm set into a dream of delicious magic. Hahaha, nah, but those things are BOMB for real! I'll be back asap. I wish I lived closer.., but then again maybe not because they'd probably own 1/2 of my paycheck. :)
Great service and delicious pierogies! I definitely recommend the applesauce as well.

Came here last night with my boyfriend craving pierogis off a suggestion from a friend!! Ordered the boiled potato and cheese with mushroom toppings along some czech beers.. Craving satisfied and then some! Looking forward to returning and trying the sliders and the jalepeno perogis and the dessert peierogis too!

Most delicious pierogis I've ever had!  Not inexpensive, but totally worth it. Bacon and cheddar with caramelized onions are to die for. We also tried the jalapeño, potato and cheese and mac and cheese- all delicious. Will definitely go back!
Spinach and feat pierogies were amazing. Watch out, the portions are bugger than what I expected!
Great food! Great service! Lovely atmosphere! The best staff! We had a great time Saturday with our daughters!
The spinach and feta pierogies were amazing.  The other ones we got were good too, but those were the best.  They have beer now: czeckvar on tap!

The pierogies were delicious - homemade and seasoned perfectly. I was worried that the fried version would be too greasy (as it often is at other places) but they were perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The decor is also really nice and made from entirely recycled materials which was cool. Only yelp review I have ever left, would definitely recommend.

Bacon cheddar pierogies were absolutely awesome. Fried to the perfect texture. Mac and cheese pierogies were okay, but not as flavorful as we would have liked. The woman who took our order and served us was charming and attentive. The seating was comfortable, and it was fun to watch the cooking take place from our table. Very clean and trendily decorated. Overall, it was a wonderful place to stop for an interesting Sunday lunch, and we will definitely return if we're in the area again!
No comment

Super cute place. We ordered take out but it's a super family friendly place. We ordered the potato and cheese boiled pierogies which were great and the fried mac and cheese pierogies (definitely get these!)
No comment

This place is awesome! The pierogies are delicious! The staff is really friendly, such nice people. I recommend the spinach and feta! I've lived in Greebpoint and have eaten them there but these are far superior. The horseradish sauce was also extremely tasty. Go here!

Delicious pierogies!! Nice decor and excellent customer service. I was greeted with a smile. A wide selection of savory pierogies but make sure to try the crunchy chocolate one for dessert. Love it!!!
The best perogies I've ever had.  Bacon and cheddar is fantastic, cheese and potatoes is light and incredible!  Also try jalapeño.  Beet salad is so amazing.

Stopped by Baba's Pierogies around 7 on a Saturday night. Every table was taken so we sat at the bar. The servers helped us right away, getting us beer and explaining how the menu worked. We settled for the bacon and cheddar, and the potato and cheese, both fried. They were really very tasty! Then we got the blueberry and the crispy chocolate dessert pierogies. I prefer the blueberry filling, however the fried chocolate pierogie was overall tastier. Some reviews mentioned a long wait for the pierogies, but I didn't really. Maybe the first savory round took a bit longer to get, but still well within normal timing. I assume they are hand rolling each pierogie as it gets ordered. The servers, and the owner (I assume it was him as he had Baba stories!), were all very friendly. They made sure we liked our order and explained some history of the place to us which was great. I would definitely come back here and even get some order to take out.

Father's day lunch, party of 3: great food! Friendly people. They had different varieties and choices. The great thing is that they even had dessert pierogies. I wanted to try 2 different dessert pierogies, but I only had enough cash left for 1. I think it's a little over priced comparing to the pierogies I can get elsewhere from polish restaurants. Also, one disadvantage is cash only. $45 was not quite enough to fill 2 and a half stomachs (sliders, 2 orders of pierogies, dessert pierogies).

These are the only pierogies that I have ever had that are as good as my Slovak mother's and her sister's, apologetically to them, perhaps even better . I recommend the boiled ones for their incredibly light dough, a most delicious tasting experience.
Awesome! Just awesome. we got the traditional potato & farmers cheese pierogies. The filling was creamy and tasty. Very filling. Great service and very friendly staff.

This beautiful little nook has been in Brooklyn for almost two years and I'm upset that we didn't stumble upon it sooner! These are the way Pierogies are SUPPOSED to taste. Small, simple menu plus fresh ingredients make this place a no-brainer for a quick bite! Highly recommend their Kielbasa Sliders!! Very friendly and attentive staff as well. Will be coming here more often!
Best pierogis I've ever had and I lived in Pittsburgh for 2 years! The slaw salads are a nice pairing as well. Really bright and cute interior.
Delicious! They have both traditional and non- traditional pierogies - Mac and cheese, for example. Everything we had was great and the delivery was spot on. Yum
Really tasty if a little pricey. I like the jalapeño pierogies and the kielbasy. Great for sauerkraut addicts ;)

Highly recommend! I had both the mild jalapeno pierogi and the potato and cheese. They were perfectly made (one was boiled and the other was pan fried) and tasted so fresh. The service was also great and I waited very little for the food to be ready. The owner makes you feel right at home.
No comment
No comment

These are some of the best pierogi I've ever had. Some of the flavors are traditional and some are really different and fun, but they're all delicious. I love the spinach and feta, but my favorite were the chocolate dessert pierogi! It was seriously the best dessert that I've had in a very long time. The staff is so nice, and the restaurant is very cute and comfortable. I'm very excited to go back again!
The Pierogies were delish... and we have been searching the East Village and Greenpoint high and low for good Pierogies. And very friendly staff. Will definitely be back!

Walked in to this place with seating for about 16 20 people. One of three tables full.chose a table was told it was reserved. Sat at other table where ac was hitting my children. The reserved table walked in five minutes after we ordered .They were served first. Another party of five walked in ten minutes later they were served first. I tried this place once before. It was okay. Not worth the high price. Last time.

I have found my new favorite spot in BK!  Friends brought us here tonight for a light Friday dinner and I was beyond surprised at how delicious and fun a pierogi dinner could be.  The Mac & Cheese were spot-on and the Jalapeño too, and we topped it off with Chocolate Pierogis - from a picky chocolate snob I'll say they left me asking where they've been all my life? Sincere friendly staff and a cute decor (and a squeaky clean bathroom thank God!) paired with amazing food...a must-go for anyone near Gowanus.
Loved it. I got the the potato & cheese, boiled, and it was delicious. I got an order of 5, and was content with the size. 5 will fill satisfy you - I'm not sure I could've eaten 9.
The potato and cheese pierogies are incredible. Get 'em fried and use their sour cream!!

I'm from Long Island and do not have a pierogies spot. Have to say great service and awesome food. Wait time for food is a little long but that is because they hand make the pierogies on the spot. Now that is fresh on demand.
No comment

Just had a delicious dinner of the Sauerkraut, Jalepeno, Mac & Cheese, and Spinach Feta! They were all amazing and you can see them being hand rolled in the kitchen! Great work by Helena and her team!

Took my Polish mom here and we agreed - best pierogies (apart from her grandma/my great grandma) we've ever had! All made fresh to order. The dough was the perfect texture and taste! And of course the fillings were delish! Also - really can't beat the staff there. They are very friendly and love what they do. Can't wait to go back!

My sisters and I stopped here after an event at the Barclays Center, and let me tell you, it has some of the best pierogies I have ever eaten. I come from a Slovakian family myself, and these remind me of my Baba's homemade pierogies. My sisters and I each ordered different pierogies. I had the bacon cheddar, while my two sisters had the mac and cheese, and farmers cheese pierogies. They were delicious! The mac and cheese ones were a wonderful twist to such a classic dish. After we ate there, we decided to grab some spinach & feta pierogies for the road, and they were just as good as the ones we had in the restaurant! From now on, I'll have to start lying to my own Baba and say that her pierogies are the best I ever had!

SO good!!! Wish we ordered more.  Fried bacon and cheese were amazing; we loved the potato boiled too. Can't go wrong here.  The service was great - very good experience overall.  Can't wait to go again!
Best food in the area. Worth the price worth the drive. Nothing I can really say that hasn't been said so just check it out
Best Pierogies I've had in a long time. Loved the authentic and family atmosphere. I will definitely be going back to Baba's next time I'm in Brooklyn!

The best Pierogis ever.  Incredible, Amazing, Delicious and Fresh, Never Frozen. This place is truly special, very cozy and warm. My favorites are pan fried Jalapeños.  The staff is always friendly and happy. Big plus Czech Beer on top ...

Fantastic pierogies! I love boiled ones but tried the fried ones they were delicious. Mac and cheese were amazing. Potato and cheese were just as great. The side of bacon was ridiculously good. Took some Feta and spinach home and they were even great cold. Our only regret was not ordering more to bring home!! Oh and tried some kielbasa sliders no words everything was great!

Baba's is the best! The perogies are made fresh to order! What?! Not frozen? And ready in under 10mins! You can't get perogies like these anywhere else in NYC. All in a very comfortable, welcoming setting. It's just the best. Go eat perogies at Baba's.
Got the bacon cheddar pierogies with Helen's Dip - delicious! The cucumber salad was pretty yummy too. Plus the woman behind the counter was super friendly. Definitely coming back soon :)
WOW!!!! I got the bacon and cheddar pierogies.... SO GOOD! Try the blueberry dessert pierogies too!!
Delicious! Eat in or delivery it has always been excellent! Jalapeño pierogies are amazing!
Excellent pierogis. Try to bacon/cheddar. Crisp and tasty kielbasa
No comment

Wonderful places deserve a review! (I have been to both Gowanus and Williamsburg). Like many of you I have grown up eating pierogies. My grandmother made them and in a heartbeat if you weren't waiting when the pierogies hit the table, you were outta luck. Everyone's grandmother, mother, cousin, uncle made them- and everyone will rave that their grandmother etc made them the best- But no, these pierogies are special! Let's start off with how beautiful the space is! The staff is wonderful and the restaurant is very clean. The decor is simple but thoughtful. The process from walking into the place, getting seated and ordering something that reminds you of a happy place in your heart is special. The classics are undoubtedly what makes me feel like a kid. But hold on, pair with a chicken soup and schnitzel bites and were on another level of life. Don't sleep on the other menu items because everything is fresh and made to order. I have eaten through this entire menu and I must say everytime I have anything at Baba's the consistency never changes. You can't go wrong with anything on this menu. When I am eating out, I want quality, and thats exactly what I get each and every time. I spare no expense when dining out, it's a treat after a long day at work. The atmosphere is refreshing the food is exceptional and the service is delightful. I can't say enough except- GO THERE NOW- Your belly will thank you!
No comment
The bacon cheddar pierogies are amazing! They come in a batch of 5. Everything is made fresh to order. The store front is cute and quaint. Can't wait to go back and try their kielbasa sliders.
what a fine surprise!!  Some delicious twists on an old standard plus friendly service made for a great first experience. Don't miss it!
Excellent food and really great service! Highly recommended. Bacon and cheddar as well as Sauerkraut were amazing.
Happen to see this listing on Yelp and had to check it out as I love periogi!!! I had the potato and jalopeano (just a hit of spicy ones) and the crunchy chocolate  periogi - both were great!!

Pierogies were so delicious and worth the wait. I went with girlfriends on opening day. We expected their would be a wait, so we snagged a table and posted up. I actually have no idea how long we waited because we chatted the time away - but the pierogies...yesss!! My favorite was probably the bacon cheddar. The jalapeño was good too, but I wanted moooooorrrrrrreee spice! Mac and cheese was yummy, and I can't wait to try the rest!! Space is adorable, so if you can grab a table, you should!
Great place and the young couple who own it are really nice folks. The food is really good and well worth a trip to Gowanus. I had the sourkraut pierogie deep fried and the golden beat salad.

What a warm, friendly and homey atmosphere! The staff is so personable and kind; they make you feel welcome from the moment you walk through the door. The pierogis are DELICIOUS!! Loved the spinach & feta and the bacon & cheddar ones, but also really really enjoyed the potato & cheese ones w toppings like caramelized onions & bacon bits. Definitely try to save room for dessert too, because the crunchy chocolate pierogis w homemade whipped cream are to die for!! Will definitely be back to this lovely little spot & wish the owners every bit of luck & success, as I look forward to being a patron for years to come! ... Oh and btw their music selection is awesome!!

We heard about this place because it made the best of NYC cheap eats in NYMag. Turns out it's not far from where we live in Brooklyn, so we tried it out last night. AWESOME! Super tasty pierogies (not too doughy) and great fillings. Definitely will be one of our go to places...lots more pierogie options to try. Highly recommend checking it out.

They handmake each order of pierogis, so even though that means they ask for additional prep time they still came out in a reasonable amount of time. We had an order of the jalapeno pierogi and they were perfect. Crisp on the outside and the filling was amazing. Not too spicy, just enough to go well with the cheese and potato. Our waitress was very friendly and the space is bright but also small and cozy. A+ experience!
Amazingly good! If you haven't gone make a plan to go immediately. Helena is a gem!

Really yummy! I got take-out when my mom and dad were visiting tonight and we all LOVED it. We had potato & cheese, jalapeno, cheese, and potato & bacon + plus a beet and cucumber salad. What really impressed us in addition to the food was that the restaurant and kitchen were SPOTLESS and the fellow taking the orders was really friendly. We enjoyed the experience very much. It's also really economical - a 5-piece order was plenty filling.

This place is amazing.  The food is so, so good, and it's a casual, but stylish atmosphere. I got the potato and cheese pierogie, boiled, with butter; the jalapeño pierogie, pan-fried; the kielbasa sliders, which came with a side salad (got the cinnamon-spiced carrot salad, so unique and delicious) because they were under the sandwiches category. Also, 5 stars absolutely for he customer service-nicest guy was working the counter and brought out food to our table, even though he probably doesn't have to, with the way this kind of restaurant works. It was not the cheapest meal I've had, but one of the best for sure. Also, I went came here on a Tuesday, and they were donating 15% of their proceeds to homeless people.

Today was my first time at Baba's Pierogies and I'm already planning my next visit! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Favorites include spinach feta, bacon cheddar, jalapeno pierogies and the sliders. A welcoming delicious spot you don't want to miss.
The most fantastic pierogies I've ever eaten!   And they have beer on draught!   Great Brooklyn find!!
Went in two times and they were out of pierogies. I understand that it was their opening weekend, but it was just disappointing. Also, another cash-only business on this block.

We were a group of five girls on a Sunday brunch. We all shared pretty much all the flavor pirogues they had, the schnitzel balls and kielbasa. Everything was absolutely delicious! For desert we had the pirogue filled with chocolate and fresh whipped cream, also amazing. This is a small, quaint place which started to get busy as we were leaving. Amazing food, will definitely come back.

A nice place, with delicious food, and a lovely environment with modern simple decor. It has a lot of diversity in food and is great with kids. Our 7-year old wanted to write his own review: this place is awesome. You should go here a lot.

Went with a group of 6 so we ordered 1 of each flavor. They were all excellent!!!  My grandmother was Czech so I grew up on pierogis. I especially loved the macaroni and cheese and cheddar and bacon. I also highly recommend the dipping sauces, especially the horse radish.
This place was so great. I had the sauerkraut pierogies with caramelized onions.  Make sure to get dessert also

THE BEST!  As someone of polish/ukranian descent...I've been eating pierogies my entire life.    These are some of the most fresh & flavorful!  Love the different flavor options too!  And don't stop at the pierogies!  The rest of the menu is equally amazing!

Refreshing. Light. Minimal. Baba's is classically Brooklyn in tracing its roots back to the "Old Country". And Baba's is creatively Brooklyn in its unique approach to pierogis. Glad for the friendly staff and great value. Not every new Brooklyn restaurant needs to be exclusively chi chi. Baba's has class without the airs of indifference. This one's a keeper!

yum! pierogies!  we were greeted on the opening weekend by an accordion player and a warm smile....there was a bit of a wait for our toGo order and the place was bustling so we decided to go for a stroll around the neighborhood as it was a beautiful day.  the pierogies were homemade goodness and reminded my friend and i of those our own grandmothers would make...the dough, the filling, all of it was pierogie perfection!  i am sure they will work out the timing and orders will come out quicker once they catch their groove... we will definitely be back!
Delicious!  We had the potato bacon cheddar pierogies and the kielbasa sliders. Big portions all around. Reasonable pricing. I'll definitely be back to try all the different varieties.
Great Pierogies.  Staff was very friendly.  Cash only.  Kielbasa sliders were great.  Check it out if you like Eastern European food.
My favorite new place in BK. Delicious homemade pierogies just like grandma used to make. The decor is authentic and simply wonderful...I keep coming back for more.

I can not say enough how much I love this place.  The pierogies are light and delicious. The Bacon Cheddar and the Mac & Cheese pierogies are my favorites. Try the crunchy chocolate dessert pierogies too.  Go early - they sometimes run out of my favorites sides.

Absolutely delicious! Went with my mother and sister and had a fantastic meal! We had the bacon cheddar, spinach and feta and Mac and cheese, they all were scrumptious! Helen's Dip is definitely something you cannot go wrong adding to your delicious selections! The dessert pierogi are amazing as well my personal favorite were the crunchy chocolate I could eat them all day! Overall I am definitely going to be a repeat customer and so is my family!

Just passing by and what a nice surprise.  We had lunch here.  The pirogues were freshly made and delicious.  We had the mac & cheese and spinach feta.  They were the best I have tasted.  We also tried the blueberry.  They were fresh berries inside a  shell.  Fresh whipped cream on the side.  Yummy!   Can't wait to stop in again.
No comment

We randomly walked by this place. Was searching for something to eat in the neighborhood, saw this cute looking pierogies cafe. We looked at the menu, saw other customers' orders, and decided we would eat here. The texture of the pierogie skin is soft and has the perfect chewiness. We had spinach and feta, and farmer's cheese and potatoes. They taste homemade. That is because they make your pierogies to order. One pan fried, one boiled with mushroom toppings. Delicious and satisfying. We also ordered kielbasa with homemade sauerkraut. The platter is on the small side for the price comparing to other items on the menu. But we really love the place and want to support small business like Baba's. Good and affordable dining is disappearing in New York. We need more places like Baba's. The owner really wants to share their food with us and they are proud of their culture. We will come and eat more pierogies soon.

Food was delicious, and the vibe was great! We sat at the bar. Bartender was very nice, helpful, and knowledgeable about the menu. Great happy hour deals even on the weekend. Will definitely be going back again!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

First time trying aguachiles- was blown away by the negro campechanos aguachiles. The habanero has a slow burn but it's the perfect level of heat. Also tried the Amarillo one which was also tasty, but has less of a kick. Loved the tostada de viera (raw scallops). The fish tacos had the perfect crisp. The pescado del dia Al pastor is also a must - it was branzino the day we ordered this and I was amazed at how they took out the bones while keeping the fish shape intact.
Loved the food and ambience. The service team was great but took off one star for the horrible hostess.

Quite the gem south of the Lorimer stop on the L! Outstanding aguachiles and ceviche, not to mention the most unique variety of salsas when ordering chips & salsa. Great happy hour deal as well (includes weekends!) most certainly will be back every time I'm in the neighborhood!

Ceviche was okay but the tacos needed more sauce and flavor. Margaritas are very sour and not the best in Williamsburg. Unfortunately this place did not live up to its expectations and that knocks out three stars each (there were peels left on the shrimp in our ceviche). Our server was very nice though, but would not recommend this place. Much better tacos and Mexican food in WB elsewhere.
No comment

This restaurant should be on every foodie's must eat list!! The restaurant is a seafood focused Mexican restaurant and if you've been a fan of Contramar in Mexico City, you will love Ensenada! The super highlight of the night for me was the perfectly cooked butterflied roasted fish that came with fresh hot tortillas. Can't wait to be back for another fun mezcal and seafood night.
No comment

As Mexican Americans, my wife and I can say this is the best authentic Mexican seafood we've had in the five boroughs. The tuna tostadas and Al pastor fish are amazing and our go to. We've added this place to our list of favorites in the city. We'll continue to be back.
A new favorite with incredibly fresh seafood, awesome drinks and great vibe. Amazing tacos and the patatas bravas are an underrated star. Love this spot

Absolutely spectacular! Our party of 3 got the scallop Tostadas, aguachile sampler, Branzino al pastor tacos and the hibiscus dessert. The Branzino al pastor were not just one of the best tacos I've had in NYC, but in my life (and I lived in Los Angeles for 6 years). That dish reminded me of Cosme's incredible kampachi al pastor, especially with the pineapple butter. My jaw essentially hit the floor after the first bite of the dessert, so complex and otherworldly. The service and drinks were major highlights too. Overall, would say Ensenada is one of Brooklyn's best-kept secrets and the trek from Manhattan is 1000% worth it.

Went here last night. Food was incredible - salsa flight, chips and guac were amazing. The guac was too onion-forward for my friend (who is a chef btw for what it's worth) but no complaints from me! Tuna tostada appetizer was next. Chef friend had doubts before it came. She thought it was going to be one of those teensy tiny one-bites that you pop in your mouth. No chef! The tuna tostada app is full of flavor with a surprise of toasted sesame and each is the size of your palm - many bites. Next up was the aguachiles - which is a form of ceviche (raw fish in broth?). I had the verde version - bright green, fragrant, herbal, spicy. Chef had the negro - deep brown, lots of heat, rich, spicy. We had smoky mescal and a couple cocktails, too. All of it delicious! Good service too. I'd definitely go again.

Food was amazing- the flavor packed in every bite was incredible. Service was also great and very nice staff. We ordered the guacamole, tuna tostadas, shrimp ceviche, fish tacos and patatas bravas. Already planning my next visit when I can do the whole order all over again!

The food and drinks here at so awesome - and so good that I came to eat here two nights in a row. This is fish-forward, authentic, super fresh Mexican food the quality of which I would compare to Atla. Everything I've had so far has been delicious, and I can't wait to keep coming back for more aguachiles!

The menu is uninspiring and overpriced ($17 for 2 tacos, $15 for guacamole, $13 for chips & salsa), and I couldn't find anything I wanted to eat. I decided to leave, but the server was very pushy about ordering something, although I can't blame her because the place was completely empty on a Saturday night.

Went here with a party of six. As soon as we entered, we were immediately offered a table. Our server was good- He is an expert at the menu and selling us--no kidding. We had no idea what dishes would be appropriate for the occasion, but he simply went to buy some samples and explained which ones were which, as well as which ones he loved and recommended. Although it's not our first time doing Korean barbecue, it is our first time here, and when we informed him of this, he helped us incredibly by making food suggestions and by keeping a close check on us so we could report on the cuisine. I appreciate the opportunity!
No comment

Atti is a really great Korean bbq restaurant that just hit the scene. We had a group of 7 and ordered various meats and side dishes. We allowed the server who is also part of management to take over for us. He didn't disappoint. Superb cuts that melt in your mouth. Side dishes were awesome. Very good stews.

My friend brought us here on the recommendation of one of her other friends. The barbeque was quite good, and the ambiance is nice, but the ordering minimums are kind of odd, and it was a little expensive. For a group of five, it was explained to us that the minimum was 2 x the pre fixe menu, plus 3 a la carte meats. We chose the three cheaper ones. We each spent $75 after tax and tip. The waiter was also really weird about giving us a few more leaves of lettuce. They did comp us some shrimp cocktail (which wasn't too tasty or fresh, but a nice touch), though!

Great addition of Korean BBQ in Downtown Brooklyn and I would definitely recommend the meal seat that requires 2 people at least with 4 great cuts of meat by the chef. Everything was tasty and high end. Even the tableware was high quality I must say. One thing that isn't great is how pricey everything is. I ordered some extra lettuce to wrap the meat and other stuff without realizing it was 8 dollars for a few slices of lettuce which is a bit ridiculous. But besides that, service was great and the quality of food was excellent. I would definitely come back again but will not be ordering extra side dishes that would normally be feee in any Korean restaurant.
No comment
Delicious food! Better than cote without the wait. Service is great and ambiance is perf for date night or girls night! They're drinks are strong as well

If you've ever been to the Michelin-starred Korean Steakhouse COTE , ATTI gives a similar vibe. I loved the décor, and of course, the food! To start, my career is in facilities management, so I immediately notice how spaces look and make me feel. You should know I'm a slut for good millwork and lighting, and the wooden slat wall panels and lighting caught my eye immediately. My table ordered the oysters to start and the Chef's 4 selected cuts as our entrée. In Korean BBQ fashion, the meats came with several small sides called banchan, which included kimchi, egg souffle, bean sprouts, lettuce, and a variety of sauces (to name a few). The meats were grilled table-side and all tasted high-quality, and were well seasoned. We ended off with their bingsoo- shaved ice with red bean. The entrée was $64 a person and I think this was a great value for all it came with. My paloma cocktail was pretty but did not taste that great... but it was also the only drink I ordered. I'd still give ATTI a 5/5 as all the meats and sides were perfect, along with the vibe.
Food and services are both amazing.  I came in a group, but I see lots of couples dining here too - ambiance is definitely nice for a date.

We got Han Sang Set A, which came with 4 selected cuts. The meats were good, just not a lot. Two soups, egg, and shaved ice were also part of the set. As for banchans, you can get free refills, just ask. The plum mojito was refreshing.
No comment
No comment
Very the best traditional Korean BBQ full of side dishes. Great quality meat and an excellent combination with vegetables! the genre of healthy bbq! Solid spot & thoughtful mood and service.
No comment
No comment
A beautiful experience. Beautiful restaurant. Great Service, Everything on menu was fully explained. All the sides were amazing on top of Chae cooking all of our beef selections perfectly.

Yay for a fine dining KBBQ place in downtown Brooklyn!! Went with a group of 4. The meats were mostly really good - we got the premium menu as well as the other two cuts that didn't come with the menu so that we could try all the different cuts. I would recommend all of them aside from the filet mignon which was too lean. They have someone grilling it for you so you don't need to do it yourself but make sure you tell them how you like the meats cus the person who did ours kinda overcooked some of the meats until we told him. It was kinda expensive - they don't give you free vegetables (ssam and scallion salad) like all other kbbq places I know. Each was 8 dollars for a few leaves which is pretty crazy. Can we just bring our own vegetables?
No comment
No comment

There's not a lot of Korean bbq in Brooklyn - generally speaking, this place tastes good. A bit pricier and doesn't offer as much variety as the typical joints in Manhattan's koreatown BUT I'll definitely come back with friends. I hope their menu expand or rotates!
Phenomenal service and quality of food. The absolute best that Brooklyn has to offer in terms of Korean food and BBQ. Very premium quality. Very worth the visit.

This spot is pretty decent. Its a good KBBQ spot for downtown bk. It's a bit more on the pricer end but the cuts of meat are good. I did the Han Sang and it was lovely. I was full after but if you're comparing it to Ktown BBQ spots then I can see how it might feel like it's not a lot of food for the price but again the preparation of meats are different. In addition the service is different too, there's more attentive service here. I will come back!
No comment
Finally KTown level food in Brooklyn. Go here, get the chef's set menu (while it's still affordable!), and try to get seated with KO! He's great
No comment
Positives - the meats are high quality and well prepared. But the service is slow, and the cost is exorbitant- not worth it.
The best Korean BBQ in Brooklyn! The Ambiance is nice and their service is very friendly!!

5 stars is not enough to give this restaurant. The restaurant has a beautiful ambience and our waiter KO made this a wonderful experience for us. Everything on the menu was amazing - the marinated short ribs is a must try! I would definitely recommend this restaurant for date night or groups. Looking forward to my next visit!
Sooooooooooooo goooooooooooooooooooooooood. A lil pricey but worth it!! Much needed addition to the neighborhood
Nice place, very awesome food. Would highly recommend it! The cabbage pork bun are a bit soggy but otherwise things are very good.
This place is simply Amazing and a wonderful option for dim sum. I have a huge serving of rice and chicken.

The food here is worth the price, and they provide good service here. It's also has a good amount of seating and the tables are clean. It's located near Baruch and one of my friends put me onto this spot, so if you're reading this I'm putting you onto this spot now. They also offer food based on dietary restrictions. Definitely 4 stars
No comment

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment
No comment

Came in the morning and saw only one table then others started trickling in but it still wasn't that busy. The place is clean and spacious. You pick up and bus your own table. We didn't have to wait long for our foods. They don't all entirely taste hot and fresh. The siu mais were salty and the sticky rice was a bit bland. The soup dumplings weren't that impressive. They were lacking something. I really did enjoy the chicken feet which was cut into smaller pieces. The fried taro dumpling was good. I've never had cilantro in them and it was a great addition.
No comment
No comment
No comment

My friend and I ordered Sunday takeout here and loved the shrimp rolls- it had crispy stuff and shrimp inside the changfen which was super unique. We also ordered the hagao, chive dumplings, sticky rice, and radish cake. We didn't like the chive dumplings very much and the radish cake was mediocre but everything hit the spot :)
No comment

No comment

column3: Lower Pacific Heights, San Francisco, CA
column6: Easy ordering with open seating. Clean  dining area, self service pick up food and find your own seat.
No comment

No comment
What a grrat place for fast and delicious dimsum. Easy to order on iPad or at counter. Love the open seating concept and space. Great service and lots of options to choose from!
No comment
No comment
Nice dim sum place! Tried for the first time as I was in the city! My fam loved it as we ordered the Dimsum combo A which gave us a variety of the menu. We loved it!

Stumbled upon this spot on a freezing NYC evening with a friend after overpaying for subpar drinks at a "holiday" bar. We were a little confused by the ordering setup, but it's a matter of navigating on their iPad and you're set. We ordered pork soup dumpling, steamed dumplings and purple yam buns. Our order was promptly made and we were served quickly and easily. The space is modern and ample. Everything was tasty and filling. Overall, for the price, location and experience it was well worth it and I'd return/recommend.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Yummy dim sum good service good times with friends after work couldn't wait to try as many as I could

The menu was diverse and delicious. The staff was nice, and I think this may be the best way to eat dim sum - ordering it all in bulk, taking it all back to your table. Everything tasted great, but my favorite was by far the worst thing for my waistline - the Fried Rice Dumpling.  When I come back I'm ordering like 10 of these things and then going to the ER.
No comment
No comment

Very disappointed with my experience compared to the reviews. I thought it would be much better. The spring rolls were oily and not fried properly. The soup dumplings were ok. The pork chive dumplings were the only items that were good. The fried noodles were also nicely done and had good texture. The dumplings were not the best. The vegetable ones also didn't hit the spot. They stuck together and ripped apart. I felt bloated and heavy after eating the food. Had high hopes but I wouldn't be running back to this spot.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great service and great food! Would highly recommend a stop by for lunch. The cold brew hibiscus tea is great!
No comment
Chinatown style dimsum in the neighborhood.  Nice environment and clean place.  Will definitely come back.

I've been coming here for a couple years and have never been disappointed! The only thing that I do not really like are the soup dumplings, but that's only because there are so many soup dumpling options in nyc. Other than that, the dim sum options  are truly delicious for a great price.
Very good food and service! We ordered several dim sum dishes and all are fresh. Very clean as well, will return :)
No comment
Delicious food. We got Dim Sum A and hibiscus tea which was extremely refreshing. Super cute place with quick service, highly recommend!
No comment

column3: Long Island City, Long Island City, NY
column6: No comment
No comment
All delicious. The portions are a good size. Fast service. Eat in or take out.  Very clean! And clean restroom.

Great place for some quick dim sum! They have pretty much everything that you would find at a traditional dim sum restaurant. I was surprised to see so much seating (they have a top floor) so it was nice to eat there. I will say the prices are quite expensive for the dim sum, but overall, everything tasted great!
No comment
Great place to come and grab dumplings with your friends . The wait time is usually pretty short too !
baked bun is a must! Absolutely delicious! The price is definitely worth it. We recommend b

If you can't get to Chinatown, this is a good midtown spot for Dim Sum. It's a casual spot where you order at the counter, and then you pick up the food when it's ready. Seat yourself. Cool ambiance. Plenty of options. Some favorites were sticky rice, congee, and the black sesame roll. Will definitely come back.
No comment
No comment
Nice Place to sit down for breakfast. Also has wifi. Get the congee it's really good.
No comment
Best dim sum in NY. Super reasonable prices. Quick, fast, easy. Fun things on the menu like mala siu mai and Tim Ho Wan like Baked BBQ Pork Bun.
Food was a little cold since it's served cafeteria style but it tasted not bad. Still a cute and unique dimsum place to checkout!
Service was quick and easy, ambiance is very bright and clean. The food was great definitely will be coming back
No comment

amazing dim sum place that's actually taste better than the dimsum restaurants in chinatown . food taste very fresh and has a comfortable and clean atmosphere. i come here very often . i love this place !

Gorgeous, modern restaurant with plenty of seating. The staff are really helpful and kind in giving suggestions. There's a counter or kiosk to pay and then you sit with a buzzer and wait for your food. The chairs are also very comfortable and food is DELICIOUS. Can't wait to come back to try a lunch special.
No comment
No comment
Food is excellent and I would say one of the best dim sum places in nyc - prices are reasonable and the place is clean
No comment
Good quality dim sum at good prices, excited to try! Will update with more findings! Their iPad self serve isn't working, so just walk straight to the cashier to place your order.
No comment
No comment

The title of the restaurant says it all "awesum Dimsum" and very cheap too. It's a no frills place , you order at the counter and go pick up the food - but the food is amazing . Also the place is very clean . Would totally go again
No comment
No comment
Great food, great service! And great price. Love coming here for a casual dinner or lunch

My husband and I were craving Dim sum and came here for the first time. I loved how simple and fast the process was. We tried the soup dumplings, pork pastry, baked pork buns, bbq pork bun, and lava bun. The soup dumplings were ok and a little small for the value. We enjoyed the bbq puff pork and bbq pork buns the most. Overall a solid dim sum place that's fast and easy for a quick bite.
The food is a amazing and the service is great This is a mess. Come, check it out. I order the pork rid steamed rice
Great dim sum with a lot of variety. The dragons roll soup and wonton has great flavor in clean. Har Gow is plump and big. Ask for hot oil.
No comment
Awesome Dimsum is just as it's name it is absolutely excellent "AWESOME DIMSUM". Everything is delicious and prepared fresh! Would recommend to anyone wanting dim sum in the area!

This place is so convenient to order! You order at an iPad kiosk which makes it easy to change your order or look at what's in each item. Being a dimsum place you order w couple of each like a tapas place. The service is really quick and they also have to go containers and sauces available in case you order too much like I did. I also highly recommend a hot tea to go with your meal!
Awesome environment and great food! Quick service too! I had BBQ pork buns and loved them! The sesame balls were to die for.
No comment

Awesum dimsum is a great fast casual place for dim sum. Food comes out fast and hot and it is pretty similar to what you would get at the ones in Chinatown. I particularly enjoyed the dragon roll- like a steamed rice roll with fried dough stick but with shrimp, but everything was pretty good overall. Price point is pretty good and there are decent veggie options!
Good price for good food! There are lots of options and even good vegetarian options. Sled service is fast and convenient.
No comment

You can almost walk past this place because on the outside it looks small but it's big  inside. There's a lot of seating and so many choices for fried/baked/steamed dumplings. I couldn't decide what to eat and wanted to try everything. I got siu mai and steamed shrimp rice roll. Both were really good! A
No comment
No comment
Such a cute place with the best food! Very aesthetic interior and super close to baruch! Will definitely come again
What a gem!  Yummy, clean, fast service.  Did I say yummy?!  Omg so authentic and so good and so happy to have this place close to home.
Delicious Dimsum. Kind servers. Clean and pretty restaurant. If you are looking for dimsum to-go, or just a quick eat, I fully recommend. 5/5!
Chill spot and easy to order! Food looks amazing and there's free hibiscus tea so take advantage
No comment

I had down down 1 star because the quality was a little inconsistent. Came back twice after, Ordered the same items and a few different ones but i found the dim sum too greasy and they went a little overboard with the salt.

Definitely a good spot for dim sum located in the center of the universities (Baruch / NYU / school of visual arts). Dim sum is tasty. I've had it many times for lunch. Best to order ahead as they can get busy! Also - Leave a review for a free hisbiscus drink!
I love this place! My favorite is the pork soup dumplings. Affordable, quick, and friendly staff! This is a great casual dining spot and great for takeout! YUM!
No comment
No comment
Love this place, great soup dumplings and I love the lava buns, good for a dessert at the end.
Great place for a quick Dimsum fix.   Hargow was a bit salty for my liking.  Good service.  Casual ambiance.  Personally I still prefer traditional Dimsum house :)

Perfect place for dimsum craving in this pandemic! It's basically a self-serve dimsum place by ordering first at the counter and picking it up when your buzzer rings. You can also get a free drink by following this place on Insta - we got the hibiscus tea, which was great and paired well with the dishes we ordered. We got an assortment of dumplings, shrimp rice roll, and rib, which were all delicious! The rice roll was a little dry and my least favorite one. The dumplings were definitely the best part, especially the house dumpling! Highly recommend.
Service was great. Servers were patient with me and food was delicious. Would definitely recommend!
No comment
No comment
No comment
So good!! I love yummy food for cheap prices!! I bought noodles and dumplings for under ten dollars.

Got a variety of items, each was above average, and quality went above expectations.  For a restaurant doing dim sum all day and by taking your order in the front, the experience was great and would come back.  Price was also not bad comparing to food in Manhattan. Highlight was the sticky rice!
No comment
No comment
No comment
We were looking for a place that is open early in the morning, and this restaurant is the only one In Manhattan that is open at 8 am. The har gow, rice roll, and lava bun are good.
No comment
No comment
Went here for lunch with my girlfriends, and such a great time! Ordering was simple and easy, and the staff was great! Lots of great choices on the menu. Will definitely be coming back.
Amazing, high quality dim sum. A hybrid casual + sit down, this place is both unique and unexpected. Small wait for some of the best dumplings in town, Chinatown included! Don't miss.

Delicious affordable Dimsum. I order from here when I am in the mood and they are always quick to deliver. Their options are tasty and you get what you pay for. It isn't the fanciest or highest quality, but the price is good for what you get.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Everything was so delicious and convenient! I loved how this dim sum place was fast casual. You can order at the counter, on the machine, or on your app. Would definitely recommend one of the first two options, it's faster than app ordering. The food was super fresh and high quality. Very similar to what you'd get from a dim sum cart without the crowd surrounding you. My favorite were the har gow and beef steam rolls. Definitely will come back soon!
No comment

More expensive for smaller portions than what I am used to but makes sense considering the area. I am very surprised and glad they are open at 8AM because majority of Chinatown dimsum places aren't open this early! I will definitely come back because food is pretty good, seating is comfortable, and bathroom is clean. You can even pack your food to go yourself as the containers and paper bags are right in the utensils area.
Clean interior and modern in the middle of Manhattan. Lots of choices in the menu. Will visit again
Delicious dim sum and incredible selections.  This has become our go-to dim sum take out (replacing Tim Ho Wan)!
Quick lunch for sui mai to go. Clean restaurant, not very busy during workday. Quick service and good tasting food.
No comment
Great clean place, nice staff, easy to order from the kiosks and nice menu selection!
No comment
This place had such fantastic dim sum! I ate the whole thing in like 2 minutes (picture of my empty bowl below). Highly recommend!
Super nice interior. Very calm and quiet ambiance. The food was good. Service was amazing.

Go here for amazing and high quality dim sums. They are the standard for good dim sums in NYC in our humble opinion, they make dim sums that you would expect to get in Hong Kong. Their dim sums taste good even as take outs.  @therealyaokui
No comment
Great for simple, quick, and yummy lunch! Close to penn station and port authority station.
Great new dim sum place in midtown if you're looking for a quick bite to eat! Got the pork rib combo.
So clean and modern place to eat. I love the atmosphere of this restaurant. If you don't know where to eat for quick bites, I highly recommend

Awesum Dimsum is quite simply awesome!  While the format is a kin to fast food, the quality is second to none. As a bit of a dim sum snob who tries highly recommended dim sum from Hong Kong to London and beyond, I can attest that Awesum Dimsum is one of the best. Not all items are available every time so you will need to go several times to try everything, but given how good the food is that won't be much of a sacrifice.
No comment

This place has a very good seating arrangement and a great ambiance. The teas are really great and the veggie dumplings are even better. The staff is very fast and courteous. They also have breakfast and lunch specials that are pretty cheap.

column3: Southland Park, West Palm Beach, FL
column6: Amazing service and a really fabulous ambiance that justifies the quality of their food! Definitely would recommend!
Hits the spot! Friendly service. Tasty food. Great space. What a gem in the neighborhood. So glad to have the option available.
Great food and fast. The dim sum was very fresh and service was easy and quick. Came for quick lunch

Great selection of yummy Dim Sum, in a minimalistic location.  You order on a kiosk, and pay at the counter.  You pick up your food (not brought to your table) and beverages.  The restaurant is essentially plywood right now, very small and kinda noisy, but that presumably will change eventually.  The tight space makes COVID a concern though.
Delicious food! Loved the dimsum combo A and good hibiscus tea. I would definitely come again if you want some good fast and casual dimsum!
Amazing food, expedient service, comfortable atmosphere. Couldn't have found a better place to frequent for lunch before work!
Nice and clean . Good Dimsum ! Very affordable too. This is my first time in New York n boy was this place cleaner then the street on the way I walked here from the hotel .

This place has a fun casual vibe with yummy bites. Lava buns had the perfect texture and filling that was very balanced. Noodles tasted okay, definitely enjoyed the buns more. Scallion pancakes came out hot and crispy - we went back and ordered a second! White custard buns were a yummy dessert ending and very filling. You order at the screens, pay up front, and pick up your food from the counter.
Solid spot. Not so much if an enjoy your dinner in a quiet atmosphere kind of place. More of an enjoy good food and move on kind of a joint. Solid selection and I will be back for lunch soon.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Rly yummy food and tastes super fresh. Service was quick and efficient, and super clean place :)
So amazing! Definitely the place to go for dumplings! Soup dumplings and pork bao are the way to go!

4.5/5!!!! Love the easy use ordering system via kiosk, seat yourself and pay up front where you can also order drinks. I don't even know where to start. Orders one of almost everything to try. The rice rolls were great! Absolutely loved the shrimp and awesome rolls! Soup dumplings were the perfect one bite! Everything came out hot and crispy ! Would definitely come back
Nice and modern place with many options! :) Very clean! Would recommend coming here for lunch!
The food here is really good. The quality of the dim sum is even higher than some places downtown. Definitely check this spot out. Clean and friendly service.
No comment

This place was highly disappointing.  It was S if the food were pre-made and re-heated.  The soup dumplings seemed as if they were NOT home made.   They charge for sauces.  Highly overrated.  A waste of money.
Great food we tried dumplings and they were great. They also had veg dumplings. Awesome food
No comment
I'm really glad that there's a delicious dim sum place with an array of offering that is open early in my neighborhood.

Definitely want to order here again! Got delivery, the shrimp dumplings, shumai, shrimp rice roll, pork and shrimp fried buns and the pork ribs. The house dumplings and chicken shumai came with a few dishes, the house dumplings were pretty good and the chicken shumai were not something I'd order again. The shrimp dumplings and shumai were great. Love a rice roll and these were delish. The best part were those fried buns! Pillowy in all the right places but full of deliciousness.
