No comment

Unfortunately this place is very mediocre and the owners are not honest. If you want dim sum, goto Nan Xiang Xiao Long Bao. That's where the authentic dim sum are. Our dish came out with a string of thick hair. Super gross. We didn't touch it and asked for a new one to be made. The woman literally took it back and brought the same dish back out and told me it's new. The best part? The hair was still in it! I was stunned. I could see it was the same dish because of the clear glass and open kitchen. They eventually made a new one and give us an extra side dish for compensation but my god I was shocked.
Came here many times，awesome place！Food is really nice as well as the service. Will recommend！
Great service, great food, and great atmosphere! Order food through the self service tablet and it came out very quickly!
Such a cute place with a great ambiance! The service was also quick and food is great!
Awesome service and amazing food! Can't wait to bring the whole family to this establishment!
No comment

As someone who is Gluten Free craving dim sum, this was the perfect place. Really great gluten free options and tastes great. There are QR codes you can scan for menus or order yourself from the Kiosk. Food came out fast and fresh, will be back.
Wow. What a great, fun surprise. We'll worth the trip. Will def be back and will bring friends.
No comment
Good food and amazing place to eat Chicken Mushroom Steam Rices. Clean environment and delicious food

Really great dumplings in a safe and clean environment.  I tried the standard trio of Shrimp, Chicken and Pork. I absolutely loved the soup dumplings. Shrimp were high quality and delicious. The chicken were good but there were some bits that I did not love inside.  Pork buns were light and fluffy. The cost is a bit more than typical Dim Sum. All in all a great place for a solid dose of Dim Sum.

I took my cousin here for the first time since we were craving dim sum, and it's really hard to find all day dim sum in NJ. It was completely empty when we first came in, but the workers were really nice and helpful. They led us to the front counter where we saw a wide array of dim sum dishes that we were excited to see was being served for late lunch. My cousin ended up loving the soup dumplings and crispy shrimp rolls, while my favorite was the steamed shrimp rice rolls. It got busier as we started eating, with lots of people coming in and out for takeout and mobile orders. But the workers still found time to check on us during our meal and even helped clear our table. Definitely worth the train and stroll over, especially on a beautiful sunny day. Can't wait to come back!
Food is really good, the service is fast, and it's always clean. The specials and samplers are really great
No comment

Yum!! Love the dimsum here. I live close by so it's an easy commute on my legs and the prices are decent. My favorite is the egg tarts and the baked pork buns. I also like how they have samplers on the menu so you can try a little bit of everything. they're super fast and the restaurant is spacious! Would come again
No comment
This is my favorite dim sum place in NY. My favorite are the rice rolls and their bbq pork buns. 1000% recommend.
Super delicious! One of the best dim sum I have in Manhattan and the price is quite reasonable!

Was quite average to be honest- the dim sum in flushing's much better. The pork here tasted a bit off in the xiaolongbao and the siu mai. My favorite from the order were the shrimp dishes (har how and shrimp rice roll), pork puff pastries, and egg tart. I purchased the pulsd deal, which was definitely not worth it if you don't drink beer. They ask for a tax on the max amount of the charge when you arrive.
No comment
Amazing, so beyond fast and so cheap. There are so many options. Best dim sum ever in nyc!
Great place and the food is awesome. Would recommend getting a collection of items but specifically the soup dumplings and pork boa buns
No comment
No comment
Best dim sum. Always come back here from Long Island. Great menu. Good choices. Great staff
No comment
Super beautiful interior! The selection is very large. I ordered the Har gow and crispy shrimp roll. I definitely recommend going here for a quick bite.

Stumbled on this close to our Airbnb. This place did not disappoint my family. They are extremely picky eaters but they actually enjoyed this place a lot. Food was delicious, place was clean and staff was really friendly.
This place may not be for everyone, because everything is self serviced.  But, no doubt, this is the best dim sum in New York City, and maybe the entire country.
Great vegetarian options! Friendly staff! Loved the steamed vegetable rice roll dont forget to add the chili oil!
Great spot for authentic dimsum. Super easy ordering process and everyone was very friendly. Great atmosphere as well as you can just seat yourself once you order.
No comment
Dim sum is awesome. Friendly staff and delicious food. Very clean and good restaurant. Will definitely be back!
This Awesum Dimsum was Awesum! I really enjoyed the hibiscus tea and the soup dumplings. I will definitely be returning here ASAP.
Great staff, great environment, haven't tried the food yet, but hopefully it's good, get back to everyone on that!
No comment
Perfect place for a quick healthy snack on the go or a mini feast. Plus it's nice and quiet inside so it's a great place to escape the hustle & bustle
No comment
No comment
The food look so good and is absolutely delicious I extremely recommend this place to you
No comment
Quick and efficient dim sum, get to order through a kiosk and eat there! Very clean and quiet as well.
No comment

I got a deal through pulsd to try this place and I really liked it! I was a little unsure at first since it has a little bit of a modern/ fast food ambiance but the food was really delicious and came out quickly! The restaurant is not very wide but deep, so it looks small but there is a good amount of seating. The steamed pork buns were soft and fluffy, siu mai were juicy, and scallion pancake crispy and went very well with the sauce! The beef rice rolls were ok, but the sauce I think would have been better if it were stronger flavored like the scallion pancake sauce. But overall very happy with my meal!
No comment
Really clean and decent place near Times Square. Got out off Port Authority and was thrilled to see this Chinese dim sum place. Food quality is good as well.
super cute and clean dim sum spot! big menu and lots of dine in space. definitely one of my favorites!
Great selection on the menu. Modern interior and good price to value ratio. Would recommend!
No comment
No comment

For quick dim sum in a nice setting, recommend Awesum Dimsum. The hargow and Siu Mai is great and as well as the wonton soup and baked bbq pork bun. We got the hibiscus iced tea and it was a perfect amount of sweetness.
Great dim sum place with great prices. The service was good and the food was good as well. Highly recommend this place!

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment

So fast and easy! There's a kiosk inside or you can make your orders online via the QR code on your table and pay right online. This was the perfect spot to warm up and grab food quickly in the city. Will be back again soon!
It's good for a quick need dim sum now moment. Casual eatery. The awesome dim sum dumpling is pretty yummy although I think there is msg.
Great value yum cha food and the place was really good vibes! Would recommend the dim sum and har gow :)

Cute dim sum spot in the city that has these special rose dumplings for Mother's Day! Love that they had a large selection of vegetarian options as well. Everything is cooked to order and fresh. The restaurant has a lot of room to dine in. Try the custard tart too!
Awe dim sum was a very aesthetic place to eat and do work. They were very helpful when it came to picking out my order and what was best for my diet.
The combination of kids meal is good, has combination of different types of dim-sum to try. The price is also reasonable. Will come again!

We love this place! SO much variety for dim sum and we especially love it for takeout. Some of our favorites are the steamed pork buns, soup dumplings, and sticky rice in lotus leaves. Definitely recommend for a serious takeout operation.
No comment
No comment

I mean - hey look, fast food dim sum is a great concept. The vegetables were super fresh and tender. This is a great quick spot for dim sum and it's clean. Ambiance is just fine. It wouldn't be a destination restaurant for me but if I were in the area and wanted a good dim sum lunch in the go, I'd definitely go there
No comment
Delicious food and amazing place!!! The steamed rice rolls were absolutely delicious. Would 100% go again!

The space is bare bones with counter-service only, but it's great dim sum, Lots of gluten free option. Dumplings and turnip cakes fantastic, some other dishes just ok. Skip the egg tart and rice noodles.

I found this dim sum spot on TikTok! It's a cute little restaurant and I love how you can order your food at a kiosk on an iPad. Right above your head they have pictures of each item to make ordering easier! After getting off the train, we wanted to get a light meal to eat. Once we placed our order at the kiosk, you had to walk up to the front register and pay. We decided to dine in and they immediately asked for our Covid vaccination cards. I love the extra safety precautions they are taking. Each table was clean and had hand sanitizer bottles at each one. This was my first time ever having dim sum. The barbecue pork buns we're full of flavor and meat. The buns were so soft, warm, and fluffy. The crispy shrimp rolls were amazing and I'm mad I didn't go back for more! It was packed with shrimp and each bite had an amazing crunch to it! The steamed shrimp rice noodles weren't the best but it was my first time having it and it was still packed with shrimp just like the crispy shrimp rolls! I'll definitely be back!
No comment
No comment
Great place! Solid portions and affordable price. Quick food. Came here on a Sunday night with friends and had a great experience.
Awesome dim sum just like the ones from Hong Kong. Totally recommend and the prices are reasonable.
This place looks really clean and nice! In the heart of NYC and the price are pretty reasonable too

Love Awesum Dimsum. They label vegetarian options and divide the menu by "fried and "steamed" and "rice/soup/noodle". I got the vegetable dumplings which I really loved. There is ample seating, friendly staff, and lots of booths to order at - making it perfect for a quick snack when you're in a hurry! It's great, healthy, and awesum when you're detoxing to have steamed options!!
The food was really good! I enjoyed the har gow a lot! I would recommend this to my friends!
Lives up to the Name! The Bacon Wrapped Shrimp ones are amazing. Bacon Wrapped Shrimp Rolls
Beautiful interior. food is authentic and tasty. Absolutely love the chicken siu mai and steamed ribs. Staff is nice too
Delicious food, friendly staff, and affordable! Their hours are super convenient too. Will definitely come back.

Got the house dumplings and the Steamed vegetarian rice roll -- very good and price was pretty reasonable! Highly recommend if you're looking for a quick bite to eat near times Square. Also a nice quiet environment to get out of all the madness~

Loved loved loved this spot! So easy to order, lots of classic dim sum options, and nice interior. Food came out super quick and staff was helpful and friendly. The soup dumplings were great as well as the veggie dumplings and pan fried dumplings. I liked the rice rolls and the tea. Well priced and good food.
Came here for dinner on a Friday night. I liked everything we ordered! Esp the soup dumplings and the fried taro dumplings.

Even though Awesum Dimsum isnt located in Chinatown, the food itself was super authentic. The modern feel to the restaurant threw me off a little bit when we went in, but when the food arrived I was beyond happy. Totally recommend the Lava Bun and the Shrimp Cheung Fun!
No comment
Great lunch choices and quick dumplings. Prices are also pretty affordable for dim sum
Great location and food! We weren't able to dine in after 8:15 but it looks really modern inside. Chill vibe.
No comment
Awesum Dimsum is always delicious! When I'm feeling "bad" I go for fried options, but steamed rice rolls, har gow and siu mai are my go tos. I must try their congee for breakfast sometime soon
the dim sum here is very delicious and easy to order. all the dishes here are full of flavor.
Just moved to the neighborhood and stumbled upon this gem, so stoked! So many options at a decent price. Will be returning
Amazing food!!! Really lovely atmosphere!! The vegetarian rice rolls are vegan and gluten free, soy sauce on the side, just how I like it!! Thank you so much!
No comment
No comment

Decent dim sum fare, especially for Kips bay. Lots of indoor seating, clean modern wooden bright interior with lots of indoor seating. You order using a touch screen and then wait for your buzzer to go off. They had all the usual offerings, and it tasted good. There is better dim sum in the city, and it's certainly not the typical dim sum vibe, but a solid option if you're in the area craving it.
No comment
No comment
Great dim sum! I liked the Har Gow. Highly recommended! They always have specials too.
First time here and the menu is fantastic!!! So yummy. I love the design. Can't wait to come back
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Simple menu and minimalistic setup, it is a pleasure to enjoy food here. The food was very well made and service was great.
I love their soup and the ambience is very zen. Good place to go when you are on 23rd for lunch as not many choices these days
Amazing dim sum must try , quick service and comfortable place . Come and check it out
This place is awesum! No pun intended this is my third time here and it does not disappoint! Highly recommended if you are in the Gramercy area! The shumai and sticky rice are my personal faves!
Absolutely amazing dimsum comparable to the best dim sum restaurants in China town In my opinion. Try the dragon rice noodle roll it was my absolute favorite.

Absolutely love this place. Ordering is super convenient and the staff is helpful.  The food is delicious and steamed fresh. Kitchen moves very quickly to get the orders out so the wait time isn't too bad.  A+ !
No comment

Everything was delicious! Great for a yummy meal on the go. Friendly service. Reasonable prices. Very fresh. My favorite was the veggie rice rolls and the tofu skin and red bean puff, but everything we had was great!

Super close to Baruch, good lunch special. Clean and roomy, much needed dim sum presence in the area. I got the lunch special, it comes with a choice of rice (pork ribs, beef ribs, mushroom chicken), dumplings and a tea. Will come back.
No comment
Loved ordering on the iPads and the food was ready quickly. The food was very authentic, the dumplings were my favorite, we got a few different kinds and they were all great.

I stopped by on a weeknight and got the bbq pork buns, white custard buns, and spring rolls. All were tasty. I have no idea what white custard is but the custard buns were my favorite. They tasted like a very rich and sweet vanilla custard/cream pastry. I've got my eyes on their dumplings next. One thing to note though is leftovers don't stay well.
Small very clean place with good food. The tables range from shared long ones to separate one and a few seats at the window, along with one table outside. Good dim sum- not oily and fresh.
Good for a quick bite of dim sum, XLB.  Portions are on the small side - for 1 or 2 people.
No comment

Pleasantly surprised! I've been avoiding this place because it seemed pricey relative to Chinatown, but my friend recommended it so I figured I'd give it a try. It was much better than I thought. The main surprises are that the dim sum is actually pretty good; at least my staples of Hargow, siu mai and beef rice roll were and they didn't try to skimp and give only 3 pieces of the hargow & siu mai like some of the other new dim sum places in midtown. Would come back to try the other menu items

Super affordable, quick service, and clean environment! Dim sum is pretty authentic with lots of variety

Their flavors are spot on, in fact I find their dishes addicting. The textured of the dumplings and rice noodles are just divine. It's definitely hard to pace yourself. Lots of good dim sum - they have all my favorites (steamed shrimp rice rolls, soup dumplings)! The inside was clean and the food came quickly!

This place isn't necessarily the most authentic dim sum restaurant but the food is pretty good! The ambiance is definitely more modern so it's a good place to get Dimsum without all the hustle and bustle. Overall really good and I keep coming back for more.
Yummy and fresh.  Loved the fried shrimp roll, soup dumplings and sticky rice in particular.
Best dim sum!! Came here a couple times and got the fried rice dumpling. Not the same anywhere else.
Expect fast food quality dim sum (between Costco frozen food and authentic dim sum in a restaurant). Not sure how this got a 4.5 on yelp. Cool concept but not worth another visit.
I've been here multiple times and the food is definitely good.  There are days when I crave dimsum and this place hits the spot.

My favorite dim sum place on a rainy New York day! Best Asian breakfast food in Time Square!
Delicious and quick!!! Loved this place. The food was great and the workers were nice. Nothing bad to say!

Took hubby here for his first soup dimsum experience. He loved it!  This is not a gluten free spot but I was able to request for fried rice without soy sauce which was ok. Hubby and a friend enjoyed salt and pepper pork chop and pan fried lo mein!

I came here on a Sunday afternoon with a group of 3 people. We ordered the Dim Sum Combo A and an order of the steamed dragon roll. The place seemed to be very modern where you can order on the iPad kiosks and then wait for your order. You do get your order in steamed bamboo baskets if you dine in. However, we ordered takeout so we could eat at Madison Square Park nearby but there was a lot of indoor seating. The combo had a lot of food: 2 Har Gow, 2 Sui Mai, 1 Sticky Rice, 1 Cabbage Pork Bun, 1 Special Chicken Sui Mai, 1 House Dumpling, 2 Spring Roll, 1 Crispy Shrimp Roll, and 1 Baked BBQ Pork Bun.  Each order came with 3-4 pieces except for the rolls which were 2 pieces. It was enough food for 4 people basically. The dim sum was freshly prepared and high quality. My favorites were the more modern dim sum items which were the fried shrimp roll and the steamed dragon roll. They were interesting and not found in traditional dim sum places. It was a bit pricey but it's in a pricey neighborhood. I would come back and try other items, the short rib and the rose dumplings looked good.
I love this place. my family lives nearby and it's my first stop on arriving. I'm waiting for my order.
No comment

No comment
Awesome dimsums with authentic taste. I have been since Pandemic and taste still the same. Prices are jusr right to budget.
No comment
Super flavorful dimsum! Recommend the shrimp ball congee highly. And the iced hibiscus tea is perfect on a hot day.
Great dimsum in Gramercy. Food js fresh and customer service is wonderful. Get the pork and chive dumplings.
the food and drinks are amazing. Very fresh and quick. Would recommend this place 10/10. Really good place if you're looking For a quick lunch. Try the hibiscus tea. It's soo good

I can't explain in words how much I loved this place.. absolutely an awesome place. I love dim sum.. this was the first place I tried after Covid. This will definitely be on our favorite list. Ordered almost 10/12 dishes and loved all of them... the Scallion pancakes were so good, loved all the shrimp dishes.  veg dumplings were my least favorite. I'm just so happy that I found this place !! Will be returning soon
Had the SiuMai, scallion pancakes, and Soup Dumplings. Everything was super flavorful and it quick.

Got the steam rice rolls, steamed port buns, turnip cake, lava bun, and fried taro buns. The fried taro buns were a bit heavy but overall all the dishes were fresh and great quality. Clean space and calm ambience, good find!
Low key dim sum restaurant. Very popular for takeout. Great if you don't have a lot of time for some good finding in the Gramercy area.

What a disappointment! We visited Awesum Dimsum due to its positive Yelp standing but man were we mislead! Food took forever as if it had to be freshly cooked and yet it all tasted cold, rubbery and stale. The staff was pretty rude when we asked for an extra soy sauce packet but - trust me - you need the soy sauce! Not worth the calories let alone the price.
No comment
Super clean and the food was lovely. Friendly service, couldn't ask for better :) reasonably priced too.
A lot of variety of Dimsum and amazing in taste! Recommendable 100%. Also prices are very decent for the amount of food you get

Decently priced though they may veer on the expensive side if you are used to Chinatown pricing. There is a good amount of options that are classic dim sum dishes and a couple with more modern twists. It can be a little overwhelming and you may end up ordering more than you can eat but the food is good.

Really nice ambiance, friendly staff and the food was delicious. The presentation of the menu makes it really easy to order
Really cool spot with tons of options! Great workers too that help to figure out what you'd enjoy.
If you're seeking delicious dim sum, this is the place! Plenty to choose from on the menu, great service and large seating capacity. Can't wait to go back!
My go-to dimsum place in NYC! I come here at least once a month. The food is amazing and the price is super reasonable. My favorites are the har gow and the vegetable dumpling.

I definitely wanted to come try this new dim sum place after hearing their new twist to dim sum as they have vegan/vegetarian options! They have most of the OG dim sum items like har gow, xiu mai, and sticky rice but they're missing egg tarts and pan fried turnip cakes! All the dishes tasted mediocre, not terrible but not amazing. For the price and vegetarian friendly options, it's decent but if you want an authentic dim sum experience, I would go elsewhere.

A very casual but nice restaurant - this isn't a full serve restaurant but the tables are pretty nice and neat (you order at the desk and take the food). Would definitely come back if I want some quick dimsum.
This place is really great! A fast casual take on traditional dim sum it was a great surprise to find it when we moved to the city.

Awesome indeed! Stop by for a quick bite before meeting up with a friend. Super easy ordering process with QR code. Had the hargow and crispy shrimp and it was solid. Will come back to try more dim sum.
Not sure if it is a new restaurant after COVID, but the design is like a fast food restaurant. The food is tasty and feels good.

I was really excited about visiting awesome dim sum we elected to go here after I read some articles online and saw the Yelp reviews.  Decided to try it out today instead of going to our usual place dim sum go go in Chatham square.  Unfortunately very disappointing experience, the soup dumplings they're served to you in a little tin foil cups and the bottom stick to the cup and the meat has really very limited flavor not a good execution at all very disappointing.  The steamed rice cakes and I got the ones with pork might have been the worst thing I've ever eaten pretty much. I could imagine  the meat tasted like .... Well I won't say it out loud.  Call me old fashioned but just having a little fancy decoration and stuff not going to cut it you got to really make the food.
Super clean inside for reasonable prices. You just can't beat it, it's my 4th time here bringing a friend & I couldn't recommend it enough to others!

the combo A is really filling and delicious, especially the spring rolls. i also really enjoyed the fried rice dumpling!!

Loveeeeee this place! So cheap and has rlly good fresh food. I ate steamed dragon roll and scallion pancakes. YOU HAVR TO COME BERE

Awesome Dim Sum is our new favorite dim sum spot now in Covid-19 NYC.  The interior of the restaurant is clean and modern.  The dumpling steamer baskets are brand new.  Pleasantly surprised to find outdoor dining available.  We loved all the dumplings we ordered but especially the Dragon Rice Noodle, I'm drooling now thinking about that silky rice noodle stuffed with crispy kaitaifi and huge morsels of shrimp.  Tasted just like the shrimp rice noodle served at Summer Palace restaurant inside the Jing'an Shanghai-la Hotel.  We used to eat that often when we lived in Shanghai.  The quality of dim sum here is elegant and top tier, but the prices are reasonable.  We loved Awesome Dim Sum's House Dumplings and Watercress dumplings too.  After we finished, we walked from E 23rd and Lex to Columbus Circle to visit friends and then continued to home to UWS.  I was amazed that we had so much energy after eating dim sum.  Did not feel groggy or tired.  I'm very sensitive to MSG.  We are convinced that Awesome Dim Sum is truly awesome because their  dumplings are delicious and seems to be MSG-free!  That's a miraculous feat for legit Chinese dim sum!  We are already planning what to order on our next visit to Awesome Dim Sum!
No comment
Super delish dim sum spot. Especially if you need gluten free options, you can eat almost anything in the menu. Everything was super fresh & yummy. The crispy shrimp roll was to dieeee for 10/10
The hibiscus tea is such a summer refreshment. I feel at peace when I drink it. #Awesum
The best dim sum. Always my favorite. Great service as always!! Easy access from the park and very central
Friendly service, good space, and delicious food.

I just went in to ask if they had gluten free options and they circled half the menu. I ordered shrimp rice crepes and pork bun. I'm in heaven. It's been more than a year since I've had dim sum and most of the Chinese food I love is off limits. I can't wait to go here again. Also I forgot my credit card and the manager ran after me. So nice!
Very cool concept. Dim sum fast food. There's a limited menu, but each item was delicious. Fun drinks as well.
The place look awesome and the food smells great. The lady at the counter is very nice and pleasant too.
The food is delicious. The self ordering system works well and good for COVID era. It's similar to Tim Ho Wan but the food is slightly less refined. I would like to see more food selections though.

Amazing dim sum!! This is a very cool spot to grab food with friends. Great service and the food comes fast!!

I LOVE this place it's my go to and it has the best pork short rib noodles! Cute aesthetic and nice coworkers.
Amazing dim sum--yum!!! Perfect restaurant to go with a group during lunch. Super clean also. Highly recommend if you're in the area. It's pretty solid.

I'm from out of town and it's difficult to find good dimsum where I'm from! I was yelping close by restaurants nearby after I was done with brunch. I was in a bit of a rush to get going back home, so I ordered the Dim Sum sampler online. It was AWESUM. Perfect temperature. Great flavor. The flavors reminded me of childhood Houston Chinatown days. I asked for hot chili for dipping and my heart was happy as I took the trip back home.
Discovered this new dimsum place in Hell's Kitchen...nice modern, clean decor, great service, good prices and tasty food!
Cheap and good. Not too crowded either. Polite and good selection. Good place if you're not in Chinatown!

My boyfriend and I were walking home this evening, still full from a big lunch, but we noticed this new storefront and were tempted. I'm so glad that we stopped in! Really tasty food, and super friendly service. We ordered the siu mai, spring rolls, BBQ pork buns, and cabbage and pork buns--they also suggested har gow (shrimp and bamboo shoot), and crispy shrimp roll. The spring rolls were perfect. Really crispy outside, and soft inside, just like I like them. The siu mai was also great, and the har gow was an especially nice surprise. We're glad to have dim sum in the neighborhood, and will definitely be back! Looking forward to being able to dine in again. The space felt very clean and modern, with a great skylight towards the back.
Delicious authentic dimsum that reminds me of Hong Kong! Clean environment and friendly staff! Will definitely come back for more!
No comment
No comment

Excellent Dim Sum and great service. I ordered the Sui Mai, Pan-Fried Dumplings, Scallion Pancake, Sesame Balls, and Har Gow. Everything was fresh and flavorful. I prefer this over the carts. Some might disagree and say the carts are part of the experience. I get it but if you're a seasoned dim sum goer or you're an amateur, this is kind of ideal. You order after scanning QR Code on the table and selecting the food you want. Don't forget to order your sauces (soy sauce and hot chili oil). After you've placed your order, you immediately get a message with the exact time your food will be ready. No more wondering if the carts will ever come your way or if they've run out of your favorite item. I love the use of technology for efficiency! It's all about setting expectations. They brought our food and everything was delicious. Not one item disappointed me. And they were running a special! If you paid by Venmo or PayPal, you got 50% off your bill, up to a max of $10. I wasn't expecting that. I would definitely recommend and obviously come back. And I love the decor. Raving fan of Awesum Dim Sum. Love the play on words too. Great and legitimate dim sum Midtown and it made me very happy! My only regret is that I forgot to order the soup dumplings! Next time!! Oh and it was spotless!

It's a casual dim sum place, but their food is really good. I got a few different things and my favorite was the crispy shrimp rolls. Service was nice and it's a very good pricing overall. I would come back for sure!
So good! The food is hot and fresh and they have fantastic deals that really give you your moneys worth. Great specials aswell!!
Awesome, fast casual dimsum that has all the classics with good quality. No need to go to Chinatown for good quality dim sum. A bit on the pricey side.
My favorite lunch spot! The service is quick and the food is always very good. I recommend the soup dumplings.

Excellent food! It is high quality Hong Kong dim sum quality. Very clean place. Its a gem!

I tried the rice rolls (Cheung fun) and the custard buns. I found the rice rolls pretty thick with too much rice roll to meat ratio. You should have nice, thin layers of rice roll... Having said that, food was fresh and tasty and I'll come back considering there aren't any solid dim sum places around the neighborhood.

Amazing!!! clean and wonderful employees. first time day in New York and I'm very happy that we came here and didn't miss this perfect spot. The fried shrimp roll is the best!
Super yummy food, good ambiance, and fast service! Menu is extensive and you will find something you enjoy.
If you need to get your dimsum fix, this is the place. Quick service, good portions, and excellent taste!

New family owned business. Very sleek, modern and clean aesthetic that separates them from most dim sum restaurants in the city. Quality ingredients, authentic taste with some interesting variations, and affordable.
was so good!! the bbq pork puffs and soup dumplings were my favorite  the food and vibes are great
Quality Cantonese style dim sums. Super well made and tasty. Place inside is clean and easy to order food.

Industrial looking on the inside with the concrete walls. Had to try everything or at least as much as I could eat. Liked everything. Little hidden gem. Now I don't have to go to Chinatown when I need my dim sum fix.
No comment

There were outdoor seating during COVID. The food was pretty great. I recommend the scallion pancakes and the har gau. Do ask them for sauces. The only thing was it took an hour for us to get the food after ordering.
Holy crap, the best dimsum EVERRRR!! Loads of options, all affordable. The dumplings were way bigger than we expected. Between two people five dishes was almost too much. Highly recommend!!
No comment

I stood on line and never got served! I went in today and the lady on line in front of me had her arms folded and kept looking towards the door. So I wait there and a few minutes go by and the lady left. I moved up and quickly realized why she left. The man behind the counter glanced and saw me there at least 5 times and never came to ask me my order!! A couple came in and asked if I was on line, I said yes and waited another 5 minutes before I realized that the couple were leaving. I left as well. I came because I heard good things online but I am starting to believe its paid. Please talk to your staff and improve your customer service.

Believe the hype. This place really is that good. Order one of everything. You won't be disappointed. Some of the best soup dumplings I've ever had and they delivered soooo well! Great shumai, noodles, honestly you can't go wrong. Love this place.
No comment

Delicious dim sum.  I can attest that it is authentic with my root of origin (Hong Kong).  The place is very clean and service is excellent.   Will definitely go back.  So glad to find a decent dim sum place outside Chinatown, which is a bit far from my home.

Sooo good. We got this for Valentine's Day brunch. I will go back here. Not the old school traditional dim sum with the cart but the flavors were right up there. I liked the soup dumplings, my partner wasn't as pleased but the pork riblets, steamed pork buns and everything else I inhaled were a delight! Come check it out when you're craving

Love this place, always worth a drive from NJ to get some good dim sum ! The owners also are super generous, we went one time and they have us an order of the shrimp roll! Now we always order it for every-time we go !
Ordered from here tonight! Very quick delivery and well priced! Prob the best dim sum I've had in the area!!!!!! Yummy

I'm in love. This place has incredible dim sum and is super quick/convenient. Not as far from me as Chinatown or Flushing, but still has some really great food to curb any dim sum cravings (honestly I prefer the food to other popular dimsum places in the city). I think I base all of my dimsum experiences on the shrimp rice rolls and har gow - they're great here, you can't go here and not get them.
This dum sum spot is great!  Casual and fresh. It doesn't hurt that it's in an area that doesn't have a lot of dim sum too. Neighborhood favorite for sure!
Really surprised by the quality of the dim sum! My favorite were their custard buns and beef rice noodles (actual minced pork and not a beef patty cake situation)! Would def go again

We've ordered delivery and take out a few times since this place opened up and love it! So nice to have a great dim sum option outside of Chinatown. Fresh food, great tasting and good service would recommend!

My daughter had brought a coupon 2 eat for 29 dollars from an app. I don't know which one. It included 5 plates and 2 beverages. She thought it was 5 plates for both but it was 5 plates to share and then she was told the plates were only the 7 dollar ones. When I looked at the menu the 7 dollar plates had what looked like 2 or 3 small appetizers on each plate. The reason we didn't eat there was because both of us were very hungry and didn't think the special would fill us up. I think the app for the deal should be explained in more detail.
Delicious dim sum in a nice and clean space. The service was also great, and prices are not too bad for authentic dim sum
No comment
Not a bad delivery dimsum option for non Chinatown. They have the greatest hits and they taste good.

Excellent delivery, incredibly packaged for flavor, freshness and steaming hot dumplings and broth. Loved the shrimps dumplings, the steamed beef and the soup dumplings. Excited to try the rest of the menu!

This is my new favorite dim sum spot in Manhattan. Each dish tastes amazing and pretty cheap (around $5 per dish). The soup dumplings and shrimp siu mai were my favorites. They were super juicy and flavorful. The pork buns were delicious and also had a really great soft texture like pillows. I hope I can come back again soon!

These were the best Siu Mai i have ever had in my life and I have been on this planet for many decades. My hubby and I had most of steamed items on the menu. Every item was delicious. Beautiful thin skin rice wraps on the har gow and shrimp and beef rolls. The roast pork bun, turnip cake, sticky rice, pork and cabbage buns - all were juicy and yummy. Fantastic flavor, all items were freshly made - SO good. Also, a huge plus for me - they gave me chili oil without me asking.. I was so happy!!!!! The space is exceptionally clean, excellent quality in the front of house and back, you can see thru to the open kitchen.. We will definitely be back!!!
Huge space and decent environment. Tables outside. Food is great. Fresh Dimsum. Hope this place lasts and survive COVID.

Love this place! Dim sums are fresh and delicious! It's clean inside and staff are friendly. Must try their steamed dragon roll, it's my favorite! My kids love their fried dumplings and har gow. Definitely we will go back!
a lot of different options on the menu, decently priced, traditional and delicious food, definitely recommend coming to this dim sum place :)
No comment
No comment
Great dim sum place. Super reasonable, fast and fresh. Good quality and great service. I'll be back!
To be honest it tasted good but not that good to have each one cost like 6-7 bucks for 4 little pieces.. waaay too expensive
Finally a great dim sum place. Been here several times. Delicious, fast and courteous service. So good!

Awesum dimsum is indeed super awesome!! Looks clean, feels clean and staffs were very friendly. Ordered Siu Mai and Fried Dumpling to go as lunch and regretted that I didn't order more! (I usually order smaller portion of food when first time trying a new restaurant.) I even got a free Hibiscus tea and it was delicious, too. The dim sum there was very authentic. Also I think the staffs/chief are Cantonese/HongKonger so they really know what they are making!
Yummy food , clean place , great owner . I will definitely be returning . All covid procedures were followed with as well .

I am impressed, Awesum Dimsum was certainly superb. Great place. The menu is really fantastic, so many very good choices, I had to go with Siu Mai, and it was excellent. All of the staff are really friendly - you most certainly feel welcome and taken care of. Way to go Awesum Dimsum.

Wow.  I have been waiting for a good dim sum place by us for so long and it has finally arrived.  It's as authentic as you can get outside of Chinatown.  They make their steamed shrimp rice noodles from scratch (it's not the frozen pre-heat nonsense).  Their sticky rice wrap actually has a salted egg and not the fatty pork that some other places have and their bake bbq pork bun rivals that of Tim ho wan.  I tried their vegetarian dumplings which were done really well too.  Overall I am super excited they opened up down the street.  Please go and try this place out if you like dim sum!  I would be sad if they closed down (like many of their predecessors using this space).  This will be my go to place for now as I haven't been going to Chinatown as much.
Super affordable and the food was good! Kind of like fast food dumplings lolll loved ittt

The dim sum was the best that I've had in NYC. The wrappers were light and fresh. It's better than other dim sum restaurants because your order is made fresh and not served from carts which are pushed around from table to table. The soup dumplings had great bursts of flavor. The shrimp dumplings had a nice fresh crunch to them. This dim sum place was comparable to the best in the San Francisco area.
Great addition to the neighborhood. Solid and tasty! Love the shrimp rice noodle, crispy shrimp roll, and custard bun.

Delicious! There are 2 kiosks when you enter to order then you pick up at the back. You can dine in and pick your own table. There's also a few outdoors. Just as good as Chinatown without the stressful environment.
This is the best Dim Sum spot in NYC hands down, and very affordable. The staff is super friendly. I come here all the time.

I love dim sum but I hated the way it made me feel after each meal. This place uses quality ingredients that don't make you feel gross. I was thoroughly surprised how clean and amazing the food was. I ordered the steamed shrimp rice noodle with har gow and bbq pork buns...all of them were bomb.

Excellent dim sum. I had the siu mai and the turnip cake and both were fantastic. The chicken mushroom steam rice also was very good, a simple but surprisingly satisfying dish. Looking forward to trying more items from this spot. Five stars
This place is straight up amazing. Some of the best dim sum in nyc. Get the pork buns and shrimp rolls
very convenient and fast. soup dumplings were ok. nice modern look to the place, too. would come here again for sure

Excellent Dim Sum.  This is the third time we've been here, and the food is always delicious.  The shrimp with rice noodles is fabulous and cooked perfectly.  Had delicious soup dumplings today.  Haven't had anything but excellent food.

First time getting delivery and they were super fast, nothing missing and the food tasted just as good as when I go there in person. There aren't many dim sum spots outside of Chinatown but this is easily one of my favorites.

Ordered takeout here. The springroll and shu mai is very oily. After I ate these 2 along with other stuff for awaile，I feel so nauseus and throw up！I throw all the leftover out. Had high hopes for this store bc the good reviews，but apparently the ingredient is not fresh. Will not order again！
Love this place. All their stuff is great, and we keep coming back (delivery/takeout). We get the pork buns, house dumplings, shumai, sticky rice wraps. Yumm
This place was amazing. Very fast preparation, extremely kind staff and spectacular dimsum. This will definitely be my go-to spot from here on out!

I live in Edmonds, WA but I'm sure the food is awesome. Just saw the youtube video by Mikey Chen a few days ago. He really loved it. We have good dim sum here but nothing like that unless you go to Chinatown. Also with the lockdown, everything is to go. Dim Sum to go is not the same as eating in at a restaurant. That food looked soooo good!
Great food for very inexpensive! So happy I tried this place as it's close to where I live- I expect to eat here plenty more times in the future!
Great selection of dim sum that is super flavorful and thoughtfully made. My favorites are the fried pork and shrimp dumplings and the special chicken siu mai. Takeout has been great during pandemic.

My husband and I were out on a walk around our neighborhood and saw this new place-- WHAT?!?! A new restaurant opened just as NYC is starting to reopen?!?! That takes courage! Well, that's not the only admirable thing about this cute little fast dim sum place. The owner is so gracious and offered us complimentary iced tea and chatted with us while we waited for our take out order. Then, when he brought out our bag, he told us he'd added a complimentary crispy shrimp roll order so we could try it and let him know what we thought. (It was indeed awe sum.) We used to live in Flushing, so we know our dim sum. This was some of the freshest, most authentic we have had. I want  all of you who live near by to run there and get your takeout because these folks deserve a fighting chance during these troubled times. The food is soooo good (if you like a wide variety of dim sum dumplings - who doesn't?) The only drawback is I might just have to eat this a few times a week, just when I was getting rid of the COVID weight gain.

3.5. Made a sizeable order that arrived over two hours late.  Neither phone number worked to contact the restaurant directly. Everything was cold  The picture shows the three tablespoons of sauce they gave for the entire order. After heating, the food was tasty. Would prefer from them again.
Delicious dim sum - especially the shrimp dumplings, the rice noodles, and the BBQ pork bun - and the owner himself brought me my to-go bag - great experience!
so excited that this place is in my neighborhood. everything is so good. love the pork buns and the sticky rice with pork. going to have to come back and try the lobster stuff they have on weekends!!
Delicious cheurng fun & dim sum, and really nice people!  Can't wait to eat inside one day!

This place definitely lives up to their name. I've tried the rice rolls, har gow, baked cha siu bao, turnip cake, and sticky rice wrap. Everything tastes freshly made and authentic. I'd have to say that this place far exceeds several popular places that I've tried in Chinatown. I've been here once a week the past month. They have tables set up outside for outdoor dining during covid.
When it comes to dim-sum this is definitely my go to spot! The service and food is my favorite and I visit awesum dimsum quite often!

Excellent dim sum. We got a bit carried away and ordered a great many dishes from the menu for takeout, and I can honestly say it was among the best dim sum I have had in the city, including many trips to Chinatown. The ingredients were very fresh, and the dishes had a refinement that is often missing in Chinatown dishes. While a cut above the usual dim sum, the food was still very authentic.I highly recommend. A great find!

Delicious, affordable dim sum, new to the area.  The space is beautiful and will be great when we can dine indoors again.  I've ordered nearly everything on the menu, and it's been as good as any place in Manhattan I've been to.  Selection is slightly limited (about 20 different items), but service is fast, dependable and so nice!

Please support this great place that opened so recently!  We need more places like this.  Incredible customer service....we called 5 min before closing and placed a large order and they accommodated us, threw in a ton of freebies, and came out to the car curbside to deliver it to us.  But most importantly -- the food is absolutely fresh and delicious.  I grew up on Chinatown dim sum and this absolutely rivals any of the best.
True to its name, this place has awesome dimsums! Great variety, authentic flavours and freshly made, can't wait to go back and try everything.

Thank goodness! I love me some dimsum and this definitely satisfies my cravings!  Always wanted more diversity in food here in Gramercy and thrilled about this new addition. Super clean and modern inside; the gentleman was very sweet, prices are great and food delicious. I ordered the sampler which came with a free iced tea and I also ordered the siu mai. If it wasnt for awful pandemic, im sure this would be so busy at all hours.  Hope everyone can support our local businesses- we want to keep Gramercy alive and well!
Great food & service. Very clean. I had the shrimp roll, sticky rice, and pork buns. All were great and very filling. Will definitely come back!

The dim sum is excellent and as good as what I've had in Hong Kong.  The place has a clean spare look that reminds me of Sweden.  The people are really helpful and cheerful.  Outstanding value and quality of food.
Great food for so cheap! The people who work here are so kind! Love and will def be back!
Stopped here for lunch today.  Ordered 7 items (shiomai, hargow, sticky rice, vegetable dumpling, etc.).  Everything was fresh and delicious!  Highly recommended.  Place is very clean.
I'm obsessed. Every single thing is good, fresh, reasonably priced. I can't speak more highly of this place. Go and find out.

I was blown away by the freshness and quality of the food,    I ordered:  siu mai, steamed dragon roll, har gow & crispy shrimp roll.  Everything was perfectly prepared and delivered in individual bamboo steamers.  The shrimp roll was the crispiest I have ever had and all the shrimp dishes had large chunks of shrimp.  I will return.
The food here is AMAZING 10/10 I will definitely be coming back! Very nice and fast service as well. Super clean and covid safe.
Had the best experience at Awesum Dimsum! Food was amazing, prices were great. The whole staff was super friendly and helpful. We'll definitely be back!

Awe Sum Dim Sum has dim sum that is among the best I have ever had. I used to go to Chinatown for dim sum and in more recent years I have been going to Tim Ho Wan in the East Village but Awe Sum Dim Sum is our new destination. The dumplings are always very fresh and the baked pork buns and sticky rice wraps are always good. Our favorite dumplings are the har gow, shrimp in steamed rice noodle and siu mai.

Our favorite spot for dim sum in the area! The food is fantastic and the owner is wonderful. Ordered for pick up twice and it was ready within 15 minutes. Highly recommend checking them out, you won't be disappointed!
I had the dim sum sampler plate.  Everything was as excellent.  It was as good as the dim sum I have eaten in Manhattan's Chinatown and the Chinatown in the Sunset Park neighborhood of Brooklyn .

A friend found this spot while walking in the neighborhood, and we went there for dinner last night.  The dim sum were delicious and the man in charge could not have been nicer or more helpful.  They have a good selection of dishes and you get complimentary tea and a custard bun.  For good food and a welcoming atmosphere, this place is a must.
Cute outdoor seats (limited), very clean and cute indoors and out, good service, and delicious food!
good customer service and amazing food for very very reasonable price. The owner was very welcoming and the space was very clean as well. Would definitely recommend 10/10
Amazing food and ambience! Very fresh tastes and awesome staff!! Incredibly clean, friendly service and really beautiful outdoor dining :)

Dim sum but fast food style? SAY LESS. I'm on! I love love love dim sum and I love getting dim sum with my family but sometimes I order dim sum from my local Cantonese bakery or restaurant but it doesn't taste as good as the ones from actual dim sum restaurants. But this place is ridiculously good. Everything is so fresh and the variety is amazing! They have dim sum dishes that you won't find at your regular dim sum restaurant. Ex. Lobster Shuimai! If I had another stomach I would try everything in the menu to be honest. The workers here so are friendly and welcoming - gives me warm family vibes I love it! The interior is also very aesthetically pleasing and minimalistic. NYC currently doesn't allow indoor dining but they do have a few tables and chair outside- very very limited! I just took it to got and ate in the car- still taste very warm and yummy! I'm super glad that this is located near Baruch where there's a good amount of Asian American students. They would definitely appreciate this place when schools start opening back up! I'll definitely be back to try everything else I haven't tried. Also the price is so affordable for the quality of food you're receiving!

Overall, pretty good. Wasn't feeling a bunch of skewers so I got what they're not famous for, udon. It was pretty good and I enjoyed all the toppings. I tried one vegetarian skewer and it was pretty good. Would come back

I enjoyed my food at nonono but the surrounding elements of my experience were mediocre. The upstairs seating seems unfinished and industrial. Felt like a second class experience compared to downstairs. Our dishes also were brought out rapid fire and they were trying to hurry us out to close for the night. I liked all of the food itself and may be back to try the ramen and some of the things I didn't get to try.

The food was really flavorful but it was quite expensive for the portion that was offered. The environment was very cute though and aesthetic. The skewers were extremely expensive for what they are
No comment

Perfect date spot! So cute and great vibes. We got the meatball, short rib with onions, pork, scallop, lime cilantro, fried potato, hamachi, nonono kara age, yaki corn, nanchatte steak, Kani fried rice and cod roe cream udon. The food was fantastic. We were so stuffed!  Everything was extremely tasty and full of flavor. For dessert, we got the rain drop pudding and the sesame panna cotta. It was all so light and lovely. I can't wait to come back!

For atmosphere/ ambiance this place is delightful!!! We ended up getting seated in a lil nook in the corner. For everything else - hit or miss is the best way to describe the dishes we had so prepare to do some research before you come.

We got a reservation here for lunch easily and shared the lunch special. It's $29 for 3 of the skewers (the chicken was my favorite but overall the fish and steak were juicy as well) and it came with a choice of ramen. We got the tantan ramen, it tasted super peanut buttery and thick. The broth was rich but it got a bit heavy after awhile. The noodles seemed a bit over cooked but overall it was a great deal to split between the two of us and we had the salmon tataki on top of it. The salmon was fresh but there was not much else in the bowl.

Food was good.  Portions are small. Cool casual place to go after work. Reserve a table online.

I recently tried nononono for dinner with my partner and our couple friends, and the experience was pleasurable. The atmosphere was perfect, with a mix of casual and fun dining vibes. The drinks were good, although I would have liked them to be stronger. The skewers were definitely the highlight, but the sushi rolls are worth a try. The fish was fresh, but not melt-in-your-mouth level! I recommend nononono for casual dinners and lunches--it is a bit pricey for the ambiance.

No comment

Food was great everything was delicious I had some skewers and the egg over rice. Service was slightly slow due to volume but it's nothing bad. Ambiance is nice the table I sat at had a plant suspended from the ceiling.

Modernized Japanese Ramen and Yakitori shop with tasty broths, unique apps, and specific hours of operation that come together for a strong experience when having a casual date or group meet-up. $20 a dish. 4.25/5 stars as a dinner spot.

Very cute place. My favorite were the karage and the miso eggplant. The eggplant had a very sweet miso sauce topped with grounded walnuts for a nice crunch. Must try.
It was a great spot to come with a date for a late night izakaya food! Food was delicious and service was great!

We came in a Saturday and the place was packed, so I'd definitely recommend making a reservation in advance if you are interested in the limited cuts for yakitori. The servers were very friendly and attentive and the food was excellent. We tried a variety of chicken yakitori, kara age and the cod roe cream udon. Everything was very tasty but the cream udon was the standout dish. It was so good that we had to order another one. Will definitely be coming back for this again!
No comment

This is my first review after a short hiatus and definitely not a bad one to start with!! The inside has some really cool decor (alc bottles lining the inside), and there's 2 floors. Personally I think sitting on the top floor is a little nicer since there's more room and spread out. you must try one of their drinks (get the basil one) they're so good and you can't even taste the alcohol. so a bit dangerous. As far as food goes, the rainbow roll is excellent and this is coming from a former sushi hater. The creamy udon is also very popular and can't go wrong with some of their skewers (they recommend like 4-5 per person). great spot for dinner!!!

Overall good place for food and drinks. Definitely recommend getting the nasu dengaku (eggplant) dish! Cod roe cream udon was also good with lots of pork inside and chawanmushi had a lot of flavor. The yakitori didn't impress anyone, even though I thought that's what they are known for. I liked my kessho drink which tasted like apple candy but not sickeningly sweet. The servers were all kind and attentive.

Definitely recommend this cute place! Highlight of the experience was the water droplet cake, it's so fun to eat and comes with a delicious sweet sauce and soybean powder, very light dessert and perfect way to balance out the heavier ramen they have here. Loved the skewers and the sauces they paired with each one. Only thing is that the ramen is a bit salty and I personally wish there was more broth but overall super delicious and cant wait to come back!

Cute izakaya spot with delicious food! Came here for dinner randomly and loved it. It's quite spacious, has warm lighting with a lot of windows. Service is good and frequent. Mostly I thought the food was all around great - everything we tried was umami. My absolute favorite is the tori live pâté- it comes with ginger on the side and you must try the pâté with ginger as it brings out an entirely different flavor dimension! I also enjoyed the salmon salad - salmon was melt in your mouth and salad tasted fresh, as well as the mushrooms. I didn't love the cod roe udon as much, and I've had similar dishes at other Japanese restaurants that were executed better. Overall I had a 9/10 experience here and highly recommend if you're ever in the area.

Place is pretty good. My daughter loves it, as do I. Can get busy at times. But usually worth the wait

The food taste pretty good. But I ordered takeout and they gave me the wrong item so it took me half an hour to go back and get the right order. I also asked for no onions in the food and there's still a lot of onions. I'm totally fine if they tell me they can't take out the onions but they said okay and still put it. Very disappointing about the service.

Absolutely love this place , I have returned a few times because the food is just that good. Everything is so fresh and full of flavor. It's so cute and cozy inside. The staff always makes sure your well taken care of. Highly recommend grabbing some dinner here!
Yes yes yes! This place was delicious. Great ambiance + food = memorable experience! I was also able to find a vegan option and it didn't disappoint. Definitely coming back!

My girlfriend and I were walkins and were advised that it would be a 30 min wait. Put our number down and walked around in the area. They were prompt to call us at the 30 min mark! Everything tasted so good. Loved the chawanmushi and scallop-uni carpaccio the most. I saw they had a Yelp checkin after, so I recommend to take advantage of that in advance. Chicken skin yakitori was kind of plain tasting. Service was decent with food coming in a timely manner.

I hate to say this but I thought this place was good but not great? The meal was delicious and the place had good vibes overall, but I don't think anything was that memorable (even the black sesame dessert! And I love black sesame dessert) and probably wouldn't actively choose this place over any of the others in the area.

Flavors were all just okay. Chicken breast was dry, pork with shio was dry. Shishito peppers were doused in this sweet sauce that was overpowering. Nanchatte steak looked sad and nothing like the photo in the menu, but tasted alright. It was almost like they gave us whatever leftover pieces they had, all cut up into bite sized pieces to make the dish look fuller. Really, none of the yakitori was memorable except for the chicken meatball and the short rib with onion. Even the karaage didn't have much flavor, but it was really crispy. For a yakitori restaurant, the only things I really enjoyed was the sashimi/seafood. Service was very attentive, but they forgot to put in  3 items of our order. I'd come back for the sashimi and maybe try some of the hot entree items next time, but would skip most of the yakitori.

Happen to be in the area for last minute dinner plans. In the mood for Japanese and found this interestingly named restaurant.  It's a Japanese tapas style dining. Decor is reminiscent of small industrial Japanese town, cozy, I liked the 2nd floor setup. The food was very good. Nice riffs of standard dishes.  Had the yakitori, excellently grilled and seasoned.  Ramen was on point (get the extra noodles if your really hungry). The oden was a bit bland, it's a mix of fish cake, sausage and veggies in broth. The Kara age was flavorful and crispy without being oily. Soba meshi also satisfied my carb cravings.  Wanted to try the desserts but was too full, next time. Gotta head back to try the rest of the menu.

this was one of the first restaurants I visited since moving here, and it was the quintessential type of spot when you'd think of an aesthetic NYC restaurant. It's very cozy, with warm lighting and great service. The inside gave me Muji vibes, and the servers were very gentle and friendly. I'd definitely go back! the crab fried rice was pretty good

I came here with a friend and we both got the yakitori don. It came with soup which was nice. I think it was pretty good but the peppers were soooo spicy. Maybe I just have a low spice tolerance but I couldn't eat the peppers because they were so spicy. My face turned super red and my tongue was on fire. I think this place is quite pricey if you order other menu items. Not sure if I would visit again, but nonetheless it was a nice experience and worth a try!

I rarely give 5 star reviews and this is one of the most delicious meals I had in recent memory. My friend and I shared salmon tataki, nori tofu, seared salmon roll in the picture. The food were so amazing that we didn't remember to take pictures when the remaining dishes were served - variety of fancy mushrooms, salmon belly that's to die for, and sesame dessert which we agreed that we need one each next time. Every dish was simple yet flavorful, and clearly made with high quality fresh ingredients.  The restaurant doesn't have a ton of seating, so I'd recommend making a reservation or be prepared to not be able to get a table during prime dinner time. Service is quick and water glasses are continuously refilled. Lovely experience overall!

Not a good value, quite disappointing experience. Drink was watered down, it was more of a whiskey flavored water. The food wasn't great surprisingly, we tried a few things, the best was a small fish appetizer. Otherwise the soup, rolls and the soba fish dish was just rice and noodles. The soup was very heavy and creamy and again just noodles. Service was somewhat spotty and they would definitely hurry you.

pretty cool spot for yakitori! cream udon was good! a little pricey since each skewer is kinda tiny so don't expect to be super full just off that. they do have sets that combine skewers, rice, and soup i think

The restaurant was really cozy. Everything was shareable size. The appetizers are really interesting and yummy. It is better to order more of those rather than digging into only the main noodle dishes.

Love the interior, the food and the cocktail! We ordered two lunch combo, both are great!

Made a reservation on a saturday night for 5 pm, but there were quite a few empty tables outside and inside even though there was a line before it opened. Tried a lot of different dishes here and they were all pretty good! The skewers were okay but my favorites were the other dishes. The rainbow roll was really good and an interesting twist on a classic sushi! (There was parmesan and pesto i believe on it.) The creamy cod udon was also really good, very creamy and a little sweet which i've never had before so thought it was a great dish. The steamed egg was also good as well, a nice appetizer that wasn't too heavy. The chicken skin salad was a cold appetizer which was also good and had a great taste. The shoba meshi had rice and noodles and a good flavor as well. My favorites were the sushi and udon! Loved the decor here as well!

the service was a little shakey at the beginning but quickly got better. I had a spicy tuna roll and Shoyu Chintan ramen which were both delicious. I will say the menu is not too diverse and not too many vegetarian or seafood options for meals except sushi. All the ramens are meat based and there isn't any noodle dish that doesn't have meat.

The place was a chill lunch spot. I got the lunch combo with ramen and skewer and a soda. Overall, it was good spot and wouldn't say over the top. My friends did get the scallops and raw salmon u think and the liked it. There are definitely more skewer places that are good but was overall a solid meal.

LOVED THIS PLACE ! We got their brunch special , spicy pork ramen tori tantan . It was actually the right amount of spicy and flavorful. The portion was huge too. Definitely going to come back and try other dishes.

Was able to get last minute reservations and was so glad i went! We were seated immediately and the service was amazing. Staff were super knowledgeable and friendly and the food was soo good!! Highly recommend!

Decent izakaya place. Great for socializing. Some of the meat (specifically the gizzard) was too chewy and not as enjoyable. The Gyako roll was great. The roe on top of the rolls was exquisite. The prices are a bit steep imo, but it's NY prices. All in all, I recommend it for meat lovers and for networking occasions.

Great spot for Japanese food! Came here for dinner on a Saturday night with a group of 5 people. To drink I got the Basil Cocktail, which was fruity and refreshing. To eat we all shared a bunch of things, of which I think my favorite was the Cod Roe Cream Udon. I love noodle dishes with a creamy seafood sauce and this dish was no exception. The Cream Curry Udon seemed to be one of the favorites among the group as well. I also liked the Kani Fried Rice. We also got the Tori Tantan Ramen, Shoyu Chintan Ramen, and Rainbow Roll which were pretty good too. Glad I got to try this place out!

Made a resy about a week in advance for a Wed dinner for two. Conveniently located near the hotel I was staying at and highly recommended by someone from CA. Overall, we truly enjoyed the meal, drinks, and service. It was summer, so we didn't try the ramen or udon, next time for sure. We ordered the basic yakitori chicken thighs and short rib. Both meats were soft, juicy, and very tasty. They were grilled in an open space downstairs behind the counter and I was pleasantly surprised that I did not smell like the grill when we left, granted we were not seated at the counter. We enjoyed the Hamachi and Salmon Tataki. We also ordered the Maguro which was a little blah and dry. Service from beginning to end was great. Will def be back. Thanks!

Walked in on saturday night with 3 guys. We put our name down, ~30 minutes of wait. The server called us when we had our table. Place is pretty low key, izakaya. I liked how it's not too loud. Everywhere in Ktown, bars are too loud to talk. We ordered short rib, mala pork belly, shishito, chicken gizzard yakitori: cream pasta, oden, tuna rolls. All foods were pretty good, but table was kinda small. We ended up stacking our foods together. They have lots of sake. Two types of beer, sapporo and kirin. Def recommend this place for a group!

Nonono- the name is unfortunately quite fitting for the food.  Not that it was terrible, but it definitely missed the mark for me.  Albeit super reasonably priced, the yakitori was bland for me.  The spicy one lacked flavor as well which was upsetting.  My friend didn't seem to enjoy his ramen that much either.  All in all, wouldn't be returning as there are much better yakitori places in NYC.
Good place to go for a brunch or ramen in code days. Not many place serve chicken paitan ramen. Salmon salad and cold dish is fresh.

Amazing service and the creamy cod roe udon was spot on! Hamachi was also good and had an amazing balance between the sauce and seasonings.

Hip and delicious Japanese spot not far from K town. I ordered the combination set and was very impressed by the quality ingredients and flavors. The shio paitan ramen's milky chicken broth had great depth of flavor. The chicken and pork slices were nice and tender. The chicken and beef yakitori were also juicy. I would be a regular at Nonono if I lived in the area.

The best part of this spot is the variety of food and skewers offered! However, I'm taking off a star because I found a few of their offerings a little bland or lacking in flavor. I wasn't too keen on the meatball, skin, short rib, pork tongue skewers.  I liked the oyster, shishito, mala Kara pork, and lime cilantro skewers better. But my favorite, by far, was the grilled salmon belly and the kinoko x3 (grilled mushrooms).

This place is so good for skewers!!! So much to choose from! Service is good. So accommodating. They aren't cheap when they give you the tables. They are willing to give you a table for 8 people when your party is 5.

Nonono in Nomad is a modern yakitori restaurant serving up delicious grilled skewers, raw fish and noodle dishes. We ordered the oyster chicken, meatball, pork belly, and short rib yakitori, salmon tataki, hamachi, fried chicken, and soba meshi. In addition to the food, Nonono also serves a slew of refreshing and aesthetically pleasing cocktails. Nonono is a solid place to sample yakitori and other familiar Japanese fare

I ordered takeout and delivery from this place religiously through the pandemic. When NYC finally opened back up, I had the chance to come here for dinner with friends. We sat at the top floor in a comfy cozy corner section almost all to ourselves. It was a neat spot. The cocktails were great. We ordered everything, literally going through the list of skewers and ordering at least one of everything. The tofu was surprisingly sooooo good and refreshing (we were there during one of the hottest days in the summer). Service was great. I'm glad this place survived the pandemic. This is definitely my go to spot for Izakaya that is not overly expensive.
It's so good. I don't understand how it's so good. It's crazy. The ramen here is INSANE and the drinks are delish. Came here 2 nights in a row cause I couldn't resist

Clean and delicate food and environment. Cocktails are good and in great shapes. Tofu would be my favorite. Dessert is also good.

Such a cute restaurant with so many delicious options. I got the Kabochan seasonal cocktail (spiced rum, pumpkin spice, lime juice, oolong tea, apple cider), and it was amazing! I tasted the Buttered Saka Mushi (clams and mussels), Nori Tofu, Nasu Dengaku (Deep-fried eggplant with miso, nuts and scallion), and the Salmon Tataki. Friends raved about the shishito peppers! Wish I took pictures, but the food was so good I was distracted

I came here for lunch on a Thursday afternoon with a friend.  They check your temperature and you have to complete a health questionnaire during COVID-19 times.  The tables were spaced out and there's partitions if you want to eat indoors.  We ordered the yakitori don set and the nabeyaki udon.  The yakitori don set had a shishito pepper skewer, a chicken meatball skewer, a chicken thigh skewer, and a chicken breast skewer over furikake rice along with a bowl of miso soup.  The nabeyaki udon had shrimp, chicken, vegetables, and a poached egg.  The yakitori don set was delicious and filling.  The yakitori was grilled well. The udon was a bit bland and the egg was not poached so I would skip it.  Service was friendly but slow, maybe they were short staffed.  I would come back and probably just stick to the yakitori.  The teba gyoza (pork dumpling stuffed chicken wings) look good.

I've been meaning to check this place out and finally got the chance to go recently. While their yakitori menu is somewhat limited, everything we got (chicken thigh, chicken meatball, short rib, mala pork) was very good. I will say though that all the marinades for basic yakitori seem to be same or similar. For entree, we got the cream udon and shio paitan ramen and both were nice accompanying dishes to have w the yakitori. The ramen in particular was memorable since it had a very flavorful and thick broth, similar to a pork based tonkotsu broth. Overall, it is a nice spot whether you are in the mood for yakitori or noodles.

came here with my friends who had a reservation 8pm. it sucked because we had to wait for the table in front of us to clear out before we can sit so we didn't really get seated til 830pm and the kitchen closed less than an hour later so we were rushed in ordering which also sucked. the food itself, i don't see myself coming back to pay that much $$ for the little quantity that they give. i really enjoyed the eggplants and the drinks but besides that, i think this place is overrated and don't see myself coming back.

The mushroom dish was okay just plain cooked variety of mushrooms. We had 5 people and ordered a little bit too much food as you can see in the pictures but it was so worth it.

My friend and I came here on Sunday and it was absolutely wonderful. We only got sushi rolls so I can't speak for the other meals on the menu. The service was quick and they came to anything we needed. Sushi was fresh and delicious. I would definitely come back.

For a place called NoNoNo, it should be called Yes Yes Yes with the way I'll be coming back here. Made reservations for 8 and arrived 30mins early, was seated within 3mins of my arrival. The menu is great especially if you like to eat family style and share amongst each other. I definitely recommend the Chicken Oysters, it takes a bit of time to cook so may come out after your other meals but definitely worth the wait with how juicy and tender it is. As an adventurous eater I enjoyed the chicken heart, gizzard, the breast was juicy and tender, short rib nice and meaty and the pork belly was melt in your mouth good. For drinks I recommend the Bonsai and will be coming back to try the Sakura which is seasonal. For dessert we tried the Rain Drop Pudding, which was eh. Definitely visually pleasing enough and pretty for photos, not much flavor even with the addition of soy bean powder and kuromitsu sauce. Then we tried the kuro goma which was nice and lite.

everything here was amazing. from the rice dish, to the noodle dish and even the skewers- it was all perfection. the service was also really great as well! our server explained the menu and even gave us recommendations too. will be back !!

Really nice small plates for dinner with a partner or group of friends! The food is amazing, the atmosphere is lively, and the service is great! The clientele is mostly professional millennials and it's one of those restaurants that is upscale but casual. They have lots of wrap around outdoor seating which makes getting a reservation here not bad at all. I still wouldn't recommend walking in. It may be a little overwhelming at first because there's a lot of stuff on the menu and because it's small plates you have to order a lot. We got an assortment of the Yakitori and highly recommend the short rib - it's literally the best thing I've ever had. Also recommend the salmon tataki - have to get the teba gyoza, the eggplant, and the raindrop cake! For a full meal it's on the pricier side but I still think it's worth it!
