We loved nonono.  Dishes are pretty similar to what you could find in Japan and the large menu allows the guests to never become bored. Beautiful presentation, friendly waiters and great food. Everyone should visit nonono!

Good portion size, the set is perfect in my opinion. Reasonable prices, good service and nice ambience. Highly suggest to make a reservations because many people do and it's already almost full and super busy the most they open at 12pm. Professional and friendly staffs, clean restaurant with beautiful interior, and food tastes good. The yuzu mimosa was nice, I personally wish it was a bit stronger but it's not too sweet and I really like the pulps they added in there. Ramen is nice and light on the stomach but still pretty flavourful. Fresh ingredients and pretty good quality. The sashimi was nice and really enjoyed the chawanmushi. Would go back and I would also recommend this place. A bit of noise but not loud. Good for family, dates, catching up with friends or even enjoying a nice meal alone.

Review for lunch, which is a different menu from dinner - far more limited in options. Thought it was generally not bad but I didn't love it either. The Yuzu Sorbet dessert was really bomb and my favorite item. Also liked the Suishingen Jelly, although it's pretty similar to the one at Cha-An. I ordered the Yakitori-don which was a variety of 3 different chicken skewers + what tasted like steamed shishito peppers. They were very lightly seasoned, and I liked the weird chicken ground mix one the most - the chicken thigh was juicy but I would have appreciated more seasoning. I also tried a bit of the tantan noodle which was good but was on the opposite spectrum of being pretty strong in taste (fairly salty and not the clear brothy type) - great for a few bites but might be a bit much if you're not sharing. The Galbi skewers were okay, wouldn't order it again.
Nonono is delicious! Always a good meal. I always get the lime cilantro and yuzukosho nori skewers. They cook it in front of you!
No comment

This was my second time back at Nonono and it's as good as I remembered. I got the the Tori tantan ramen lunch set that came with three yakitori. The noodles were perfectly chewy and the broth was flavorful. The yakitori was the a great addition of sweet and savory protein. My favorite was the beef short rib with onions. I don't even eat onions normally so that's how I know it was good. They offer a drink with the lunch set but I opted to just get a hot tea. The proportion was perfect for a nice afternoon lunch and the staff were very friendly. Overall, a great experience and would definitely recommend to friends and family.

Loved the ambiance of the place and the food! It was a very modern take on Japanese food, and seemed like a "tapas style" in which you order several smaller dishes and share. We had the creamy curry udon, beef tataki, and soba meshi. The creamy curry udon was my favorite because it was super fun and delicious. The curry itself wasn't too spicy, and because the potato cream on top balanced it out, it was perfect! Love the whole concept of this place and their food. Definitely would recommend!
No comment
No comment
No comment

In mood for fusion/Japanese Yakitori in NYC - this is the place to go. I was a frequent traveler to Tokyo/Japan. Have not stepped out of NYC since the pandemic began Feb 2020. Nonono gave me my Yakitori fix. Friendly staff cozy establishment. Worth a few visits.
No comment
No comment

There are two floors for nonono and the place is quite spacious in terms of seating. I love the cute, colorful counter tables and the overall deco of this place. The staff was also attentive and friendly. My friend and I ordered their tori tan tan ramen ($14) and shoyu chintan ramen ($14) respectively. We both found our bowls mediocre. The tori tan tan came with minced pork while my shoyu chintan ramen came with both chicken and pork. However, we both found our ramen just mediocre and not too memorable. Although mine filled me up, I'm not sure I'd go back for their ramen at the very least.

I came here for a friend's birthday and our party of 10 went all out. I really liked my Kyuri cocktail to start. The standouts were the short rib with onion, baby potato, 7 kinds of sashimi, shio paitan (chicken ramen), and rainbow roll. Overall everything was really tasty. Service was great.
No comment
No comment
Solid Japanese tapas place with friendly staff and good service. Small dishes are delicious especially the chicken oysters and other yakitori dishes. Sushi is so so.

Nonono is a nice little spot in ktown Manhattan. It was my first time trying this spot and I ordered the ramen. It was one of the best ramen I've ever tried. The noodles were thin and cooked perfectly. I also ordered a cocktail to go along with my meal and it was pretty good.

Cute date spot with good service. Food is decent and comes out quickly, though on the more expensive side. Highly recommend all of their skewers and their cream salmon udon (party favorite). 4/5 but will definitely return.
No comment

This place is always packed but then it's definitely worth the wait. We came on a Thursday night and it was pouring and the wait time was around a hour. The ramen had a very thick broth and it wasn't really my favorite but everything else we ordered was delicious. Overall 8/10.
No comment

column3: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: Ent in on a Sunday, early with mi reservations. Great yakatori, kids loved the short rib wih onion. Sat up stairs, very nice setting. Food was reasonable, but fake drinks were a tad overpriced. I had a play on an old fashioned which was decent.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Such a gem that I wish I found earlier! We made reservations for this place for 9 pm and we walked into the cutest place, two stories with beautiful warm wooden decorations, delicate utensils and great servers. For my main I got the Tantan Ramen which was amazing, the broth was delicious and not too thick yet filled with amazing garnishes like garlic and scallion, so flavorful and filling for a cold day. The noodles were pretty thin and in my opinion not outstanding, but the flavor of the whole bowl made up for it. I also really enjoyed the Salmon Tataki we ordered for the table, the fish was done at a perfect level that showcased the best salmon taste and accompanied by a light sauce that complimented the dish so well. Definitely would recommend. The skewers were also unbelievable, flavor and texture of each bite were perfect. Also got a cocktail with plum wine, can't remember the name, but it was pretty sweet if you're into fruity drinks, it was only $12 which was very reasonable. Would come here again if I could!
No comment
No comment
No comment

It's place was delicious. We ordered a variety of yakitori and shared it family style and it was perfect.  All very tasty!  They also have a great whiskey selection if you're into that! The outdoor seating that put together reminds me of being in Asia, hope they end up keeping it that way!

Their food is great. My favorites are beef tongue skewer, scallops &uni carpaccio, and nasu dengaku(eggplant dish) but all the food we ordered  were very good. Attentive & friendly staffs and surprisingly kids friendly! Definitely coming back soon.

saw this place had good reviews & an even better looking menu selection so had to book a res! (which I would highly recommend bc it was quite packed when I went - around 7:30pm on a saturday) although they might be known for their yakitori skewers, their seafood items were what I enjoyed the most. the chawanmushi was a highlight for me as it was a nice warm bowl of crab, fish cakes, and shrimp in a  savory egg custard with uni and salmon roe on top. honorable mentions include: salmon tataki and nori tofu (which was surprisingly quite filling). their nori paste is out of this world!! the scallop uni carpaccio was light & refreshing but the basil sauce threw me off a bit. the salmon bruschetta roll seemed very interesting but the thick block of cream cheese + basil sauce didn't sit right w me. last but not least, their cocktails!! I tried the basil and ume gumori which are apparently their sweetest ones and my bf ended up ordering 2 more rounds of the ume gumori. the others looked good too so I might need to go back and try them!
No comment

ONE OF THE BEST OUTDOOR DINING SETUPS IN NYC! Each table has their own booth separated by walls from the other diners and each little dining booth has a heater, so it's perfect to go here in the winter months. They take all the utensils out from a sanitized bag before you use them also. I got the Karubi Don, which was very delicious and filling. Highly recommend this place for a chill lunch or dinner.
No comment
YesYesYes and yes!!! Go there and eat it all. Interesting and eclectic decor, excellent service and very decent prices. I can't wait to go back and try their ramen.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Hands down my favorite izakaya in the city. They have amazing tapas style options and the skewers are a must get. All of their cocktails are really tasty and refreshing (though alcohol content is questionable). I love the daikon cocktail and order it everytime I'm here. I also strongly recommend trying the miso octopus dish. The wait time is pretty intense here so I definitely recommend using Yelp waitlist if you weren't able to book a reservation.
keeps to traditional basics through Japanese cooking preparations and with fresh ingredients. Excellent job adding their twist to the common japanese grill cuisine

Had an enlightening bowl of shio paitan ramen here.  Perfectly al dente noodles, ample meat and rich soup.  The soup was more dense than usual which made it less refreshing but it hugged the noodles better.  Fast and friendly staff.  Very relaxing atmosphere with natural light and earth tones.  Slurping is mandatory.

Super hot Japanese. It was good . It's didn't drive me to culinary ecstasy. Good noodles. Cool wood space. Nice service. The  Yakitori looked great and I wish I had ordered it. Nice Sake selection. It got crowed fast . We arrived as they opened. Seems super popular. Not sure why.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Went here with a few friends for the outdoor heated dining booked through Resy. I had no clue what to expect as far as the outdoor arrangement. I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived to learn that we essentially had our own little wooden home completely closed in, separate from others, and a heater inside. I took off my winter coat and was comfortable inside as if it was indoor dining. The food was incredible! I recommend the skewers (specifically short rib and meatball) as well as the eggplant dish. I ordered the Yuzu flavor martini and it blew me away. It was made to perfection. Found a great spot! And ordered it on UberEats for lunch delivery the next day. My only complaint is that our waitress was not super friendly.
No comment
No comment
No comment

It was surprisingly easy to get a reservation here on a weekend. Inside was not too fancy, but still nice; felt crafted and authentic. Portion sizes were appropriate, and food came out fast. Everything was high quality. Even basics like a spicy tuna roll was elevated. My favorites were the Shishito peppers and the chicken oysters--absolutely delicious. Service was great. Would definitely go back!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Love this place!!! The basil drink was delicious. Must get the Kara age (fried chicken) and the teba gyoza (my favorite dish of the night). The scallop uni carpaccio was also great. The ikayaki (grilled squid) was a little too buttery for my taste but otherwise not bad. Can't wait to return and try the other items!
Delicious, beautiful, classy, but overpriced, especially the grilled items. Recommend the mushrooms, steamed eggs, and steak with onion sauce
No comment

Ordered the shio paitan for a quick lunch before flying out. I can right when Nonono opened for lunch and was seated quickly at the counter with view of the chefs preparing the food. They work very orderly and cleanly. My ramen looked exactly like it did on their menu. It was a bit saltier than I would have preferred but I still finished all the broth since it tasted really good. On the lunch menu, there only the vegetable curry bowl that's vegetarian, the ramens all use a chicken broth.
No comment

If you are searching for the best izakaya in New York, nonono should be at the top of your list. Nonono has Tokyo-level Japanese food with a completely New York vibe. As at any top izakayas, the skewers are delicious with a range of options including various chicken parts, beef, pork, fish and vegetables. The price for the skewers are reasonably priced and good for sharing. While the service is a bit slow, it is still very good and always friendly. Beyond skewers, the liver pate, the ramen and the sushi rolls are all great. Drinks are great too.

Cute spot with good ambience! As yelp suggested, we ordered the short rib yakitori, the salmon takati, the tamaga bacon, and the Tori tantan ramen. The short rib is so flavorful and delicious! It comes with one small skewer, so order a couple if there's a group of you. The salmon takati was also very good and fresh. The ramen broth was 10/10. We didn't get to try any of the rolls, because for some reason they said they were all unavailable (might have something to do with coronavirus and grocery availability in nyc right now). Service was quick and attentive, but bus girl kept trying to take our dishes before we finished eating. No biggie, but slight feedback there. Will definitely come back here!
No comment
Extremely disappointing food. This place is way overhyped. The yakitori was pretty disappointing and dry. The cod roe cream udon was good. Service was very slow that night.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I finally got to try this place. Long wait, lots of varieties but had not met my expectations. There was nothing special. Cream curry udon was milky but not even spicy I didn't know what I was eating . Kani fried rice was lack of flavor I had to use the dragon ball dish sauce to have it with it. Most of menus were small/tapas size but expensive. Once is enough for me here.
Usually a wait especially during the weekends! Love the Japanese styled food along with the ambiance. The salmon appetizer was really good with the yuzu beer.
No comment

nonono has become one of my favorite restaurants in NYC. It's our go-to spot when we can't decide what to eat on a Friday night. Everything here is tasty, well priced, and presented nicely. I eat here at least once a month and have brought visiting friends here as well, and everyone enjoyed their experience.
No comment

No comment

Do yourself a favor and come here for lunch anytime during the week at get the Tori Tan Tan ramen bowl. It was filled with perfectly chewy noodles, rich creamy spicy nutty broth and savory mince pork. We got seated immediately when we arrived at 1pm on Sunday and the service was super quick. Dinner time gets a little busy so lunch will be your best bet for immediate noods in your face hole.
No comment

At first I was hesitant to try this place, but it was a great experience. The portions were perfect and we ordered lots of items! We started off with the corn, crunchy cucumber, tofu, and the strawberry salad. All of this items were amazing. I wish the strawberry salad had fresh strawberries instead of dried strawberries. But nonetheless, it was amazing. We got the chicken yakatori with scallions, very tender and flavorful. The ambiance was soft and quiet. Light chatter from the other tables, soft lighting, and just a small and cozy place. The bathrooms were located upstairs and had a sliding door , a little inconvenient. But it was different. I would definitely come here again!

No comment
Very good food covid safe!  Service is good! Atmosphere is good They gave heated outdoor service
No comment

Loved this place. I have been wanting to visit for a while. Came on a rainy Wednesday afternoon right hee they opened (outdoor dining cuz COVID). The waiters was super attentive and the food was right on point aka fast and delicious. Our fav was the wings! Taste just like gioza! Also their basil cocktail was delicious. Definitely stop by for some good Japanese bar food and drinks

No comment

Went here for lunch. I like the vibe and there simplicity of the brunch menu. Essentially two lunch sets, and you can substitute the main dish with two other options. Service is quick and nice. We also ordered a dessert that looked amazing and tasted great. Their yakotori set was not too oily or salty, and I certainly enjoyed the seasoning. My friend ordered the ramen (Lunch set A) and it looked equally appetizing. This is a great spot for a quick lunch. Make sure to make a resv as it is quite popular.

This place has a funny name. But the food is delicious even if it's pricey. The food is slightly more pricey than what I would be able to get in my hometown. But then again almost everything is more expensive in New York. I didn't see all of the restaurant since I picked up my food to go. But what I could see looked modern, bright & clean. The first time I went there was a small line up outside the restaurant. Nonono specializes in yakitori. Their yakitori is delicious though small in portion size. Their selection of regular maki is limited but still delicious. The special rolls look good but I didn't try any of them while I was in New York. I'd order here again but I wish they had some more of the more typical bento or combo dishes so I could I try a bit of everything. They do really elevate the yakitori though & have a good selection of that.
Last night we had a best dinner at Nonono! I and my friend decided to come nonono for a dinner because we had been a long time didn't see each other. The service was great!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is hands down the best Japanese tapas place I have ever been to. It has affordable prices on top of amazing service and the place is also nicely organized and cute to sit at (the bathroom is super cute too) My favorite dish was the egg yolk marinated mackerel sushi roll because the mackerel was so fresh and the egg yolk soy sauce was super delicious and strong (it was only ten bucks!). I really loved their pickled squid dish and corn as side dishes. A must try is the yuzu dessert; I'm so thankful my friend suggested to get this because it ended the night perfectly. 10/10 recommend this place and it's a great date night for two! Bonus points to the restaurant for having three no no no signs on the outside

Most of dishes are not available as well as sakes. During pandemic which is understandable and the staffs were diligent updating our orders in timely manner. The last piece left of back cartilage was so good that I even forgot to take a picture. Other yakitori dishes were too dry that didn't go for second bite. Mentaiko cream udon was incredibly delicious with lots of hearty vegetables with umami flavor. Will give it another try for chicken skin and more back cartilages when possible.

Loved this! We don't have a lot of ramen restaurants where I live but I knew my young boys (ages 7 and 10) would LOVE flavorful noodles. It was a hit and my 10 year old enthusiastically exclaimed it was his new favorite food. Great atmosphere and staff. We tried several things on the menu and everything was great.
No comment
No comment
No comment
One of my favorite Japanese restaurants in NYC. Very creative and offers a larger selection. Would love to visit again!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Omg what an incredible meal I had at nonono. I've been wanting to go this restaurant for years and I think to myself now 'what da hell took so long'?? Apparently the menu has been reduced due to Covid but no matter it was still divine. We ordered everything from meat on a stick to salmon tataki, eggplant, mushrooms, to rich flavor ramen, oh and the unforgettable sushi rolls. Every dish was executed perfectly and so fresh!!! The price to portion size ratio is also just spot on. I liked how quickly they served up the food and just left to us to enjoy. Very good set up for Covid. We sat indoors and I felt really safe with the set up and the distancing. High recommend it.
No comment

Just went for indoor dining last Friday night. Tried all the yaki tori options and they were all pretty tasty and healthy, just could have used a bit more seasoning options in my opinion. Venue is great, lots of space both inside and out.

I ordered the chicken karaage and my friends and I also got the raindrop cake. I thought the karaage was okay, but it could've had more flavor. The raindrop cake was better than I thought it would be. The soybean powder and brown sugar sauce make all of the taste basically, but it tastes good. For me, everything was a bit more expensive than I liked. I would also recommend coming here with the intention to share and split to get more out of your money and to enjoy more of the menu since they are small plates! We also had to wait a while for service, but they were pretty busy so it's understandable.

Everything was so delicious I will definitely be eating here again! The only thing I was out for about was the tofu I just wish it was warm like when it's freshly cooked but maybe they don't do it the traditional Japanese way
Terrible service. Not more I can say. Genuinely disappointed at how the staff did not offer help or solutions to any of our issues. Have not been so disappointed in a long time.
Amazing food! Authentic yakitori and delicious ramen! Would highly recommend. Great selection of sake too.
No comment

Everything here is delicious and if you get there early it's very easy to be seated quickly. The salmon bruschetta are unreal. All of their fish fastes really fresh but they're definitely not just a sushi place, they have creative drinks and all kinds of different dishes- tons to try. I can't wait to go back!

This place is fairly good, but a little overpriced. We ordered four dishes for two people, and the total was $60 after tax and tip. The little tofu appetizer was $7, and the Saturday roll (which only had 6 pieces) was $14. My basil strawberry drink was creative, but a little too watered down. I couldnt taste or feel the alcohol at all. In typical Japanese fashion, everyone is super sweet and polite, especially the hostess.

One of those gentrified spots that perfectly caters to my tastes. We got multiple skewers, my favorite was the meatball. The nori tofu was not like anything I had before and a great combination of cold, sweet and salty flavors. The Nanchatte steak was incredible, and shattered my expectations of what beef should taste like.

Really nice dinning experience overall. Everything we ordered on the menu was great. My favorite dish is miso steamed fish . Would definitely go back to try out other items!

I came here on a weekday night for dinner, so I had assumed the food would speak for the popularity. The food was great, not much to complain about, but if you have lived in NYC for your whole life and have been spoiled by the quality and creativity of the food that you can find in the city, this place was not that special. Don't get me wrong, the food and atmosphere was great. Just not that different from other good Japanese restaurants. Portions were also small.

Good Japanese fusion place for brunch. From appetizer to dessert, all were good. Food size good for share by two. Ok service.

just writing this so i remember i've been here. nothing bad but nothing good. not pricey cos its exceptional just pricey because its in manhattan. the other day in the village i was charged 9$ for a pouch of jack links and i almost cried.

Hit and miss dishes like every other dish is good. Don't get the veggie and rich. It's literally a rip off with no veggie and mostly rice. The stuff chicken wing were blah .
EVERYthing was so good!!! Their cod roe cream udon was delicious! You must try. Service was fast and our waiter was nice! Will definitely come back next time we're in the city.

More like yesyesyes! I came here last night with two friends and used waitlist to get in (a very good idea)  and we had such an excellent time. The service was great, and the food is to die for. We had skewers, salmon, ramen, corn, an egg dish, sushi and cocktails and everything was top tier. My favourites were the daikon cocktail, the ramen and salmon tataki. Definitely recommend and will be back next time I'm in the city.

One of my favorite izakayas in New York at the moment. I've stopped by two times so far and nonono doesn't disappoint! A nice casual spot for tapas in the evening with a specific lunch menu on the weekdays. Would recommend getting the skewers in the evening to share! It does get busy so try to get on the waitlist if you are planning on going for dinner. The lunch sets are affordable and filling as well.

Ramens were great, all the dishes we tried from grilled tofu to chicken skewer and edamame were tasty. The drink selection was great. And you can make a reservation! Great service. Awesome spot for ramen in midtown!
No comment
No comment

The brunch and dinner menu are totally different so be warned, if there's something you particularly are dying to try! The brunch menu was definitely more limited but all the options looked delicious. For the amount of food that you get, the set brunch options are not bad at all. For $24 you can get a bowl of ramen, chirashi don, and a chawanmushi (steamed egg in a cup) and for $26 you can get a rice bowl, sashimi salad, chawanmushi, and soup. A la cartel options are also available. The shio paitan ramen was decent--the broth was rich, and very comfort-foody. The chawanmushi was delicious: light, umami, and slightly sweet with hidden scallions, fish cake, and shrimp. The chirashi bowl was delicious, with a fun assortment of fish and perfectly prepared sushi rice. Seating wasn't an issue (we went around 1:00) and the decor was super cute! Definitely a yummy experience!
No comment

Came here as a walk in and was super happy they were able to seat us. We got the salmon tataki, some hamachi appetizer, the mushrooms, pasta, and some skewers. I also got the ume cocktail and that was just okay. Would recommend getting the salmon tataki and the hamachi appetizer but didn't like the mushrooms as much. The restaurant is also very nice and cute and a great spot to catch up with friends. We also got the sesame panna cotta and it was very good!
Great little place. Friendly staff and a simple menu with layers of complex flavors. We came for lunch. Four of us and a beer are for $75.
No comment

My second time here, and they change the menu a bit.  I love their shrimp crochet but it's not there anymore.  Overall great place for Japanese tapas they have a lot of varieties to choose from.  The cocktails are also really good.

Well I gotta say this is my favorite izakaya...but note I'm from San Francisco; so upfront set the tone.  The space was funky but neat, the waitlist was easy enough (thanks Yelp). The cocktails and drinks were yummy.  The food came out fast. All good yes?  Ok.  The Tsukune (chicken meatball) was amazing.  I mean out right fantastic and amazing. The sort of thing where you order it, take a bite and tell the server to queue up a second order.  That chicken meatball alone puts this place on top...but good thing it has everything else going on.

We have a fun time!  The place was very relaxing.  The host was not pushy but helpful with recommendations. The atmosphere was inviting. The food was delicious. You could not really go wrong with anything you choose. Definitely a place worth returning ti
Solid ramen joint for a ramen lunch in midtown and no wait (that's why they don't take lunch reservations).  The chicken broth tori tonton with minced pork is a winner on a cold snowy fall day!

Nice place for Japanese food! Nice environment to come drink and eat with friends. Definitely recommend to come but can be very packed so try to reserve! Spent about $66 per person with tip and tax~~
Love this cute Japanese spot! We went for brunch and the menu selection is great. Friendly and attentive service. Recommend the galbi brunch set

Really good sushi, the Halloween special with crab was delicious. Friendly servers. Good whiskey!
No comment
Fast and friendly service, nice food and very reasonably priced. Restaurant has spot where door open and closing is a bit disturbing.

Excellent place to catch up with friends! The ramen there is on point and the yakitori delicious. We tried two ramens, the seasonal soft shell crab chowder, several skewers of meat, and the raindrop dessert. The wait was a bit long and the waiting area is small, but the food made up for it. Would definitely come back to try the other items!

This is based on an offer I got from take 31, which was for a free beer. We came here after dinner to redeem it, thinking we'd just get a beer but no! They also offer hot/cold sake. Waitstaff was very friendly and their sake went down very smooth. Would definitely come back to get food as wel.
No comment

All I have to say is -- this is one of my new favorite spots! I put myself on the waitlist around 6:30pm for two on a Saturday night and finally got seated around 8:30pm, do this because it gets really busy. My boyfriend and I shared the salmon tataki, kani chowder, duck ankake, curry cream udon, and shoyu tintan. Everything was really good but the salmon tataki and kani chowder stole the show! The salmon tataki was placed on top of a bed of avocado and some kind of sweet soy sauce and garnished with micro greens, it was so fresh and delicious. The kani chowder really hit the spot and was filled with mushrooms and clams topped with a fried soft shell crab. I would highly recommend getting these two when visiting nonono. I'll have to come again to try the yakitori -- I was too stuffed this time! The bill came out to $71 before tips for the two of us which isn't too shabby at all. In addition, we had great service and will definitely be coming back again.
so delicious! the tofu nori and short rib were standouts. loved my plum wine drink too. very affordable for such amazing quality!

We were here for Christmas dinner and ordered a lot of food. Takitori was not bad, our favorite are gizzard and knee cartilage. Kara shoyu is a spicy noodle soup with grounded pork and chive in it, it is so good and I really recommend it! Beef Takaki was ok. We tried the special creamy soft crab soup, it has curry in it and to be honest the taste was not that good, so I wouldn't recommend it. For the dessert, I myself like the Matcha ice cream sandwich but my friend liked Afogato better.

The interior of the restaurant looks pretty nice. The noodles taste okay but it honestly just taste like normal ramen that you can get anywhere. The location is kind of remote.

Great yakitori! So tasty, my friend and I finished everything and had zero regrets eating so much because it was just so good!
Love this Japanese tapas spot. Ramen was the only disappointing  dish

Been wanting to try this place for a while now - it's good but not amazing. We ordered about 10 skewers and liked maybe half of them. One of the gizzards skewer was so chewy we couldn't even finish it. The scallops and uni appetizer was my favorite. Everything else was okay. Their menu is very diverse so I will probably come back to try some other dishes.

Delicious food. Great selection and vibe. Would recommend if you're looking for a izakaya or small Japanese tapas. I would recommend joining the waitlist on yelp or make reservation before you head over.
Food was a bit overpriced (most ktown restaurants are overpriced) but it was generally good. The only food that left me a strong impression was the fried chicken haha

nonono you are simply remarkable, I had a lovely experience here yesterday. A very unique environment. After looking at the reviews I purchased Short Rib, and it was so amazing, it is now my favorite dish. The staff members were really good, smiled a lot, felt genuine. I strongly recommend nonono.

column3: Lower Nob Hill, San Francisco, CA
column6: Such a consistently great restaurant. Got the short rib yakitori, salmon tataki and spicy ramen. Highly recommend!

Such a good restaurant, great service. Outdoor dining was very warm since they have heaters. Would definitely go back.

Been to this place several times and it's amazing! You definitely need a reservation if you don't like waiting because there's always a long wait. Went here with friends and the food is yum. I recommend the kinoko cream skewer, yuzukosho nori skewer, tamago bacon skewer, salmon tataki, creamy udon, tori tantan, raindrop cake, and the black sesame panna cotta w ice cream. Definitely coming back!

A very cool, casual Izakaya. Extensive menu, which is overwhelming at first, but after tasting the food you're grateful that you can return soon and try something new. Menu design also should get an honorable mention here. It is one of the best designed menus with beautiful photography. You can see, feel and taste the attention in every detail here.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Ive been a fan of this place since they first open and this it so far one of my favorite dinner place in ny! Their menu is so creative and it is constantly changing with many new exciting items to try everytime i go. Do get the octopus, shortrib skewer & the nanchatte strak, you wony regret it! Be sure to check out their menu every so often to check out their new items.
Ended up ordering almost half the menu. Every dish was tasty and good except the raindrop dessert (it just looks really pretty, but tastes average).

A huge (and beautiful menu) that allows you to assemble a meal from small, yet actually affordable, plates or larger dishes. Everything I ate here was absolutely delicious. I remember, in particular, the cold creamy soba with uni - it sounds really odd but it was one of the best things I've eaten in recent memory and it looms large in my head - I can still remember the taste very distinctly, and I often long for it. Go here! Try a bunch of stuff. It's worth the wait.
No comment

Best sushi delivery I've had so far during quarantine - delicious, fresh, and unique. (Salmon Bruschetta roll was our favorite!) also the Soba Meshi was delicious!! Can't go wrong with anything you order here.
The shaved cheese adds an amazing texture to the fine prepared dish, well balanced in flavor. Feels like they raised their price point but understandable. Gotta come back and try more for sure!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Really delicious. Korean will love foods in here. All clerks are kind. Recommend here!
No comment

In the last 3 months I I think I have been here at least ten times. I really really enjoy this place. I love to order a bowl of white rice and then a ton of different skewers! I feel like I should go ahead and try the variety that they have on the menu, and it all looks perfect and right up my alley but I just can't seem to get away from what I get every time. The service staff is fast and they get everything that you need in a timely fashion. I would recommend to stop by, I'll certainly be back. Bom apetite.
Amazing place, $5 sake happy hour! Food is also fantastic, there's no dish I didn't like. Particular the squid sushi and skewers (they all all amazing and savory)

We went there at lunch time. The menu isn't various compare to the dinner menu. The ramens were fine, the base soups were tasty. I asked the waitress for an extra egg which never got answered. The dessert was quick nice.
Food was good and presentation was nice. Went here with my girlfriend and we both liked it. Food wait time wasn't that long
Love this place!! Skewers are sooooo yummy. Also get the raindrop cake.. so pretty and yummy :)

This was my third time here and I've always left content and satisfied. I absolutely enjoyed their tapa styles dishes especially with a group of people so I got to try several different foods. We got the grilled corn, grilled cabbage, duck ankake, salmon tataki and gizzard & beef short rib yakitori. All were so delicious and all I can say is yes yes yes. My favorites were the grilled corn and salmon tataki! The basil cocktail was super tasty too. Highly recommend this place but try to make reservations in advance or put yourself on the waitlist atleast 30 minutes before. I already want to go back to try other dishes there!

I definitely recommend making a reservation. Service was exceptional. Everyone was so friendly. We got a ceviche that I could eat every single meal for the rest of my life. Very fresh and the presentation was awesome. Rain drop cake was really fun and different. Great spot for a date night.

Holy crap, this place was great. My dining partner and I came hungry (a must) and enjoyed browsing the tempting and lengthy menu to pick out a range of small plates. As pescetarians, we were delighted to have plenty of options, 90% of which were stellar. Honestly, only the stuffed squid disappointed: too dry and tough. Everything else, though, including the specials? Would eat again.
Ordered Karubi Don and Chawanmushi for business day lunch. Great service, good ambience, food didn't hit my expectations but it was ok, just a little pricey.
we came here for some yakitori and my favorite was the gizzard. it has such a crunchy texture and all the skewers were super light. the cod roe udon was also really good
No comment

I believe it would be a fantastic place for dinner, but the brunch it served really disappointed me. Brunch menu has few selections which basically composed of ramens and appetizers. Avocado with uni was good and worth a try but that's it. Poke bowl was extremely small and desserts were as normal as those you could buy in a Japanese restaurant. Anyway, if you go there for dinner it is a fantastic place, and I'm looking forward to seeing a new brunch menu with a larger variety of choices.
No comment
No comment
No comment
The food was okay. Long wait as always. And I think it's a bit pricey. Ordered a curry udon, scallop uni, fried squid and the fried salmon. Not bad but not great.
My go to place for work lunch. Great menu, simple selections of four ramen bowls and three rice bowls with a foursome of yakitoris. Make reservation for dinner!
No comment

My fave japanese yakitori place. All their menus are fantastic, well marinated and at reasonable price. I ordered their tapas like duck tapas also the squid one, oh so delicious. The ramen is a bit mediocre. Service was quick and theres a bit of wait during the peak hour

This is one my favorite ramen restaurant I had before. It is also one of the most trendy places to in midtown (Korea Town). I give the food 5 stars. The food was awesome, the taste is just right (not as salty as other Ramen place). The Kara Shoyu (fried chicken) was really good, the meat is tender about just right to not have the dried taste like regular chicken tender. The duck and the ramen taste really good. I give the service 5 stars . The staff was nice, friendly and professional, the food came out fairly quick. There are picture on the menu, which made it easy for foreign customers to pick. Finally, I give the environment 5 stars . The place was clean, and quiet. It would be an ideal place for date night or a quick break from work. Overall, I give this restaurant a 5 stars.
No comment

NO NO NO I cant eat No more!! Food was delicious and plentiful.I had spicy tuna roll, salmon tataki, ramen soup, should I continue or do you get the drift! no no no I will continue salmon more sushi .......
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great option for ramen.  Interesting menu with box combos and some great skewers.  Nice casual atmosphere in a bright and airy space.

Made rsvps thru yelp and it was confirmed almost immediately. This is such a nice, clean and cozy restaurant. Theres so many items to choose from on their menu from sashimi dishes to ramen. We ordered some appetizers to share and the scallop dish really stood out for us! The ramen was also VERY good!!! Service was great and prices were reasonable. Would definitely visit again to try more items!
No comment
Excellent outdoor dining spot. Service was very friendly and professional.  Food was very good and a bit unusual which we really enjoyed.  Recommended!
No comment
No comment
What is wrong with some of these reviewers? One of my favorite spots in Midtown and so many options that solidly perform a 4-star food scenario.
Overpriced average food. There are way better Asian tapas and better pricing than this place.

I ordered a Nabeyaki Udon and Shoyu Chintan ramen for delivery since we started going to the office again. There were 2 slices of pork and 2 chunks of boiled chicken that were absolutely flavorless (besides salt) that was included with the ramen. The broth had no umami richness whatsoever. With so many good reviews and a plethora of great ramen/udon places in the city, I expected this place to be comparable at the minimum. Such a let down...
This place has affordable and AMAZING food!! It is a little busy so I had to wait for half an hour but once seated, the food came out fast and it was so so good.

Went here with a friend! I was so excited cause I hear a lot of good reviews about this place! Must definitely reserve before coming here cause it gets really crowded, especially during dinner time. ited cause I hear a lot of good reviews about this place. I ordered the Beef Tataki, Tuna, and etc. I really enjoyed the food here, even though the portions are kinda small   They offer a lot of different types of cuts. My personal favorite is the Tuna! Love the jalapeno sauce that comes with it  Would come back again!
No comment

Really great food. Everything is affordably priced for what it is and there are some more filling dishes  towards the back of the menu that hit the spot too (e.g., ramen, soba, rice dishes). Cocktails are inventive and fun. Must try at least a few of the yakitori skewers! Vibe is casual and a bit on the louder side. Utilize their yelp waitlist to avoid a wait!
No comment

Here seems to be more popular for skewer and drinks. Their options are mostly tapas and noodles. Some tapas / appetizers I recommend is the deep fried eggplant, fried chicken and their current special: Tako wasabi. The eggplant was supposed to be deep fried but it didn't taste fried... More like steamed with super flavorful with sweet peanuts toppings. The fried chicken came with 3 drums - wasn't like those typical popcorn chicken you order else where. I really liked their yuzu plum wine cocktail with lemon - came here twice and ordered the same. For the skewers they were all mostly just okay... I didn't like the chicken breast with scallion nor the chicken thigh with cream and truffle...(too overwhelming). I think my favorite one remains the beef tongue. Must try!

(Dec 2018) Came here for friend's birthday around 7pm and we all left with happy belly. It is definitely a more contemporary Japanese restaurant with some hipster feel to it. We ordered Basil and Daikon drink (each $12), both of them are pretty light and sweet. We also ordered scallop ($6), lime cilantro ($4.50), eel ($6), and tomato salmon ($4.50) yakitori. All of them are above average but I do think they are a bit overcooked and portions are too small. In addition, we ordered salmon tataki ($11), nonono karaage (4pcs for $12), ika yaki ($10), saba oni on roll ($10), and creamy curry udon ($13). My personal favorites are the salmon tataki with guacamole (and yes, at first I thought it was wasabi too) because it is freshly served on a cold plate and the nonono karaage because it was very crispy with flavor. Creamy curry udon is pretty strong and thick in flavor and definitely would recommend sharing this. HH (beers) are from 5-7pm. Recommend!

This was become one of my favorite places to get lunch. I always get the option with skewers and always leave satiated. It's not only Instagram-worthy food and space but the dishes are super tasty. Definitely want to come back for dinner as they have a larger menu. They don't take reservations for lunch but tend to work to accommodate you.

Great vibes, great food. We were up in the mezzanine which is just an awesome space. I got the creamy cod roe udon. Absolutely delicious and so much for a reasonable price! Service was a bit slow though.
No comment
Very popular spot, for a reason. Tons of choices all tasty! We come especially for the eggplant which is addictive
No comment
No comment
No comment

Such a great spot. This place is so freaking adorable. Started with the tuna tartare which was killer. It was so fresh and the jalapeno sauce was incredible. I cant wait to eat it again. The salmon roll was also good. It definitely had a kick to it. We closed with the creamy ramen and a bottle of the nigori sake. If you stop by you won't be disappointed. This place is a winner in my book. I will be back.

Would come back, especially on a date or to catch up with a friend. Overall, the portions are a little small and the cocktails are a little simple, but the space is large enough where you can have an audible conversation with friends, the staff is friendly, and food is pretty damn decent.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great drinks, okay service, and not great value. Our meal came out to around $100 for 2, and we definitely weren't full! They're based around small plates and skewers, which was fine, but only some of their skewers really wowed (short rib was good, chicken was alright). The fried rice dish is just an average home style dish. The sashimi plate was quite good and fresh, at $18 a platter. Everything else was a bit forgettable. (We ordered sashimi platter, short rib skewer with onions, pork with ponzu, chicken thigh skewer, steak, fried rice, and drinks). The steak was okay. Also, it took a bit for even our first skewers or appetizers to come out. But, like I said, their drink menu is really interesting - I had the strawberry basil drink and it was really refreshing. Would be interested in coming again for the drinks.

I mean as soon as you come in the their hospitable service is a 10/10. Loved every plate we had, and I probably had about 10 different dishes. Had a drunken whale dry sake, and it was perfect match with all the food. Oh and the black sesame ice cream which I'm 100% sure that they make it in the store, in a magic lab. Will definitely come back
No comment

Really nice new restaurant, the interior is well decorated and the menu is simple and straightforward. The only downside is that there aren't really any options for vegetarians, everything has a meat base or has meat it in, so just to be aware. Otherwise noodles are solid and great for a winter meal, and they've been slowly expanding their menu. A nice little place on the corner.
No comment

Came here for lunch so we didnt get to try the dinner menu. Strongly recommend the Shio Paitan ramen, thats the one with the creamiest broth and delicious sliced pork! wish it had a bit more toppings, though. My mom got the shoyu ramen and it wasn't bad, but nothing to write home about. We also got the raindrop pudding. Super cool looking and just the perfect amount of sweetness. Will love to come back for their dinner menu!
No comment
No comment

Food is amazing and comes out really fast. Everything is meant to be shared. Some things worth getting are the hamaguri clam soup, the chawanmushi with all the uni and ikura and the scallop carpaccio.

One of the best Japanese fusion in town. It's not only good for its Yakitori, but also nice for its raw dishes. I've come here for twice in two months. Everyone I've recommended this place agreed it's the best. I'm a raw fish lovers, while my friends only eat bbq stuff, but nonono offers the great combination that we can both enjoy! I honestly would say every dish I've had was so good. Love the chicken skin, and knee bones. Will come again of course, probably will become my always-come-here list.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Been here quite a few times already, and I can definitely say that both presentation and taste-wise, the food here is very good. They specialize in skewers which range from ~$3-$6, depending on the type you want. I highly recommend the chicken cartilage one, as it has a very crunchy texture and well-balanced flavor. For carbs, I'd recommend getting the creme udon - it's beef curry udon with cream on top basically. I wasn't a big fan of their sushi, but their salmon sashimi was very nice.

Another Japanese tapas place found in midtown New York City. The first dish is scallops topped with uni and seaweed paste. The second place is a seasonal $9 tasting plates and it's so worth it. We also had the sushi tacos, shrimp with cucumber sauce, squid stuffed with sushi rice and the beef tataki with shredded cheese. Nonono also has a great yakitori menu and the prices are so affordable too! I also tried the chicken yakitori with truffle cream sauce. Delicious! Again, tapas fans, definitely try this place. You can book through yelp or if you forget to book, yelp allows you to join the waitlist on its app.

My friend and I came on a Friday night and had an incredible experience filled with fun vibes and awesome food. This place would be really great for a girls' night out dinner or a casual, cute date night. We started out with two cocktails - the basil strawberry and radish yuzu. Both were very fruity yet not overpoweringly sweet. We tried a variety of different appetizers, skewers, mains and desserts but the stand out dishes were the nasu dengaku (deep fried eggplant) appetizer, chicken oyster/meatball/short rib with onion skewers, scallop uni carpaccio, dragon ball (grilled beef with tofu sauce and quail eggs), uni chawanmushi, and kuro goma (black sesame panna cotta with black sesame ice cream and biscuit). Staff was very attentive and brought out dishes in a timely fashion, which we really appreciated. Will definitely be back in the near future!

Came here for my birthday dinner on a Saturday night at 8:30PM. Reserved through yelp and was seated as soon as we arrived. I think I had high expectations for nonono but was kind of let down. I really enjoyed the ambiance because I typically enjoy trendy tapa restaurants but nothing really stood out to me. We ordered the beef tataki, 2 orders of the kani cream croquette (which came with 2/order for $10... $5/croquette wtf), a couple of yakitori, 2 special rolls and 2 bowls of ramen, all to share. No one enjoyed the beef tataki because the meat was so tough and the yakitori was ok. Honestly, my favorites were probably the croquette and ramen, but I wouldn't order the croquettes again because they're so overpriced.. The shoyu paitan ramen broth was really rich and creamy. The extensive menu is probably why we didn't enjoy nonono as much because we weren't very sure what the signature or special dishes were- not sure if I would return but there's so much more to try.
No comment

Your experience at nonono will be greatly enhanced if you are eating with an adventurous friend who wants to try all the things (and who is hungry). It's a fun Asian tapas spot, with a really long and diverse menu! I've been here for dinner twice, and have tried a bunch of the dishes. The standouts have been the yakitori skewers (chicken thigh, chicken oyster, and skirt meat with shishito peppers), the salmon tataki with avocado, the corn, and the soba meshi. But honestly, the only thing we ordered that I would pass on next time was the dumpling stuffed chicken legs -- the chicken legs themselves were delicious, but the taste and texture of the dumpling weren't for me, and it just ended up being too much. Would definitely make a reservation if you are eating here around prime time on the weekend.

Made reservations here with a couple friends on a Saturday night. The restaurant was beautifully decorated and there are plenty of tables on the main floor and upstairs. The menu is perfect for sharing and food comes out as it's prepared so we ordered a bunch of things at different times throughout the meal. Some of our favorites were the beef tongue, chicken meatball, pork with tare, zucchini mentai mayo, atsuyaki tofu miso, dragon ball, and the zuke maguro. We were really impressed by the flavor packed into all the food. We loved this place would totally recommend. We'll be coming back soon!
No comment

If you want to get their Izakaya dishes, I would recommend the beef tataki and kara-age (of course, any of the yakitori options are solid too!). The food come out in a timely manner as everytime one dish was finished, another came straight out. Our waiter was extremely attentive and made sure that our drinks were refilled and took down additional orders. The interior is hip with wall seating as well as tables.

It is a cute place for a date night. We were on the bar table and could see the chefs cooking. It was an entertainment on its own. Their cocktails are delicious too. You have to be here early to get a table on a weekend since it gets crowded with groups pretty easily. Their yakitori menu is one of the best ones I've tried so far and I would love to visit this place again.
No comment
No comment

Great experience here with my partner. We had quite a few dishes, some we are not familiar with, and were not let down in the least. I highly recommend coming here if you're in the mood for some great Japanese faire. Great pickles and more. So good!

I got take out from this location since the wait time seemed to be longer than I was willing to wait. I got the fried rice, karaage chicken, and some skewers. The fried rice has some crab meat on top and is a great choice if rice is your jam. Skewers were delicious, I had chicken gizzard, chicken skin, and short ribs. The chicken karaage comes in 3 leg pieces and they do come bone in, prob the best dish out of the items I tried.
Excellent family style food. Sharing ramen was new to me, but very welcomed and delicious. Didn't have anything that I did not like.

I ordered the special which was a trio consisting of: wasabi octopus, seaweed wrapped tuna, and a white fish over sliced onion. This dish was amazing, as long as you enjoy some spice! The nori tofu and octopus sashimi were also really good. So good I ordered two of everything. Nonono's fresh fish, unique flavor pairings, and upbeat environment gives this restaurant a 5 star ranking.

Nonono, I still don't completely understand the motto even after reading the description several times on the menu, but that's besides the point. I'm a big fan of Take 31, and Nonono seems to follow similar trends except with Japanese cuisine. The food is great, with many options, and unique eats -- from skewers, to noodles, to rice dishes, to appetizers, to share plates, and uncommon items. The skewers and many of the dishes were pretty solid. Skip the ramen though. The chicken wings stuffed with gyoza was also quite memorable. Beware of the waits though.

Make reservations ahead of time to make things easier, but we only waited for maybe 20 min as walk-ins on a Saturday night. There's a little counter along the window you can be sat at to enjoy a drink while you wait. I recommend getting the Shiso cocktail... I'm a fan of cocktails that doesn't taste like liquor so this was perfect. It's like a bougie Mike's Hard. We got a bunch of skewers (8?) and then a ramen to share. Portion was perfect for us 2 girls and we probably spent a little over $40/person.

This is an awesome take on Yakitori + innovative dishes. My favorite was the corn and the short rib. We simply couldn't have enough of the rib that we kept on ordering over and over again. The eggplant had a delicious peanut sauce that we really liked. It's a spacious place but can got very crowded at rush hour. The service was perfect - our waiter so sweet and fast! Their house beer was also amazing. Might be the best house beer I've ever had! I would definitely come to try seafood based dishes as we focused on meeting mostly meat. Highly recommend!

Went here for the first time on Saturday (June 12, 2021). Service was quick and the food was amazing!! I had the spicy tuna roll as an app and, for my entree I had the Karubi Don. The spicy tuna roll was so fresh and tasty! The karubi Don was amazing as well and, it's a decent size too!! I'm not too adventurous with food but, both of these were tasty, not spicy at all and right up my alley. Would def go back!!
Went here for dinner before a show - everything was good! All the skewers were cooked perfectly; I love the meatballs the most.  I will be back :)
No comment
No comment

Super cool trendy izakaya! The zuke maguro and eggplant dish were my favorites. The tuna came with a delicious jalapeño and ginger sauce, and the eggplant was very flavorful and juicy. We also had the cream curry udon, which was cool looking with the whipped potato, but tasted okay, literally just udon noodles in Japanese curry. Also, I was a bit disappointed by the chicken and scallop yakitori, which were a bit tough and lacking flavor. Overall though, the food was creative and tasty, and the service and atmosphere was great!

Nice place.  Food is ok.  Ramen is ok, better than MEW.  The let down is they don't have any yakitori option except the lunch special for lunch.  So please don't go there thinking you can get some yakitori during lunch.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Was excited to see a new yakitori joint open in nomad area.  They had wide selection of different cuts of chicken, beef and pork, as well as small dishes and entree courses.  Everything was seasoned and grilled perfectly to chase down with a cold beer.  The decor and atmosphere of the restaurant was very modern industrial feel, perfect for a either group or friends or date.  Will have come back to try more entree dishes, but good yakitori spot in my books!

Cmon now - so good - I have the great privilege of eating here once a week. Love the friendly and thoughtful staff and there literally is not a single thing on the menu that is  not superb. Thank you nonono
No comment
No comment

One of the cutest places i've been too. The food is good, the service is so helpful, and the overall feel is something I really appreciate!! Gotta love the decor & uniqueness of all the dishes. Definitely trying the Uni Avocado next time!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I literally live across the street from this place and have been 3 or 4 times since they opened. The service is always quick and friendly. The menus is vast and should have something for even the most picky of eaters. I'm always ordering new things trying to make my way through the menu. I definitely recommend checking it out!
No comment

The food is soooo yummy here and the restaurant has cute decor. Service meh. :P The menu has really deliciously mouth watering options that will make you want to order one of everything. I loveeed the ebi wasa and scallop with uni. Izakaya is alright but I preferred the other dishes we tried more. I also liked the spicy cream curry udon. It's comforting with a kick. It's quite filling so a good item to share. Had the basil cocktail which I enjoyed also. Plenty of other things I would love to try next time.

My girlfriend took me here for my birthday and we loved it! We were starving and wanted to try as much as possible so we ordered a bunch of the small plates. Our favorite was the salmon tataki (it was so good we ordered 2 orders) because of how fresh the salmon was and also because the avocado sauce paired so well with it. I think our second favorite were the daichi mushrooms with the scallop basil sauce; the sauce was so creamy and flavorful. The skewers were grilled and you could tell marinated right. The tens gyoza was different and I loved them. I liked that the chicken wing didn't have a ton of flavor in itself but the pork dumpling meat did, great pair! Everything else we ordered was delicious as well (see photos). I found the salmon belly a little too fatty and wasn't a huge fan of the ground radish; I don't think ground was the right way to go because of how soft and fatty the salmon was...too much of a purée texture for me. I would love to come back to try their noodle dishes.

Maybe I ordered wrong, but I just don't see what the hype and great reviews are for. I tried two types of ramen, both were subpar. One tasted silty, the other had no flavor. The service was great and I saw other dishes that looked good, so maybe I'll retry. Ramen was a definite no, though.
No comment

I love yakitori and Yakitori Nonono definitely exceeded expectations. They have a lot of yakitori options but also a ton of other dishes. We got an eclectic mix of dishes. Almost everything was delicious. The only underwhelming dish was the grilled mushroom, which was perfectly cooked, but a bit bland. Really cool space and friendly and fast service.
No comment
No comment

Yum yum yum!  Enjoyed the true Asian flavors and the very kind staff. It was cold and windy outside. Warm soup made with quality ingredients was exactly what we wanted and we were not disappointed. Ate at the bar facing the sidewalk which was fun people watching for this SoCal crew taking in the city. PS. The flavors are authentic with high end ingredients. Your tummy will thank you.
Tapas styled Japanese cuisine - everything was amazing but the karage was absolutely delicious! And not to mention their drinks, very refreshing!

I live in LA. I haven't been here since around Christmas. I still think of it fondly. Will definitely return when I'm back in the New York. Service was great, food is amazing. Aesthetic is nice. Highly recommend this place.
No comment

yesyesyes. Chawanmushi best I've had. Skip the grilled aji it was overcooked. Service was mixed. My main server was a bit disappointing and inattentive however other server were extremely friendly and helpful as was the hostess.
No comment

Although a bit spicy, but surprisingly clean tasting ramen, noodle has the right chewiness, sashimi is fresh too, love that they use freshly grated wasabi. Chawanmushi (steamed egg custard) is a bit over cooked thus not so silky, but as part of a set I have no complaint (would not order it alone though). Price is on par with similar establishments, but consider the quality and location, I would revisit and try the yakitori (heard that is their signature).
No comment

I enjoyed the food here, very authentic and inexpensive. It is a perfect place to either dine alone or with someone else. I came on a Saturday evening, and it was extremely busy, but the wait wasn't too bad. The crab fried rice was tasty and I would highly recommend for someone who isn't big on noodles (me)... I docked a star because our waiter was very impersonal, unwelcoming, and rushed us through our order selections. Other wait staff seemed to be more friendly, but unfortunately we were stuck with one who wasn't and that impacted our dining experience a tad.

One of my favorite restaurants in Manhattan. There are so many options and everything we had was out of this world. I will definitely be coming back. The wait wasn't too long actually and it was a bit of a younger vibe. I enjoyed the portion sizes and the bowls, napkins, utensils, and the decor is nice.

column3: オールドトロント, Toronto, Canada
column6: No comment
No comment

This was a very good dining experience. We ordered the tori tantan ramen which was the highlight of the meal. It was very flavorful and had the right amount of spice (could be too spicy for some though). The meat skewers were also good. We had the meatball (3/5)short rib (4/5) and chicken oyster(3/4). The ika meshi (squid stuffed rice dish) was unique but not impressive. I would recommend skipping it. We ended with the green tea dessert, monaka sando which was yummy and a nice combo of sweet with a hint of salty. Comfortable atmosphere and server was helpful with decision making. I also liked that it was shareable to you can try several dishes. Would go back to try some of the other items.
No comment
Food was great and creative. Service was meh. They forgot our order, so we had to wait 30-40 minute before placing that order again.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
3.5 stars. Food was fine, nothing special. I actually expected more since I love the other restaurants from this restaurant group (Hand Hospitality).
Came in with a party of 5. The small dishes and entrees were delicious and reasonably priced. Great atmosphere and friendly staff.

Decided to eat here with a small group of friends on a weekend. They were super busy and we waited about 30 mins until our reservation time. The food was good overall but nothing really stood out to me except the crab chowder. It had a soft shell crab and a curry chowder. I'm not usually a curry fan but it was good! Other items we ordered that I liked were the scallop uni and steamed egg. my least favorite was the kani fried rice, which didn't really have any flavor. Overall, I would recommend trying it out and hopefully can come back to try more items and give it another try myself.
No comment
Great place for dinner - plates are a bit small but packed with lots of flavor. Service is amazing and food is brought out very quickly. Would definitely come back again.

Love this place. Definitely one of my go to's the owner that runs this place really knows what he's doing. As well as all his other restaurant. The food and service is always consistent and everything is thought out well. You can truly tell This is his passion

Omg cannot boast enough this place is fantastic. Quality dishes executed very well and for such a budget friend price. Happy hour from 4/5-7 with $4 hot sake; everything was amazing will be coming back again. It's best to get a reservation because the place is super popular even on a Tuesday afternoon/evening and with good reason!

This casual place is all about Japanese home cooking. It's not flashy or fancy but they do serve great food. We ordered a la carte; I particularly liked the tsukune, which are chicken meatballs. Tori liver pate is also great. It does get busy but if you are in a small group you can squeeze in at the counter. We came late and had no problem getting seats for 3. Also try the shochu because why not?
No comment
Have a great experience there! The service and food are both good! I like the decoration there! The food is both healthy and delicious!

Fantastic food and great service. We ordered many plates to split between us all and each dish had its own unique flavours and textures. Everything was cooked perfectly. I can't speak enough of this place! Definitely recommend for groups and a nice date night.
No comment
Would eat here everyday if I could! Great variety of yakitori, ramen and other amazing dishes. Great house sake as well. Highly recommend!

I'm glad to find this place where I can get all types of Japanese street food. Food are delicious. Service is great. Prices are a little above the standard but overall is good. I love the yakitori they have great smoke flavor in it. Rainbow roll sushi topped with parm cheese it's pretty good combination.  Shiso cocktail is delicious.  Amazing raindrop Dessert! It's fun to watch it jiggling & tastes really good. I definitely will come back to try other items.
No comment
Yes yes yes!  I'm still in awe of the creativity and delicious food.  Please keep it up!
Good quality great service. The food is not too salty or too bland or over cooked. I thought the chicken oysters were chicken around the testicular area, but I was wrong.
No comment
We came on Saturday and they only had brunch menu. Food for brunch is not stunning good.

Been here serveral times for lunch and dinner. The lunch menu is pretty limited so just note that before coming. It's a cute place for dinner with great yakitori. Also, the yelp waitlist really cuts down waiting time. This is more of a high end izakaya themed restaurant, with a variety of food options.
No comment

I got chicken thigh and gizzard yakitori as well as two boxes of yakisoba through caviar. I had high expectations but unfortunately the food was really bad. Both yakitori were very dried. The yakisoba did not have any flavor at all. I only gave one star because of the packaging as it was very well packed despite the food having a mediocre taste

Sososo good.  Plates were inventive and beautiful.  Flavors blended together magically.  The yakatori is delicious.  Zucchini yakitori was my favorite, it was amazeballs!  Defiantly will be coming back to try more of their creative and delicious dishes.

column3: Anaheim Colony Historic District, Anaheim, CA
column6: No comment
Great place,  the food was amazing I still dreaming of the ramen ,yakitori  and the beef bowl that me and husband had everyday . I can't wait to go back there to try many more food that they offer
Very reasonably priced, cute space and great service. The food does come out fast so if you're looking for a long dinner date this isn't the place but other than that this restaurant is awesome.

I just cancelled my $100 delivery order after waiting for 1.5 hours, because restaurant said 1 of 9 items I ordered was still not ready. Quoted delivery time was 55 min. I cancelled due to safety reasons, given that 2 of the dishes I ordered were raw seafood. Their food is mediocre and not worth waiting for that long.

New restaurant in the area, came here for a going away dinner. Very cute interiors with upstairs seating as well. The staff was very attentive and nice. We ordered basically everything off the menu since we had a big group and my favorite were the short rib, zucchini and chicken skin for skewers. The desserts were very delicious too! Will definitely be back again.

I love their small plates, and freshly grilled meats, vegetables ( you can even watch it ). Sushi are good too. And I had for desert Panacota with black sesame seeds, and a scoop of Ice cream - I enjoyed it. Will be back .
No comment
What an amazing time we had! Small but charming the staff was attentive and amazing! We loved all of the offerings but recommend the dragon's egg!
It's hard to give a perfect review but with nonono it's not normal. All the dishes are legit and well-thought they don't shortchange you, it feels like Osaka

Excellent yakitori style food and skewers, at a reasonable price! I went there with two foodies who liked a bit more of the "whacky" items - so we ordered cow heart, gizzard, beef tongue, etc. Almost all proved to be super delicious. As a bonus, if you get there before 7pm they have happy hour with $5 drinks!

So, stopped in here for lunch and we were so glad we did. The lunch menu has something for everyone even though it looks limited upon first glance. I had the Tori Tantan ramen which was served piping hot and it was delicious. My friend had the veggie green curry which was also really tasty. Clearly they know what they do well. We sampled all 4 of the yakitori skewers. Our favorite was the chicken meatball - a perfect combination of salty/savory with a delicious glaze. Price is right too. All in all it was a perfect lunch - just the right portion size, that won't break the bank, and was absolutely delicious. I'm looking forward to going back. Added bonus, really nice staff.
No comment
Best yakitori place I've been to in New York! Mushroom trio was packed with flavor and great selection of meats.

A tapa place Japanese style.  That's Japanese yakitori to you.  How can you go wrong?  Me and my friend had an awesome time.  Happy hour and the food was scrumptious.  We ordered so much and we thought we will not be able to finish it.  Boy, I was wrong.  We cleaned our table.  The restaurant may have named it Nonono but the food was yes yes yes....
Good ramen place. Chicken, pork ramen. They have Affordable lunch menu as well. Interior is very cute.

I went on their grand opening night and was so impressed. The decor and lighting really set the mood for a great night. Started out with drinks and they were seriously all so good! I highly recommend  trying at least 1 or a few ;) The skewers were all soooo good, this is my new GO TO spot! My favorites is the Tsukune yakitori and the Yuzu sorbet dessert was such a refreshing end to the meal. Can't wait to go back soon!
You will regret if you don't try NoNoNo.  I have lived in NYC for 15 years, trying tons of yakidori places and NoNoNo is simply the best. Just go

column3: マンハッタン, New York, NY
column6: No comment
Ramen was great. My kids loved their Ramen bowls. They were accommodating to my Gluten Allergy.
Delicious japanese comfort food at a great price. I recommend the miso eggplant appetizer. The tori tantan was flavorful and had a good level of spice. The servers were friendly.

Great place, definitely worth a try. Food was pretty good, my favorite was kani fried rice and grilled squid, the sausce for the squid was very creamy and flavorful. I'd put that sauce on everything. Drinks are very interesting and the one I tried was great. Grilled corn was fantastic. Skewers are pretty good too, had scallops and shishito peppers, both were decent. Deserts were light and also quite interesting, tried rain drop, see photo.

Major disappointment. After making numerous trips, finally got to try this bland place. We ordered the chicken and oyster ramen, nori tacos, chicken skewer with truffle sauce, beef short rib, green tea ice cream sandwich. The beef short rib was flavorful, everything else was 2 or 3 star. Ramen lacked flavor. Green tea ice cream was good for people who don't like overly sugary desserts.

Nice place to hang out at night. The nonono chicken Kara age with fried juicy tomatoes is very delicious. The dragon ball is a little bit salty. I recommend the raindrop cake for dessert with bean powder and black sugar syrup. It is a very traditional Japanese dessert and it is on my "must to order" list

Great atmosphere, pleasant staff and great soups. Skewered meats are tasty but the coconut curry udon was delicious as well as the cream noodle soup. The soft shell crab curry chowder was tasty and a must order with some rice would have been nice to soak up all the broth. Make reservations when possible cause wait is about half an hour or more.
Had the nonono special and it was AMAZING! The iced tea here was really good too. It paired excellently with the dish! Would highly recommend!

There are lots of ikazayas in NY. But this one stands out by the details and execution found in every dish in their menu: fried rice with crab meat, clam with butter and truffle oil, crab croquette with béchamel, ... Pair that with a list of very refreshing cocktails and you have all the elements for a cool chill evening.

Uni lovers, rejoice! I came here with my husband for a casual anniversary dinner and nonono did not disappoint! We started with skewers, which we thoroughly enjoyed : chicken breast, chicken skin, bacon & egg, shiitake mushroom, and potato with truffle sauce. Then we decided to order several appetizers. I'll mainly highlight my favorites of the night. (1) The ebiwasa (wasabi sweet shrimp) was great, but since the dish only comes with 3, I was craving for more. Make sure you ask for the fried heads, they pack an insane amount of flavor. (2) The uni scallop carpaccio was lovely. A great balance of savory from the sauce/nori + sweet from the uni and hotate, and the shisho garnish was the icing on the cake. (3) The uni cream soba was a cold dish that was surprisingly nice. I typically don't eat too much soba, as I prefer more flavor in my noodles. This dish was light, but still managed to deliver on flavor (I think mixing the wasabi helped) and didn't make me feel bloated like a heavier noodle dish would've. Overall, a great meal and I will gladly come back!
One of my most favorite places in New York! Check out their specials! The food is delicious and the servers are fantastic!

This place has a great variety of yakitori and small dishes. The price is also reasonable given the location. I have became a regular at the restaurant. Usually there is a long line for week day lunch and might have a wait for weekend dinner, so definitely go early or late.
No comment
Was dope man. Very different approach. Truly enjoyable service and food price was on higher end but was worth it

Left sincerely wondering what the hype is about. Bland, tasteless dishes one after the other. Insanely fast paced service, with all the food coming at once left literally zero room on our tiny table. Servers literally stacked plates on top of one another and left without clearing empty, or abandoned dishes. Cocktails had a rancid smell that left us sick to the stomach. Over priced. NO NO NO indeed.
It's ok.. food quality is decent but overpriced. I guess that's normal price for New York.Food portion is very small, I was still hungry after ordered several dishes lol
No comment

An authentic Japanese restaurant. The food quality is very consistent, and the service is decent.  Their seasonal special is something you can't find it anywhere else in the city. Cocktail is also in high quality.

Came after work with a friend in town. I don't find many good restaurant's in this area but nonono was fantastic! We got sake, saporros, short rib with onion, shishito peppers, corn, dragon ball, and Kani fried rice. The rice was okay but everything else was great. My favorite was the short rib! It's a little expensive but the food is so well prepared and unique that it was worth it.
No comment

I had to wait 1 hour and 10 minutos for mediocre food. After eating it, we realized that it's not worth what you're paying for. Serving sizes are small and are not worth waiting for, especially if you're hungry. Try another Japanese restaurant like Village Yokocho if you want skewers.

Yum. This place was packed during the dinner hour and I popped in with four coworkers, hoping to grab a table. The hostess seated us within 20 minutes at a private table up on the second floor. We enjoyed a delicious meal and really appreciated our special table. Thank you!
No comment

The design for the space is very very nice. From all the pictures that were posted on social media, you'd expect the food to be amazing as well. It was pretty average in my opinion. Average and expensive. Definitely a place where you would have to spend quite a bit of money if you want to be full after leaving the meal. But hey, if you have the money, go for it.
Their Oden soup is to die for and they have all good foods. Have to make reservation like a week ago but other than that it's good. Also u cannot seat longer than 2 hrs.!

This is the best yakitori I've ever had in NYC. I came here last night for date night with my boyfriend and after our first bite of our first yakitori we knew we were in for an amazing night.  Everything was cooked and seasoned so perfectly.  Everything was so juicy! The chicken meatball was by far our favorite. The staff was also very kind and helpful.  Will definitely be back soon and would definitely recommend!!

We're a long time patrons at Yakitori Totto, tried this place and really loved it. We ordered a bunch of Yakitori sticks- skirt steak, short rib, chicken oyster, heart, gizzard, wings etc and all were amazing. We also got the stuffed wings which was fantastic and sauce was delicious. We tried their curry udon which was great but probably better to have when it's cold out since it was hot and spicy. Service was great, can't wait to come back.

If you guys looking for cozy place and nice food in mid town, then please check this place! I went this place last week with my friends, and had some cocktails and yakitori.
