Especially cocktail was so uniquely awesome. One of cocktail was made with "beet". I heard that beet is one of super food! Of course taste was wonderful.
Pricey for small plates of food but very tasty. I'd probably go somewhere else if you don't want to splurge.

Waitlist is a option. I added myself and went shopping around the area. My table was ready before the estimated time so it was really convenient. Food came out fast and service was great. I ordered the grilled squid and it was fishier than I'd like. Other than that, it was a nice place for a quick bite

The wait can be long but it's one of my go to places for dinner. It's a good idea to order a few dishes and to share if you go with a group. The quantity is not a lot, but the menu is big and I love the variety of skewers you can order! I also recommend the cream curry udon.

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: No comment
Food is delicious, and love their cold sake . You have to make a reservation days before you go, otherwise you have to wait for long time, but definitely worth the wait.
Awesomely awesome vibe. Go with friends and try a bunch of new things. Highly recommend the rice-stuffed squid. Amazing

They have interesting cuts that a lot of other Japanese restaurants might not have but not all are outstanding. However it's a nice restaurant to go to with a large group so you can sample a lot of different dishes.
No comment
No comment

This is my new favorite yakitori spot. It used to be Yakitori Totto but that place has gone downhill. The yakitori we ordered were all good and seasoned well - chicken wing, tail, skin, oyster and thigh with cilantro, short rib and skirt steak. The eggplant with miso was also very good. I didn't care for the daichi mushrooms or the teba gyoza.

The restaurant is spacious and modern, which makes a great overall ambiance. I came here an hour before closing time and ordered several small plates for dinner. Each plate came fast and tasted delicious. The rain drop cake was particularly delightful.

Was here recently for a group dinner. I think it is the best way to enjoy these type of restaurants. Prices are a little expensive (but not out of the ordinary for the location); a relatively decent size party allows you to order and try more plates while offsetting the costs. Everything here was delicious. Only plate less than expected was the beef tartar. It was more cooked and well done than expecting. Would recommend to come and give this place a try. Probably will not come here regularly, but only during special occasions. Literally... everything was delicious. left feeling full and satisfied. Will return again. Recommend coming early after work to avoid wait times, or making a reservation.

Tried everything on their menu. Went there multiples times. Small tapas style dishes for Japanese food and kinda on the pricy side. But digs the decor and vibes. Can I say I actually likes their ramen the best out of everything?
Sat at the bar in front of the grill. Little too hot for dining. Love the drinks. Food was ok considering the price.
Great place for Japanese food. Easy to read and pick from menu. Dropped in without a reservation on Saturday for lunch. Excellent service and tasty food.
No comment
No comment

COD CREAM UDON!! it blew my mind!!! Ordered it as delivery and it came piping hot. It definitely needs to be eaten quickly. It's rich, flavorful, creamy, not too heavy, perfection. So happy I ordered from here.  I've dined in multiple times and have always been exceedingly happy with the food and the service. It said 30-40 mins but it took probably about an hour BUT THATS OK!! COVID.  Keep being amazing guys!!!
No comment
Okay izakaya. More of a Korean fusion version. Not as good as other real Japanese ones. I think it has been improving since the beginning though

We loved the extensive menu; good choices for a picky party of 4.  Very fresh sushi and tasty noodle dishes.  Enjoyed the variety in the drinks menu, with particularly great house cocktails.  We will be back.
Good for a quick, casual bite but I wouldn't come out of my way to try it. Good Japanese food but I've definitely had better ramen and skewers elsewhere.
No comment

High quality food and a great atmosphere. The items here are unique and flavorful. There are so many options that it's hard to choose, but all the dishes we had were delicious! We tried the curry udon, salmon roll, many skewers, fried duck, and the matcha ice cream. Amazing. Make sure you make a reservation!
Great food love definitely come back.timing was great.service was excellent .must trybit
No comment
Amazing Japanese fusion tapas place. Place was well lit, cozy, and the food was great. Not a cheap spot but definitely worth checking out

Nonono is a gem because it ticks a lot of boxes. It's not hard to get in, I never need a reservation for 2 (but I'd make one for more). It's not too expensive, and can be used for both casual or nice occasions. The service here is extremely efficient, there's multiple servers working every table. It has a great ambiance, and the food is interesting and great. The short rib is addictive, the duck with egg salad is bomb, the sashimi is so good. Get a pitcher of beer, sit near the open grill and have a fantastic meal with very little effort.
No comment
All dishes were really good, but the portions are rather small for the price. Quite authentic and delicious though.
No comment

Awesome food and super attentive friendly staff. It's such a great place to chill with friends on weekends or after work. They have many unique and creative dishes. I absolutely loved their raindrop cake (loved it to the point where I had to order three cakes total). It was unbelievably refreshing. For sure I will be back soon.
Nice food, reasonable price, clean and spacious environment here. Feel breathable here in the crowded city once you're seated. Will definitely come here again.

This place is great! For the most part I'm a selfish fat kid in training, so I normally don't do tapas, but they do a great job here. Most of the items are sizable enough that you're not staring at the last bite wondering if you're a d*$k for eating it (and every other last bite around). Order: the beet cocktail, the corn (I know, just do it), mushrooms, fried rice and the karaage... and probably most other things. The few items we had that weren't fantastic were still very edible, just not fun flavor bombs like the others, so I won't mention them. They're still deserving of an order. I can see it being busy here, so call ahead, but it's deceivingly large with two floors, so hopefully there's room for ya when you stop by! Def pop in if you're in the area. Don't be mad if it takes you five visits to get a real feel for the place. That menu is large!

I feel lucky to walk in nonono the other day. I did not expect it to be a great restaurant, but now I have recommended it to 4 friends. I like to try out different food in restaurants, and nonono's small portion suits me really well. I ordered the chawanmushi, calm, octopus, grilled mushroom, and some noodles. The chawanmushi, calm, octopus were amazing. I like how they are not too salty but still full of flavors. Will definitely come back. Restaurants like this makes NYC a special city.
Pricey, but fantastic service and inventive dishes. Have had several group events here and the staff is always super friendly. The cocktail menu is also excellent.
No comment

i love this place! such a great spot to gather with a few friends and feel confident there's something delicious for everyone's tastes. Great light and airy space that fills up quick so make sure to get there on time and early!

Such a chill place. I love the interior, cozy but nicely furnished. Moreover, their foods and cocktails are amazing. If you are looking for a spot for your first date night, I highly recommend this place. Great service, will definitely come back!
mediocre food and limited cocktails available. Overall I would not come back.

NO NO NO! Do not come here. Horrible service. We sat upstairs and the waiter forgot about us - not only did no one come by for almost an hour with no service, he admitted to forgetting about us AND forgot to put our order in until we asked about it 3 times! We sat there waiting for service and food that never showed up. Unfortunately, after realizing the issue, the manager or the server did not care to make amends and simply said "sorry". They did not care about losing us as customers, since they have plenty reviews from first-time customers and it was super disappointing.

I so badly want this place to be a yesyesyes but it turns out to be a nonono for me. We ordered several distinctly different things off the menu and somehow they all ended up tasting pretty much the same ??? I think I kind of figured out the secret of their cooking here... dip it in butter and grill to crispy on the outside, add flavor with salt or sugary water. Not gonna lie the chicken tail tastes pretty bomb(I never had fried butter but if you tell me what I am eating is not chicken but fried butter I would believe you) but the rest of the stuff tasted very bland (stuffed squid: soggy rice flavored with sugary squid water, stuffed wings: the only seasoning I could taste is the overwhelming ginger and a bit of sugary taste on the wings, and the seared salmon is proper but I have had better). 5 stars for the interior design with something extra for the dining experience, super cute menus and bathrooms!

Overhyped for sure. A few of our skewers came undercooked so we sent it back - not all meat should have that much pink in it. The restaurant itself is a lot more dingy than the pictures let on. Not a fan. The chicken skin skewer had a foul smell.

Great new place for a tapa-style japanese menu. Definitely try their daily special for a bargain delight. All of their menu was at least 4 stars worth so bring your friends and try a little bit of each!

This has an incredible take on Japanese cuisine that I really appreciate. The menu was also visually stunning and gave you a journey on what to expect. Everything on the menu not only had a description but a photo and it was like a really nice book. The food was good and ambience was there to match. Also it was huge and for NY I've never seen a restaurant that big unless it was Eataly and that's more of a marketplace than a restaurant. Props I'll be back
No comment

First time here and we love the place and service. We had Jay and he was so kind, friendly and professional. We will definitely be back. Service was outstanding by him and the food was very good and authentic. Thank you for having us!
Great yakitori and fried seaweed sushi. My fav! Go early for dinner to beat the rush and avoid the long wait.
Great variety. Yakitori is amazing, and so are the ramen and udon. Sushi is a bit overpriced tho. Overall quality and variety is amazing
I am visiting from Southern California and wanted to try the yakitori NY has to offer. Very good! Best beef tongue I've ever had.
Insanely good. A little weird that they gave us an 8:30 reservation, we sat at 8:50, and then they told us the kitchen closes at 9, but we knew what we wanted and put in a massive order just in time.
Popped in on a cold rainy day jonesing for ramen and it didn't disappoint .  Service was fine and polite and meal was very solid but nothing to rush back for.
Overall experience is great. Food taste good but all served in a small portion. Recommend for 3+ people to come.

This is a modern izakaya that serves solid Izakaya fare. Came here twice for dinner. Food has always been on point and drinks are decent. Yakitori is grilled well. Nothing is burnt and everything is relatively tasty. They have some creative things that we liked and some more traditional offerings that are good. The tsukune and nonkotsu are one of my fave. The grilled corn was also really good. The mushroom caps were tasty. Wings were grilled well. My least fave was the noodles. But then again I'm not a huge carb person. Service was friendly and accommodating. Seating is definitely more comfortable here than at a real traditional Izakaya. Didn't try any of the cocktails so can't speak to that but did have a glass of white wine on my last visit. The place filled up pretty quickly and was busy throughout the evening so go early have ressies. Prices are higher than traditional izakayas but this is a bit more upscale so I don't mind. Would def come back next time we're in the mood for Izakaya food.
Really really good. Love being able to try and share multiple things. Food great. Service great. Atmosphere amazing.

Definitely worth trying this hugely Asian/Japanese influenced restaurant. The food is largely tapas style "read portion"! The ambiance is great with ultra modern setting and would be an envy of younger casual generation clientele!
Good staffs and foods, drinks, location is the best as well.i think japanese style izakaya but Korean owner? I like atmosphere, def come back again .

I went to nonono with my girl friend on a Saturday night and I love this place. We had a great time there to catch up and enjoyed the foods. I went around 9:30pm so some dishes were run out but the rest is still pretty good. The food is so delicious. The price is very reasonable for the quality and the portion. We spent around 50 dollars each and we tried many significant dishes. Many dishes are also very creative which I never seen in other restaurant. Highly recommend the uni cold noodles. I would definitely want to go there again to try everything on the menu!
Just like the pictures in the review, everything was delicious.  Quick service. Have to make reservation on wait time usually 45 min.   Totally worth it

The environment was spot on; a huge fan of the chill/Japanese vibe. Came for the yakitori, but the skewers turned out to be a disappointment. They weren't bad, but nothing outstanding. Go to Torishin or Toriko instead. However, the other dishes were a delight (especially the yellowtail and fried chicken)!

One of my favorite restaurants in New York with the best Japanese food! Their dessert was actually amazing. The vibe was also really nice for dinner. Make sure to reserve beforehand - it gets crowded at nights!

usually a wait, but the food is good! If you use the yelp wait in line thing you would still have to wait once you get there. I like the skewers esp the veggie ones, all the ramens are good too. Drinks are light.

Food was decent but we felt very rushed and service was horrible. We had appetizers and a meal and server didn't ask if we were finished with the apps and just plopped the meals on the table. Three of us sitting a small table.  We could hardly fit all the plates on it!  Server didn't know how to open wine. Felt much more like a cafeteria.
No comment

The skewers are so good and it's nice to have a variety so you can try something new. Between 4 people, we spent about $180; skewers, croquettes, and 2 bottles of Drunken Whale sake. Service is attentive enough to not feel like you're being hassled to hurry up to leave or feel completely ignored. The wait time is nonexistent but if there is a long line they do have a tablet outside to join the waitlist, so that's pretty neat to have!
No comment
Very mediocre food in small quantity, very much under poured drink that has no punch... only thing stand out would be great service

Great interior design! It's really simplistic and comfortable. Came here on a Friday night for date night around 6:30 and were seated right away; however, must note that on our way out around 7 something there was a large line. So come early! This place has a really organic feel and so does the food. We really didn't know what to get so we ordered a lot of small plates randomly. First off was the salmon tataki- so yummy and very tender. You get a lot of salmon which was unexpected! The salmon is on a bed of avocado and has great sauce pairing up with it. Not going to lie I almost was full trying to finish that off. We also ordered the uni carpaccio (on little scallops). I'm not a huge fan of seawater tasting things but this was really fresh and didn't have any sea smell or taste! Also comes with a lot. We ordered one skewer of chicken liver which was good but not super seasoned. For healthy veggie options we ordered the mushroom plate (Kinoko) which were beautifully grilled in its super natural state, so they basically don't have taste, BUT there is a small dish of seasoned enoki mushrooms which you should grab a little bit of and eat it with the rest of the mushrooms. Tebasaki Gyoza- super juicy, but it's not crispy since it's not fried (like Koreans). These only have pork stuffings. I ordered the creamy curry udon solely for the novelty of it since I've seen it before. The mashed potato cream on top is not thick mashed potato cream. If you mix it with the curry it'll simply disappear. The curry udon itself has a lot of sauce and no meat/veggies in it. It has a good curry kick to it. Only eat this as a shareable carbohydrate, not as a one person meal. In fact forgot to say, share everything. Sui shingen/ water cake is good and simple, and also the black sesame panna cotta. Both are good desserts to end the meal!

You should definitely made reservation before you go to this place.  They wouldn't sit you until everybody is there.   The dishes are like small tapas.  We have tried a lot of dishes from the menu.  My favorites are the salmon tataki, nori tofu, duck Ankake, cream curry udon and tori liver pate.  Salmon tataki was really fresh and it tasted delicious with the pairing of avocado and the sweet soy sauceon the bottom.  Nori tofu was flavorful and soft,  it was a very refreshing.  Duck Ankake was cooked perfectly,  the skin was crispy on top and the meat was not over cooked.  Cream curry udon was amazing.   There was a layer of creamy potato on top, once you mixed with the Japanese curry, it was delicious.  Tori liver pate was smooth and creamy, I just wished I had more bread.  Ika Meshi was a bit disappointing,  the squid was very tough. The beef on the Dragon ball was over cooked which made it very chewy.  Teba Gyoza was not fully cooked but the staff took the dish back and gave us a new dish.  She apologized right away and came back to check of us after every dish.
No comment
Great food and value. Very efficient. The short rib and chicken skewers are great. Highly recommend.
Small portions but perfect for a laidback friends night out! Great happy hour deal for beer. Food was on the saltier side. My favorite dish was the scampi!

It's a popular place so going without a reservation can lead to a bit of a wait but it's pretty worth it. The dragon ball dish was my favorite along with the kani fried rice. We also got two sushi rolls that were pretty good. The portions are pretty small so keep that in mind but it's a great place to order a few tapas and try a bit of everything. Great ambience.

The food is good, and it's a nice, casual place to go with friends.  However, the last time I was there, my waiter literally chased me outside (I was on the other side of the street and 1/2 way down the block) to ask me why I didn't tip, and I told him 20% gratuity was added to the bill.  He didn't believe me, and I insisted that we go back and look at the bill together (I worked as a waitress, and I would never, ever stiff someone on a tip, so it was important to me to either find out if I was wrong, or prove I didn't do that!).  The line item on the bill was clearly marked as "gratuity" and there was 20% there.  The waiter did seem genuinely puzzled and told me that "they never do that."  I don't know what was going on there, but it made me feel really awkward (even though I was right), and I don't want to go back.

Arrived for Brunch on Saturday, place was already getting full and sat on the 2nd floor. My friends and i ordered the ramen set and Yakitori don set, it was very good and flavorful. Love the steamed eggs that came with the combos as well!
Wait for a long time to get in around 40min in the Friday evening. The BBQ is good but not so surprised me. Creamy noddle is delicious  love the salmon and other seafood most
Great service staff made sure you were good and spoke very nicely. Food came on time and fresh as can be

Everything here tastes so good. Try all the skewers and the other dishes. Drinks are delicious. The whole time I was thinking, I wish we invited two more people so we could try more from the menu. After the tasty dessert we we're stuffed. Good food, great service and pretty affordable food for the city.

This unassuming corner restaurant was great. I loved the original cocktails and the tapas style dining. Everything is intended to be shared and the small dishes allow you to order many of dishes to try. The cooking was traditional but all the flavors had an unexpected twist to it (except for the regular yakitori). Three of us ordered 6 cocktails, around 13 main tapas (sometimes an order is simply 1 yakitori stick), 3 desserts and the bill came out to around $210.

Stumbled into this restaurant because sugarfish had a long wait, and it was such a pleasant surprise. From the decor/ambiance to the the food, I definitely recommend heading here. This is an izakaya style restaurant, so definitely take advantage of that and get as many plates as you can. The grilled short rib was amazing.
No comment
No comment
No comment
I very much like the atmosphere and staff. Food is amazing here and I would definitely recommend checking it out. Coming back next weekend! :)

Super trendy place. Highly recommend the Beef Tataki and Creamy Curry Udon - both were excellent, especially the Udon. Unique flavor - haven't had something like it before. Works very well with the potato puree. Also got the Yuzukosho Nori and Salmon Belly which. The yakitori was a little bitter from the nori and I wasn't a fan. The salmon belly was fine
Loved it. Definitely recommend to use waitlist on yelp to reserve a table. Flavors and food were on point.

As good as it gets. Delicious and powerful meals served in a homey environment. Clean crisp dishes that amaze the pallet and delight all the senses at reasonable prices . GREAT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Fantastic find and awesome place for a date night. Made a reservation for 10pm Saturday night and that was a good idea--place was packed but I didn't notice any waiting patrons. Super friendly staff and outstanding service without being overbearing or intrusive on our dining experience. Recommend the delicious crunchy nori tacos and nonono roll. Had the crab fried rice but it wasn't anything special, particularly compared to the other unique items we tried. Raindrop dessert was fun and peculiar, nothing like anything I've ever tried before.
No comment

Surprisingly good. Dropped by for late night dinner. Had a few yakitore, chicken cartilage, rib eye, potato, and the chicken with black sauce was a nice pleasant surprise. The chicken broth ramen was also delicious. Will come again.

Had lunch here and everything was fantastic! The entree was absolutely delicious. I had the dish with the different types of skewers. Then had all three desserts and each was absolutely stupendous! Presentation of all dishes was on the same level. Service was great too!
Awesome place to come by and have a nice bite thank you guys for the service it was amazing
No comment
No comment
Love it! Great ambience with amazing food and drinks. Make sure to order Yakitori (tamago bacon, shishito, chicken heart, pork with ponzu sauce...)
Racist establishment.  Takes black/latino money and kick them out for no reason. I saw it first hand . Police offers did nothing . Stay away from this establishment
No comment
I have been there once and have ordered delivery a couple times. Food on average was good! I love the cozy ambience and will go back with friends
The rice dish was slightly better for a simple lunch option. Tried the ramen as well which was still really good.
Really enjoy the environment, i like the decorations a lot, the services person are cute, food all taste ok. Would definitely go back

yesyesyes, give me more of that chicken oyster, ebi katsu, tsukune, and short rib. Nori tofu and kinako cream chicken were also really good. FYI heart tissue has this crunchy chewy texture, somewhat like gizzard. Liver wasn't as rich as I had hoped.  Kani fried rice was ok - always wish there was more crab in these offerings. So, some hits and misses, but highlights were very high.
Love this place! They do know how to grill meat. Tried a ton of small plates and paid a reasonable price.

Came here for dinner with friends while visiting New York. There was not a wait when we arrived later in the evening. I was wowed by the variety in their menu - though sometimes that can be a bad thing, as I am bad with making decisions especially on food. I got to try a variety (sashimi, thin pork belly, eel, etc) and had a good meal. The only thing that got me a bit peeved was that the waiters/waitresses don't seem to be communicating with each other. We told one waitress that we needed a few more minutes to decide on the menu, and another comes within half a minute, demanding us to order. In addition, once we paid, they wanted to swiftly kick us out so that they can prepare the table for a larger group. I was not very happy with that. We sat after paying maybe a few minutes to finish a conversation.

3.5 stars. Food was not bad but nothing to rave about. We were interested in the ika meshi (squid stuffed with rice) but when we tried to order that, the waiter warned us about the fishy and chewy texture a few times. He kept telling us how he explained and warned customers about it ahead of time but still ended up getting complains... we were a bit worried at first but did end up ordering it. We understand what he was trying to tell us the moment we bite into the squid, it taste nothing like a typical grilled squid or calamari, it was not horrible but I won't order it again. The rest of the food was okay without any big surprises. I like the Saturday's roll and pork yakitori with ponzu sauce. The stuffings inside the teba gyoza was a bit bland. My friend likes the Dragon ball dish but I find it a bit too salty when we are having that without any rice or noodles. Overall, food was alright but nothing memorable. With so many yakitori restaurants in the city, I doubted that I will be coming back to nonono.

Wait can be long but the food is worth it. I especially recommend the shiso pasta with clams. All the flavors were subtle but blended together in yummy goodness! It paired well with the skirt steak + shiso pepper skewer. We also enjoyed the short rib & chicken gizzard skewers, as well. Beer is perfect with this meal/snack!
Such a nice place ! The good is incredible, the prices are good! The place is cool and trendy! Love it !
A great place with super cozy atmosphere,food,service and drinks. What else you expect from a restaurant in NYC?will be back soon.

If you love tapas (small plates) you will love this place. We ordered an assortment of yakitori, the salmon tataki, steak nan chette, grilled squid, oyako salmon roll, kani cream crab croquettes, and ramen. Everything was delicious and fresh. We also ordered the hot Sake and the Basil and Daikon cocktails, and they were awesome too. This is a definitely a place to try!!

They have pretty unique dishes and they were absolutely delicious! It's a Izakaya style food (Japanese pub food) but the quality was amazing. My friend and I had about 10 dishes (they are small and also we were hungry) and every single one was really good. I didn't get to try ramen because I'm pescatarian (no veggie ramen option)! I'd definitely go back!

How the hell does this place have 4.5 stars?? Absolutely the least impressive food I've eaten in NYC. There are thousands of restaurants you could get a better meal at, dont be tricked by the high rating.
Its ok. Not bad by any means, just nothing impressive. Theres better ramen in the area for cheaper. Cool environment though. Decent for work lunches

I stopped by initially because of the name, which is great, and was pleasantly surprised that it served interesting ramen. I have come for lunch and tried the Shoyu Chintan and Shio Paitan. They are both decent modern Tokyo style Ramen bowls. I liked the lighter shoyu broth. I enjoyed the taste of the the Pork Chashu. The style of the Chashu, Sliced thin and not grilled/broiled, is fairly unique in NYC and more common in Tokyo so I'm glad it's catching on. The chicken breast is a bit disappointing it tended to be more on the dry side. The chicken meatball nice and airy with a light soy glaze was satisfying.
Great vibe and ramen! Staff is very friendly. I always go there for lunch and it's high quality food and experience for a reasonable price
Great spot for interesting cuisine and casual dining! Went here with my parents and fiance and the menu had something for all of us. Beef tongue stew is a must!

Very cute interior, wonderful for a date or a small group of friends. The food here is melt in your mouth yum and it definitely feels very authentic. If you head over here I highly recommend the yuzu sorbet!

My new favorite go-to place when friends visit the city! It's beyond affordable for the quality that you get. My favorites are the nori tofu and scallop / uni carpaccio, but literally anything you get will be good! Service is super quick as well.

Ate there with a bunch of friends I hadn't seen in a very long time.  Menu is perfect, something for everyone. Would like to see more gluten free options but it was still great.  Service was awesome and was very accommodating.  Will be back definitely whenever I'm in the area. Very nice decor as well.

Very popular place. Went on a Friday night before Halloween and it was busy the whole time I was there and after I left. They don't take reservations between 6:00 - 9:00PM I believe is what the hostess said. We waited about 15-25 minutes for a party of 3. All the food was delicious and fresh. Loved the Halloween special. Was super sad that I didn't get to try the raindrop pudding because they ran out that night.

Great place for small plates.  Came here with 6 friends and ordered A bunch of stuff!    Everything was great and really food for sharing. Favorites were the fried chicken drums! So good that we ordered more.  Ramen was also really good as well as the pork rice and noodle dish. So happy that this is a place that's close to where we live. Will definitely come back!

It's wonderful place to eat in! Very real good Japanese food there! No fake Japanese food!! Ate shio ramen, sushi and some appetizers! Wonderful!! Those real Japanese staff have the best customer service and hospitality! Great! Will definitely come back!!!!

One of my favorite, go-to spots in the city. The restaurant is rustic in a trendy way and is good for a casual dinner or something slightly more special. They have a wide variety of skewers, small/to-share plates, and medium/large dishes. Of the skewers, the chicken tail is super juicy and tender and my personal favorite. The short rib with onions and chicken skin skewers get a shout out as well. For small/to-share plates, the scallop uni carpaccio and sweet shrimp are delicious. The grilled salmon, squid, and gyoza are also solid. For medium/large dishes, I like the oyako salmon roll, and think the cream curry udon is worth a try. Lastly, I recommend making reservations or going early for dinner since it gets packed pretty quickly.

The food was simple, elegant, and delicious. The restaurant has a cool industrial mid century modern vibe going on. We sat in a secluded nook upstairs and ordered tons of food. It all arrived one after another which felt like a welcome barrage of tasty morsels. The dining here is like Japanese taps essentially and is best shared. So good!

amazing!! great service and fantastic food not to mention reasonable prices - can't wait to return. Incredible yakitori - in fact everything we tried was flavorful, fresh and served quickly and with a smile. Wonderful experience every single time.

Excellent small bites and combinations. Great solo or in a small or large group. More people, more to try and share. The menu is so well composed and it is really tough to narrow down the selection. Solid cocktails, sake and beer lists. Great space, good vibe, excellent service. Definitely a repeat.

This place is new, owned by the same owners that run a few Korean places nearby (Take31, etc). Japanese yakitori place, slightly modern and upscale elements to it, but lively place for a meal and drink. Menu is incredibly diverse and seems to have a few fusion elements to some, but the primary attraction is the yakitori which is well done.
All I can say is this place should be on everyone's bucket list.  From the yakitori to ramen th good was excellent.   The service was good and friendly.
We had a lovely dinner here. Tapas is the correct word. We tried the edamame with anchovies--delicious,. The rolls were excellent. The service was very good and I would certainly recommend it.

Mostly positive experience - from the decor to the service to the food itself. Taking away 1 star because they forgot to bring us a dish that we ordered and we were still charged for it. We live in the neighborhood and would like this to be a regular spot - guess we have to be extra careful next time and double check our order and receipt. Would be helpful if customers could write-in their order on a fill in the blank menu so everyone can keep track of # of items of each and what to expect.
No comment
Authentic Jan food, lots of choices for skewers and sakes! Food portion is a bit small tho. Overall good food and nice staff! Cool interiors!
Went here with some friends, great ramen. Very filling and decadent. Staff was kind and food came out quickly. Hope to be back soon!

Fantastic Japanese small plates restaurant.  Definitely try the stuffed wings, but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Don't come here too hungry:  You'll have to order many plates and spend a lot of cash to leave feeling full.

Skewers were subpar. Only the chicken oysters were good. Thigh was super marinated. Ordered beef tataki but it was medium well, not rare. The dish was also odd and didn't seem to go together overall: beef, arugula, and asiago cheese (?) Not sure how much diff rare beef would turn the dish around. Apparently, they precook the beef and just slice what they cook, instead of cutting rare beef and torching it. Their karaage was uh.. let's just say all the other karaages I've tried in regular ramen places taste much better. The only thing that was rlly good was the trio platter. Overall, the portions and quality of food are not worth the money. Service was rlly bad and the waiters looked annoyed everytime we asked for them. Also, people can bring dogs here? The group who sat next to us had a dog (not a service dog) that was constantly pacing around. Not sure what the rave was but did not feel it. Won't be coming back again.
Parking was good, loved my noodle soup, and the fried chicken fingers were dark meat, which I loved.

Really great yakitori!!!  Love the menu design, great way to present the dishes in a modern way.  Makes you want to order everything. That being said, skip the mushy sushi and stick with fried and grilled things, especially the beef tongue and chicken Oyster.  We will be back!

Newly opened this summer, but I only got to try it out recently. From the people behind Her Name is Han so I new it was probably good. When having their yakitori, they were more flavorful and you can tell the quality of the meet. Service there is great as well. They additionally had some unique items like stuffed wings. I think they fell short with their Shio Paitan which didn't seem to include any salt, but at least their creamy curry udon made up with its spiciness (but be careful because it is heavy).

Was brought in by the raindrop cake (fun and delicious), and was utterly delighted and refreshed by the basil cocktail. Saturday roll was quite tasty, as were the chicken skewers. Everything was beautifully presented.
No comment
Definitely love the food here, we mainly ordered skewers this time and some desert. Delicate and delicious too.
Love the new concept of Japanese food. Such a unique sense of beauty and taste. The peach blossoms are actually real. Love this place and Strongly recommended!
Great food selection and fast service... everything was good.

My friend & I dined here, had a quite good time. Foods are good, pricey but that's everywhere in the city anyway. Yakitori was pretty good, I had Hatsu & Nankotsu. We really liked creamy curry udon and dessert, enjoyed yuzu sorbet very much. Ordered sharable 5 dishes, 4-5 Yakitori, dessert and drinks for $60 something each and we were full. Not bad. We would like to come back again.

The HAND Hospitality team has another winner. Stopped in for lunch one day and loved the Shoyu Chintan ramen - simple, yet delicious. Came again with a group for dinner and sampled more of the menu. Loved the yakitori we tried, the scallop uni carpaccio, and zuke maguro. Looking forward to the next time I'm back.

Not worth the waiting. We walked in without reservations around 8 and was told about 30 min waiting. But the actual wait is 1hr+ We expected the food quality be good enough for this long wait, but emmm food is very average. Price is not too expensive, but not cheap enough for their tiny portion. One extra star for service. Maybe good for groups, the atmosphere was loud. Don't come unless you have reservations and low expectations on food.

Been here twice and service and food has been great! Really love the grilled corn, stuffed chicken (gyoza style), tako sumiso, and the standout dish for me is the beef with onion sauce. Ridiculously flavorful.
Gas grilled yakitori with a slight singe of bitterness to finish. Nothing special to see here - probably not the experience you were expecting. Great restaurant name though - really draws you in ののの？

I was super excited to try this place after all the reviews and ended up being underwhelmed.  They serve tapas style which is a great way to try quite a few different things.  The issue was that not one of the dishes we tried blew me away.  The menu is super long, which can sometimes be overwhelming.  I also ordered a glass of wine which came in a regular glass and was probably half an actual glass - which is annoying at $10 a pop.  Overall, could be a good place for a large group but nothing too exciting.
I love the food here! A bit expensive but gosh I love the salad, the rolls, and the skewers. Might be a wait if you go during peak time so I recommend going when they open at 5:30!

This restaurant is really a paradise for the food lover. the interior is well decorated and the menu is simple and straightforward.  The wait staff is attentive and ready to guide you through the seemingly overwhelming menu. The food is beyond delicious.

Found this restaurant because of my love of Izakaya and the help from yelp. The meal was very complete and delicious. I found the food diverse and filling. Everything was cooked perfectly. The waitstaff was very attentive.

This is a great addition to the neighborhood! Great Yakitori (they have all the best chicken parts here - heart, liver, cartilage, you name it they have it). The side dishes are also quite tasty and innovative in their own right - grilled eggplant was very good.
So yummy and very casual, low key atmosphere. Looks like a hole in the wall, but very intentional. Everything we had was delish. Service was friendly. Cocktails were yummy, if a little small.

If you want an authentic dining experience with amazing food then this place is a must. Aside from the food being nothing short of spectacular, the atmosphere and vibe will make you feel like you are in the land of the rising sun. Fun, hip and cool. Don't wait, do it before word spreads.

This is American-Izakaya. If you want authentic Izakaya you will be disappointed. Terrible service, I asked for my soda 3 times, tried different waitresses and took half an hour, same as an extra napkin. I will not go back to this place.

Came here on a Tuesday night, no wait which was nice but it was still loud as hell. Which is fine, this is a bustling, hip restaurant. My average rating is more for the food portions. It felt very overpriced for what you got

Sensory delight! Very creative, simple menu.  salty plates-- next time I'll ask for no salt. Also small plates. Been there a few times and it's always an exciting break from the usual. I like to think it's like an excursion to a trendy spot in Japan...
Delicious Yakitori!! Creative and enticing menu. Want to eat it all, need to come back and eat it all. All the food. All the knowledge.

Had the chicken liver, chicken thigh yakitori and they were great. Kids had the ramen and rice dishes. Servings were a bit small so there was definitely room for dessert. Service was prompt. Great concept of using the entire chicken, no waste. Could not make reservations since resy wouldn't let me book for six but we were fortunate enough to score parking and a table for six.

I have had Japan chicken sets at many places at NYC including one 1-star restaurant. But this one is quite cheap and have almost the quality as the 1-star. Will come back very soon. Good decoration style.
No comment

What first draws your attention when you walk in Nonono is the chic, minimalist design, stereotypical of a modern Asian restaurant. The service was attentive and quick, and the food came out very quickly. In a swift 15 minutes, I went from the cold sidewalk of New York City, to a steaming hot, scrumptious. savory bowl of ramen. I had the Tan Tan and delicious would be an understatement. The cocktail of textures and flavors that overtook my taste buds, and for as long as it took me to slurp noodles and broth, I was happy. I highly recommend Nonono if you are in the area, you will not be disappointed.

Lunch selection is affordable and delicious, but their true claim to fame is the dinner menu, which has traditional yakitori offerings as well as unique tapas offerings like scallop uni carpaccio (highly recommend). Other delicious items to try: yuzukosho nori chicken, salmon tataki, chawan mushi, any of the sushi rolls, yaki mentaiko, and zuke maguro. Really everything we tried was amazing and we'll definitely be back for more. The tapas portions are small, so if you're planning to make a meal of them, the price can add up ($30-40/person), but I think it is worth it to try a greater variety of their small dish offerings instead of just going for a bowl of ramen.

Relatively spartan but nice inside. Food is really nice. I had a taw tun appetizer with garlic/jalapeños and spicy chicken ramen. I like spicy food and this was perfect. Seemed a little mild at first but had some good heat as you kept eating. Service was excellent.

Had for lunch today with a pal. House sake was very smooth. The Beef Karubi Don was seared just right with a perfectly made roasted baby tomatoes and onions. Everything was so good. 5 stars. Price for two was just over $40. Very reasonable! Will definitely go again.

This food here is good especially the short rib skewer. But the restaurant clearly isn't well prepared for so many customers coming at the same time. The waitress couldn't remember what we ordered. They either put the wrong dishes on the table or simply forgot to cook our orders. The whole meal took me about 2 hours. In the end, because the pos machine was broken and no atm on site, i had to go 2 blocks to get cash from atm and walked 2 blocks back to pay for it. Such horrible experience
Loved the wait list booking feature. The cocktail tasted so soothing with Shiso! Excellent food! Glad to come across this place! Will go back there again! Highly recommended!
Just amazing. One of my favorite spots in NYC. You chose your food from beautifully taken simple pictures, and never get disappointed. Also the beat corn I have ever eaten.

One of my favorites in NYC. Incredible flavor and interesting options. The setting is amazing too. One of the first restaurants I recommend to friends coming into town. It's also very affordable for the quality of the food. Not to say it's cheap, but I've paid significantly more for food that was of significantly less quality. Definitely a gem.

Abysmal service on an early Friday night. It seems they have dozens of servers who are constantly playing frogger only to still have subpar service. It was maddening. Literally a full Asian staff, which I'm a fan of, and unnecessary chaos, which I'm not, really left much to be desired. Also only place I've ever been too where the clientele is primarily of Asian descent and out of a full restaurant first floor I was the only black patron (who was getting shit service) seated next to a couple of unmannered white parents meeting their sons girlfriend (getting all the attention). Our waiter would constantly pour over them without so much attention while hardly giving my two person table a glass. Coincidence? Definitely not.
Really have no idea why it gets such a high score on Yelp...mediocre taste...just so so...
Love the attention and services very nice place for a sit down and chit chat drink are wonderful. I recomand basil (i believe spelling incorrect but must try ) the food is splendid very fasinating .

This is a fairly new yakitori place in midtown. The modern loft-like decor with the hanging bulbs is trendy and I like the open kitchen while not being smothered by bbq smoke. The place also has a bit of rustic feel from the purposefully (assuming) lack of painting and renovation. The food here is above average - certainly some dishes that are really tasty, particularly the beef tongue and chicken cartilage. Most of the meat are marinated well. Although I'm not sure I can justify the price for the food. But... it's midtown, they have rent to pay, so I get it.
Love it! Nonono has my favorite bbq skews, back cartilage and knee cartilage! Both are excellent.
Really nice restaurant. All dishes are more on the small bite side which allows you to try on more stuff.

Didn't love this place. The Yakitori was good. The mains were okay. The food was overall on the salty side. We asked for small plates but half of them were dirty. Toward the end of our meal the grill smoke got pretty significant, I think they need better ventilation. When I got home all my clothes smelled like bbq. I'm not entirely sure why this place was so packed.

I had the pleasure of dining here during one of their first weeks of opening. Everything here is displayed with the amount of detail and thought that you'd expect from a Japanese joint. Most of the space was left raw but the decor is charming. We ordered several plates as it's tapas style. Everything we had was delicious! From the yakitori to sushi to mashed potato. Some we liked more than others, some were entirely new and unique renditions of simple ingredients, but all good. The two cocktails that we tried were light and refreshing as well. A great hidden gem!

The food is so damn good. The design of this place is also super cute. You gotta try their their chicken yakitori series. I especially liked the ones with chicken bones. Get their ramen too! The spicy one was amazing.

I went on a friday night and no reservations were available. We used the yelp waitlist feature (first time) and while our actual wait time was much longer, it was helpful in that we were able to leave and grab drinks nearby while seeing live updates on where we were on the list. We had several kinds of yakitori, sushi roll, steak, and ramen (which wasn't spicy as we had hoped, but still delicious). I would skip the potato salad and shishito peppers next time, but all in all the food didn't disappoint and the service was great. Also recommend the matcha ice cream sandwich! I may not be back every wknd as it is on the pricier side, and leaves you hungry for a late night snack, but I would definitely recommend and will be back.
Yummy.  They use all the parts of the chicken to full effect.  The ramen + the yakitori make for a great satisfying meal.
Nonono when it's really yeahyeahyeah. Don't miss out,'this is exactly where you want to be

This place is officially my favourite izakaya in NYC! Food is so good here and so are the drinks. My friends and I came here for my birthday & we were not disappointed. We've tried many izakaya places in the past looking for the best one. The flavors here were unique and delicious. My friend who doesn't even eat raw fish ate almost all of the dishes that were raw. We got the scallop uni, soooooo creamy what a great combo! The beef carpaccio was also perfect we had to take one to go. We ordered the squid w rice inside, the squid was a bit rubbery/overcooked but that was the only thing that was not perfect. We got the salmon roe and salmon roll, not amazing but exactly what you would expect. I do wish they had salmon roe and salmon rice bowl instead. We also got a bunch of other dishes that were amazing but I can't remember them right now. Try the daikon beverage with the plum wine SOOO GOOD.
Cool atmosphere, especially for the area. We got some apps and the ramen. It was good, not super stand-out amazing, but good enough that I'm sure I'll be back!

This place was really a pleasant surprise. Food was so creative and so many great options. We couldn't choose because we wanted almost everything! Everything we tried was so yummy. The service was also amazing.
No comment
This place was absolutely delicious. Space is modern & fun, food was amazing. We brought our 3 kids and they easily found something on the menu that they loved. Highly recommend.
Foods taste incredible and being served fast. Staff were nice and friendly. Recommended.
Small portions but tasty skewers. Though not only limited to yakitori, many other options available. Cozy but very modern interior and good service

Delicious Japanese food. This place is also good for a late snack. I enjoyed everything I had. The service is good and fast. They were on it and top of their game. They were very hospitable and friendly.
My new favorite restaurant in the city. I used to love Mew Men and this is an incredible restaurant with great variety. Can't wait to come back !
I like the scallop uni appetizer! Also the atmosphere and decorations. Would go back and try sth else next time!

Pretty decent, cute place. We were able to get a table without reservations during the weekday by getting there early and sitting at the bar. The main food items were just okay in terms of flavor. But the main selling point was the desserts. We ordered every one they had, and they were SO incredibly delicious. I would come back just for the desserts.
Place has great ramen and sushi, we went exactly at opening with reservation and it filled almost immediately. I will go back

Friendly staff, and the food divine. Every dish has its own distinct flavor and presentation from the yakitori to the sushi to the fried rice. The best thing is that it has such a great variety of food to choose from that it's versatile for people with different flavor profiles
So good! The bathrooms are really nicely designed and everything is presented beautifully - especially the desserts!
Looks like a modern American influenced Japanese restaurant, but the taste is quite authentic.

Both the food and interior are beautifully curated, loved the plant details and the cute plates. There were many vegan/vegetarian friendly options (cocktails, cough, gin is vegan, cough) that were amazing. Definitely recommend the cucumber/mint and raspberry cocktails. You can also ask for things without toppings, as suggested by the waitress, if you don't want certain toppings/ sauce. So considerate. Definitely recommend nonono, everything is also very instagramable
Great prices and lots of delicious options all set in a really cool open, airy environment. Highly recommend for large groups and birthday dinners

I always like to bring friends and family here when they are visiting nyc because 1) i can never have enough of their food 2) their unique dishes never ceases to amaze my guests. The sushi with the egg yolk (saba oni on) and dragon ball are my absolute favorites. Their cauliflower ikura did not taste that special. Their beet and daikon drinks are amazing if you like sweet drinks.
I love the food here. And I love the service. We tried it last night and will def come again.
No comment

This place was highly recommended by a friend.  Took my friend there from out of town and all were disappointed.  Menu looks nices but food was really not that good.  Sushi was ok but the bbq skewers definitely was overrated.  We would not recomend ordering the ramen since both the soup and meat were not good at all.

We came here because of the rating but extremely disappointed. The food is very sweet and they put sweet or soy sauce in most of the courses. The yakitori is just average quality with a lot of sweet sauce on top of them. Order the pork with rice and noodle and it's overwhelming with lots of sauce. Very disappointed.

The worst dining experience ever - the waiter forgot about us, never checked on us for 45 minutes.  No food ever got delivered and when we brought it to their attention, they told us they forgot to put the order in and just said sorry.  We said we're leaving and they just told us ok and sorry - terrible service and would never return.  Don't ever sit upstairs and they don't care about repeating customers.

NoNoNo to this place! It's really sad b/c the food was okay the first time (yakitori isn't that hard to make) but I just left after waiting 45 minutes with no food or drink. I guess because we were sitting in the back, they forgot about us. When we mentioned politely that we hadn't gotten anything, it took them another 10 minutes to come check on us. The reason was because the waiter forgot to put the order in... there was no remorse, no effort to reach any resolution... in this area there are so many options. I have to wonder how long this place will even stay open. Tom Colicchio once said that ppl check out restos the first time for the food but come back for the service. Based on my experience today, I def won't be back and you shouldn't either. No wonder there was no wait both times I visited. Again... nonono to Nonono!
This is one of my favorite place to go in NYC. The Ambiance in this restaurant is extraordinary and the food is delicious.
Good place with good food and lot of menus to choose from highly recommend this place to other people. Prices are also reasonable and lot of pretty designs

Amazing food and fantastic experience! Cocktails had well-balanced flavors but still with a kick. Every dish was outstanding from the skewers to the small plates to the ramen. Our server was friendly, helpful and attentive. Service was timely but not rushed. A definite repeat.

Very delicious, not too salty Japanese fusion from a Japanese perspective.  The only reason why don't get 5 stars because they constantly rushed us and tried to get us to put in the entire order, even dessert, all at once because they were "soon closing."  We had a reservation, FYI- they will close the kitchen right when your reservation time starts!  So, beware and try for an easy reservation I guess. Service isn't great.
Awesome Japanese in an industrial chic environment.  Great lunch, limited menu but well worth it.

Though I didn't leave with a complete feeling of satisfaction after eating here.  They do serve fresh, creative meals at an expected price, for New York city, that I would recommend to anyone if in this neighborhood.
It's a solid option for the area. Nothing mind-blowing but everything is tasty. Wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.
Their food is a little overpriced for their quality but they have a good location in midtown so not complaining. Their ramens are pretty authentic and well made.
Came here with a friend visiting out of town. Everything was delicious. I loved the variety in menu and small plates.

Have been 3 times now and amazing food and consistency each time. Only complaint is the awkward waiting system. We arrived back in time for our check-in but still had to wait 1 hour. Luckily hostess was apologetic and provided us complimentary beers.

If you are able to get a reservation here, the food and cocktails are both excellent and reasonably priced. The daikon cocktail was highly original and the perfect start to a delicious meal. Yakitori highlights include the wings, meatball, chicken oysters, skirt meat + shishito and yuzukosho nori. The hamachi kama is expertly prepared, the crab fried rice hits all the best notes of home cooking and the crab croquettes are an indulgence that is totally worth it. The speed of service here is very fast so I recommend choosing a variety of single items up front and adding to your order once you've decided what you like.

First thing first, they have absolutely great taste in interior design. We went there on a disappointingly cold rainy day but the damp streets in NYC suddenly became poetic once we got inside the restaurant. Friendly staff, beautiful facilities. Our favorite is Chawanmushi which is so, so good. They also have the best sushi which we ordered several kinds of, super rich in flavor. Definitely would go back.

My boyfriend and I went here last night and it was so good!! It was nice how easy it was to get a seat on a Saturday night! We went around 7pm and only had to wait a few minutes--though the place was definitely busy so if you want to avoid a wait completely, it'd probably be wise to check/join the yelp waitlist before arriving, particularly if you have a big party. The vibe was young and hip, and the food was delicious! They have choices for everyone, adventurous or not. We ordered some skewers (chicken oyster, chicken thigh with yuzu kosho seaweed, beef tongue, chicken meatball, chicken gizzard), potato salad, the scallop and uni crudo, the beef tongue stew, marinated rice stuffed squid, and chicken wing gyoza--yeah, we eat a lot  most people around us ordered about half of what we did. Anyway, everything was so good! But our favorites were the beef tongue skewer (so flavorful and so tender!), and the chicken wing gyoza (stuffed wings are always so delish). This place is a great place to hang out and drink with friends while nomming on some delicious izakaya snacks. We will definitely be back!
Went here with a few friends the first time based on a recommendation and will go back again. The food is really good and the service is quick considering the quality of food that's served.
Has been walking past this place for a while now and decided to check it out - the food was delicious and prices were reasonable. What made the whole experience great was the service!

Came for dinner with a friend on a weekday and we didn't have reservations but they seated us pretty quickly. We ordered the Skirt steak and beef tongue skewers, fried chicken, liver pate, the steak with onion sauce, and the rainbow roll. The liver pate was my favorite, super smooth and buttery. I liked the beef tongue skewer more than the skirt steak. I didn't realize they dusted cheese on the rainbow roll, but it was still good. The steak with onion sauce and the fried chicken were okay.

The food, the service and quality of ingredients is exceptional for the price. very nice place, its a pity they dont have some more greener space or area with the garden, but its impossible due to the localisation. not a big variety of cocktails, but the one they have are amazing and pretty unique. definitely recommend and will visit again.
One of my favorite places. always feel so welcomed when I come here. Food and service is wonderful

Been here for lunch and dinner, and can't get enough of it. The dinner menu is far better than lunch--lunch menu is pretty limited, as is it's cocktail menu, and the dinner cocktails are super good. Honestly they do everything great here--good ramen, solid sushi, amazing small plates and yakitori.

Not that good. We got all kinds of adventurous things and they all turned out to be some variation of flavorless leather. We tried quite a few signature dishes along with that night's specials. Nothing was really worth paying money to eat. The environment also is very bright and uncomfortable, like no one is having a cozy conversation or exchanging comfort here.

Can't decide if this spot deserves a 3 or a 4. The ramen soup is delightful and 5 Stars. The service was slow however. It was a soft open so maybe that was why? I would try the other ramens on a revisit.
Everything i had was nice, but there was not a single dish I had left a memorable impression. The overall ambience was laid back and nice.

They were exceptionally rude, cancelled our reservation without notifying us, and then made us wait for a smaller table than what we asked for, making one of our group squish in against a wall where they could barely use their arms, and they wouldn't serve us drinks even though we had IDs with us. Our waiter was also aggressive and short with us, and on top of everything they included a 20% gratuity in our tip which we didn't want to pay but they wouldn't remove from the cheque. I've been here before, and the food is delicious, but it was completely undermined by the uncomfortable and at times hostile dining experience.
nonono is definitely yesyesyes in my books. Tastefully decorated and the menu is to die for. Seasoned just right without excess sauce. I would return in a blink of an eye.

I really wanted to like this place. I was a little thrown off by the etiquette. Everyone was attentive but something was kind of off about this place. The food wasn't mind blowing or memorable. The only thing I remember is that some of the seafood items tasted a little fishier than normal. Drinks we also really not good for the price. In general, for the price I paid...I expected a little more refinement. For one thing, 2 of the requested items were not available...I was told they ran out. I had a 5:30 dinner reservation, so it isn't like they made all of the items that evening. Then, I had ordered several sticks of yakitori and I ordered each meat in pairs. One of the pairs I ordered, the waiter told me that they only had enough to make one stick and I had to replace the 2nd item with another meat. I had wanted two of the same thing so my friend and I could taste the same items. I told him I'd like to replace that pair and he said he couldn't because he already put the order in. Like...okay. It seemed there was a disconnect with the kitchen and staff.

I was really looking forward to my meal at nonono and had booked it two weeks it advance. But it was meh kinda overrated. There are better yakitori places in the city and their cooked dishes were hit or miss. Cute space... nice vibe but I don't think I'll be back.
Limited lunch menu.  I didn't find anything too unique here, but it wasnt bad.  Good option if you're local, it's cold, and you dont feel like walking too far.

Great new spot in the neighborhood. Super excited about it. The whole menu appealed to me, so it was super hard to decide what to get. Favorites were grilled lettuce, squid, iron pork, scallops with uni, and the sorbet. We definitely will be back to try the ramen!

I work just across the street, so I walk by everyday. My coworker and I finally decided to try the ramen for lunch and I was blown away. One of the best bowls of ramen I've ever had. So much complexity, spice and flavor in one bowl. Came back with my fiance and now it's one of my go to sit down lunch spots.

Microscopic portion sizes for average tasting food. I understand that this restaurant is meant to have small dishes, but coming for dinner with my boyfriend and having 2 pieces of duck each was disappointing. The same goes for the rest of the dishes we tried. If you're hungry, please do not waste your time or money here.

Most of the individual items on the menu are good, but the place is quirky. The seats are not too comfortable. The lunch menu is extremely limited -- cannot get yakitori for lunch without shishito peppers, which I don't like. Some nice surprises include a tofu and avocado dish, and the tsukune (chicken meatball).

I have nothing to say. This place is like a heaven. Amazing snack style food, friendly employees and a very reasonable priced menu! Everything is in small portion so you can enjoy a large variety of dishes. I am planning to go back to try more sometime soon!
Amazing find.  The chicken broth is the best I ever had. The sashimi was outstanding and fresh. The grilled mushrooms were delicious. I can't wait to come back.
The quality of the food and decor is surpassed only by how amazing the staff is. Really can't recommend enough!

Such a great experience here. The service was excellent and the food was fabulous. There isn't that many option but everything is so good! It was valentines day and we received a goody bag with lots of candy and treats, such a sweet gesture. Also the vibe was great- we came back and I told everyone at work they need to try!!
Very good food and service. I want to come there often! I bring a baby every time. The employees are kindness for my baby!

We really enjoyed our dinner and the food was very good. We ordered several dishes and they were all simply delicious. We went early and the restaurant filled quickly with other diners. Plenty of other people enjoy this restaurant's take on trendy Japanese food, too. Just a small thing, but we didn't get the happy hour pricing on a beer that we ordered.
The grill is absolutely amazing, the beef tongue and rib have heavenly taste, super thick and juices. The chick is also top notch too ～

So delicious! The steak with onion sauce was amazing, and my fiance loved the basil cocktail. very friendly service and nice restrooms. we got two larger dishes and 3 yakitori each and it was a good amount of food.

Huge mix of small plates.  Overwhelming selection. Waiter seemed unfamiliar with the menu. Would love to recommend dishes but plates came in such a frantic and unstaggered manner, I can only say we enjoyed some, and some missed.  Skip mushrooms ( no taste), and salmon too much fishy taste. Wings better everywhere else.  On second thought skip overall.

This is probably one of the best Japanese restaurants in New York city. They have various menu of Yakitory, small platters, and cocktails.. especially their plating was so fabulous. Their staffs were friendly and well known about their menu. Delicious food, good mood, and reasonable price! If you are looking for fancy restaurants, Nonono is the one.
Quite enjoyed this place. Simple and good. I've come here 3 times in the last 2 weeks.

Servers are attentive, but Size of meals are smaller than expected, calls a plate 18cm in diameter a larger option. Very zealous for aesthetics. Would not recommend for a meal to fill you up but a meal to brag that you have money
lunch is mostly set menus, picking between ramen or udon. the ramen's pretty dope, i def plan to return for dinner izakaya.

Good happy hour and really scrumptious food. Had a bit of everything, standouts were the eel skewer, egg skewer and squid stuffed with sushi rice. The restaurant's aesthetic is beautiful without seeming to try too hard. Will definitely be back.

I had such a great time here with my friends. They have an absolutely modern and beautiful interior design. Table setting which is an important feature on first impression, was neat and clear as well as every dishes. Me and my friends ordered some cocktails that is named by its main ingredient. That made me easy to decide what to get. Ordered some yakitori along with ramen and other side dishes. Generally everything was nice, for me, the ramen and the side dish of tomato with soy sauce was amazing. Those two are the must try besides yakitori. Finally desserts. We got water drop mochi?(sorry i forgot what its called) and yuzu sorbet. I think the water drop dessert is worth trying, but I liked the sorbet better. I only got to try the "good yakitori places" in east village where the servers are pushy to customers, but you dont have to worry about those here. I would definitely come back to this place. It was an amazing experience and i loved it.
i have never had such tender chicken thighs. beautiful ambience, great service and fantastic food!

Friendly service. Great that you can make a reservation. The Yakitori is really good. We stick to that tonight. The skirt steak with shisito, meatball, and corn. Reasonably priced - not cheap, but ate well and didn't feel like we were charged too much. Will definitely return.

The food was pretty good. The order of how you eat the food really matters. We ordered one of the steaks, which was delicious and super savory, but after taking a bite of that the other dishes we had tasted really bland in comparison. This was the second time I went to this restaurant. The first time twenty minutes after seating us, the kitchen stopped working. They gave us "free beer" cards and told us we could use them on any of the drinks in the menu, not just beer. So we went back two weeks later and tried ordering other drinks and were told we couldn't. We even explained that it was from when the kitchen stopped working. I would have expected better service from a restaurant who's owners own other restaurants around the city.

Came here with some friends and absolutely loved this place! We tried almost all the skewers, tried a few small plates and finished our night with ramen. The food, drinks and service were all awesome!

Omg what?? Did I die and go to food heaven? This is the bestttt Japanese my boyfriend and I have ever had. The restaurant seated us right away even though we didn't have a reso (tbf we came to dinner at 615pm). It's clean and modern and minimalist. The menu looks amazing but we had to choose and I stand by our choices. I had the cucumber cocktail (bf had a beer) and we ordered pork (no. 5), short rib (no. 1), squid with butter sauce (amaaaazing), noodle and rice dish with pork and omelet, and the pork ramen. We did not need that ramen but good money couldn't have made me stay away from it. We also ordered a great sesame dessert. I'm in awe. The bill was $80 and waaaay cheaper than we expected (he guessed $110 and I said $90). This is a steal by any standard but coming from DC, we were so pleasantly surprised by how cheap dinner was. Love this place and will be back next time we are in the city!
My wife and I ate there on Monday, 27 December when we were looking for a nice lunch. Everything was excellent. The Tortilla Soup was great as were the tacos. Highly recommend it.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Perfectly located in the theatre district, especially close to the theaters in the high '40s and low '50s, this is a main draw. Additionally, the menu truly has something to satisfy every Mexican food craving from tacos to bowls. I ordered the shrimp bowl over rice, which had a generous serving of fish and a tasty sauce topping all. Margaritas hit the mark and, overall, was a perfect pre-show meal.

I was between 3-4 stars, but the great service pushed it upward. I ordered takeaway for a few people and the staff were super helpful. The order was ready quickly and packaged nicely into a to-go bag. The place itself is super cute and has a tiki bar feel. The drinks looked nice, but I wasn't able to try one. It is very convenient to Central Park where I was meeting up with others. The burritos themselves were ok. Constructed well to keep everything from falling apart, but we found them to be a little dry. We did enjoy the green salsa that comes with the chips. If I am in the neighborhood I'd give them a second try to see if a different order is better.
Ordered online for a quick carry out. Great food great service nice people. Loved it!
No comment
Delightful, patio - delish bowl. Simple yet delicious! I had a spicy margarita and a bowl with wild mushrooms, very satisfying!

Really friendly service, but my burrito was $14, pretty small, more than half rice, and the non-rice fillings weren't that great (chicken). Maybe other stuff is better, but I'd never get another burrito from here again.
Luv their tacos,  good cocktails and best is their customer services is spit on. Very friendly. Thanks for making my lunch enjoyable!
No comment

Great Mexican food!! Food wasn't heavy but filling. The appetizer, guacamole, was super good. Drinks were great. They had a variety of salsas from mild to crazy spicy. Enjoyed it right before the show! 2 thumbs up!!

It is hard to find a decently priced place for lunch near MOMA.  Azule Cantina was great. I had a burrito bowl with chicken. Portion was very generous and well seasoned. Highly recommend this place. Get

Azule Cantina is the place to be! The bartender Jocelyn (she works closing) makes the best drinks and her costumer service is amazing! The food is great also, my favorites are the nachos and the quesadillas! Definitely a must try!
The service is amazing everybody is so nice. The food is amazing. The atmosphere is amazing very beachy the prices are amazing. If you are looking for a fun and good place to eat try this place
Tasty rice in the bowls that has some citrus in it. Good price point for the neighborhood.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The price is right here The perfect hole in the wall, small, local business place to grab food on the go. It's perfect for a quick lunch during work days  , especially if you're trying to eat healthy, fresh food without breaking the bank. It's Korean Japanese fusion, so I would say their yummy sticks / sushi burritos are a combination of kimbap and sushi - in the form of a burrito of course. I need to try the other items on their menu, such as the udon, next! Sometimes there is a small line but the service is really quick and always friendly. I'm so glad I found this place.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Cheap, delicious, and filling food. I got the original yummy roll, shumai, and chicken teriyaki. I couldn't finish everything all at once because the roll was already so filling! The original yummy roll was delicious and filling was flavorful, but the rice could have been seasoned more. Chicken teriyaki was cheap and delicious. I love coming back here for a quick lunch!
No comment
The food is just as lovely as the couple who runs this lil establishment. The food is always fresh and delicious! A go to lunch spot with an incredible bargain
No comment
No comment
No comment
It's literally a hole in the wall. Filled with a cute Korean family cooking these kimbap x sushi esque burritos. It's quick, cheap and delicious.
Love this place. The sushi burrito was very cheap and good. The mom and pop shop is super cute and small. Would recommend for a quick bite.
Do it! Finally stopped by Yummy Stick. Got the Shrimp Tempura. Tasted like sushi burrito heaven. Super filling as well.
Was intrigued by this literal whole in a wall.  Basically is an uncut sushi roll that is served warm. Was a great quick lunch on the go as I ordered 2 for only $12!!!!!
No comment

Spotted this place after searching for something to eat in manhattan for lunch. After looking, I wanted to order everything but, we decided to order 4. It was definitely worth the price and did not regret a single one. We didn't really use the soy sauce provided besides dipping it for the salmon and avocado because the flavor was great without it. The fact that the store was a small family store made it even better. Will definitely try to make the travel to come back and order the rest of the menu.
Truly the best ever, love this place and the lady that works the counter. Shrimp tempura yummy stick is unreal
No comment
This tiny mom and pop shop is amazing.. the service is fast and the lady that takes the order is soo sweet... the sushi burritos are to stay for... great place for a standup lunch
No comment

Great little spot to grab lunch from. Prices are low and the food is tasty. Shrimp yummy stick and ninja yummy stick (special) were both wonderful. Will be back for a tempura stick soon! Consider stopping by and supporting this tiny hole in the wall place.

I love this place so much. The owners are so nice and welcoming and the yummy sticks are delicious. Get two if you're super hungry--they're that good. Every time I'm in the area, I need to swing by to get a spicy tuna yummy stick.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Definition of hole-in-the-wall, super fast and friendly service. I had to try the original yummy stick and it did not disappoint. I will definitely be coming back to this spot and recommend it to anyone visiting or living in the area

Spot is a gem. Never heard of it before (don't live in the area) but was swayed while walking past based solely on the good vibe of his tiny setup. Been back three times since. Owner is genuinely friendly and sweet and you can taste it in the rolls. Go support him and his family. Love Maru 2, it's now one of my favorite to-go places in the city. This isn't a corny and soulless sushi burrito spot, just homey uncut rolls made with love. Get the Ninja Stick.
No comment
Very cheap and inspired. Fast too. The spicy tuna yummy stick was great. Lots of options for 5-6 bucks incl. chicken teriyaki over rice for 5 bucks.
No comment

Love this little place. It was a wonderful experience. Every thing that we purchased was really fresh and tasty. Workers are super helpful and service is very swift. I'll definitely be back to try some other things.
No comment
My favorite sushi spot nearby! The sushi burritos are delicious and easy to get as takeout. The owner is incredibly kind to customers and a pleasure to interact with. 10/10 recommend. Hidden gem!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I ordered delivery from this place. Ordered through grubhub. Tried calling then 10 times to make a small change on the order but no one picked up. The food was prepared very late too. It took them an hour to prepare the food and was delivered to be 10 minutes after that. So I totally blame it on their service. The rolls were good.

Five dollars for phenomenal food. Great amount. Great taste. Great people! So welcoming, and speedy. Can't believe I haven't been there in a year, miss is so much, used to come here at LEAST three times a week.
No comment

Maru is a decent enough place to stop by on a lunch break, but given all the other food options in the area, I wouldn't say it's going to make my list of regular places. The prices aren't high, but when you begin adding things to your order, it comes out to the price of any other fast-casual lunch place. The sushi rolls are fine, but the rice isn't fresh (though I guess you can't expect too much from a casual place like this). The udon was also fine, but tasted almost like it came out of some sort of instant udon packaging. It satisfied my craving, but is not high on my list of good, casual Japanese lunch places.
Love this place. Excellent and inexpensive salmon yummy stick. Love the owner who is the nicest man in the entire world.
No comment
Tiny hole in the wall with the friendliest owner! No frills mini sushi burrito spot with really fresh food.
