If you don't like Thep, you're unqualified to eat incredible food. Between the service, the atmosphere and the food, Thep provides an ultimate dining experience. My favorite thing on the menu is the sweet potato pad thai - it's light, flavorful and you almost forget that you're eating sweet potato noodles! The peanut dumplings are also incredible and the crab fried rice (served in an edible coconut) is also decadent. Thep is walk-in only so be sure to go on the earlier side on a week night!
No comment

It seems like the UES is flooded with Thai restaurants but this one is my favourite so far! We ordered the chicken satay and papaya salad to start and both exceeded my expectations, especially the papaya salad which was surprisingly not sweet and rather spicy (delicious! A must get). For mains, we ordered the drunken noodle, pad thai and massaman curry with avocado. All were good, although felt pretty standard but still highly recommend. The avocado was a bit lost in the curry but it kind of worked! Our server was Pim and she had great recommendations :)

Maybe I am being too harsh because I have had better food at lesser-known places in my suburb and much better food at Sala Thai, which is basically on the West side of the same street. The menu looked enticing and beautiful, so we prepared ourselves to be wowed. The food was decent, but I would not call it great, not something I would come back for. The chicken satay was a bit on a dry side, it tasted as though the marinade has not seeped fully through the meat. The short rib udon tasted very bland. The shrimp curry was Ok, again, not out of the park. The service was nice. Overall, if you happen to be in the area like we were and craving Thai food like we were, this is not a bad spot, but I would not make a special trip (and I have done it with other places).
If you need Thai in the UES, Thep is a great spot. However it's more about the ambiance/decor, whereas the food is above average, but there's better Thai in lower Manhattan for sure.
Cute interior and yummy food. Order the appetizers - the kra-pow puffs were delicious!

Absolutely LOVE this place.  Vegan options are amazing.  I can't wait to go back.  The Avocado Massaman  is calling me.  Peanut sauce was good too.  My husband had the cashew dish and that was amazing as well.
Amazing Thai food. My go to spot for Thai food in NY. We ordered the drunken noodles and pad Thai. It was delivered quickly, tasted so fresh and was still hot.
Park mor and sugar crane shrimp-- tastes like meat! Ice tea is also good. Decor is also lovely!
No comment

Great atmosphere and was seating fast with the yelp wait list. Food is fresh, plentiful, and tasted like authentic Thai food. Server kept us entertained and suggested the most popular on the menu as well as his personal favorite. Definitely coming back
We were a group of 6, everyone's food was delicious. Only negative was the food didn't come out together for everyone. Two people were staring at their plate waiting for the others.
Absolutely phenomenal thai with fantastic private outdoor seating suited for warm and cold weather. The food is some of the best in the UES and its our consistent go to aocial

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: THEP is a beautiful looking restaurant with a delicious Thai Iced Tea!!! Looking forward to coming back here for a nice, NYC-affordable meal with friends :)

Enjoyed an early Thai dinner after a walk in the park. We had the spring rolls and edamame as an appetizer and vegetable and chicken Pad Thai for dinner. Everything was delicious! We sat in the indoor patio during a warmer winter night and were very comfortable. The sodas were great - quality fountain soda. Definitely recommend if looking for some delicious Thai food!
Went here for lunch, we had the shrimp pad Thai and the red curry with chicken, very delicious! Great outdoor seating option as well. Lovely experience, will come again!
The food and decor were fun, but not that tasty. All the dishes were presented very well, but it didn't taste so authentic. Felt like it was a bit overpriced as well

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: The food was so good and the drinks were strong! Such a great place that accommodated my larger group of 7. Definitely recommend if you are on the upper east side in search on a good Thai place. Staff was nice, food was good, drinks were good.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Absolutely amazing. Fantastic service, beautiful environment, and most importantly; great food! They had classics I expected that were elevated and played gorgeously. More impressively they had some dishes I'd never heard of that were delightful to try. I know there are a lot of options out there but this place should not be missed. What a joy.

This place is soo cute! The ambiance is very modern and perfect for date night or just hanging with friends. The food is delicious too! We got a bunch of appetizers which were all good & we got shrimp pineapple fried rice as our main course which came in an actual carved out pineapple and it was delicious. Staff was friendly and service was quick. Would definitely go back!
If I am eating Thai on the UES this is where I go. It is very good and the decor is delightful. I recommend the pork belly in the clay pot

If you wanna wait for 40 mins for a table only to be offered a terrible table sitting with other people, go here. If you tell them you don't like the table, they tell you - wait another 40 mins for another one. The host was terribly rude, the staff were too busy to care. Restaurants like this should not even be in business. Go somewhere else. There are other Thai restaurants just around the corner, UpThai and Bua Thai have better service and food!
Great flavors, huge portions, really nice service. Make sure to make a rez, line can be pretty long on prime nights.

I've been to many Thai restaurants in NYC and THEP is definitely among the best of them. We arrived at around noon when it just opened and got seated right away. However, the restaurant got pretty packed by the time we left at 1:30 pm. We got the THEP wing for appetizer. The sauce is really good, like a sweet chili with Thai herbs. Most of the wings are cooked well but one of them was a little raw close to the bone. The short rib Massaman curry was my favorite - sweet and tangy with a little spice, not as rich as other curries so easy to eat. The curry sauce came with onions, scallions, sweet potatoes, and peanuts, all of which I loved. The short rib was cooked well and super tender but was a little cold when it came as if it had been sitting out for a bit. The Kee Mao noodles were also good and did come with a lot of veggies. Our server asked if we want spicy (there wasn't a 1-5 level), we said yes, and it was TRULY spicy. We loved it but definitely check with the server if you have a lower tolerance. Overall a very pleasant dining experience and I definitely see myself coming back to try more dishes real soon.

This place has great Thai food. We tried the appetizer platter which was really good, it's good for two people. Ambiance was nice and they have air conditioning in the outdoor dining construction. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

The food and the ambience and the location here is great . I got the shrimp pad thai and it was full of flavor and delicious. SJ gave great and amazing service. If you have a thai food craving definitely come here !!!!
Very beautiful atmosphere and decor! Loved how fast the server was able to serve my party of 8. The ambiance was not too noisy, very welcoming, and eye-catching when you first walk by the restaurant

I've been to this spot several times since moving to the area and it's always been so delicious. I love taking guests here from out of town. The Tom Kha soup is a MUST TRY appetizer, I love it with tofu but the shrimp option is also great. Their drinks are also fantastic, I could recommend any of them.

Stumbled upon this place randomly on Yelp and was intrigued to try their duck panang curry. Also ordered the crab rangoons. Appetizer came out quickly - it was crispy and creamy! Highly recommend the duck panang curry - flavor was a good balance between sweet, spicy, and savory.

I am from LA and based on the previous reviews; they intrigued my friend and I to come and visit. We ordered the crab rangoons and panang curry with seared duck. Both dishes were very delicious and highly recommend locals and tourists to stop by and eat!

Walked into this gem on a busy Friday night & the service was fast, the food was hot & super tasty! I ordered appetizers & an entree & both servings were generous. I definitely will return & totally recommend!
Food was delicious! Got seated quickly and food was brought out in a timely manner. 10/10 recommend
Thep Thai is a paradise! Ive had the Thai-me of my life. I ordered spring rolls, fried rice, pad Thai and curry! Nuff said!
No comment
No comment
Be sure to get the chive pancake appetizer! Not only is it tasty, it's also the perfect shape for dipping in the sauce.
Great food and service!! Highly recommend the sampler platter! Beautiful ambiance and really cool outdoor seating with A/C summer.
Everything taste great. We love the crab dish the most. It's refreshing for the summer!

The restaurant itself is absolutely beautiful- great ambiance and perfect for a date night. I got the Clay Pot and my friend got the sweet potato pad Thai and both were tasty but nothing mind blowing. All in all I would come again.
No comment
Nice Thai spot on the UES! The staffs here are really nice, I ordered the Drunken Noodle and really enjoyed it!
No comment
Amazing spot!! The service was incredible and the food was amazing in taste and presentation!! Will be coming back!
The atmosphere is top notch! The aesthetic of the place is really great. Great choice for food and spending time with friends. :)

AMAZING THAI FOOD. BEST PAD THAI IVE EVER HAD! for sure coming back tomorrow! And probably every day this week! Now that I'm thinking about it everyday for the rest of the year. Maybe ever 2 years. The worlds my oyster.
Food was good! Get the masaman curry. Outdoor seating was nice and intimate, cozy with the heat lamps. Got seated quick, and they came to check a few times.
Very good and tasty. I Recommend the pork clay pot from their menu. They give a good amount and service is very good

I ordered the spicy udon noodle with shrimp and it did not disappoint at all. Would recommend this dish to those who enjoy spicy food! Service was efficient and friendly. Would definitely come back to try something else on the menu in the future!
Food is exceptional. Servers friendly and helpful and ambience is just right. Free Thai iced tea with review!

column3: Sant Pere, Santa Caterina i la Ribera-Born, Barcelona, Spain
column6: The food all looks great and the flavor was amazing. The portions are also really big so I couldn't completely finish mine but it was really flavorful. I got the KHAO SOI and it was a really well made dish. And the Thai iced tea was really refreshing as well. Overall an amazing place to eat. :)
No comment
No comment
No comment

Favorite Thai in this neighborhood.  E auto Gil inside, and now beautiful patio dining as well.  Avocado Musslman Chicken, nice flavor of peanuts and curry, is my all time favorite Thai. Perfectly accompanied with a Singha beer.
No comment

The Tom Yum is to dieeee for! Get the large and it shares 3-4 very nicely, especially if you plan to eat another dish on your own. I then got the Penang curry, medium spicy. Perfect spice for people who doesn't want to sweat bullets and absolutely savory and sweet! I love the little private rooms outside as well because it makes the experience more intimate. Today they are playing house music so it makes you feel like you are at a club!  so random, but so nice!
Very nice interior! we are able to get appetizers and drinks at the bar. Great service and food

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Great food great vibes. Always one of our favorite places to go! Highly recommend Thep!
No comment

First time at THEP and I will definitely be back! BEST spring rolls I have ever had- not at all greasy and perfectly delicious. Pork buns - the sauce on them was spectacular. The drunken noodle was yummy and just the right spice. The shrimp pineapple fried rice was amazing and chockful of shrimp- I'm talking 6 big beautifully cooked shrimp. Yum.
No comment
Delicious food and great service. Would go back again. We got the appetizer platter and multiple mains and all good.
Nice outdoor seating area with nice food. We ordered calamari, which is crispy and fresh. The crab fried rice and pad Thai are both delicious.
I could say it's one of best Thai places in nyc!!! Papaya salad and lobster dish is excellent!!
Second time to come here, miss their fired shrimp dumplings and avocado curry with chicken

A good time was had at THEP! The mixed seafood pad thai was yummy which included shrimp and squid. They weren't overcooked at all and the noodles were coated w just the right amount of sauce. Atmostphere inside and outside were beautiful and relaxing. Highly recommend THEP if you're in the area.

Loved the ambiance and decorations. Hard to have conversations due to loudness, though. Thep platter was great to try many apps - great for groups. Portion sizes looked small but was very full and satisfied at the end. Crab rangoons had very little crab. Tom kha soup was creamy and Tom Kim was sour but tasty. Both worth trying. The duck was very tender when warm, make sure to eat it before it cools. The sauce was very unique. Drunken noodles have a perfect balance of spice and savory. Thai iced tea was a light and great addition. Basil fried rice had a tinge of sweet for a relieving bite after the other dishes. Would recommend!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
Perfect for COVID times - outdoor patio seating with heater and great food. Thai iced tea was lovely too.
Great food, excellent service, and the iced coffee was stope the show. Highly recommended if you're in the area.

The food and service was incredible BUT the waiting process was really confusing and annoying. Overall, think was worth it for the great food and ambiance, but I would not recommend if you are impatient!
No comment

I work in the nearby area, and ordered the sausage fried rice and added vegetables to it for lunch! It was delicious! The sausage meat reminded me of Chinese sausage but even juicier and softer! I have no idea how they get the rice to be pink, probably food coloring? It still tasted amazing. A bit on the pricey side but it was a great comfort food dish for a long day of work. I've also had their pad Thai here before which was solid. But will definitely be ordering this dish again!
The food here is amazing. Perfect duck breast, really flavorful. I ordered the Graeng Phed Ped Yang, which comes with rice. It's not too spicy and is rich and creamy.
No comment

I love coming here and also ordering takeout. The ambiance is wonderful and they have plenty of outdoor seating. I generally order the noodles and the curries and they are always served quickly and delicious. Great spot to visit on the upper East side!

The food here is really good, tasty, good size and fair price. We have tried so far: the pineapple fried rice, lychee iced tea, pad Thai, Tom kha, fried calamari, cashew king (wok) and the pork belly buns. Everything was on point except for the duck on the pad Thai that was too dry for my taste and not as flavorful. They don't take reservations so be prepare to wait or arrive early. Decor inside is very cozy and the staff is friendly.
Great food in an excellent indoor outdoor set up.... As other have stated quality food , fresh ingredients and hard to be beat. Just go if you haven't !
Great food, good service, and nice decor (jungle and light design). Seating subside and out. Follows covid refs. Overall, really nice night out.
The food and ambiance can't be missed!! Great and innovative menu with a lot of vegetarian options!!
Amazing food! Great ambiance, the outdoor setup is so cute! The pork chop and pad see ew is my favorite.
The food is really good here! I ordered tom yum soup with shrimp and a garlic sauce dish with seafood. Tasty!
Thai ice tea is very good! very creamy and not so sweet! This place has nice environment, the food is good!

Found this place via Yelp,  beautiful indoor and outdoor dining area. Staffs are very friendly and efficient. Dishes are beautifully presented and tasty although we would like the sauces a bit less sour and less sweet. A good find overall.

The staff here are so friendly and accommodating -- they went above and beyond to help me with distanced outdoor seating for our group of four. The food is delicious and came out quickly. Love the decor and clean bathroom too.

Perfect spot for lunch after a morning at the MET. The abundant outdoor seating was spacious and airy, but still kept us dry on a rainy day. I enjoyed the sweet potato pad Thai made with sweet potato noodles. Would come again!
Stumbled upon this adorable Thai restaurant today!! Had pad Thai and steamed pork buns. It was so good! The staff was pleasant and the atmosphere was astounding!!!
Taste good, we had nice time here. It's near to the MET, very convenient. We order the papaya salad, pineapple fried rice. Tom yum, chicken curry

Great food with a great ambiance!. Perfect for a date or meeting up with friends. The food is delicious every time! The staff was so accommodating and kind. This is one of my absolute favorite spots in the city!
Servers and service was great. Atmosphere super cute. Peanut dumpling were super delicious (and it's purple) the pad Kee mao was flavorful as well.
Great outdoor patio with sun and plants, thai ice tea was refreshing, but food could be improved, my basil stir fry was over-sauced.
it was disgusting.  it wasn't fresh, not authentic and I didn't feel well.  I threw most of it out.
No comment
No comment

Delicious food, beautiful presentation, perfect ambiance, and good service. It doesn't get better than this. Calamari was delicious, sample platter gave a taste of all things yummy, the drunken noodles were delicious. We're coming back for sure!
Wonderful service! Seated quickly and order was taken fast as well. Super packed even on a Tuesday night. Ordered mixed seafood basil fried rice - flavorful and delicious. Can't wait to come back.
The food was excellent! I got the drunken noodles and they were tasty with a little kick. Cocktails were fun and refreshing too.
No comment
Very cute atmosphere and great food. The fresh garden rolls are very well presented and filled with crunchy vegetables. The chicken wings are also really great.

I've lived in the city my whole life, lived in Thailand for 2 months. Love Thai food. This is the best Thai place I've been to since I went to Thailand 10+ years ago. Don't miss this place. Great ambiance, service, food, and staff. Definitely coming back soon.
I love the selection here and location. Great spot, I love their pad see ew, also the thep platter is to die for

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: LOVE. Always an up beat but casual atmosphere, allergen/vegan/gf accommodating, and absolutely delish food! Plus fun drinks and fast service!
I love the cute decorations! The food is amazing, especially the panang curry, the pineapple fried rice, and the pad thai.
Sat on the balcony. Great ambiance, great service, even better food. 10/10 would recommend.
No comment

Came here for lunch today and sat outside on the deck. It was beautifully decorated- very cute date spot. We ordered Khao Soi and Chicken Siamese fried rice for lunch! Both were very flavorful and filling. Will definitely be back!

Recommended by a friend and came in at a Saturday afternoon for a early dinner....Love the vibe at the restaurant....ordered the THEP platter, pineapple friend friend and avocado curry...everything was great and we would definitely come back again...
Good food good vibe! Very friendly staff! Beautiful interior. Me and my friend god pad see yew and drunken noodle. They were both very good
The ambiance of the place is amazing! A great spot for a date with the setting of flowers is beautiful. The pork buns were really good!

Very prompt service and friendly staff. Got sat in a perfect outdoor spot upon arrival although we were 15 minutes late from the Wait List time. Really enjoyed the appetizer platter with the variety of nibbles and sauces. The chive pancakes and spring rolls were especially delicious. The fried branzino bites were perfectly cooked and the sweet potato pad Thai is full of flavorful tofu which I enjoyed..
No comment
Great for takeout. Extremely fast and consistent. First time dining in, ordered lemongrass porkchop
So delicious and the atmosphere is lovely. The staff is warm and welcoming and the drunken noodle was terrific.
Awesome place! Highly recommend! Iced Thai tea were great. We got both pad Thai and pork buns and they were delicious
No comment
Tasty pad Thai! Get the shrimp. Also love the Tom yum soup. Perfect on a cold day. If you can, get the outdoor seating.
Amazing Thai food and incredible ambiance. They have many different items to try that you wouldn't find on most nyc Thai restaurants. Definitely stop by.

Dropped by on 4/10/2022 and fell in love with the food and service. Gets pretty packed but they have multiple outdoor semi-insulated wooden spaces for parties of 2-6. Once you place your order, the food arrives in under 10-15 minutes. I ordered the sweet potato pad thai and added chicken for an additional $3.00. Portions are huge, chicken was well cooked. My partner ordered the chicken pineapple fried rice, which was served in a pineapple. They're great with presentation of their food and decor looks good. Their thai iced tea is also great (you get a free drink if you write a review). Overall, I recommend the place. Well seasoned food. Quick service. Nice ambiance. Will be back.
Excellent food, great service and pleasant ambiance , can get crowded in the weekends and nights, hugely popular place
No comment
Love the food and ambiance! We ordered the duck salad and the crab fried rice. Both are really yummy
No comment
Very quiet and authentic place. Great service and food. Definitely coming back for soups and salads
No comment

This place is so amazing! Authentic Thai food made right! The starters and the thep bites were so delicious! I ordered so much I thought it was my meal alone. The ribs were soaking in this sweet curry sauce that was out of this world crazy good. Falling off the bone meat. I would so come back here! The rice berry rice was a bit dry, but all the curry sauce made up for it.  Love this place!
No comment
Great atmosphere, refreshing Thai iced tea, delicious food!Khao Soi dish was very nice from Chiangmai. Crispy calamari's very fresh. Full stocked bar.

The appetizer sampler was a great variety and presentation. The pad Thai was the perfect texture and taste. The Tom Kha was creamy and not too heavy. This was some of the best Thai food I've ever had (and I've been to Thailand)! There's a heated outdoor section with beautiful flower and light decor at the top. Would definitely be back!
No comment

Cute restaurant with chill vibes. Went here with my family and every dish was delicious!  I got the drunken noodles and they were able to adjust the spice level since I have a low spice tolerance. Staff was super friendly! Overall, great experience, so we'll definitely be back.
Love the pad kee mao here, always a staple! The ambience is also perfect with pretty flowers everywhere.

Pretty good food, definitely better Thai food near here. I've come here a handful of times but still  would not call it the best place for Thai. The drunken noodles are yummy but the pad Thai is very sweet and a little mushy. Not bad if you're looking for good decor and appetizers though. Also the Thai Iced Coffee is really good!
we love our drinks and we love thep thai!! this restaurant is a neighborhood favorite of ours and we keep coming back. staff is excellent, attentive and the food is delicious!
No comment
Amazing place! Khao Soi was delicious and the mild spicy is truly mild! The sweet potato pad Thai was unique and very filling. Decor and ambiance were both great! Fast service. Overall a must try!
Atmosphere is beautiful! Perfect date spot. We ordered the platter, pad tai, and the drunken noodle. We were looking for tai food for lunch and this but the spot.

THEP had amazing food and ambiance. Very friendly and prompt service. I ordered the THEP platter for my appetizer and the pork belly clay pot rice for my entree. Both were very good. Will definitely be back.
Very nice food, especially the thep wing and pad Thai. The source of thep wing is really good. Highly recommend.
Love the interior, ambiance, drinks and food! Everything was very tasty and delicious!

The food was so good and the drinks were strong! Such a great place that accommodated my larger group of 7. Definitely recommend if you are on the upper east side in search on a good Thai place. Staff was nice, food was good, drinks were good.
Beautiful decor. Great food. Will return. Great service. Upper east side. Nice for lunch
Great food and ambience. We picked up and the place looked packed. Would definitely recommend for family and dates.
Incredible Thai. Favorite Thai spot in NY. Pad Thai and drunken noodles were delicious. Was delivered fresh and hot!
Loved the food , ambience , and their service were great! Ordered the golden sachet, tom yum soup, and pineapple fried rice. All had complex flavors but was well balanced.
Great ambiance, food and service. Really appreciated the chicken pastry puffs, green curry and Thai ice tea
No comment
One of my favorite Thai places in the city. The food tastes fresh, authentic, and delicious. I always get Thai spicy and it's actually really spicy but flavor profile is still good.
Atmosphere was so beautiful. Pad Thai is great  had a fun cousin date here, I like how they have screens over the tables great social distancing
Love the unique decor. Amazing vibes with excellent friendly service. Delicious foods and pretty drinks.

The restaurant was really good and has a wonderful atmosphere. The setting is amazing and absolutely fantastic. The food is unique with great Thai food. Everything is so good and unique. I had the Pineapple fried rice, Khao Soi, and Drunken Noodles which taste really delicious. The food portion is reasonable great and pricey as well. Fantastic service!
No comment
The experience was great, but the food did not taste good. I got the branzino and it was just not up to par, seasoning was so off and I barely ate any of it. My partner liked their dish though!
No comment
Excellent food and drinks! Nice atmosphere, friendly staff. Definitely a neighborhood favorite

The Thep combination platter for appetizers was a good combination of the different types of appetizers offered. We ordered two dishes and one came out room temperature. They did take it back to warm it up some. Overall the food was okay.
No comment

The outdoor seating had cute hanging plant decorations. The tables and chairs can be a bit tight. The serving dishes are pretty. I got the fresh roll which had a finely cut variety of vegetables with a yummy savory peanut sauce. I personally don't like when sauce is too sweet. I got the Tom Yum noodle soup with tofu. It was tasty and tangy with the flavor soaked into the tofu.

The interior of this place is so freaking gorgeous and aesthetic, amazing for photos ;) and the food is awesome as well. I got the crispy calamari (which was small in portion but very unique flavoring), green curry and pad kee mao which tasted amazing as well but a tad bit spicy but over all an amazing place worth the try!!!
Great food, fast and pleasant service. I've been here many times and you can be made to feel as though you're being rushed to eat and leave. That's the only major downside.
No comment

column3: Eastern Shores, North Miami Beach, FL
column6: No comment
No comment
Great atmosphere all around! Quick seating and lovely staff. Delicious food and drinks, especially the Thai iced tea. Great for a night out with friends!

This is a very popular Thai place with nice decor in the neighborhood. We loved the Crab Rangoon and Pad Thai. Cashew King was just okay. Our waitress was very nice and accommodating! We will come back and try more dishes from this place.

Lovely restaurant, friendly and quick service. The restaurant has installed barriers between tables for covid precautions. The Kra-Pow Puff was a delightful pastry. It was cheesy with a kick of spice. Would definitely order this again
No comment

Great Thai iced tea, I had the pad si ew and it was very good great flavors maybe the noodles could've been cooked a bit less overall great Thai spot definitely would recommend to anyone looking for Thai in the city!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great food, good portions, nice ambiance. Avocado massaman curry was delish! Will be back!

Such cute decorations!!! They have so many options for seating, and the greenery is such a great look. The food portions were actually pretty decent. You will definitely feel full even with the Tom Kha soup. Visiting from another state and so glad I stumbled upon this place!

I've walked by a few times and I've always wanted to try Thep. I love Thai food, but my husband isn't the biggest fan. So, as I was walking down second avenue, starving and looking for a place to eat outside on this beautiful day, I spied the floral decorated porch and decided this was the perfect time to pop in. I was sat immediately, and pulled up the digital menu which was extensive. I wanted to try something I hadnt tried before, so I got the northern Thai egg noodles in creamy coconut curry broth with chicken on the bone, and it was delicious.  If I had to make one change I would sit a bit further away from the hustle of bustle of 2nd Ave. Highly recommend!

Great place to have dinner, came in on Friday with a large group of 9. Got seated pretty quickly, ordered the sample platter and the khao soi with the chicken. The appetizer platter wasn't anything to rave about but I would say overall their curry was really good. The khao soi chicken was really tender and he curry wasn't too spicy. Service was great got a free Thai ice tea overall a solid night

There's a ton of good Thai on the UES, and in addition to PuTawn and UpThai, THEP is right up there as well. I would highly recommend the pork bun, Penang curry with shrimp over white rice, and the Kea Mao flat noodle entree with crispy fried duck. Everything was fantastic and we would happily return.
Nice seating and service. The food is yummy. It's good place to go and have a relax lunch.
Amazing customer service and the food is incredibly authentic! 100% coming back and would recommend for ambience, food taste/authenticity and staff friendliness!

Love the food and the environment here.  We ordered 5 dishes.  All are good, especially the avocado curry, tom yum and golden sachets.  The price is reasonable too compare to other restaurants in NY. Definitely come back and recommend to others.
No comment

I usually don't eat out but I was with friends in the area and we were looking for a place to try out and it was honestly a better than expected experience. I got the beef drunken noodles, and tried a little of the tofu fried rice. The food was really good, service was fast and responsive without feeling rushed or pushy. Definitely recommended and will totally come back if I'm in the area again!
AMAZING!!! Good food, good vibes, good music and a great duck red curry. A definite must in NYC! Don't forget to ask your server about the free Thai iced tea!!
No comment
The crispy calamari and thep platter were delicious. The drunken noodles were a good amount of spicy. Would definitely return.
Great curries. We had the Panang and red curry and they were both excellent. My husband is hard to please and he was very satisfied.
Delicious!!! The pad kee mao was flavorful and there was a good amount of tofu in the noodle dish! I got the mild version this time but I think I would do the medium spicy next.

Recommended by a friend, we came for a late lunch~ I ordered the drunken noodles and my friend ordered the pad Thai. Both dishes were really good! Very rich flavors~ The pork buns were also good, although the pork belly portion was a bit large for the bun, it was still very tasty.
Amazing food and drink! Love the pad see ew and Thai iced coffee! Will be back again to visit.
No comment
This place was awesome. Food and service top notch. Had the golden sachet .. highly recommended
No comment
Have been here twice before and absolutely love this place. The apps are great  and I really enjoy the pad kee mao.
No comment

Stir-fry udon noodles with shrimp. $20. Spicy. Takeout portion very small. Flavor was decent. So spicy could only taste the spice. Versus other Thai restaurants in the area Thep is way overpriced. Other Thai restaurants provide much more food for the price and quality.
Food is definitely yum and the place is very pretty. Love that they offered a vegan sauce for my noodles when I specified my dietary preference.
Drinks and foods are delicious! Great friendly and attentive staff! We got the pad Thai and khao soi. Drinks were bird of paradise and and cl
Great food, drunken noodles fried rice were very good. Wok much to be desired.
Thep Thai is my go- to restaurant for Thai food in New York! I absolutely love the avocado masamaan curry and order it every time I order or eat from there - make sure to ask them to make it spicy!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Sorry it's ok if ur in a hurry but it's definitely not Thai food- subpar - I went there with a friend only because we were in a hurry
I've been wanting to try the place as it's always busy.  A good sign.  Had the go to Thai dishes, a curry and Pad Thai.  The curry was excellent as well as the pad Thai.
Great!!! The best Thai restaurant I've ever had. It's amazing! I recommend it. It's really nice

The food is excellent. I've had a ton of Thai over 30 years, in and out of NYC's restaurant scene. The flavors at Thep are incredibly well done. The spices hit just right, from subtle to heat. Delicious dumplings, super light scallion pancakes, crunch spring rolls, all with a range of dipping sauces (try the sampler platter). My green curry had just the right heat and an unusual reddish, earthy brown rice. My lady's chicken drunken noodle was the best we've had. The servers were all very skilled and polite. It's busy, somewhat noisy but worth it. Go check out Thep!

One of the best Thai restaurants in the neighborhood. We got the platter for appetizer, since my wife and I love variety. Our favorite was the golden sachet and chive dumpling. It definitely hit the spot. My wife love her curry and for my drunken noodle. The noodle was cooked perfectly soft and flavorful. The beef was a bit dry and could be better. But other than that, it hit the spot. Will definitely come back again when we're in this area.
No comment
Really awesome Thai place. Noodles were a tad not-chewy but the flavor was awesome and the portions were more than adequate. I got the drunken noodles.
No comment
Ambience is great. Quite big as well. Even though cane during busy times we did not have to wait at all. Prompt service. Food looks good as well.
Great atmosphere. Decorated beautifully. Lovely appetizers. The curries are not at par. Descent upscale thai food
No comment

Came by the restaurant after playing badminton. It seemed really popular as it was fully packed with people waiting outside as well but the wait wasn't long. Cute interior and nice plate arrangements. My friend told me it's not true authentic but more like fusion, tho it was nice. The Thep platter was my favorite. The fish was a bit too sour and spicy for us. The duck curry was ok but personally don't love the sweetness. The salad was nice but very "normal".

Amazing food and service!! Cannot get better than this. We ordered the golden sachet, puffs, pad Thai with beef, and drunken noodles with beef. All amazing quality and presentation. Thai iced tea is a must!!! One of the best Thai places to go to, and I visit many all over the East coast--

Dined here on a Friday night and got seated very quickly in there huge outdoor space. We ordered the pork belly clay pot and Kai Soi with beef. Thought the clay pot was delicious- the Kai soi could have used more heat.

We enjoyed every dish. Whole crispy fish, pad Thai, pineapple fried rice are classic. Massaman avocado curry with chicken on the bone was standout. Pork belly clay pot we had high expectations but the pork was not as tender as hoped, but still tasty.
No comment
Huge portions, quality food, authentic Khao Soi & friendly staff. I love my neighborhood Thai spot!!
No comment

Amazing food amazing environment too, I got the green curry with shrimp and man let me tell you that it did not disappoint AT ALL. There was this waiter I didn't catch his name but he was super nice and even though it was busy he took really good care of us and he was really cute too:)
Best Thai restaurant I've had in NYC so far. Generous portions, friendly staff, great service.
Crab Rangoon, green curry, Thai iced tea, were  fire............,,,.,,,,.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,.,,.
Good taste! The Thai tea is really good! Duck sale is special. Tom yum soup more tends to sour but tastes good too. You need show them your review you can get free tea.

The food and service were amazing. We had the short rib massaman and the meat was fall off the bone tender. The chicken khao soi was also very good and the Thep platter is a great sampler to start. Will be coming back, highly recommend!
The duck pad see ew was fantastic and the outdoor seating was very lovely. A tasty and aesthetic eating experience
No comment

Tried Thep Thai for the first time tonight after an anticipated few months and it definitely lived up to the hype! The waiters are super friendly, and the food came out speedy without compromising flavor. We got the Thep Platter to start to get a taste of everything and it was delicious. For dinner I had the cashew king which was fresh and delicious. My friend got the Pad Kee Mao which she loved and they were able to accommodate her and make it not too spicy. Overall great experience and can't wait to come back!
Really amazing noodles (drunken noodle) specifically and they have great service!! I'd come back!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Yummy enjoyed a lot and would recommend. We sat in a cabin and the ambiance was very nice
No comment
No comment
Came here on a Saturday night and it was packed! And understandably so. Ambiance is great! Food is great! Service is really good! A super nice date night - highly recommended!
The food is quite good, especially the pineapple fried rice! I will definitely come again!
No comment
No comment

Delicious food, beautiful outdoor seating and great service! I ordered the dumplings and the THEP rice bowl (at before I got a good photo!). They have two sets of outdoor seating, one with a gorgeous flower canopy and the other with booths that have AC/heaters. Great for a date night, or someone who wants Instagrammable Thai.
Great food and very good selections of cocktails. Will definitely come back for the food and drinks
No comment
great vibes and food (my favorite is the khao soi) their outdoor seating is well heated too :)
No comment
The ambiance inside and outside is great and I love the pad Thai and the pad see ew here!

The food was really good. Just couldn't get enough of the Tom yum soup, the Siamese fried rice was just amazing, the drunken noodles were okay along with the wings. BUTT BEST LYCHEE THAI TEA I EVER HAD!
No comment

As someone who thoroughly enjoys Thai food, I was very excited to try this new spot. The ambiance of the restaurant is very trendy inside and out and instantly catches the eye of any pedestrian. Unfortunately, the way myself and my two other guests were treated upon being served ruined the entire experience. I understand wanting to check up on your table and see if anyone needs anything or if they're ready for order but this was NEXT level. Quite literally every 2 minutes we were asked if we were ready to order. Each time this occurred we apologized and and said we still needed a couple minutes. It got to a point where it was so over the top that we couldn't even have a conversation because of the constant interruptions. It very much felt like we were being rushed in and out of the restaurant. Our food came very quick which was nice but we were in and out of the restaurant in the matter of 25 minutes. The food was good and I'm happy to have seen they have Gluten Free options. However, I wouldn't come back and wouldn't recommend to others without sharing my service experience.

This place is so cute! Wonderful ambiance and really cute decor. Got to do a midweek lunch with my Homegirl and it was perfect. We order the cream cheese wontons. The cheese was warm and melted perfection.  Then For our entrées, we ordered the pad Thai and the pineapple fried rice. Both of them were flavorful and delicious. I am excited to come back and enjoy more of their menu.
No comment
No comment
Favorite Thai on the upper east side! Decor is pretty and food is delicious. I usually get the cashew king which is one of their best dishes!
No comment
Great Thai food! Very nice twist on traditional Thai meals. Short rib massaman was delicious!
No comment
Cozy space for some rich, warm delicious food. Waiting staff are quick & friendly. Decor is chic and easy to find a table for lunch. Definitely will be coming back!
No comment
Decorations and ambiance really good!! Food was yummy, good flavors but not mind blowing
No comment
No comment

Ordered Queen of Siam Basil with chicken. Exceptional dish. Not five stars as the rice portion was really too small. And extra rice of the same size was priced high. Hopefully something that can be addressed.
Excellent food and ambiance. Great value. Highly recommend. Staff were friendly and attentive

Was looking for khao soi that would be even half as good as khao soi mei sai (?) in Chiangmai. We were really impressed! The broth was rich and had layers of flavor. The noodles were well cooked and the chicken was good in it too. Also ordered the pad kee mao and chicken chashew from the wok. Too full to try anything else but tempted to come back just for the pad Thai and fried rice but have limited days in NYC.

Inviting warm atmosphere. Our waitress was very helpful in recommending our party dishes and the food presentation was on point. COVID protocols are in place with all staff wearing masks and plexiglass separating patrons.
No comment
No comment
Probably the best drunken noodles i have never had. Plenty of shrimps in the dish. The flavor is amazing. Their tom yum soup is great too.
No comment

So cute! Well decorated, lovely ambiance. Our server, Nam was delightful and offered us free Thai iced teas. We didn't have to make a reservation for a Saturday afternoon lunch and there was plenty of outdoor seating.
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment
Very friendly staff. My favorite was the pad thai and tom yum. Get the beef salad  Also the peanut dumpling is good!
No comment
Great ambiance, good food, attentive staff. Ordered the duck so supple and succulent. 10/10 experience, would come again
Had fantastic duck curry, Tom ka soup, amazing pad Thai, this place rocks!  Highly recommended!

probably the best Thai food I've tried in a very long time. the restaurant was beautiful and the service was great. we sat outside and enjoyed people watching. the Khao soi was very nice and rich and the noodles perfectly cooked and the raw onions onto added a nice crunch to the meal, 10/10 would recommend. the park mor was also really good! very pretty dumpling due to it being purple. I also got the red curry the flavor was nice and balanced and went perfectly with the soft rice. the kra pow puff was one of the best curry puff ive ever tried the bread was soft and pillowy with a initial crunch.
No comment

My best friend and I came on a Sunday and wait was not long at all. Service was amazing- friendly staff and came to check on us frequently. The food service was lightning fast too. We never waited for more than 10 minutes for each order to come out. Food was phenomenal- full of flavor and very good portions. Definitely worth the price.
The food was really good! Loved the masaman curry and tofu drunken noodles. So yummy. I recommend this place
This place is really well decorated, staff are nice and friendly. It is a good place for friends to hangout! Their curry is yummy and spicy enough! Big portion! Def enough for girls! Recommended!
Delicious ! Got a thai iced tea plus green curry with chicken, flavors are very authentic and decor is nice too
No comment

Thep Thai has been one of our favorite restaurant spots for the past few years, we live next door and always prefer Thep due to its ambience, amazing food selection, and incredible service! All the wait staff are super nice and accommodating. The menu includes all the delicious thai basics (basil chicken, summer rolls, fried rices, and spicy soups), in addition to some really unique finds (purple dumplings??). This is one of those places you eat at not because it's just right around the corner or familiar, but because it's consistently great!

Love the food. Ordered Crab Fried Rice and that's the best crab fried rice I ever had. My friend ordered Lobster Fried Rice, also great! The only problem is the waitress kept reminding us to finish our food and leave quickly by frequently came by our table asking us are we finished even though it was clear we haven't.
Great food and super fast service. 10/10 would recommend to anyone, get the pad Thai mine was awesome.
No comment
We are visiting this restaurant for years now and it never disappointed. The service is kind and fast, the food is goooooood and the new covid outside setup is private and clean.
I love coming to this restaurant with my friends. One of my favorite Thai food restaurants in the city. If you are in nyc, definitely check it out!
Chicken dumplings and calamari were good. Along with Thai iced tea. Green curry was also great!

Very cute and clean location with indoor and outdoor seating. We got the pad see ew, pineapple shrimp fried rice, and thep platter. The noodles were great and the fried rice came out in an actual pineapple which was cute. Also got thai tea which was really refreshing.
Second time dinning and I love the decor and ambiance. Great and tasty Thai food and awesome service!
No comment
Amazing food and service! Usually it's really busy, but today I got lucky with the rain and I was able to walk in without a wait.
No comment
No comment
Ordered the Soft Shell Crab fried rice. BOMB! Very well cooked. So much flavor in the crab. And the fried rice was also delicious. Definitely recommend. We also got seated super fast!
Thep Thai is my go-to Thai spot in the UES! i've ordered something different each time and it's always been amazing. I find it hard to find a good Khao Soi and the one at Thep is wonderful!!
It was good! I was in outside patio and it was warm and confortable. Massaman curry is big and you can share in a group.
A pleasant surprise. Definitely recommend!. The seafood Udon was delicious .. Diversified Menu. Excellent service!
No comment
Great food and wonderful service. Our favorites were the Spicy Udon and the Tom Yum soup. Loved the atmosphere.

Yum -- got the khao soi delivered and it was delicious! Like how they separate out the soup and noodles so you can portion out to the ratio of your liking; I personally like a higher noodles:soup ratio and even had soup leftover that I used up for another meal.
Kra-pow puffs are the best! Excellent service, beautiful environment. We love coming here for the food and the ambiance.
Amazing food get the drunken noodles they were bomb!!!would def come here again!!!!! The service was great
Great atmosphere. Excellent service. Spring rolls and Cashew King Chicken was delicious.
Came here for lunch after a hospital trip. Excellent Khao Soi (get chicken on bone) and perfectly made Thai ice coffee. Nice ambiance for a date night as well. Highly recommend!
Excellent food and service. Flavorful, spice level is perfect and good portion size. Will definitely return!
Highly recommend Khai SOI noodle!! It was delicious. Great place to catch up with friends over dinner :)
The restaurant is gorgeous! Very aesthetically pleasing. The service was great too. Delicious food, definitely worthy of the hype

Visiting from out of state and the ambience of this place is beautiful! Candelit, floral decorations, very intimate. The food is good portioned and prices are fair; especially love the pad see ew and curry!
No comment

This restaurant has a clean and beautiful aesthetic. Their Thai tea was superb (classically sweet, which is great for me!) We tried the Avocado Massaman curry and the Khao Si, the Khao Si  was savory and SOOOOO good! Best Thai dish I have ever had from anywhere. The Massaman was hearty and paired great with the rice. Would recommend this place to everyone I know!

I decided to try out this place because many of my friends recommended this place to be the best Thai restaurant in NYC. I ordered fried calamari, pad see eiw and drunken noodle. As expected the foods were great. The service was also great. I will definitely come back!
No comment

When I walked in I was blown away by the beautiful scenery and ceiling of flowers! I orders the THEP platter and was amazed to find every dish matched well with all 4 sauces. An unique twist on well known Thai dishes. The drunken noodles were a delicious and spicy!
Fast service with great food. Appetizers came quick. Food was well portioned. Outdoor seating is nice and cozy.

Randomly discovered this restaurant after work. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff. We ordered papaya salad, pad Thai and pineapple fried rice. The papaya salad was my favorite. Will recommend this gem to my friends.

column3: Black Mountain Ranch, San Diego, CA
column6: Looks amazing! Tastes even better. I just moved to New York and this reminds me of thai food in California. Really flavorful. Smells amazing. The restaurant is beautiful as well.

A must go to Thai restaurant in the heart of Manhattan! Beautiful restaurant with delicious Thai food. Unlike many crammed and run down restaurants in Manhattan this one is very modern and organized. The pineapple fried rice and pad thai there are must haves. They put the pineapple fried rice in a cute pineapple which gives them extra points! There is a reason as to why they have 1500+ review at almost 5 stars.
No comment

I absolutely love THEP, and I have never been disappointed here. I absolutely love the Golden Satchets for an appetizer, they are fried to perfection and have a wonderfully savory and satisfying filling. For the main dish I typically get the beef drunken noodles, with noodles that have just the right amount of bite and chew to them. The pork chops are also very good and tender, served in a very generous portion.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Great food! I ordered the Spicy Udon Noodles with Chicken and was able to adjust my level of spice to my liking. The presentation was nice and the food came pretty swiftly. Our server was friendly and responsive. We sat in an outdoor booth which came equipped with adjustable air conditioning, which was a plus. Overall, a very solid meal + experience!

Ate here tonight with some friends who wanted drinks (I'm vegan but everyone else was not) and while I didn't order a drink, I did order dinner and got the fresh rolls, Tom Kha soup, and a side of rice. Everything was absolutely delicious and I'd definitely come back here again if the occasion arose! Servers were very attentive as well! My friends also finished their meals (one person got a noodle dish and the other one a salad to go with their drinks) and seemed to like the food as well.
Great ambiance and food. I got the drunken noodles and shrimp dumplings. Reasonable prices. Great dinner date spot.
Been here so many times and never disappointed!  The food is amazing and drinks hit hard
Love the food flavors and service!!! The wait was long but the food was worth waiting for. If you're on the upper east side don't miss this spot!!! It's great.

My wife and I stumbled upon this cute spot on a stroll through the upper east side. To say the food is exquisite is an understatement. The flavors bounced off my tongue, like a melodious symphony, punctuated by hints of sweet, spice and salty. 5/5 review for an appethaizing time. Thai it out!

This spot was killer - great indoor ambiance, great music, fast service, awesome eclectic menu. Tea leaf salad , pineapple fried rife, curries all excellent. And amazing thematic cocktails. Really good modern Thai spot on the upper east - must hit
Amazing food and the nicest service!! I came with with a group of friends on a Tuesday night and there was no wait. Got the puffs and Pad See Ew. Sooo good!!

The food was delicious and the decor inside is so cute. Came here twice in a month! The drinks were a little too sweet for us. We also got the espresso martini and my friend said that just had too many flavors that didn't go well together.
Best Thai food on the UES and the inside atmosphere and decor is beautiful ..Servers are great
Food was good. Nothing extraordinary, but acceptable. Seating was not really comfortable. Service was not the best either.

This place has the best Thai food in all of NYC hands down. Don't believe me? Come here and fill that sexy tummy of yours ASAP, and you'll become a believer no doubt. You don't like Thai food? Well, you've simply never been here. Bring your Thai yummy here and you won't regret it. Peace foodies
No comment
No comment
Great vegetarian options and beautiful scenery. Definitely the avocado curry with vegetarian duck!!

We had a party of two and walked in for dinner on a Saturday night, and wait was only 10 min. We got the honey short rib, khao soi, and Kanom Jean Nam. The honey short rib was my favorite, and the meat was tender and sauce was great. The Kanom also was very flavorful and the meat was very tender. The Khao Soi noodles are slightly al dente, which wasn't my preference but is still a great dish. Portions are huge so we had leftovers which is great too. Lovely decor and great experience overall!

Came here early Monday evening, lots of seating. Adorable outdoor seating with excellent people watching opportunities. We got the pork bun and miang  kana. Miang kana was delicious! Khao soi was the standout dish- soup had a deep curry flavor. Spicy udon was okay. Really nice and attentive servers who weren't overbearing. Would come again!
No comment
I always order here for my go to thai place! Had the pad thai here which is always a solid 10/10! Will be coming here for dinner sometime to try out their cocktails
Great food and drinks! I especially like their wings, pad kee mao and crab fried rice.
Nice restaurant with a nice menu! Good selection and photos and overall good experience
I order food for delivery and it was so bad. They gave me like an old curry, i got food poisoned! So disgusting.I don't recommend ordering from them.

This place is awesome!! I came here just because the Khao Soi was supposed to be amazing, and it absolutely delivered. They also offer a free Thai Iced Tea if you write a Yelp review, which I was going to to anyway so I obviously said yes. The Thai Iced tea was a little too sweet for me, but still good. My friends got the Wonton soup and Thai iced coffee, which were both awesome. The broth in the Wonton soup was beautifully savory, and the wontons were lovely and juicy. The Khao Soi absolutely lived up to expectations, it was thick and flavorful just the way I was hoping for! Will definitely be returning, some of the best Thai food I've had in the city!
We shared the papaya salad and a pad Thai. The food was delicious and the service was quick and friendly!!
This restaurant had really great service. It had really nice ambience. 10/10 Would come again.
No comment
Super good basil fried rice and great service. We had a decently sized party and they accommodated us pretty quickly.

The decor of this place is soooo pretty!! Look at all of the beautiful flowers on the roof of outdoor seating :) They accommodated our big group of 8 girls during our visit! We ordered family style and all shared the dishes. I really liked the pad thai (chicken) and crab fried rice. Service was good as well!
THEP is the best Thai restaurant, this is always my go to place for years. Their service is great and the food is out of this world. I would highly recommend this place to anyone!
No comment
Great ambience and good food. Didn't feel very authentic to thai though... It's tweaked for locals.
No comment
So yummy!! Love the food here. Great service and great vibes. Such a gem to have a place in the UES

Outdoor dining is beautiful today with the autumn temps and sun. Only thing it's very loud with traffic so definitely consider that. Got apps puffed pastries which were yummy, the cashew king which has large pieces of thinly sliced chicken breast and loads of onions, peppers, pineapple chunks, and cashews in a mild spicy, salty sauce. It wasn't my favorite but my hubby loved it. He got the avocado massaman curry which was sweet, salty, smooth. We both enjoyed this. Also got a Thai iced tea for free for writing this review. Definitely check it out.

Pat was an OUTSTANDING server. She was super attentive and all her suggestions were soooo delicious. Do the sweet potato noodles. Do the Duck Tamorin it was sweet and delicious the duck was perfectly crispy. I love having trying seasonal food and they have a seasonal menu which I loved, I tried the Green Goddess and it was so refreshing. They were good and strong. They have private rooms where I ate with my friends and it was soooo nice. Please try it while in the city you won't regret it.
Love this place, it's incredibly convenient and charming for UES lunches. The portion sizes are AMAZING and the food was delicious all around.
Great food and cute vibe! We got pad thai and curry and they were delicious. Would def come back
No comment

This was not any ordinary thai restaurant. The ambiance and the food was fantastic. I got the avocado massaman curry. The heat was just right with a tinge of sweetness. My partner also enjoyed her food. Customer service was super nice as well. I would definitely recommend coming here for just a dinner or a date!
Amazing massaman curry!! The only Thai place on the UES thats great!
Very beautiful ambiance, staff was very pleasant service was amazing and the food was good. The drinks we very beautiful and delicious!
No comment
Decent pad thai. Platter's pretty good. Good for 2 people only. Cute outdoor dining set-up. Will come back.
Such amazing Thai food! The spring rolls and cocktails are to die for. Go go go (like actually run) to Thep!
Great ambience! Loved their signature cocktail menu! A must visit if you're in the city!
No comment
Excellent Khao Soi. It's not easy to find an authentic and tasty version of this dish in NYC and THEP Thai's is exceptional. The flavors were bold but well balanced and not too sweet.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: the place was amazing and super aesthetically pleasing. The Thai tea was perfect. The food was super good.
Great food! Great ambiance! Excellent variety of vegetarian dishes. Recommend the fresh roll!

Food is great! Came out so quickly, with a beautiful presentation! The service is good and attentive. Restaurant on a corner, you can eat both inside and outside. They have beautiful plants to dress up the outside, setting a nice mood. Would recommend.
Overall had a great experience here. They had good appetizers and food, and I really loved their signature cocktail menu! Definitely would visit if you are on the east side the city!
No comment
Excellent service despite being very busy! Got the red curry and pad see ew and loved both of them. Would definitely come back!
Came here on a Thursday evening. Joined the waitlist on Yelp 10 minutes prior to arriving and got seated immediately. Great and attentive service! Ordered the chicken green curry--highly recommend!
No comment
I love Thep, I'll come by here just for lunch, we love the golden sachets and Tom kha!
Service was quick and efficient! Food is so good! Got the pad Thai and various appetizers. Would highly recommend!
The servers were excellent, the food was awesome, and the decor in the restaurant was very cute. Definitely my go - to thai spot from now on!
No comment

Really enjoyed my lunch today at Thep Thai! We got the pad see ew gluten free and the Thai rice made vegan. There are many options for different dietary needs. Even in the snow storm, the service was great and the food was wonderful!
Get the udon noodles!!! Soo good. Nice ambiance. Delicious food. Great appetizer options! Solid option for if you're in the city and want some good thai
5/5 a stellar Thai restaurant. The best in the area! Have come here many times and it does not disappoint every time.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Nice aesthetic interior and exterior. Try the pork belly pot. Wasn't the largest fan of pad see ew, but was eatable. would i come back? not for a while, but not due to the food more due to the taste was something that stays with me so i can't eat it so often.
No comment

went there on a tuesday at 5pm when they reopened for the evening. right after my friend and i ate, we were asked to move to the bar because they 'needed the table'. meanwhile there were other seats available and an empty bar. if others came in, how come they couldn't sit at the bar?  so we left to get drinks elsewhere. pictures look cuter than actually place and the food wasn't all that.. drinks weren't bad but i won't be returning there ‍
No comment
Great food and ambience. I ordered the beef pad see eaw and crab rangoon and they were great
Wonderful food. Great service by Amm (server). The green curry was fantastic and seating in the shed outdoors was a nice setting.
My go to Thai place! I always order from here and also realized it's a nice restaurant. I love the pad see ew, more pad see YUM!
Pretty good service, food and ambiance! The duck was lacking but the curry had a unique flavor. The pineapple fried rice was delicious and the starter platter is great for 2.

The food wasn't great, in fact the appetizer platter topped the main course. Do not get the coconut sticky rice, it's bland and quite horrible to be quite frank. The Thai tea lacked flavor and pretty darn bland. In all, wouldn't come back here, at all. I gave it a 3 because of the ambiance and the potential it could have solely going off the appetizer combo platter.

Came to Thep Thai during their happy hour on a Friday evening. The $7 margaritas and martinis were tasty and strong. Also ordered the chive pancake, papaya salad and pad kee mao- everything was delicious. Will be back for dinner next time!
Beautiful ambiance. Service is quick and efficient. Electronic menus very covid friendly.

This place is a little out of the way for me but always worth the trek! Highly recommend the khao soi, it's really flavorful and has a nice crunch with the fried toppings. I always get drunken noodles and pad Thai at typical Thai places but will venture out and get different dishes at THEP. They also have a cute outdoor seating area too for when it's nice outside.
Came for a quick bite and fell in love with the atmosphere (also found great parking right at front. Which is a plus!)

The food here is amazinggg. If you come, make sure to get the Pork Chop. The coconut black sticky rice was divine. And the two sauces included match so well. This sweet fish sauce is a nice addition for the vegetables and the marinated pork chop sauce has a great umami flavor.

My friend got noodles and I got the curry both are really good!! Portion is also pretty big I am too full after finishing. The waitress was nice and attentive. They have little candles on tables which make a really nice and romantic ambiance. Will come back here next time.
No comment
No comment

One of the two best Thai restaurants on the UES. Their outdoor set up is super nice with private booths including heaters and doors. They even have buttons to ask for your server or the check (limiting interactions it's diners to keep everyone comfortable and most importantly the staff safe). The Thai wings are so good. Take out from here is just as good as dining in. They have their own take out ordering system directly on their website to better benefit the restaurant and skip the fees with some delivery systems. They are always emailing discounts too!
leaving a review for the free thai iced tea. the vegetarian duck w queen of siam basil sauce was incredible, 10/10. The vegan pad thai has been better in the past but was disappointing today
Great service, nice outdoor seating, and delicious food! Not much else to say. Definitely a must try.
No comment
Really good service and loved the outdoor seating. Quick and overall very tasty. The duck skin was perfectly fried. Star taken off as most of the sauces were too sweet.
Pad Thai was good and had a nice portion size, masaman avacodo curry was also interesting to try
Strongly recommend the snow crab rice and black ink squid spaghetti! The environment is beautiful and the servers are very nice! Food came in around 10 mins after we ordered. Pleas come and try!
Great food , really authentic. Only wish the Thai Hot spice level was a little spicier!
Waiting time wasn't that bad even though there was a long line in front of the restaurant. Food was authentic and good! Liked the food, but was on the pricier side.

Solid spot for Thai in the UES. The restaurant feels super clean and welcoming from the moment you walk in and is really nicely decorated. Servers are friendly as well. For a Saturday lunch for a party of 2, we did not have to wait. Our food came out quickly and was delicious. I had the sausage fried rice ($15) which tasted really good along with a Thai iced tea that was $1 with yelp check-in. Great experience, would come again!

Server ia nice and quick. I got the red curry spicy and Tom yum noodle soup spicy. Both flavors are great. They're not as spicy as other Thai places I've been too where my tongue is burning off. Tom yum is also not as sour but the flavor is strong and good. They also give a good portion of meat. Thai tea is nice and sweet and coffee is good.
Ordered chicken pad Thai and Thai iced tea. Food was Amazing! The vibe and food was great.
First time back since the pandemic, still good. Very nice outdoor dining area. The spicy udon was too salty for me.

They have the best khao soi!! I come here / do take out at least every other week. They also have a really nice outdoor dining set up (dog friendly on the patio) as well so it's perfect when the weather is nice.
Nice environment and cute decors. Food smells so good! Love it. Thai ice coffees highly recommend.
The Tom yum soup is really good! It fills me up real nicely. I love the pad Thai. Wonderful flavors!
No comment
No comment
great place for a casual lunch with friends - fantastic service, and really cute vibes inside!
Excellent dinner choice - very differentiated dishes. Try the avocado dumplings and pancakes. Great staff too.
yummy food that came out fairly quickly. drinks were a little overpriced for the size and taste
The food was pretty decent. However service was very poor and the servers were mean. I did not feel comfortable here as a POC... never again
Very good Thai tea and yummy drunken noodles. Get them with chicken cuz it's bussin no cap.
Beautiful restaurant and great service. Highly recommend. Be sure to join the waitlist online if you're coming during peak hours.
Amazing ambience and legit thai food. Perfect for dat le night, Would definitely come back again!
Great spot, food is amazing service is great. Nice vibes, best Thai in NYC. They are really good at making sure your allergy is well taken care of.

This Thai restaurant HS a great ambiance and I especially loved the prompt service through the waitlist reservation system. The servers were very accommodating and quickly found us a table to sit. Regarding the food, the service was both quick and delicious. I especially loved the crab rangoon which had a crispy outside texture and a very nice cream inside. The drink selection was great with various alcoholic and non alcoholic options which is great for those bringing children. There was both indoor and outdoor dining so the next time I come, I'll definitely check out the outside.
No comment
Delicious food, nice ambiance, great service, good cocktails. Will definitely go back!
Calamari was delicious - unique sauce! Thai iced tea was great as well. Beautiful seating outdoors with lights
No comment
No comment
Great place, good food and love the private booths outdoors! Definitely recommend-especially love the free ice tea!
I loved this little Thai spot for my regular Pad See Mao with chicken.  Jasmine rice made for a great evening meal.  I wish I could go more often!

The food and the drinks are good. The service is HORRIBLE. I never write bad reviews but this one was bad. I was sitting at the bar / by the indoor hostess and they completely forgot about me. I have been watching the clock and it's been just shy of 45 minutes since someone has checked on me. I ate and had a few drinks and nothing. They seem to cater to those who speak the language.  They respond quicker to them and their needs. I get it, we all get busy but as one that has work in the restaurant industry for years, I am really forgiving but this was bad. I asked the guy next to me and he said the same thing.  It's a cute spot but the service makes me never want to come back. The bartender never acknowledged me & just ackowledged the person sitting next to me. I've been here going on 2 hours. May your experience be better than mine.... Also friends.. we are reaching almost sn hour since someone has checked in on me. I genuinely hope that this was a fluke night and may your experience be better than mine.

Very delicious food and great drinks! I've dined here a few times prior to covid and each time I have had a great experience. The massaman curry has a great depth of flavor, and the Thai ice tea is a must! The restaurant itself is very cozy. Will come back!
I like this restaurant. the food is delicious. Very beautiful place. Only thing I don't like is feeling rush and rude here.
The food is so good and service was great! The yuzu drinks are a must and so is the pineapple fried rice
Best Thai food in New York City! Been here 5 times and the food is 5/5. Definitely try the crab rangoon.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: This is some of the best Thai Food in the Upper East Side, if not the world! Their outdoor seating is just gorgeous and the food is amazing!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Delicious! Good ambience and service and food/drinks. I like the shrimp pineapple fried rice
Have eaten here a number of times. The food comes hot and the service is good. Classic Pad Thai, papaya salad, lemongrass pork chop...all delicious.

My family is extremely careful about COVID and we chose to eat here because of the outdoor seating (you get your own room outside with heating and lighting). While I'm not Thai myself, I grew up eating Thai food and Thep is one of the best thai places I've eaten at. We ordered the Golden Sachet, which was basically a pork dumpling wrapped in crispy spring roll skin (I barely tasted the crab, but it was delicious nonetheless). The Park Mor was slightly sweet and had chunks of vegetable in it and was delicious. The Pork Belly Clay Pot was served with fried rice and Chinese sausage in it, and when mixed with the runny egg and scallion, was phenomenal. The pad see ew and pad Thai were as we expected and also very good. Will be coming back here!
No comment
Delicious food, diverse menu and adorable little COVID safe manic booths. Will definitely return
No comment
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: My favorite Thai in the city! I love the beef drunken noodles. The Drinks are also fun!

1000/10 recommend!! MAGNIFICENT!!!! This place has amazing food- the spicy drunken noodles were so good, and the freshest thai tea i've ever tried. & it came out so fast! The vibe and look of this place is also very cute! If you're in the area, definitely stop by!!

The restaurant is finely decorated, making a quite relaxing environment for dining. There are both outdoor and indoor tables, which you can choose. The taste of the food is pretty good and not spicy at all, which is great.
Service was good able to do last minute reservation for 8. Food was awesome especially the pork belly and the panang curry. Yummy.
Fantastic restaurant in a great location near museums. The sampler platter and tom kha soup are delicious.

Came here with my friend and got the chicken pad Thai and the tofu pad see ew. Chicken pad Thai had thin noodles and was on the sweeter side and tofu pad see ew tasted great! They had cute outdoor seating in booths with heating
This is such a cute place! Their food is really good. Portions are large- every bite is full of flavor! Definitely glad I tried this place!

Great ambiance, very nice staff. The decor of the restaurant is extremely chic and cute. The food is delicious! I ordered the basil fried rice with papaya salad. Will definitely recommend this place to friends and family.

We walked right by it at first since the entrance was right in the corner of the block. However, once we got in, we were not at all disappointed. The atmosphere is really inviting and full of life and the service from our waitress Pimpisa was fantastic. It was all smiles and the crab fried rice was delicious.
No comment

This was an incredible experience. I have lived and travelled all over Southeast Asia and this was as good as anything I have ever had. Plus the staff was really good, polite and fast. They were moving at supersonic speeds. A special thank you for great service.
The food is so good! Recommend the Pineapple Fried Rice that comes in an actual pineapple. Great drinks too!

We were a group of 4 a few weeks ago. Food was good, but service quite lacking. There was no wait for tables, but we felt very rushed, from the order to paying the bill. Yet, when we couldn't get someone's attention when we needed an extra plate. What should have been a relaxed evening was not.
No comment
Probably the best Thai food I've ever had! Flavors are on point and the drinks are great. They go a step further with their food presentation too. Definitely coming back!
No comment
If you're looking for great Thai food, I highly recommend checking this place out! Great food, great atmosphere, and great service!
No comment

10/10 would recommend for anyone who had seen this on Tiktok. My friend and I decided to come here after seeing it on Tiktok and definitely didn't disappoint. We ordered the Chicken Satay, Kra-Pow Puff, Pad See Eiw, Pork Belly Entree and everything was AMAZING. (Ask for extra sauce if you get the pork belly). Our server, Peary, was super nice and checked up on us very often making sure everything was good.
No comment
Walked pass this Thai restaurant, decided to walk in. Did not make a mistake! Great atmosphere. Great food! Very nice staff. Love the pad Thai.
Popped in for a quick dinner with a friend. The restaurant has beautiful outdoor seating and they were quick to seat us. Expansive menu and food was amazing. Will be back

Love the ambience. The outdoor seating is very instagram friendly. Their outdoor cabins are private with air conditioning. it's spacious enough for a high chair and stroller. Menu has great options. A must visit.
Great food, lovely ambiance! We ordered Tom yum soup and avocado curry, both delicious!
I enjoyed the curry but the Tom yum was average. The service was good. The waitress was nice.
The food and service were great. The red curry, chicken dumplings, and Thai iced tea were delicious.
Great food. Fast service. Beautiful ambiance. A very classy place for a small dinner with friends.

We used the waitlist option on yelp to reserve our spot and by the time we walked to the restaurant nu we had a table, super convenient. The food was delicious and the ambiance was cute as well we had pork buns for appetizers and noodles for main. Everything was delicious and service was very attentive and quick. Definitely recommend this for a casual dinner or
Deeeelicious! Everytime. We got the calamari, basil fried rice, pad se ew, crispy duck in penang curry. Covid safe.
PLOY IS THE MOST AMAZING SERVER. food is amazing, drinks are fantastic, vibes are immaculate. 10/10 recommend. and that's all i have to say. wait... COME HERE
No comment
No comment
Food is really good here, but a bit pricy than expected. But definitely recommend giving a try
No comment

Our server pimchaya was so rude if you asked her A question she said read the Menu. But the food was amazing as a small business owner I would like to know if one of my employees were not treating the customers right. The place is very clean the food is incredible. But they definitely need to work on the service. We had appetizers fried rice and the green curry they were all tasty. I would definitely come back to this location and ask for a different server.
No comment
Pork belly clay pot was good. Thai tea was also good. But everything else was somewhat mediocre. Decent overall
Food was good but more sweet than usual. All in all pretty good experience and vibe..
Great ambience, friendly staff and great food! I would come here all over again. Best Thai spot in UES.
No comment
The food is so good. I really like Hibiscus drink (Kra-Jeab in Thai), sweet and sour!!!
No comment
Amazing service recommended for Thai - great woks. This is the best Thai food I've had and hence came back for a third time for yet another sumptuous dinner

I LOVE this place!!! There are other Thai restaurants on the upper east side, but look no further. Thep has a creative menu, the food is always amazing, and the presentation is beautiful too if you're dining there! The drinks are also very good with a full bar. The Thai iced tea (non-alcoholic) is delicious. Right now they are set up with a heated outdoor structure with doors so you can feel safe and warm while eating outdoors. They pay attention to cleanliness and disinfecting. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Highly recommend!
No comment
No comment

Very nice staff. Companion had wonton soup and pad Thai which he  declared to be superior to that at most Thai restaurants in UES. I had an unusual noodle and pork  dish ( sorry,  I forgot it's name) .Large portions. Only downs:  we had to ask for utensils and the lunch specials no longer exist.

We came on a sunday. Set on our table 5 minutes after arrival. We waited for a long while for our food, so if you are very hungry order some appetizers. I loved the pad thai and I was told rest of the food was also good.
No comment
Amazing pad see eiw!!! Great ambience and service. Would definitely go back and highly recommend!
Great ambience and food! I had the Siamese fried rice and crispy spring rolls which were flavorful. I would come back next time I'm in the area.
No comment
