Amazing Thai restaurant in the UES. I never usually come up to the UES but I definitely believe this is one of the best Thai places I've tried. The service was on point and everyone was very friendly. They also have amazing cocktail drinks too! Every dish I ordered was beautifully presented. I'd definitely will come back here.
No comment

Came in late on a Monday night and it was crowded but we were seated immediately. Service was good and we received our food quickly. We tried the sweet potato pad thai and the avocado curry and both were excellent. I also received a free thai tea for leaving this review.
Thep is amazing! I was seated outdoors right away, which is great seating not on top of the street. The chicken pad Thai is very good.
No comment

Great lunch specials that include an entree, appetizer, and a soup or salad for about $12-15. You get 10-15% off if you order online through their website. Everything I had here has been delicious. It's the best Thai restaurant in the area. I always get the calamari as the appetizer, which is delicious. I love the tangy sauce that comes with it. The clear soup sounds bland, but it actually quite tasty. I recommend the khai soi. It is a unique dish with fried noodles and a curry soup base.
No comment
The food and service are great!! We had a great experience with our server and our food was so yummy! Will be coming back again
A great vibe! Ac inside and beautiful patio. Very accommodating for dietary restrictions
No comment
No comment
Enjoyed the meal overall - got the Khao Soi, Pad Kee Mao, and the Crab Fried Rice. Service was good, ambience / interior decor is very nice.
The service and food was delicious. The drink I ordered was a martini tasted like a margarita. Needs improvement. Overall very good want to come back to taste other dishes.
Chicken served raw. Management took a long time to acknowledge that eating raw chicken is not healthy and said that sometimes that chicken satay is raw in the center.
Good food and good ambience. The servers are very attentive. The ice tea was good, Not too sweet. Ordered the queen of Siam Basil tofu and it was also really good. Highly recommend!
Ordered the Spicy Udon Noodle with Chicken, which was true to its name. Spicy and delicious! Takeout was prepared within 15-20 minutes and I was helped immediately once I walked in the restaurant!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: First thought was, wow this restaurant looks fancy! Ordered chicken satay as an appetizer and it was really juicy. It came with two dipping sauces, peanut sauce and cucumber vinaigrette; enjoyed the latter more because of the sweet taste. Entree dish: pad see eiw with chicken and it was pretty good. Sauce was a bit too flavorful for me tho. Still a good meal worth its price. Would come back 8/10 recommend
Great food. I ordered the Papaya Salad and sweet potato pad Thai. Service was super quick. Would visit again.

One of the best Thai restaurants in the city.  Food is great, price is reasonable, place is very comfortable and pretty too esp their outdoor seating. The waitstaff, especially Pear and Up, are super friendly too. You can't go wrong!  Highly recommended.
Excellent food and service! Everything was fresh and served hot! Def worth the hour drive
Great food reasonably priced with nice staff. Some of the best Thai I've had. Pad Thai beef was phenomenal
No comment

Cute Thai restaurant with good veggie options! We got the spring rolls, papaya salad, panang curry, pineapple fried rice, and spicy udon noodles. I felt the fried rice lacked flavor but everything else was really good!

This is my to-go Thai takeout place in UES. I love that they do not skimp on their spices, and the drunken noodle and green curry actually have a kick. Try their kra-pow puff and you will not disappoint! It's one of my favorites on their menu.

This place is a must go if you're in the area! Beautiful flowers outside and decorations draw you in and the welcoming workers and delicious food keep you in. Tables are separated with plastic sheets which I appreciate. There was no wait on a monday afternoon either, and we were seated right away! I got a beef pad see ew and tom kha, both of which were great. Typically prices but the experience is worth it.
Ordered the Thep platter which was delicious--really liked the spring rolls and the chive pancakes. For the entree we ordered the crab meat fried rice and the branzino. We enjoyed both!
Great flavors! And ambience is cozy! All in all great experience. Good veg options as well.
One of the best places I've had in NYC for Thai food! My friend and I shared the pad thai and pad see eiw and they were both delicious. The thai iced coffee was great as well!

The ambiance was great, beautiful decorations and presentation. The food was good as well, spice level was what I expected and it was reasonably priced for the quality! I didn't love the thai tea but the other drinks were very cute and seemed good!
It's  decorated really nicely and the food is delicious. Ordered the platter, pad Thai, and spring rolls. It's a can't miss.
Food was good and the staff was friendly. Interior design is very nice. Servings are large.
No comment
Absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in the Upper East Side. Food is always delicious, so flavorful, and dependable. The Khao Soi is a must, but everything else delicious. A must-try!
Very good food. Thai tea is not very sweet. Very good ambiance
No comment

Great thai food! Portions were perfect and the soup was SO delicious on a chilly day. The seafood tasted fresh and the leftovers tasted just as good the next day. I can't recall the name of my drink but it was light and flavorful. The staff was super friendly. Overall a really nice experience for my first time dining in NYC since covid!
No comment
Love the food. It's pretty authentic flavor.  Great staff, they were really friendly.  Will have to come back here whenever I'm in New York.
No comment
No comment

Great ambiance and really sweet, attentive servers who genuinely care about our experience. When it comes to the food, I would say it's comparable as the dishes I've had in the best Thai restaurants in metropolitan cities. I also travelled a lot in Thailand and the Tom Yum soup is just as how I remember it tasting there. This place ranks really high.

This place was damn delicious! Best Thai food I've ever had. Period. Along with the great food the service was quick and polite! We ordered the kra pow puffs (fantastic), drunken noodles (fantastic #2), golden Sachet (fantastic #3), shrimp steamed won ton (fantastic #4)

This place is great! I hardly have any complaints. The food and drinks are awesome. I just wish the staff didn't stalk you for you to be finished. Lol I really felt pressured to order another drink (which I was already going to) but I would have appreciated some time to decide. Other than that this was a bomb ass spot. Highly recommend the drunken noodles  so yummy and the hazy-something drink lol it's made with don julio and it's really tasty. The drink I'm posting was appealing b/c of the cup it's served in but don't let the cup fool you. The taste of it is meh! But the hazy-something drink was up to par for sure. Also, super quick service which I loveeeeee. Our food came within minutes of ordering and it was fresh!
Food was really good! We got basil fried rice and green curry, and the pea dumplings. The basil fried rice and curry were very flavorful and tasty! The pea dumplings were underwhelming.
No comment

Came here on a Saturday for an early dinner. Got the pad Thai, Thai iced tea, and drunken noodles. The pad Thai was arguably the best we've ever had, so saucy and flavorful. The drunken noodles and Thai iced tea were okay, needed to add soy sauce to the drunken noodles bc I felt it lacked flavor but it could be personal preference. The food came out in less than 10 minutes. Nam was an amazing waiter and very accommodating. Will come back again!
No comment

Great food and vibes! Got the pad see ew with tofu and the red curry with tofu. Both were delicious and fairly priced. Ambience is great here -- the decor is wonderful and intimate enough for a date night or casual enough for dinner with friends on a weeknight!

Got the Khao Soi with chicken and it was phenomenal. Pretty sure it's the best Khao Soi in the area. My girlfriend got the avocado massaman curry and it too was delicious. We also shared the Thep platter which had a good variety little bites with four different sweet  sauces. Overall, excellent Thai restaurant. I've had takeout here before and am glad I finally stopped in for dine-in.
One of my go-to restaurants in the area! The spicy udon is amazing. I always order from here, but the decor and ambiance are worth visiting for.
Got the chicken satay and the tom yum noodle soup. Pretty good food! Service could've been better, but we arrived about 45 min before closing.
No comment
thep is a nice thai spot in the upper east side. it is in a good location and nice outdoor setup.
Great place, cozy and the food is good. I keep returning  for their pad thai. I'd recommend
No comment

I'm glad their curbside, outdoor dining boxes had both heat AND AC capabilities. The food was good, albeit slightly overpriced. It was pretty busy for a weeknight. Unfortunately, you can't make a reservation ahead of time.
Great ambience with indoor and outdoor options! Nam (our server) was attentive and knowledgeable. Red curry with mock duck was very tasty!
Outdoor seating was lovely. Plates were smaller than expected, but the food was delicious. Would definitely recommend the avocado massaman curry and the Tom yum soup. Our server, Nam, is very sweet.

Picked up for take out. Spicy steamed Branzino was excellent--expensive but worth it. Wings are good (not exceptional and small portion for takeout). Siamese fried rice with duck tasty as well, as is garlic goddess with shrimp. Will return.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: We had the short rib massaman and the pork belly clay pot and both were amazing! Great drink menu too!
This place has a super cute interior and very nice exterior. The menu options are also nice.

This is it, yes this is the one! Creativity will be the theme for this review. I have had good thai and bad thai. While this certainly qualifies under the category of "good thai" it more so transcends this and enters the realm of creative Thai! They are creative in the way that they have adjusted seating for COVID, they are creative in the options they offer on their menu, and they are creative all the way down to the way they have orders taken (gotta go to find out (;)! The food itself was special, the pineapple chunks were exquisite and meshed so perfectly with each section of duck and each grain of rice! The spring rolls are the best I've had in the city hands down, especially when smothered with that unidentifiable sweet and tangy sauce! Their vegan options also were fantastic, but be ware, when they say spicy they mean spicy! That tofu was still sensational though! Will be back!
The ambiance is wonderful with pretty flowers hanging from the ceiling. The service was fast and super friendly. The Thai Tea was very good as well!

Beautiful decor, very modern. Service was ok but could have been more attentive. My 8 year old son had to hail down a waitress to ask for addl spoons and bigger plates before our food got cold. The prices were a little high for what you got. The fried calamari appetizer was overly fried to the point that it lost the calamari taste and texture. I wouldn't recommend it. The Khao Soi, Pad Thai and Massamam curry were all very tasty. However, the recommended bone-in chicken was very hard to eat and share especially given the vessels in which they were served. We might return with some modifications to what we ordered.
So good! I would recommend the pad see ew and Thep platter. No wait on a Saturday for lunch!
Wonderful fresh food! Great interior decor and ambiance. Don't skip on the sampler platter.
Amazing experience!! Love the cocktails and the pork buns! Great service and highly recommend!
No comment

Cute atmosphere (both inside and out) with pleasant and attentive staff.  Tasty drinks and decent portion sizes. One star off for noise inside, it's difficult to hear your own party sometimes, but I'm sure if you get a table outside it'd be perfect in the summer.
Good food. Like really good food. I was visiting the big apple for the first time, saw this place. And had to stop in. You will not be disappointed.

I dined outside with my family and consensus was that the food was delicious. Between the four of us there was calamari, spring rolls, wonton soup, and Tom kha soup with tofu as appetizers; then pineapple fried rice with both shrimp and chicken, pad Thai with tofu, and green curry with tofu. Our server was very polite and attentive and wore a mask properly for duration of our stay. We would definitely return.
The ambiance is lovely, food is good, and prices are relatively affordable for the neighborhood. Will come back.
No comment

This place was super cute. Very dog friendly, had individual pods for people to sit outside and the whole team dressed up for Halloween. The food came super quick and our waitress was really attentive.
Great food, made to order!! The pad Thai is always delicious. Definitely returning
No comment

Great food got the seafood pad see ew and shrimp pineapple fried rice. Definitely would come again
Beautiful restaurant with delicious food! I recommend the park mor and the golden sachet apps.

The Pad Thai is amazing as well as the Sausage Fried Rice!! I got the wings and the spring rolls as an appetizer and they were both amazing. Fast service, good hot food, and decent portions!
Good authentic Thai food on the UES. Fast service and good ambiance. Would recommend!
Great service, delicious food, wonderful options and overall good ambiance. Amm was a very sweet and helpful hostess. I'll definitely be back!

Such a lovely place! Love the deco, delicious food, and friendly staff. I live nearby and def come back here now and then!

Amazing food! Great restaurant for girls night out and cute Instagram photos! Would definitely recommend this place. The staff was great too!
Food was really good. Satay and pad thai were  good portion and reasonably priced. The happy hour (5-6 PM M-F) includes $8 mixed drinks. I had the lychee margherita and it was really good.
It was okay. I like the curry one better than the others. It is more American style than the traditional Thai food.
They have khao soi!! And delicious Thai iced tea
Tasty Thai food cooked with good ingriedients.

the place is soooo cute from the inside and out ! even though i came on a friday it wasn't too busy and we got seated instantly. the service is amazing and don't even get me started on the food . this is one of the best spots for thai and don't forget to get the thai iced tea!!
Amazing food, ambiance and service! Highly recommend! They check your temperature on the way in and have outdoor seating available. Big selection of thai food!

This is my second time at a Thai restaurant and it was absolutely amazing!!!! From the appetizers to the drinks to the entrees, it was just perfect. The aesthetic is beautiful. The service is also great!!!! I cannot wait to come back!!!!!!!
I loved the pineapple fried rice and duck so much! This place is Highly recommended!! Interior was very cute as well!

I did not like their outside location on the Side, in a kind of mountain cabin, but their front outside is fantastic. They don't take reservations and there is always a line but they take your number and call you when you are about 20 mins away from being seated. That works fine . Food is pretty good indeed.
The drunken noodle and Thai iced tea are delicious! Highly recommend. The service is excellent, with good ambience.
No comment

I met a friend to grab a quick bite on Tuesday and read great reviews so decided to give this place a try. Staff were wearing masks and outdoor seating were available. Staff were very friendly and we were quickly seated. We end up ordering the Cashew King Vegetable and Avocado Massam curry. Food came quickly and both dishes come with a side of jasmine white rice. The food were well prepared and comparable to high quality Thai I've had. Definitely would come back to this place and try the meat dishes next time!

We started off with the Golden Sachet and Papaya Salad. Both were delicious but the papaya salad was particularly refreshing! As a main course, we shared the Soft Shell Crab Fried Rice which was served inside a coconut shell! Overall ambiance was great and waiters were great as well. Will definitely come back!

My mom and I brought our dog for outdoor dining and ordered the thep platter as an appetizer, avocado massaman curry with authentic chicken on bone, and pad kee mao with chicken. The food was great. We also received a free Thai iced tea for writing a  review!

The menu had a number of unique items I had never seen before and I eat a lot of Thai. Food was beautifully presented, perfectly seasoned, fresh ingredients and delicious and a great outdoor seating set up. Definitely  a keeper!
No comment
No comment

Came here today for first and last time. I ordered spring rolls, Panang Curry and Duck Tamarind. Hard to believe because of the good reviews but the food here is horrible! The duck smell and taste horrible! The waitress agreed about the smell and void the dish. Tasted like old spoiled food. What happened? Panang curry was 90% broth 9.5% vegetables and 0.5% meat (three tinny small bite pieces) and on top of that, it was not good. Never again!
No comment

I love their massaman curry. Especially because it's topped with avocado. It is creamy and has a great peanut flavor. Pro tip ask for both tofu and veggies only $15. Bonus their bowls, plates and silverware are fancy. Their outdoor seating is great with a nice atmosphere. I can't say enough good things about this place. Best Thai in the UES.
No comment
No comment
I think this is the best Thai restaurant in NY!! The food is super authentic and delicious, and service is  impeccable!! Must try the Thai iced tea!!

Great outdoor dinning in own but with own AC unit. Also a heating lamp and fan. If you are COVID-19 aware, good place to go. Menus is great with lots of options. Free coffee or tea for review. Tom kha soup was great.

Really 3.5 stars.  Lots of outdoor seating is a plus.  The food was very good...but...our entrees came out before our appetizers.  So that meant that they put our food under heat lamps while they made the appetizers.  Friends complained that the Thai iced tea was not sweet...unheard of!  The chicken basil and shrimp pad Thai were good also.  But the peanut sauce looked like mustard!  And no desserts!!
No comment

The food we ordered was good. The sampler appetizer was good for sharing and trying different items but none stood out for me. I really liked the thep papaya salad - very tasty and refreshing!  My group also ordered the shrimp pad thai, lemongrass pork chops, and a fish dish (forgot the name). The fish dish was pretty spicy.  Pork chops were tender. I didn't try the pad thai but it looks a little too saucy for me.  I also tried the pop and cava drink and really liked it. They gave a real popsicle which was a nice touch - and definitely refreshing on a hot summer day.

The outdoor dining structures were beautiful and unique, and WARM! Perry took great care of us and our emotional support animal. The food here is always reliable, the red curry with shrimp won't disappoint, THANK YOU PERRY!
Food is so flavorful. Best Thai food ever. Very cute innovated outdoor seating. Will definitely be back.
No comment

I have been a regular a Thep Thai for the past three years. Let me tell you. There's nothing that isn't absolutely delicious. Some of my favorites include the calamari and Thep wings (the calamari is easily in the running for best calamari in the city. Change my mind). For entrees i always love the curry and noodle dishes. You can't go wrong with panag curry or pad see eiw. Service is always fantastic. This is a must try for Thai in NY. A true gem on the Upper East Side.
No comment
Best restaurant I'd eaten at in a long time. Food and service was excellent. Wish they allowed die two people to eat in one of their sheds.
Great vibe, very attractive set up while I was walking by and decided to give it a try. The food is amazing would definitely recommend 10/10!

Really nice place! We had great service and the food was good. I got the Queen of Siam Basil which was really spicy (and it says it was spicy) but dang it was off the charts for me. I still did enjoy it though, I wish the meal had a tad more substance (I got it with the squid). Overall, it was good. If I ever came back I'd get a different meal.

This vibe is popping! Great food, wait times are reasonable, and the atmosphere is on point
No comment
No comment

All for it. What a delicious Thai place in the UES. The service was very fast and even though we had to wait a bit on a Friday, well worth it. The drunken noodles with tofu were excellent! The rest of my companions loved their curry and fried rice. All very delicious and not too spicy, though I wish it has a touch more of that classic heat. The staff was super nice and the price point was very good for the area. Would come again!!

Delicious!! One of the best thai places in the area. I had the thai rice bowl and the wonton soup and both were so delicious.
Ordered the panang curry which had great flavor! Good value for how much vegetables and chicken are in the curry. I will be back!

Really like this Thai place. We love the curry, drunken noodle, and pineapple fried rice! Will come again!!
Loved the vegetable stir fry! And the coup was amazing. Would come again. Super clean and lovely looking inside

Super cool decor and really good food! Service was very friendly and had a great time with my friends here after a long concert! Definitely would visit again

Yummy! Great service and the presentation was beautiful.  And food was really good too

It's our annual go to place for office get together event. The food is quite authentic with rich flavors that can appease anyone's palate, spicy or not. I also routinely order from them for delivery and bring my kid to enjoy their chive pancakes! Great place and almost always packed! Check it out if you're in the UES!
No comment
No comment

The first stop we made to NYC was at Thep Thai for lunch! Nothing is better than our fave comfort food! Was recommended to check this place out from the Yelp reviews and clearly did not disappoint!  We went for lunch around 2pm, there weren't many people there so we got seated inside where it is so aesthetically inviting and pleasing. Very zen vibes. We ordered the ube dumplings stuffed with peanuts and despite the purple color of the dumplings they were AMAZING!!! We also ordered the coconut water and the passion fruit drink, both super refreshing on a hot, humid NYC day! For our mains we ordered the classic pad Thai with tofu and the pineapple fried rice with tofu. Again presentation was on point! Food came out very fast! Very aesthetically pleasing and clean! Now let's talk flavor, for the pad Thai it was classic however I'm not sure if this sauce was sweeter or if there was an additional ingredient to it, it had a ketchup like aftertaste, which wasn't that bad but sweeter than I expected for my pad Thai. The squeeze of like helped balance the sweetness out but it was a bit sweeter. The pineapple fried rice was beautifully presented, I wish it had a bit more pineapple chunks in it as I was digging through the rice for more bits of it as well as it had more curry like spices that perhaps I am used to. Overall however, I'd come back and order the same dishes and more again. Hence the 4/5 stars. The service is excellent, the food is clean, delicious and aesthetically please as well as the restaurant itself.
Get a free Thai iced tea when leaving a review! Have not eaten yet....will update soon!
The food is pretty good here. The decor and vibe are great for summer time! We ordered soft crab fried rice, drunken noodle, and pineapple fried rice. They are all amazing! Great for pictures!
Fast and friendly service! Food was delicious :) got the drunken noodle with shrimp and papaya salad. Papaya salad had a nice kick!

No comment
Great spot for drinks, apps, and authentic Thai entrees. The service and atmosphere is wonderful, and having outdoor seating is a plus!
No comment

Loved all the food! Our table got seated quickly and the service was awesome! My favorite dish was the khao soy, the noodles were crispy and perfect pair with the curry. Thai tea was just right and not too sweet. Would highly recommend this restaurant!

Loved the food and ambiance! Portions are a little small, but the food tastes great. The Thai Tea could've been a little sweeter and creamy but nonetheless was still good.

The food here is amazing. I've tried a couple of their dishes and the spices are on point. I would eat here everyday if I had the time. They recently removed the drinks from the lunch special shop that's a huge disappointment...

This restaurant definitely focuses more on how the dishes look rather than how they taste. The pineapple fried rice was beautiful and I would get it again just to take a picture, but it wasn't amazing. Just a normal pineapple fried rice. The cocktails are very expensive for the size, so I will probably only be drinking water next time I eat here.

Really aesthetic looking place and the service was great-- the staff were diligent in checking up on us. Food was pretty good-- great option for those who are vegetarian/vegan. Great place to eat for brunch with friends!
Delicious food--drunken noodles was bomb. Cute outdoor seating too! Tried the pineapple fried rice, Penang curry, and the tamarind duck.
This place is lovely! Great vibe and great food. A really nice addition to the upper east side.

This is my second time having THEP. The first was with my family who was visiting and we tried the appetizer sampler, pineapple fried rice, the red curry, and drunken noodles. I loved it all that I ordered the drunken noodles again for carry out. I got it mild-medium spicy and it came with a lot of beef. Highly recommend!
Great food, like the vibes, no wait to get a table on a Thursday. Would definitely come back.
Drinks are unique, decor and interior is esthetically pleasing, fast service and apps were delicious. Would recommend for a quick date night.
Great authentic food, very chic decor. Highly recommended !! Best Thai food in the neighborhood
Pretty restaurant, great peanut sauce, handling the outdoor serving very well. My daughter loves the Thai iced tea
Amazing food and great service! The khao soi is especially good - very creamy and flavorful.

The food was really good and the service was super quick! We tried the clay pot and the garlic goddess wok dish. Both were delicious!

Nice tasting dish! The flavors blended well and it was satisfying.
Great green curry and excellent service! The Tom yum soup is my favorite and excellent ice tea

I had the pad kee mao, or should I say pad kee wow! We started with the pork buns which were delicious and also had a refreshing thai iced tea. 10/10! We are in the private outdoor cabins which were heated.

Food was pretty good, the Thai iced tea was very good. Flavor was good but they don't really have higher levels of spice at all--my girlfriend asked for extra spicy and it was at best medium. While the times were long, it was Valentine's Day so it was understandable. The outdoor booths aren't particularly warm, but they tried. Cute date spot in the city if you're looking for one.

I mean our food was beautiful with tonnes of flavor...The Chicken coconut soup was great..The rice peanut dumplings even though weird color were amazing ..Chicken Satay was okay kinda dull and very tight on the peanut sauce....The panang curry was perfect...The only was the short rib which on second attempt was good but first was undercooked....My wife had finished her meal before I got my main and they did not even offer a cocktail or anything and had the nerve to charge us for the comp Thai Iced Tea because we would not write the yelp review in from of server!
Great food and service! We were seating immediately and had our appetizers within 5 minutes! Everything was authentic and delicious. We can't wait to come back!!
The dinner was amazing and there is such a great ambiance. Perfect place to bring a date
amazing thai food! ordered shrimp pineapple fried rice and pad thai :) 10/10! tried at other thai places in ues but this is my go to place
Incredible food and service!! Their platter and cloud 9 cocktail is a must. Love the newly decorated space as well, a vibe!!
This is a good Thai restaurant for curry. It has very  thick curry paste. We really like it. If they can make fried tofu in curry it will be even better!
Great restaurant and service! Loved the chicken wings. And highly recommend the Khao soi! Great place on the Upper East!
Excellent pad Thai! I like the outdoor seating pods too. Would recommend the Thai iced tea

Ate here in the outdoor booth during the winter and it was a great setup, had a heater! I ordered the khao soi and it was fantastic. Surprisingly I was stuffed after that. Only complaint is that I wish the heater was a little warmer.
Yum ! got the pad kee mao and it did not disappoint . service was good and fast, surprisingly efficient even given covid conditions!

My 2nd time coming here and once again the service did not dissasapoint. Great quality food, variety, and customer service is a perfect blend. And compared to some other locations the price are decent. Also beautiful decor! If you're looking for a new Thai spot I definitely recommend this one.
Cute and ambient setting!! Food was good. We got pad see ew, pad thai, calamari, tom yum soup. Servers were friendly
So happy to walk by this place..Beautiful place and great food! Highly recommend this spot in Upper East Side!!
Nice food and nice ambiance! Service was great and fast. The green curry chicken was delicious.
Great service, lovely decor, they  held our table when the last person in out party wasn't there yet. Very sweet!

Extremely good service and the Thai iced teas were very good! Only thing was that the food was very pricey for what you got (but hey it's NYC) and unfortunately made my fiancé and my stomach upset afterwards.
This place was super cute! They have individual wooden booths with great heating. There's options to have indoor or outdoor dining. Food was received quick and was yummy.
nice atmosphere and fusion thai food. must go thai place in town. they have the new summer menu, beautiful colors
Great food, longer than average wait time, recommend the pad Thai. Nice neighborhood place.

Beautiful outdoor decorations and floral arrangements. I've been here once before and have ordered out 2-3 times. The drinks are made well. The crab Rangoon is my favorite appetizer. The drunken noodles are really good and great spice level!

Very cute restaurant, lovely presentation of the food, and good service. I like this place a lot, but I really only come here when there are no tables at Up Thai, the slightly superior alternative located one block away. The tofu pad thai at Thep could honestly be better. The noodles and egg are good, but the tofu is pretty tasteless. It's grilled but tastes completely unseasoned.
Great food and ambience. Came here in December 2021 to eat and ordered duck curry. The duck was a little rubbery on the skin side but overall it was delicious.
The vegetable pad thai is horrible..dry with barely any  vegetables..very disappointing

Delicious food, really good atmosphere, and awesome plants! A great spot for dinner. Pad Thai was very good!
food is delicious! the best Thai food on the upper East side!

This restaurant was on my top 5 restaurant to visit. The food was amazing and top notch. However the customer service was atrocious. The Hostess was rude, condescending and at one point dismissive. I waited a long time for a both that had no remote to contact the server and a view of garbage and a parking lot. I did ask to be seated someplace else. The response I receive was it would take between 20 to 30 minutes to get a better booth with a better view and a remote which was advertised on TickTock. Besides the food this was not the best experience

amazing ambience & great service - the food came out so fast! the food is  absolutely amazing - i recommend the peanut dumplings & thai sausage fried rice!

Good Covid setup. Delicious pad kee mao. And great iced coffee! Great service as well.
Really delicious and a nice neighborhood spot. The golden satchet, papaya salad, and soft shell crab fried rice were amazing. Would definitely come back again soon.

I am disappointed in this restaurant. I called ahead of time asking if there was a space for two in the outdoor dining area (as we are COVID safe), and they said yes. When I arrived, they said we could not sit in the outdoor space as those were for tables for four. Most of the outdoor spaces were empty, and the waitress on the phone had said "it is a very slow night." They only said that we could sit in the indoor dining area (with all the other people) because we were a party of 2.  As we are COVID safe, we do not want to sit with a crowd of people indoors. It was silly that they refused to seat us outdoors, as we would not be taking up space for other customers.  As I said previously, the outdoor spaces were mostly empty. My friend and I are very disappointed.
Come during their happy hour for special prices on drinks. Don't get the pancake, it's wasn't what I expected and it wasn't that good. The pad Thai was delicious with lots of flavors.
Got the ginger joy dish! It was really good and fresh. I really like the fact we could sit outside to enjoy a nice day. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive
No comment

Hard to enjoy food when a place keeps you waiting forever and then makes excuse after excuse for why the delivery was so late. At least refund the darn delivery fee if you can't deliver close to on time. And then the litany of excuses, "we're busy" "we're short staffed". Well so are we all, but many of us don't make promises we cant keep and if we fail we try to do something to make it up to the customer rather than keep them on endless holds on the phone. But even after putting aside my anger at how we were treated as customers, the food was marginal at best. And of course cold and dry.
No comment

Has great outdoor dining options with a nice ambience. Awesome plating. They sprayed down my baby's high chair before giving it to us. Table and chairs are clean. Great place to have lunch while social distancing. Food is great, standard Thai. Big portions. Overall great place. Service was superb.
I just moved here , it was my first experience of Thai food in New York , It was really good ! But it could be better than this for New York!

Highly recommended! I found out about this place's amazing outdoor seating setup from a few sites and went early on an evening after work. The individual cabins were cute, cozy & warm! We were able to take our jackets off on a very cold day. The service was prompt & food was great - we had the crab rangoon & curry puffs + special pad thai and garlic shrimp. Everything was tasty and the portions were very large. They also had a great happy hour, and we followed with specialty cocktails during dinner that were delicious too. I can't wait to come back to try more dishes; likely great to come with a small group too since you can share & try a bunch of dishes (trust me everything on the menu looked amazing!) So glad to have found this gem in my neighborhood, I'll definitely return especially with friends who still want to do outdoor dining even when it's cold.
No comment
No comment

Ordered the lobster and branzino for entrees which were delicious. Branzino was packed with lime. Peanut dumplings were ok. Tom yum soup was ok. Thai iced tea delicious and service was great. Would come back try more. Sat outside with heaters was fine.
We stopped in for a quick bite to eat and enjoyed every bite. Food was great, I enjoyed the Drunken Noodles and Penang curry.
Savory, super filling food! We ordered the Kanom Jean Nam Ngeow and Hung Lay with Thai coffee on the side. Staple joint of the 'hood.

Came here for the decor but honestly loved the food! We got the spring roll and golden satchets for starters and then I had the pork belly entree. Pork belly was tender, but I actually liked the massaman curry with the avocado more. Would come again to try the other dishes
We just came here for lunch. The food was pretty good and came out to us very quickly. Our server, Pat was very helpful and answered any questions about dishes on the menu.
Really great set up outside. Individual dining booths outside. Excellent service throughout the meal. Recommend using the waitlist through Yelp to avoid having to wait in person.

We had such a lovely time at this restaurant! The food was fresh, perfectly cooked, very satisfying and healthy at the same time! The decor is beautiful, beautiful plants, glowing lights, and I really appreciate all of the plexiglass partitions. I felt very safe here. Will definitely come back!

The outdoor seating is very cute, cozy and warm! The food was delicious! I got red curry and it was super tasty! The service was great all the staff is super kind. They are also super clean and taking all the precautions for covid.
This thai place has amazing outdoor seating with heating. Loved the pad kee mao (chicken) and their thai iced coffee! The chicken dumplings were also really good!

Saw this place on tik tok and was so excited to try but ehhhhh if you want good Thai food and drinks go to sea in Williamsburg , the bartender here was amateur , drinks were not good and food was okay and  got cold so fast

The service was very bad and slow. They kept on forgetting to bring us napkins, soy sauce, hot sauce. They brought it at the end when the meal was almost finished. Also the girl gave alot of attitude. The food in general was really not worth the price. Parking is also ridiculous. Overall I would never go back

the pad thai here is dry!!! i've had their drunken noodle before which is the only salvageable thing on the menu. my vegetable pad thai today had no sauce and barely any vegetables!! see photo attached.

Ordered the Khao Soi for a change and it did not disappoint. It's similar to the Red Curry but instead of rice it comes with the noodles. Absolutely delicious and will definitely recommend!
Awesome spicy udon noodles and papaya salad. This place always delivers and has a cute ambience. Friendly staff and good service

THEP has had a veryyyy quick come up in the neighborhood, and for a good reason. Although they have only been around a couple years, their popularity has grown rapidly. They have beautiful interior decor as well as a whole corner of outdoor seating which they also decorated nicely. They have an extremely similar menu to the popular thai restaurant down the block. At first I thought there was no way they would keep up with the quality, but I was wrong! The food here is just so good. In the past when I worked nearby, I had ordered the lunch special quite frequently. My favorite lunch special included crispy gyoza and pad thai. I was disappointed though, when I returned to work after the Covid shut down,  sat down at Thep to order my usual lunch special, and they told me they are no longer doing the lunch specials. I had to leave and go down the block to the other thai restaurant to satisfy my thai craving. I understand a lot of restaurants lost money during the shut downs but it is also too expensive for commuters to order from the regular menu during working lunch hours. I am not sure if they have since resumed the lunch menu but I never went back since they had stopped.
Pad see WOW! My taste buds were blown away because I was in these warm cabins. Although it could be warmer.  Must order Thai ice tea.

The noodles were so soft and tender. Probably one of the best pad kee mao I've ever had. They had different levels of spice (usually not offered in other Thai restaurants.) Ratio of meat to noodles is actually on the higher end so that's a good bonus. Their pineapple fried rice is so cute, it comes served on a pineapple. The outdoor seating is very pretty and indoor ambiance is lovely as well. Waitress was also very kind and pretty!
No comment

Excellent Thai food and service was exceptional! Went on my lunch break and the restaurant was super busy ... I was amazed at how quick and attentive the servers were. The lunch special was perfect portions and included soup or salad with an appetizer and entree. The decor was warm and welcoming! I will definitely be back!
My go-to for Thai food in UES. I took my cousins here a year ago and they still talk about how good it was. Haven't been since they built the outdoor space , but looks great!
No comment

Our favorite Thai spot. I love the fried dumpling sachets. And the pineapple rice and the Thai iced tea.... Only thing I would caution against, the shrimp isn't cooked with seasoning. So I've learned to avoid dishes with shrimp.
Best Thai food in NYC - so consistent, always quick great vibes inside and awesome take out situation
Amazing food. Very authentic with a nice wait staff. The drinks were great and creative and the cashew king w shrimp was to for

DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY.The service is HORRIBLE. They are solely focused on money and not for the customers time to ENJOY THE FOOD. I understand there is a long waiting line but they are literally eye balling you for you to leave. The waitress almost hit my friend in the eye with the paper bags she was trying to hand over him. Food was good
Visited with family and friend. Very clean, nice. The portions are decent sized and very flavorful and tasty! Definitely recommend!
Delicious food ! Absolutely great service ! Came here for a surprise lunch , will absolutely be back again. Very zen and cozy inside . Great music
Ambiance is amazing, food is great. Only thing is portions were too small. Wish the food was more spicy.

Delicious foo. Great atmosphere. Wish I had more sauce.

I really loved everything about this restaurant: the decor, lighting, the dishes that the food is served on, and of course the food. We got crab rangoon, drunken noodle, and green curry. Everything was amazing! Would definitely recommend!
One of the best Thai food we had since being in New York.  The tom yum soup was delicious and we are coming back for sure!

Cute place with amazing decor. Still reminds you of a wintry wonderland. Ordered the khao soi for the first time and it was delicious. Its tender chicken on a bone served in coconut curry broth with egg noodles. Slightly on the salty side but overall good. Thai iced tea given with yelp check in and it was also pretty good and not too sweet which I like. Would definitely come back to try more of their food.
The food was delicious, hot and tasty as usual. Wait times are a bit long in the evenings, I recommend making a reservation.

Amazing food, I had the pad see eiw with chicken... ultimate favorite is the pad kee mao (drunken noodles). Ohh and the drinks are amazing! The dodge rum drink was gooooood!!!!

Food and drinks were amazing! Came here for a date night and it was a great ambience. I recommend the indoor seating so you can get the full vibe. I got the pork chop which was delicious , and the calamari ! One of the best calamari I've had. I recommend the cloud 9 drink as well. Will be coming back

Great ambiance, food was delicious! Got the udon noodles and kao sao. Staff was friendly. Would come again

Thep offers consistently delicious food with friendly service and greet atmosphere. The dishes are inspiring, original and bursting with flavors. They also have yummy drinks. And they've done a fantastic job with the outdoor space. Highly recommend.

Food was super tasty! I happened to came across it on Yelp, after trying to go to another restaurant on Christmas Eve, which was unfortunately closed. My friend and I were pleasantly surprised by the food. Luckily we got there when tables were turning over so the wait wasn't long. Food came out quickly. Surprisingly, we were able to partake in the lunch special and yelp check in special ($1 Thai ice tea or coffe). It was a full size drink and was very tasty! I ordered the fried dumplings with drunken noodle. Dumplings were crispy and the noodles were spicy, to my liking! Would go back another time to try their curries!
the Khao Soi was DIVINE!!!! If you love Thai food and are looking to explore a new option, get the khao soi, you will not be disappointed!
beautiful and very tasty drinks! the service is quick once seated and the ambiance is very chill.

Their waitlist system is ridiculous. They claim to use the Yelp waitlist but end up closing it. So you go to the restaurant and are told it's a 1.5 to 2 hour wait.... It's absolutely crazy to expect people to wait in the cold for 2 hours.  Boo.

Love this place! I was looking for a Thai restaurant that served gluten-free options. After reading a couple of reviews, I was on board... And I'm so glad I took a chance! Today, I ordered the pad Thai with extra vegetables (with a gluten-free option) along with a side of tom kha soup. It was so good! The flavors were on point and the portions were decent. I was able to break it up into two meals for lunch and dinner. I ordered through their website so that I could get the extra 10%-15% off. And I will continue to do so whenever I'm in the mood to have Thai food. The delivery came quickly and it was very simple to order!

We came in here after a day of shopping - super hungry. The vibes and food are both great! We got pork buns, spring rolls, pad kee mao and sweet potato pad thai. All very delicious! However I was hoping the sweet potato noodle would have been like the japchae noodles rather than simply a shredded sweet potato.  We will definitely be back to try more things on the menu!
No comment
spicy udon noodle was very flavorful. the chive pancake appetizer was really good as well.
No comment
This was an amazing lunch brunch girl date. We age in their outside dinning area. The servers are lovely and attentive. The food is amazing. The service is phenomenal

Had an amazing dinner at this restaurant. I've had a lot of thai food, but they really elevated here with varieties of options. The customer service was very good! Rocky, who's the waiter helped us pick the most delicious appetizer. The whole dinner was very nice.
Thep Thai delivers on great, tasty food. Had the duck salad and Thai coffee. The meat was fresh and as were the veggies. Prompt service and Delish!
Went here with my family! Very friendly and good food!! The service was very fast and there are nice decorations around the restaurant!
The ambiance of the restaurant was great and the service was very fast. The workers were nice and the food was amazing!

I don't know where to start this is one of my go-to Thai spots in the city. I have literally brought all of my friends and family there. Some of my favorites are the Fried Calamari, Pad Thai and the Siamese Fried Rice. I recommend this to my coworkers, visitors, etc that's ever in the city. I went here twice for two different birthdays so even a great place to celebrate.

Looks expensive but the prices are actually pretty fair and affordable especially for the upper east side. Great portion size and super kind service. The bathroom is also very fancy and well kept. Tofu pad Thai ($12) as pictured below is savory, filling and delicious. They also provide a wedge of lime to add some tang. Overall, I think this a great spot for lunch and dinner.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
GreAt experience this restaurant closes at 4:00 pm to reopen so please get there early enough. The booth was personal and private, just what was needed for a birthday celebration.

A quaint Thai neighborhood restaurant with a great Papaya Salad and nice waitstaff. I don't drink but couldn't help admiring the pretty cocktails being ordered next to me. They have the staple dishes pad Thai, soups, curries and fried rice but the charm is you can choose your protein- chicken, vegetarian, Long Island duck, beef, shrimp and so much more. Go with the duck. Not a fan of their  Tum Yum soup- way too salty. Worth stopping in if you are in the area.

Our first time in New York, and PAT helped us out on the menu and in the city. I found you guys on Yelp, really cool and very nice place to come and eat. Everything is organized and done so well. The food was the BEST THAI FOOD I've tried so far. The basil fried is 10/10! Will definitely recommend this place.
Food amazing, ambiance amazing, decor amazing, excellent service. Not one plate I tried from what we ordered was subpar. I will for sure come back, 6/5 stars!

Fantastic food, fantastic service, lovely ambiance. Highly recommend! We had the sweet potato pad thai (so delicious), pad see ew (great), and the appetizer platter which was a great starter. All yum.

THEP has been saved in my list for a bit but never gotten a chance to try it until now and omg THE FOOD WAS AMAZING!! If I could, I would give them 6 stars haha. Everything was flavorful and came out hot. We thought our food was going to take a while since it was busy (even on a Tuesday night) but it came out pretty quick! Will definitely be coming here again hands down best Thai restaurant that I've been to!!
No comment
Excellent eat there last night and loved it.  Very authentic, very fresh and high quality.  Nicely presented and good service.  Recommended.
No comment
No comment
Always satisfied with the food here! Best thai restaurant in UES! Highly recommend for dinner and drinks!
No comment
Very clean and friendly. Came here one for dinner (outdoor) and it was great.  Came back for lunch (dine in) and felt safe.
Always a great time at Thep Thai !!!!!!  Great ambience, chicken taste like chicken. Hahahaha good times for sure

Atmosphere is great! I would recommend making a reservation on the weekends as it tends to get pretty busy. Staff is super friendly. Noise level can get pretty loud but I don't mind it at all. Just means it's lively :) The food is THAT good, so be sure to try it out!
Excellent Thai iced tea!  And overall solid Thai fare, from basic but great pad thai to more esoteric dishes. Recommend.
No comment
The new setup for COVID looks so nice! Great atmosphere, AMAZING food, and super friendly staff!!

Food is good, but since it's Covid time, I've been ordering online. Twice I have ordered through their online portal and both times they have a time for the food to arrive that has never been accurate. Food has come over an hour later, over 40 minutes or so after the time they say it will actually arrive. So sadly, I don't think I can continue ordering from here. And if you do, I suggest you order when you're not hungry and plan ahead.

One of the best Thai places on the upper east side. I order takeaway from this place regularly and the food is always delivered on time. One time, they forgot to send the thai ice tea and I called them for the same. They were very apologetic and I received it within 5 minutes! The pad kee mao are great and spicy! The garlic vegetable wok is pretty great as well!!!

This is now my favorite Thai place in UES (even higher than Up Thai which is quite good).  The waiting area is heated which is awesome in the winter.  The Yelp wait list makes it quite easy to get a table in a reasonable time.  I liked the decor and ambiance of the place.  My cocktail was delicious.  It was a seasonal cocktail with earl grey and egg white.  It was foamy, had a rich depth of flavor, and was just delicious.  The Tom yum soup was hot and flavorful.  The drunken noodles were the right amount of spice and not bland at all.  Overall, great quality and can't wait to come back.

One of the better Thai places on the upper east side that has good food, great ambiance, and such sweet waiters! Our food came out at a reasonable time and every dish was good. From the pad see ew, pad Thai, to the curries, and the mules. Definitely will be back to try other items on the menu.
Delicious wan ton soup and steamed shrimp dumplings! Great, friendly service and clean, private cubicles.
No comment
beautifully decorated and beautiful presentation of food! i would recommend the thep platter as a way to try everything for a good selection of everything. khao soi here is really good here too!
Looks great when I walk in. Very much looking for food as I am so hungry. We got two appetizers and two entrees. Steamed Branzino tastes good. The duck too. Made a good choice for dinner!

I've been here a few times. It is really good. I've tried Green Curry, Massam Curry no avacado, Drunken Noodles. I've gotten lunch special twice. They give you a lot of food. I like the soup. The dressing on salad is a bit weird. I think the drunken noodles are a lot better here but the shrimp is better at Up Thai. The calamari is really good. The food is very fresh overall. They are really nice. Great service.
No comment

This restaurant is outstanding! Awesome food and ambience. Had the lychee thai tea (yummy), red curry with squid and shrimp (squid was cooked perfectly), crab ragoon, and chicken satay. Great service, great food, great time!
The food is amazing here. I loved the outdoor seating with warm heaters inside during covid. Super cute. The dumplings are so so good! Def worth a visit!

Great atmosphere and decor. But most importantly the food was great. Flavors were complex but extremely well balanced. My taste buds were practically at Coachella. Each bite was another hit song from the restaurant.
No comment

Do not order from this restaurant it took them over an hour and when I finally got through they were so rude about it. He lied to me that it had left the restaurant when it hadn't and then just hung up.

I've only been to THEP Thai for lunch (so far), but their lunch special is pretty great. If you dine in, you can get an appetizer, soup or salad, a drink, and an entree for $12 ($10 if you do tofu). On a recent visit, I ordered the pad kee mao (drunken noodle) with chicken, an appetizer of fried chicken gyoza, green salad with ginger dressing, and a Thai iced tea, and was very satisfied with lunch. All of the dishes were done well, the portion size was just right, the noodles had a nice heat to them (but not overwhelming), and the salad was so refreshing. In addition to the good food, the space was nicely designed and really bright and open, the air conditioning felt wonderful on a 90+ degree day, and the service was friendly and efficient. I would definitely come back to try more (for lunch or otherwise).
No comment
No comment

One of the best thai place in town. Amazing food,amazing ambience makes it just so perfect. I visited this place with couple of friends for a birthday party. Hey all the couples its a perfect place for date too!
While the menu is not as extensive as their competition UpThai a few blocks away, it certainly can satisfy a Thai appetite. The decor and service are delightful.
No comment
Tom Yum soup is delicious. Cocktails are even better. Overall, fantastic spot. Good for happy hour, too.

Food is really good, but I'm taking a star off for the lack of organization and professionalism of the host. She took our names, but seated a couple of parties that came after us before us, and it seems like she didn't know what she was doing. Other than that, food was tasty and flavorful and portions are adequate too. I also got the pomegranate popsicle drink which was interesting.
No comment
Good food. Great outdoor seating. Comfortable atmosphere. Definitely will come again.

One of my favorite Thai spots in the Upper East Side! This was my first time trying the Pad See Ew with the crispy duck and I was super satisfied! Probably one of the best places to get duck in my opinion. The servers here are also very nice and attentive. I also like the ambience inside, it gets a bit loud at times but the decor is beautiful and they also have outdoor seating!

column3: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: This place was so delicious. We really loved the red curry; and the chicken was delicious. Service was fast and everyone was very nice. The pad see ew beef was a little dry but overall had very good flavor. The plus is also writing a yelp review you get a free drink! It's close by to the hospital to so very good! Our server Pond was very nice and she really paid a lot of attention to making us feel comfortable in our eating space.

5/5 for accommodating the S.O. and I so quickly! There was a two hour wait but The hostess was very kind and was able to sit us immediately(just not in those cool tents). Then Tony, our waiter, was so pleasant, quick and efficient! Great staff, great food!
No comment
Flavorless food. Would not recommend it! Our order was all vegetarian and it did not feel like any effort was made to prepare it with the appropriate seasonings.
sat quickly, attentive service, great ambiance, excellent food (chive pancakes, vegan pad thai, vegan queen of siam)
People are nice. The inside atmosphere are cozy. The outside tables are separated into rooms. The food looks pretty and tastes good. Overall good experience!
Great food and excellent service. I ordered the curry puffs, Khowsuey and papaya salad. Would come back for sure

The restaurant was easy to find and very pleasing inside. The aesthetic is so nice and cute. I also liked the service and how quickly the food came out. The lunch special was a good price and nicely presented.

Great ambiance! Tried the lemongrass porkchop rice. Huge portion for the price! A bit tough to cut the porkchops. In terms of flavor, the lemongrass flavor is pretty light, but compliments the side sauce very well. And best of all, it comes with a side of veggies

THEP Thai Restaurant offers fresh, flavorful thai foods. Their customer service is excellent and I would love to come back and dine in. Also, if you want a good thai tea, come and try it because they are not too sweet but a perfect balance! I'm usually picky and this place did not disappoint me at all.
Love the food here. It's great that they have gluten free options. I ordered the Tom yum soup with shrimp and the drunken noodle with shrimp, both gluten free.

I was looking for a good thai restaurant in NYC and this place seemed the right one. I ordered THEP pad thai and fried rice with seafood. Both tasted really really good  and the service was superb! Next time in NYC, I'll def come back here :)
No comment
No comment

I am a travel writer and I have been on a thai kick recently. I am EXTREMELY picky......I wanted to try a place that I have not been before...I came into this small well decorated restaurant to get a wine and an appetizer......wine list by the glass are very important because it sets the tone...I sat down and was waited on by JOY!!!!!!!! What a gem she is!!!!!!! I ordered a lovely glass of rose and the spring rolls.......so good! The restaurant has a warm and inviting feeling and the attention to detail...they really pay attention to details! I ordered another wine and the steam shrimp dumplings........AMAZING! I wanted to specifically thank JOY!!! She made my experience perfect!!!! I look forward to going back!
No comment

As you all know, NY is somewhat saturated with thai restaurants and you'll probably find that some of them are special whereas most of them kind of just blends in altogether leaving little impressions. Let me tell youknow, THEP thai definitely falls into the first category! Their appetizers and entrées are all innovative without letting go of the traditional flavors. I would 100% recommend the THEP platter because you get a sample of all the different appetizers they have from crisp spring rolls, to the golden sachets and tbe chicken /shrimp dumplings! All of which are pretty good and wont disappoint. As for entrées, the crab fried rice and the green curry. My friends ordered othets such as Pad see ew and pineapple fried rice but i especially enjoyed the complex flavors of the crab fried rice and the curry. Presentation was excellent, flavor was excellent and service was excellent! And dont forget to end your meal with their delicious coconut sorbet!

The decor is amazing and the drinks were great, however the pad Thai and the fried rice were pretty underwhelming. Considering that these two dishes are typically your staple foods at any Thai spot, it was a little disappointing to get a pad Thai with no peanut sauce and a fried rice that barely had any salt or soy sauce. Service was fast and drinks def helped redeem this place.

The food and service were great! Very nice stuff. The food came out really fast and was fresh! I had the pineapple fried rice with beef, it was really good! Definitely recommend this place and will be back soon!

TWO STARS FOR SERVICE THO and definitely DO NOT try this place for any birthday fun... the food was so good here BUT so many oddities I'm still trying to figure it out.  My birthday was this weekend and I wanted to go somewhere close to home so we ended up with THEP. My husband called for a reservation In which they told him they do not take reservations here. When we arrived someone said "we called in a reservation" the host said ok and escorted them to the table. *shrugs* so they take reservations? The food is amazing but they really make you feel rushed. Multiple waiters and waitresses arrive to move you along with getting outta there lol. I think they do not have specific tables assigned and they help at any table at any time with the goal of turning the tables over quick. My husband asked for a dessert menu and said "it's my wife's bday" the waitress said we do not have anything for bdays lol ... ummmm, WE ASKED FOR A DESSERT MENU not a birthday cake with candles. They speak pleasant with their voice but the actions just don't match. Lastly, some of the seating is communal and unfortunately my site line was a guy picking and digging in is nose non stop eewwwwwwww so gross.
No comment
No comment

THEP Thai Restaurant was super good and very affordable. We couldn't believe how cheap this place was. Terrific menu and terrific Khao Soi. The service was also perfect and everybody was kind. THEP Thai Restaurant is definitely worth checking out.
I loved this place I came here because I got lured by TikTok! The food was amazing! It was really cold so don't expect it to be warm.
No comment
No comment

By far the best Thai restaurant on the UES. I almost don't want people to find out about it, as I'm worried it will become too crowded and have a wait. Currently they don't take reservations, but usually you can get right in. Dishes are above and beyond the normal offerings at a Thai restaurant. Ingredients are fresh and flavorful. Our favorites are the shrimp papaya salad and Thep pad thai, in which the noodles are wrapped in an egg crepe and the dish is topped with giant madagascar shrimps.
This is a great Thai restaurant! Tasty food and good environment! Will definitely come back again!
Very good place! Always on the lookout for a great Thai restaurant. Very tasty starters and delicious food. If you are a tourist or local, I would highly recommend!

I have been there twice and today will be my third time. Absolutely love their options especially it's one of the best place of you are vegetarian. Normally,  I don't like Thai food but Thep has been my fav Thai restaurants so far. A must must visit
No comment

I really liked the ambience and aesthetic of the place was great. I went with a group of friends, we got pad Thai and drunken noodles. I enjoyed the food, having tried Thai food from a few different places this was pretty good.

My husband and I came to NYC for a New Years get away, and the ambiance of this restaurant is so on point. You forget you're in New York. The dishes are beautifully put together. Pond our server was very responsive. The flavor of the food here is unbelievably good

The place is so cute. The ambience is very romantic. The customer service was really great and the food came out pretty quickly. I got the goddess garlic with the black coconut rice. The black coconut rice was pretty tasty but dry. The goddess garlic was good but the sauce was rather watery. The pad Thai and the drunken noodle tasted great! And the puffs with the sauce! I would definitely come back.
Solid Thai restaurant in the neighborhood. I've come here a few times with friends and the food has always been excellent. Our server Nam was great!
No comment
Service was great and fast; came in on Saturday night at prime time 8PM; got seated in 30min. First time trying this spot hopefully it's good
Delicious food. I got Pad Kee Mao (Drunken Noodle) and my bf had Avocado Massaman Curry. Both dishes were very good! Not overpriced! Ambiance is nice. Cocktails seem a but pricy. $15+

It was good , the portion were big as well. I was in the area and stopped by. Even though it looks expensive the prices are regular. I recommend. Spring rolls were stale tasting tho. I ordered the Thai fried rice. Flavors were there. I wouldn't get spring rolls again.

I'm giving 2 stars because the delivery was prompt. Pad thai was absolutely awful. Salty chemical taste. Heavy on noodles and sweet salty sauce. Ingredients didn't taste fresh or balanced. Chicken was possibly even a little bit off. It also tasted more like low end Chinese take out than thai. I would never order here again.

Let me start by saying that I love Thai food. I came to this cute restaurant after work for dinner. Started off with the chive pancakes which were delicious. They had the perfect crunch on the outside and a  great sauce to pair with. For my main course I had the Khao Soi noodles and my bf had the avocado massaman curry. Both were amazing. Not a fan of spicy foods, and this was just the perfect amount without being too overbearing but still flavorful. Our waitress was great and super attentive as well. I had one of the seasonal drinks which was really delicious. 10/10 I do recommend
No comment
No comment
This place deserves 5 stars in all aspects- the ambient, service, but most importantly, the flavor. This place is truly a gem - it's ideal for a small gathering or romantic date
Wow! I love the food here! fresh and well flavored. I had the Udon noodles with vegetables and red curry with shrimp . The pineapple fried rice with shrimp was also delectable love
Never disappoints. Always on target. I travel from NJ for their tea leaves salad! Always delicious food. Highly recommended. Without a doubt!

THEP is one of my favorite local places! They're so accommodating of all diets and the menu has all the gluten free and vegan options clearly labeled. The last time I was here, I ordered the pad see ew prepared vegan with the spring rolls appetizer. The waitress came back a few minutes later and let me know that she had double checked with the kitchen and the spring roll wrapper had egg in it. It was so nice that she went out of her way to check for me, since I had carelessly assumed it would be vegan and didn't even think to ask her. On top of the great service, the food is always delicious! I love the chive pancakes and pad see ew. THEP is definitely worth checking out of you're looking for great Thai in the area!

Simply AMAZING! One of the best Thai restaurants in NYC - and they have lots of gluten free options. Gluten free drunken noodles are a gem in general, and here they are absolutely delicious. A little bit pricey for Thai, but worth every penny.

Finally made it to THEP this afternoon and I wasn't disappointed.  Started of with lovely Thai iced coffee since I need my caffeine.  I then enjoyed the wings which were nicely flavored and green curry is probably one of the best ones I had in sometime, it was well balanced so not overly sweet and it had a nice heat to it.  Finished it off with an old fashioned - hazy something.  Definitely worth a visit and the decor is so adorable

good food, and good service. I ordered the pad thai mixed seafood medium Spicy. It was a good mix of sweet and spicy but I Think the price is too much for what it is. Better to go to up thai down the street
No comment

The weekday lunch special is a steal! It's for dine-in only, but it comes with an appetizer, soup or salad, and an entree. I had the calamari, salad, and tofu pad see ew for only $10, which is unfathomable for lunch in this area. The calamari was delicious and crispy, and the pad see ew was good (although I wish the tofu had more flavor). I wish the food was hotter temperature-wise since both my calamari and entree were just warm, but you can't beat a $10 lunch around here that still tastes yummy.
Very good. They offer outdoor dining space and heaters. Staffs here are very friendly.
Great food (red curry and drunken noodles). Service was good. Biggest issue was that we had to wait an extra half hour after being notified to come because the  group at our table would not leave
No comment
Very COVID safe restaurant, staff are all wearing masks and adhering to social distancing. The red curry was very delicious.
No comment
No comment

Seriously the best drunken noodles I have had in NYC. I discovered it through seamless about 2 years ago from my roommate, and veggie/chicken style are so delicious. They withstand the test of delivery and stay warm and fresh when they reach your hungry stomach. Even leftovers are amazing. Also have tried their spring rolls which are standard fare. I dined in about a year ago, and its excellent service, great interior. Of course that is not the case at this time, but delivery is still top notch and fast. Do yourself a favor- support this local business and do take out with them and your tummy will thank you.
Delicious! Great flavors, especially the Kao Soi and the THEP chicken wings! Great place for dinner or happy hour!

This is a solid Thai restaurant but it is incredibly popular, so be prepared to wait for a table. I had the Tom Yum soup with tofu and it was delicious - I would highly recommend. I had the pad see eiw noodle dish with tofu as my main and really enjoyed it. It was definitely a large portion and I had a lot leftover. Overall, I think this is a great value. The ambiance inside is very cool and they currently have a lot of outdoor seating.

The food at THEP is exceptional! Very tasty and well prepared! Their pork bun is a must try! I love the service at the place and the satffs are friendly and accommodating!  I highly recommend this place! :)
No comment
Service was amazing and food is DELICIOUS!! Best drunken noodles I've had in NYC (add chicken!)
Tasty! Lunch special is a good. $13 for all the food in my pics, see attached. I like this place more than up Thai. I've also been to the Nuaa which has more sour fermented tasting dishes
No comment
Delicious Thai food! Friendly service, def would recommend this place. Pineapple rice and the appetizer platter are my fav.
No comment

Portions, flavors, service. It's all amazing. This place is usually packed so the old S/O and I were pleasantly surprised to be seated immediately when we came early evening on the weekend. Ending up getting pineapple fried rice, green curry, tom yum soup, and pork ribs. Highly recommend all and then some. The flavors in the tom yum had to be among the best I've ever had - frankly ridiculously flavorful. The service is also absolutely off the charts. So friendly! Visit here and come back often.
No comment

Awesome place. Really good service and proper precautions for COVID-19. Seating area outside is well maintained and separated. Follows proper COVID-19 guidelines. Som was really helpful and gave really good service. Friendly & nice. Would recommend.

Food was good but some of the staff are incredibly rude. They also give customers who write reviews a free drink but the catch is that they watch them write their reviews, effectively gatekeeping the reviews.
The Khao soi and Pad see eiw were both amazing and delicious! And the thai iced tea was just the right level of sweetness!
Private heated dining, great authentic selection of Thai food, good service, would recommend and would come back again!

If you like Thai food avoid Thep. The scallion pancakes- here chive - are served in thick gluey triangles. Pad Thai, a ThaI staple, was a messy mass of thick gummy noodles with some crushed peanuts- no relation to the right taste or texture. the place inside is noisy and cramped. Service is terrible- we asked for a check which took over fifteen minutes to arrive. There are many other Thai restaurants nearby that are far superior in every way.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Amazing food and even better service! Love their pad Thai, avocado massaman curry, and pineapple fried rice. This is our favorite neighborhood Thai restaurant. Will keep coming back for more!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: They don't take reservations.  I had passed by when walking & saw they had outside individually, isolated tables which is the only thing that can work for me since I'm immunocompromised in the midst of chemotherapy. I called ahead at 8 blocks away last night at 5:30pm and asked if they had an outside table available for 2 people.  Yes!,,,I was celebrating the last treatment of 6 months of chemo treatments and felt good enough for a great dinner.  What a treat.  Upon arrival I was told I could only have a table on the porch in the midst of a mob of people very close together; that I must have 4 people to sit in the isolated area by the street.  I nicely explained my situation as above and asked that the man make an exception,  No go.  I offered to show him my bald head to prove it just wasn't a story, He said no, no exceptions, he excepted a busy night,,,(How's that I thought?  You don't take reservations!) Clearly having lost the my nice debate style, I then told him, well you could chose to have 2 very thankful customers for life or never again,,,a customer who would tell this story to many others, or not.  NO!....We  left....No, I don't think I'm the most special person on the planet, but I do know what common decency  is and the management of this restaurant sure doesn't have it relative to decency, decision making, communication/skills, customer service, or empathy.
No comment
No comment
Very nice food. Must try the Pad Thai. The fish is also very delicious. It's close to the train station. Nice environment.

The food and service at THEP Thai is truly great! I got the khao soi w/ mock duck and sometimes khao soi can be a little too sweet but this was a great combination of sweet, sour and savory. The ambience in the restaurant is also great - the decor is beautiful and the service is fast!
Drunken noodles were ok, needed a little more salt and flavour. Ambience of the restaurant is nice, and the staff is courteous.
No comment
Everything was amazing, was a little bummed that they only serve deserts on certain nights; but overall everything was great.
No comment

One of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city! Food is great. Food is served pretty quick. Prepare to wait for a table. I prefer to come here in the summer when there is seating outside since the restaurant is small and you can have a long wait.

I'm sure based on the reviews there's other good items on the menu. I got shrimp paid Thai and it had no flavor at all. Just tasted like noodles and I was pretty disappointed. My fiancé got a different dish and enjoyed it though.
No comment

Have tried multiple Thai restaurant and this one is by far my top tier choice. Really enjoyed the curry shrimp and Pad Thai a lot. The restaurant is clean and cozy for date/friends reunion. Thai tea is also delicious but slightly sweeten.
No comment
No comment

Tried the avocado massaman curry and it was solid - not as creamy as I had expected and the portion was a bit on the small side but the flavors were solid and it's good for pouring over rice or noodles (ie. strong reheat value which is key for Thai takeout).
No comment

I really enjoyed my experience here. The place feels very urban inside with fun hanging plants. There is also outdoor seating if you prefer. We had their Thai iced tea and lychee Thai iced tea -- both tasted great and weren't too sweet. Our meals came quickly and in a fun display. I had plenty leftover after my meal as well to take home. I will definitely return in the future to try something else on their large menu!
No comment
I'm daughters choice after we went aight seeing. We enjoyed our lunch so many choices of unique food and so beautifully presented!!! The restaurant is very clean and quality decor modern decor!

Good service, almost too good, like the moment you stop dipping, they clear your plate. My friend was like I wanted that sauce!  You know what I mean, a slight sense of being rushed through dinner. I got the sweet potato pad Thai which was a risk I knew, unfortunately it was WAY too saucy and very sweet for my taste due to sugar in sauce not the potatoes. No veggies at all, Just a little egg and sweet potato. I was very disappointed with this $22 dish. I barely eat any and never finished my leftovers which is unheard of normally for me especially with Thai which I love.  I thought I would fix it at home with veggies and more egg to soak up some of the sauce-never happened. The dish repelled me in fact and ended up in the trash. The fresh rolls were good.  The prices are a little high for the quality. We sat out front, which was loud with buses and cars.  I would recommend sitting inside or on the side street.

I'll start by saying the food was very good!! I was disappointed in this restaurants "bait and switch" tactic. I made a reservation for 4 people to get lunch their during the week. I specifically looked for a location with a nice lunch special. When I found THEP Thai I was very excited. I checked their website to see their menus and confirmed the hours/days they were offering it. When we opened the menus there was a big "not available" sticker over the lunch special, and this ended up doubling the price of our meals. I understand during COVID restaurants have to do what they have to do to make it, but it should not be advertised if you don't offer it.
After OBAO changed their sauces and chef this is hands down the best thai food in NYC! The tom yum soup has soo many layers of flavor it is a must try!
No comment

One of the best Thai spots on the UES! I've ordered takeout from here a few times before, but went for dinner the other night. They have a really nice outdoor setup, with tables spread out to a safe distance. Tables are first come, first serve but thankfully there was only a few minute wait. I had the Drunken Noodles (just spicy enough and always my go-to!) and my friend had the Goddess Garlic with tofu and rice. We also ordered the edamame and spring rolls to start. Service was great and everything was delicious!

Beautiful ambience, very nice and personable staff, and amazing food! The food is very homey and really gives an authentic Thai experience. The owner, Rocky, was present during our meal and was kind enough to speak to us and present the vision behind the food they serve. Food quality and presentation, an authentic vibe, and the light aura define this place. Thank you!
No comment
No comment
My first time here - loved the food, the vibe, the service and the interior design! The chicken sewers, the Pad Thai, the clear soup - everything was delicious.
