The decor is so beautiful and the lighting + floral arrangements are calming. I came during mid-afternoon and staff was so sweet and checked in a lot. It was my first time eating here so I got something simple, the chive pancakes and chicken pad Thai. I asked for it a bit spicy and it was super nice. Not overly saucy/sticky/sweet. I would come back again and try other things for sure!

This restaurant was pretty good!! The interior has really nice decor with succulent themed lights. We got thai iced tea, pad thai with chicken and pineapple fried rice with chicken! The waitstaff was always very kind and we loved the experience!!
Thank you Som for the lovely lunch. Great service. AMAZING food. I can't recommend this place enough.

After many Thai restaurants I've hunted down on the upper east side, I've come to settle for the pat see eiw here!! And hear me out, they have lunch specials from $10-$14 including; appetizer, soup/salad, entree and a drink!!! This is definitely a bargain especially if you guys are like me who love variety in a meal!!! I'll be popping in often!!!
This spot was great! The food was fantastic and the heated cabins were a much needed warm retreat in the cold NYC winter. Would totally recommend coming here!
No comment
No comment
I had the Chicken Pad Thai! It was very yummy and I love the decor of the restaurant!! I would definitely recommend this place to my friends.
A great place for Thai dinner. The drunken noodles were tasty and they came out fast. The decor is fun, especially as you walk in! Excellent service, I would definitely return.

Great service, food, and ambiance! Exceeded my expectations all around. I've been wanting to try this restaurant forever but have not had the chance to since it's super hard to get a table unless you come in around 5pm. We got pineapple fried rice, Tom yum soup with shrimp, green curry, and spare ribs. Everything was delicious! What stood out was the service- super attentive and nice servers. Definitely recommend this cute little Thai restaurant.
No comment
Food is not great, just average amd mediocre. Thep platter was a waste of money. The only decent dish was the small ribs.
No comment
No comment
I love this place, great entrees, lovely outside and indoor seating, great service. I got the drunken noodles and sausage fried rice. It's just a gem on the  UES!

This is one of the best Thai food places in New York. There is outdoor booth seating, which is heated and secluded. The food itself is simply fantastic, done to perfection. The service is phenomenal. Come here if you haven't.

They have nice outdoor dining on the side with an awning and also tables that go into the street.  Ordered the chicken wings too heavily sauced and a bit spicy.  Ordered the chicken skewers which were very big .  The peanut sauce was good.  The avocado with chicken curry on the bone was flavorful.  Ginger tofu and chicken were also good.  Prefer Up Thai for food because I thought presentation was better and food quantity was better.  However I definitely like the seating at Thep better because you are not sitting on second avenue.
Love this place! Food and service were good. Will definitely come back! Perry is very nice and helpful.

Just went to this place for the first time today and they're amazing! the quality of the food is great, it is so delicious Their drinks are great too, they definitely make them well. This food is catering to my soul in a way i cant explain! My boyfriend and I took advantage of their lunch special and whether you go with soup or salad you can't go wrong ‍It is also a really nice place for a date. The prices are reasonable too.
No comment
Got the drunken noodles and the pineapple fried rice. Both were good, the noodles were especially spicy. So if you got melanin in your skin, you don't have to worry. This place has the flavor.
No comment

A solid dinner choice! My friend and I shared a few dishes. I highly recommend the tea leaves salad and the khao soi noodles. They had a happy hour deal $7 wine, cocktails and margaritas. We decided to skip the alcohol but we did take advantage of their check-in deal which was a $1 Thai iced tea. Staff is very friendly and the decor is nicely done. Definitely will come back!!!
No comment
SO GOOD! Definitely one of the best Thai places here. Everyone here is very friendly as well.

Masamman curry with chicken was excellent. Good portion at cheap price. Free Thai iced tea for a review was good deal (though I think made from a solution rather than fresh?). Amazing nice helpful staff. Good ambiance and decor.

Delicious food, i tried lunch special- fried calamari, salad and drunken noodles with shrimp and all were well prepared. The downside is the noise and tables set so close to each other and it is almost impossible to squeeze in in order to sit. I understand they want to accommodate more clients but it creates a discomfort as you can't really have a conversation and enjoy your food.
I really enjoy this restaurant.  The staff are friendly and the food is amazing.  They adhere to COVID restrictions.  I felt really safe in a private seating area outside.
Nice atmosphere, friends people. My wife and I ordered basil fried rice and pad thai. The food looks and tastes great!

I really enjoyed my meal here. I got the pork belly(pictured) and it was cooked very well. It came with a side of white jasmine rice. I asked to substitute the white rice for black rice but that was an additional $3 so i passed. If you check in on yelp, you get a $1 thai iced tea. The calamari is very crispy and the sauce it comes with is excellent.
Great food and reasonable price especially for this location. Recommend the Pad Kee Mao and Basil fried rice

We came here near the end of lunch but the staff was so accommodating. Ordered the Pad Kee Mao from their lunch menu and was blown away by the flavor and quality of ingredients! Lunch portion also came with a nice salad and fried calamari which balanced out my meal quite well. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in town.

Great food, great service and such cute decor! We had a lot of great dishes and had a great Thai iced tea. All of their plates were plated so nicely. We had the summer roll which even had some flowers in it!!

Came here the other night with 3 friends for a friends birthday and the atmosphere was lovely. We had a server named Perry, she was amazing! She was bubbly, kind and patient with us. We ordered a bunch of apps and everything came out hot! Correct! And quick! It was all so good from the pork buns to the chive pancakes to the "omg" Kra-POW puff. And the drinks were really good also, once came with a popsicle that was so yummy. But Perry really made the experience what is was, thanks so much to her and the lovely host with the short black hair, we had to wait a little longer than expected and she tried her best to keep us in the know and cool, we appreciated the whole experience. Will definitely drop by again, especially  for PERRY!
Great place and great food! A perfect Thai restaurant in Manhattan! Definitely will be here again.
No comment

I stumbled upon this place by chance to have an early dinner and it did not disappoint. The papaya salad and thai iced tea were my favourite. Super cosy, great ambiance. Will come again if im in the area!

Thank you Rocky and Team Thep! Not even 10 minutes from my original review posting and I received a message from the owner. An owner and establishment that goes above and beyond to ensure the upmost quality and care of services received is truly amazing! Rocky even personally had the order redelivered freshly cooked and visually appeasing! Looking forward to continually eating from here! Also thank you to the chef that remade my order which is delicious.

This place was great! Their outdoor seating is one of my favorite things - very private and heated!!Our server Pat was super nice and accommodating. Food came out super fast and was yummy! I would definitely come back
Where else in NYC you can get $1 Thai ice tea plus happy hour drink os only $7. order the appetizer platter. My fellow new Yorkers, check out this place if the wait of UpThai is too long

Lunch special was almost too good to be true: I got spring roll appetizer, salad, and pad Thai all for only $12! This kind of deal is rare on the UES. Not only was the deal good but the food was delicious and the atmosphere was chic and hopping with people. I'll definitely be back.

Came here for the lunch special, the portion size was good. I got the green curry with vegetarian duck. The vegetarian duck was really good and they gave me a lot of it too. The pad thai was ok, a little burnt taste and the tofu was cold. As for the thai coffee, it wasn't too sweet but also kinda bland not much coffee flavor. The service was great!
No comment
Great drunken noodles! Tasty food for takeout, and great vibes indoor for dine-in. My go-to Thai restaurant on the UES!

I highly recommend this restaurant. The staff was very nice and polite. Ka, our server was very sweet. He was very patient and kind to us. The food was amazing, everything was hot and flavorful. I will definitely go back!

This is the first time my family and I went to this restaurant and we love it. It is a great environment to go for Thai food. Staff is also friendly. If you like spicy, you will like Kanom Jean Nam Ngeow Noodle. Highly recommended!!!
No comment
This spot is so cute! Amazing service, the food came so fast and was so delicious. the outdoor sheds make it a perfect covid dining spot. There was no wait when I went for lunch.

We are so happy that we were able to get a seat here.  The food was presentable and DELICIOUS!  Portions were also good for sharing.  Pim was our waiter and she was so nice.  Would love to come back here
Great food and great service :) will come again. Be sure to get the curry with avocado, it's to die for.
No comment
Very lively and welcoming Thai spot. Great staff and great food (presented well). I would definitely make this a go-to spot with the family.
No comment
Food was amazing, prices were really reasonable given location. Our server Pond was very gracious and attentive to our needs. Would definitely come back

Can I just say WOW. Really loved every minute of this place. Food and service was amazing from beginning to end. Had many menu items as pictured. The soft shell crab fried rice was a special on the day we went. I really enjoyed the food here if you like Thai food this place is a must check out if your on the upper east side. Def one of the top Thai restaurants in NYC. Plus the silverware wasn't silver and were gold plated gives this place a feel of royalty eating.
Beautiful restaurant and very nice staff. Food is unique too. It's awesome to find Chiangmai Thai restaurant in the UES neighborhood.
THEP thai is such a cozy restaurant! My girlfriends and I came here to grab some comfort food on a rainy day and we were satisfied with all of the familiar Thai dishes that we love.

I got the chicken red curry and jasmine rice, plus Thai Iced Coffee. The portion was generous and rich in flavor, though I would like the curry to be a little bit less sweet and chicken a little less over cooked. I did get the $1 Thai iced coffee which was a great deal! The vibe is great and the decor is beautiful. I'd come back to try another dish and hopefully bump this up from 4.5 star to 5-star!
No comment
Food was great! The wait time wasn't long and food came quick. The outdoor seating is great for big parties and even has an AC in the rooms. Cute corner store in UES.
Great service and great food! Nam was our server and she was super nice! Would definitely come back again :)
No comment

Really tasty Thai food. Service was excellent. We got our apps & drinks in minutes and our entrees even before finishing our starter platter. We ordered  Udon Noodles (not pictured), Basil Fried Rice & Drunken Noodles. We had a fantastic lunch & will definitely be back. Come through Upper East Siders !
No comment

This place is great! I ordered online and delivery was really quick. Crispy calamari was crunchy and delicious, and the Panang curry is excellent. I like that the food is not greasy. It tastes cleans but delicious. Will definitely be ordering again.

Second visit and it's now officially in the rotation. Next time we are trying the pineapple fried rice. Each selection was yummy in the starter platter. We had the tamarind duck and shrimp pad Thai as entrees . The duck had crispy skin and they pour the yummy sauce at the table for a great presentation. Drinks are delicious and fun. Perfect for family or girls nite dinner.
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Got the drunken noodle. Yummy! Veggies were fresh. Waitress was fast with h20 refilling. Also with review, get free thai tea

In a crowded Thai market, particularly in the upper east, Thep stands out. Much more modern / trendy vibe than most Thai restaurants and outdoor seats are awesome, but hard to get. Great selection of cocktails (Thep Mule is fantastic) and high quality, authentic cuisine
Delicious. Nice staff gave good res. Good vibes. Very quick service. Thep platter was good

Picked up food from this location which we decided to explore while taking a stroll on the UES. We ordered the drunken chicken noodle, basil fried rice and panang curry. Extremely satisfied with the flavor and felt -among all the Thai locations we've been to in nyc and long Island - Thep Thai ranks right up there. We will be back.
Yummy food. Great Thai tea. We particularly enjoyed the noodles in coconut with the bone chicken.
No comment
No comment

This is the best Thai food I have had in a long time. The service was impeccable. They are so speedy and so kind! We each get our own heated little cabin- super safe in the covid times. I got the tom kha soup which was incredible, and the pad thai, both made vegan! We also shared the chive pancakes. YUM. We are both so full but can't stop eating. They even brought us free coffees! We will absolutely be back very soon.
LOVE IT HERE!!! so full but can't stop eating. Already thinking about what I'm gonna get for next time!
No comment
The best in the neighborhood! Appreciate the easy vegan options. Delivery is always fast, and they have made the COVID pivot quite well.
This place is soooo good! The ambience here is incredible. I got their shrimp pad Thai and it was amazing. Would go back again
Amazing food and atmosphere. Try the avocado curry!
Thep Thai is a delicious Thai spot on the upper east side. The curry hits the spot and the noodles are tasty. The lunch specials are great value and it gets busy at lunchtime so that's a good sign.

The outdoor seating and ambiance at this restaurant was incredible! Our server Perry was so sweet and accommodating. The service was fast & friendly with amazing food as well. Would definitely recommend getting there early as this spot is very popular & fills up quickly!
No comment
No comment

I called for a reservation, they said no need to make a reservation as they were empty, but after paying for a ride to the restaurant (only 15 minutes) when I arrived they told me there was a 45 minute wait. Completely inconsiderate of my time and wasted an Uber ride.

Love their app platter and gorgeous restaurant! Came here with my family for dinner and everything was great. We ordered the pad Thai, drunken noodles, app platter and green curry. Definitely check this place out if you want authentic Thai food and great Service!

4.5 When this place first opened I came here and didn't like it. The food was not well seasoned and cold. BUT NOW during the pandemic I decided to try this place again after seeing good reviews and I was pleasantly surprised. I will definitely comeback and I recommend it EVEN IF IT IS PRICEY.
No comment
No comment

Great good & service but overpriced because they cheated me $5.00 extra to the THEP Bowl for 3 Little pieces of shrimp which if you're going to charge extra then provide the appropriate serving to the additional cost for protein items. It was safe and casual atmosphere... the service was nice but again over priced but perhaps not since it's located on upper booshie east side of NYC
Great quality Thai food and very observant of safe covid practices. Very happy with their service and will return! -Julia

First time and New York and first time in this amazing restaurant. Will definitely recommend this place for anyone visiting or living here already. The hospitality here is amazing even with the whole covid pandemic they are extremely careful and understanding. Pat/Pak was an amazing employee thank her for helping and making this experience well work it here. FOOD is amazing as well . 10/10 for me .

This is a NYC favorite of mine for Thai food. An amazing spot during the COVID pandemic especially since they have private outdoor "rooms" that are heated. Pear was my server and she was absolutely delightful. She was very attentive to us and made sure we were being taken care of. The food was of course delicious, they are the gold standard for traditional Thai dishes as well as some original modern spins
No comment

The ambiance is super cute, especially on a sunny day when you can sit out on the street to enjoy the breeze and people watch while eating. The place is clean, service was good and the food came out pretty quickly. The food presentation is something notable. I wish their dishes had just a tad bit of unique twist to it, but can't go wrong if you are looking for traditionally well done Thai food.
No comment

Beautiful Thai restaurant on the UES! The food is as good as the aesthetics! Tried the golden sachet, mamasan with avocado, and khao soi. You get the chicken on the bone, so it's nice and juicy. Portions are large, so you could probably split a dish with someone. After considering the portion size, the prices are definitely reasonable. Don't forget to check in for a yummy $1 Thai tea! Cozy spot. Would definitely come again!
No comment
Great ambiance! Great service! Can't ask for anything better on a good summer day in UES! Also was stoked to find a place that had khao soi
Great restaurant with amazing menu items.  Great staff. Pad thai and basil fried rice was fantastic. Definitely recommend If you are visiting NYC.
No comment

Tried THEP for the first time last night after a friend recommended it to me. I got the honey pork ribs and vegetable pad Thai. The ribs were a bit fatty, but were still glazed nicely and the pad Thai was pretty good. The vegetables and the noodles were cooked well and I enjoyed the sauce it was in. I also got a Thai ice tea which I got for $1 because I checked in on Yelp :) The atmosphere of the restaurant was nice and overall I enjoyed the meal.

This was definitely some of the best Thai food I've had. I had the drunken noodles and my friend had the pad Thai. Both were very good and flavor was on point. Service was fast and friendly, the space is cute and clean, presentation was nice too. Would definitely come back next time I'm in the city!

Pretty good! The chicken puffs appetizer was great.  The ground chicken wasn't dry at all, especially with the added cheese. The Thep pad thai wasn't anything like standard pad thai, it's served with glass noodles that are much milder in flavor.  I was missing the sweet and sour sauce of standard pad Thai, but still enjoyable.
Great green curry!! Super delicious with tofu and the outdoor seating is really nice. Enjoyed the company also, came with my dear roommate!
No comment
No comment
No comment
This is one of the best Thai places I've ever eaten, food quality, good price and really good taste.
Such a great environment to eat for lunch, dinner. The staff is so personable and professional .. The food is amazing; the best on the UES!!!! Come enjoy the taste of Thai in the city !!!
Pretty good. Duck is from Long Island - I confirmed. I like knowing where my food is from.
Great meal! Our waitress Nam was lovely and Had the Pad Thai with Duck was delicious. Will be returning

Happy that we chose THEP for dinner! For outdoor dining, they built these individual nooks that I think will make winter dining more comfortable. The food was tasty and the service was very friendly & attentive. Will be glad to come back for another meal.
The food and drinks were so good, I booked and fight just to go back and eat!!! See you soon
I love the food here, it's one of the best Thai restaurants in town, staff is very nice too

Food was amazing. Starting off with the juicy pork buns that I finish in about 30 seconds. The crispy shrimp dumplings were a lot better than I thought. Then we got the pork belly dish and the Khao Soi and the serving size is huge so you will definitely be full!

Two words: Yu mmy.  The food is so good, and beautifully presented.  Staff is attentive and efficient.  It was such a novelty to come here and enjoy a delicious meal with a friend in the age of Coronavirus.  Five stars all the way!

I love this restaurant! The lunch deals are so great - they range from $10-$12 and it comes with an appetizer, soup or salad and an entree. It's convenient and the the environment inside is super nice. Bonus: the spoons are super nice as well!
No comment
Excellent service and amazing food. I really enjoyed the outdoor patio while eating. The menu is big and the wings are my go to.

Delicious pad Thai with many different options for style (they have a GF sweet potato version!) and toppings (all different meats, including duck, and vegetarian versions). Drinks are unique, solid mixes, and delicious to boot. Highly recommend the Cloud 9 if you like your bitters.

First time visit here to celebrate our son's birthday and everything is great here. Food are tasty, service is great. Nancy is super friendly and nice. The food portion is big here. We ordered a bunch of appetizers and all of them are delish!!! Highly recommend this place. Definitely will come back when we visit Upper East Side again.

THEP is our go-to for both a tasty weeknight meal at home and  a special dinner with guests on the weekend! My husband and I love to order in, and we've also brought family here when they visit. Everything I've ever had has been great - the Tom Kha soup is so especially comforting and delicious that I crave it all the time. The portions are large, so I usually get to enjoy leftovers for lunch the next day! Today I had the special seasonal Kabocha Coconut Soup and the Cashew King with chicken. (So yummy!) I'm happy to live nearby this place, but I'd come back often even if we moved away.
The service is very bad. The food is good. But the staff don't know how to talk to people.

Came here for dinner and found a seat by the bar so me and my girlfriend decided it was perfect since I wanted drinks and she wanted food. We had the shrimp dumplings and calamari, which were good (the shrimp dumplings was a little off for me, can't put my fingers on it but I felt like the shrimp wasn't seasoned as much as I would have liked) we also had two cocktails, Pom & bubble  $14 and the Dodge the punch $15 although they are PRICEY they actually taste really good and if your an IG lover like me these take really great pics.  We also tried the pineapple fried rice with shrimp, they had great presentation and the rice was delicious. So why did I give a 3 star.... the restaurant is SMALL and people were standing behind us like sardines in a cab while we were having dinner. I think guest that cannot fit in the restaurant should wait outside, there should be no reason why I'm eating and someone is on my back. The bartender saw this and he gave us a look like damn I know there uncomfortable but nothing was said, and as much as I am outspoken, I really tried to keep it together lol and be classy. They need to keep guest outside if they are waiting, this place is too small
No comment
Exelent food Excutive interior fabulous service . My first time here right after Hurricane but magically everything was just perfect . Thank you so much . Enjoying so much

I have this place bookmarked for quite some time! Excited to finally try it. They have lots of outdoor seating, and today happens to be beautiful outside. We got seated right away, by friendly staff. The presentation of food was very impressive and delicious! Definitely get the khao soi!
No comment

I went to this place because a friend of mine recommended it to me once. It's always busy which It means it's good. I got a drink with a pomegranate popsicle inside, so cool! A little bite: pork bun, perfect for two people. And, as a main course I had a Hung Lay ( pork belly with ginger and peanut sauce). Be advise that it comes with rice. The portion was perfect and the food was good. The only reason I didn't give the 5 stars it's because the waitress put us the Tap in the table without we asked for.
Service was great, food was exquisite, Thai iced tea was delicious, and the presentation was nice. I would definitely eat here again!

I have been looking for a great Thai restaurant in the city for a while and hands down definitely one of the best Thai restaurant I have been to. The atmosphere is very modern, chic yet casual enough for a drop in dinner. The service is incredible, very tentative to all their customers and super friendly! we will definitely be coming back!
No comment
No comment

THEP was so good! Our server, Pond, was very friendly and very helpful thank you Pond! The food was delicious. We got the THEP platter (highly recommend you get a taste of everything with great sauces to try), the THEP papaya salad (super fresh and perfectly spicy), and the Drunken noodles with duck which were very flavorful and crispy. It was a great amount for 2 people. Would come back again and again! We sat outside too which was lovely and well lit. Also, we got the cloud 9 drink which was pretty and light! And Thai iced tea which was flavorful and not overly sweet. A great dinner and a great night with my dad. Highly recommend if you want fresh and flavorful Thai food with a nice environment and great service.
This place has really good Thai iced tea. One of my favorites and the staff here is very attentive and polite!

THEP thai is one of the best thai restaurants I've been to.  Portions are great and the taste was wonderful. My table opted for shrimp pad Thai, pad see ew, & green curry. The fried fish and curry friend rice were plated nicely. Thai tea was a plus as well!
Outdoor and indoor seating. Good food, reasonably priced. Got the pad see eww with chicken, lots of meat, sauce a little too sweet for me
A wonderful restaurant, great food. My mouth was dancing from happiness would very much recommend.
amazing food and service! would definitely recommend to come here for lunch. the ambiance is very nice.
Great atmosphere for Thai and friendly servers. Got the pad Thai and khao soi, which was both flavorful. The pad Thai was delicious and the portions were large

Very attractive restaurant from the outside and gets more intriguing as you step inside! Great place to get wonderful food and have a relaxing day with friends! Waiters are amazing and quick service:) Highly recommend for a nice day and meal!!

The outside area was enclosed and protected us from the cold.  We also saw there were makeshift private booths on the sidewalk which looked very accommodating.  The service was slow as they were busy.  We were largely ignored since we were in the corner.  We had to flag someone down to order.  The food came quickly but then we had to wait and flag someone down for the check.  The food was decent tasting.  For the prices they were charging, I was expecting it to be amazing.  When I had to pay, I didn't like that they brought over a device that showed the total including the tax.  The suggested tip on the machine was a percentage which included the cost for tax.  I prefer to tip on the pre-tax amount and did not see this information on the device.  The server was also standing over me as I tried to figure out how much would be a good tip so I had to do a very rough calculation.  I don't think I will be returning any time soon.

Great food. Great service. Beautiful decor.. I  order  lunch  here many times and was so pleased with the food  that I decided to try them for dinner. The food is super authentic, the ambience is whimsical and romantic and food is so good! Must try !!
No comment
3000000% recommended! I loved everything! The staff was super friendly, food was delicious, and the dishes presentation was marvelous!. I'll definitely come back!

My boyfriend and I walked in on a weekday afternoon and decided to take advantage of the lunch special.  We were seated immediately.  I loved the ambiance and can imagine it would be even better at dinner.  With the lunch special you get a starter, soup or salad, and an entrée.  We started with the pork buns as an appetizer to share and then I ordered the fried chicken gyoza, clear vegetable soup, and basil fried rice with shrimp and he ordered the fried calamari, clear vegetable soup, and drunken noodles with beef.  Everything came out quickly and tasted delicious.  I might pass on the pork buns next time, but we will most definitely return in the near future!
This place was so good! We got the pad Kee mao and pad see ew and the noodles were springy and so flavorful! Highly recommend

had the BEST service from waitress NICE ! the sweetest and she made sure everyone was taken care of. the food here was amazing, everything came quickly and hot. we had a great time and the outdoor seating was so cute. 10/10 recommend the pad thai
Delicious food with authentic flavor and portions good to share. Easily my favorite Thai restaurant in New York!

Spring rolls were a bit oily, but service was fast and server was really friendly. Our table also ordered chicken satay, the meat was a bit hard. And we ordered shrimp dumplings which we found to be the best of the lot.
Very quick seating and their dinnerware is super unique! The duck salad and the starter platter were amazing. Would definitely recommend to dine here!
Service and amount of options while remaining authentic and tasty is impeccable.the menu has pictures to accurately represent what is on the plate.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: My girlfriend and I came here for a quick dinner. The food was good but the service wasn't. Our waitress made us feel unwelcoming. she had a bit of an attitude.
Went for take-out dinner.  Very friendly service but both of our meals were (barely) average at best.
The food is really good and the ambiance is very cozy...i had a wonderful time enjoying the food. The staff is very accommodating and place neat and clean. Love to come back again.
Really good Thai food. I love the thai ice tea, chicken satay and fried rice. The environment is nice and clean.

This restaurant was one of the main reasons I visited New York for my birthday. It did not disappoint. The food was AMAZING and the drinks just as good. Would travel to New York again simply for this restaurant. I also need to point out how hardworking and accommodating their staff was and is. Really incredible place!
Literally the best Thai I've had in the US. Absolutely awesome service even when they are slammed. Great drinks too! Highly recommend getting the puffs and pork bun as apps.
No comment

Food was very good but honesty  was lacking due to  a staffing shortage. I was told I would get an outside table in 20 minutes. Every 15 minutes I was promised until about 50 minutes was offered a table inside. Inside was very loud and made the meal unpleasant. Drinks came 30 minutes after ordering due to 1 bartender, after the appetizers. I would have preferred to be told the truth and returned at a less hectic time.

Super good! Everything is super flavorful, the atmosphere is beautiful and the service was amazing. Would come back def! We tried the basil fried rice, drunken noodles and calamari and nothing disappointed!

We ordered for delivery from here several times since the beginning of the pandemic. The food is always very nice, we especially like the thai sausage fried rice and the thep platter. Today we came here to eat outside, friendly staff and still very good thai food.
Very authentic thai cuisine served in Upper East side. Noodles they serve here are something you've never heard of and that's how you know it's the OG!

I think at this point I've tried most of the menu at Thep. I love that there are season specials for both food and drink. It's got a great atmosphere, all of the staff are really friendly and the service is pretty fast. It's usually busy and packed on weekends. The food is a bit more upscale than other Thai places in my opinion. I work in midtown west i've been to a few Thai restaurants for quick lunches and Thep is so far one of my favorites. If you are hungry for Thai then get on the Q and head to Thep in the UES.

My first time here was great! I ordered the Pad See Eiw and it had perfect portion size and was super tasty! The staff was welcoming and the ambiance was calm. The lunch special is also a plus! Highly recommended this place!

Really nice atmosphere and good service. I appreciate that they bring water right away and leave the bottle available for you to refill your glass yourself. The server and host were friendly and helpful. The spring rolls were crispy and delicious. The avocado curry was probably the best I've ever eaten. Thanks for a wonderful experience!
I love THEP! The atmosphere, the food, the drinks - everything! A great upper east side Thai place to enjoy a lovely meal. Highly recommend.

This place has great outdoor seating to start off with. I have ordered the Chang mai sausage, pad kee mao and Khao soi. My favorite was def the sausage , the symphony of Thai flavors in your mouth . The customer was top notch , they immediately replaced my entree when I complained about the spice levels .

First time in New York and this restaurant makes NYC in me even better! The decoration is very pretty and warm , the food is amazing! We the THEP platter, papaya Thai, the drunken noodle, tom kha and it all deserve 5 stars. The service is the top-notch as well, our waitress was Pond, such a sweet and caring girl. We was having really good time in this restaurant. I'll recommend this restaurant for anyone plan to travel to New York!
3 and a half but I'll round it up for generosity. Fantastic lunch option for the upper east side. The appetizers were small but well made. Unfortunately the pad thai was too sweet.
Great ambience and location! Unique food and drinks offered, am excited to come back again!
No comment
The fresh rolls were excellent- a 5- but the Pad Thai was very disappointing. The vegetables were over cooked and the sauce was unexciting with a strange tomato taste. I wouldn't order it again.

Came here after my graduation. The ambiance was wonderful and so pretty! Food looked super pretty and was delicious! We got the lemongrass pork chop, Khao soi, and pad Thai. I wouldn't recommend the ribs because were not fresh. Other than that, we had a great experience! For drinks, pom and bubbles is my go to!
No comment

Great ambience: Private heated outdoor seating isolated from others. Food is flavorful. Their special Pad Thai is unique and is a must try! Love their curry too. Esthetic cocktails and definitely not diluted; if you need them to add less alcohol, they can! Great service! Must try!!!
Outdoor seating has a nice ambience with light and heat. food is delicious and hit the spot exactly what I needed.
Arguably, this place makes the best green curry in town. We also truly enjoyed the service - waiters are friendly, prompt and accommodated all our requests. We'll be back for sure!
No comment
No comment

Absolutely delicious Tom Kha soup! The space is open and beautiful! We loved the drinks at the bar. Service was prompt and attentive. Definitely will be coming back! We can do without the egg rolls in the appetizer sampler.
This is probably one of the best Thai food in NYC. Highly recommend this place to anyone who loves authentic Thai food.
No comment
Whoever their delivery person is should be fired. Completely inept. Never got food, never ordering from here again.

This restaurant was AMAZING!!!! The place was bustling with people and the presentation is top notch! It is a cool and crisp day and the breeze that came through made the night feel reminiscent of summer. The Tom Kha soup is sooooo delicious but in such a small bowl! (Wish it was an entree!) The only draw back was that they forgot my drink and left it sitting on bar(I watched from table) for 20 minutes:( The fried rice was great and the shrimp (steamed) were definitely among the best I've tasted. I'll definitely be back
No comment

Great experience here! Awesome ambiance and amazing food. It's hard to find those two together. Loved the wok stir fry and khao soi! Definitely go here if you like Thai. Great service and food came pretty fast.
No comment

column3: Northeast Virginia Beach, Virginia Beach, VA
column6: No comment
No comment
Super rich coconut flavor in the curry. Might be a touch too rich for my taste but I still liked it. Cute ambiance and excellent service.

Love love love this spot!!! In a sea of Thai restaurants, this one stands out for its quality, diversity, and price. The spring rolls are light and flaky, the Thai pineapple fried rice served in a whole pineapple, and the masaman curry is super rich and tasty. We loved everything and the service is PERFECT. Super friendly and attentive wait staff. This has fast become our fav local spot.
Had the thai ice tea, avocado massaman curry with vegetarian duck. Very flavorful and the best part was no wait time! I would return again.
No comment
No comment
The meal was fantastic. Offers a great lunch special with an entree, app and salad for only $10. Definitely recommend it for the great atmosphere and food. Good till the last bite.
No comment
Our family lioves Thep! We eat here at least once a week. The food is consistently delicious and the service is wonderful!
The food were fantastic and service was great. Drunken noodle with beef was on spot, very delicious and highly recommended.
Excellent service. Everybody is very nice. I love the masaman curry, the pad thai, and the pad kee mao!
No comment
Such a delightful time with my girlfriend here. Great food, great vibe. Love, love, love

I love and miss this spot! When I was living in the city, I checked this place out because of the pretty pictures and good reviews with some friends. I got the Panang Curry and liked it so much that it became my go-to takeout order as well. While the curry itself was thinner than I would usually like, it has a slight spiciness that is still tolerable for those who aren't good w spicy, and the vegetables always come out well. The inside of the restaurant is so nice and bright during the day - it's a great place to take friends and just sit down and eat!
No comment

Went here for my birthday party! The ambience was as great as the food. It's an authentic Thai food place with great service and price! The portions were very generous. Each item ordered had a distinctive flavor and was delightful!
Great food! Drunken noodles were delicious and great ambience. Would definitely recommend.

Oh what a Gods Heaven place on earth! THEP meaning Godl in Thai language. What an amazing unbelievable food experience that was. The master bartender with all these amazing drinks was Tony. I have never seen such crafted cocktails.
The ambience was nice and the staff was really helpful with our orders. We had a group of nine people and the table was perfect for a big group like us. Thanks for an enjoyable meal!
No comment
No comment
Ambiance and food are A+.  Favorite Covid dining setup in the city ! Cozy, excellent servers, and food is tasty
No comment

Really like this restaurant, the food is good as well as the service. The atmosphere and decoration are great too. Minus 1 star for the price, somehow it is a little overpriced. But it is still acceptable.
Great Thai food! Love everything. Particularly great pork bun and crispy duck salad.
No comment
The curry noodle soup was amazing! Thai iced tea also came free which was good and also the curry was very rich in flavor
Great Thai iced tea and food! They're very accommodating for babies as well and nice environment
My mother and I have eaten here twice. Great food, nice atmosphere at a reasonable price. I highly recommend the Tom Kha soup.
Staffs are super friendly, decors are cute, food were satisfying. Good place to bring someone on a date. I recommend the drunken noodle if you're a fan of spice, and pad see ew for not spicy.
No comment
No comment
Fantastic thai food. Sampler app was delicious. Decor was beautiful. Service was great.
Took my niece out for her bday and had an amazing experience. Food is great, price is great, atmosphere is great and service was amazing. Thank you for an amazing evening.

Great new addition to the neighborhood. The khao soi came with a lot of tender on-the-bone chicken, it was practically coming off the bone with just a fork and no knife was necessary. The broth itself was very rich - I would've preferred it to be a little lighter and heavier on the curry flavors, but it satisfies the craving. We also tried the pad Thai, which was good - not just one note ketchup, but instead with subtle notes of soy and tamarind. The Thai iced coffee was delicious too - a bit heavy on the condensed milk but still good. Staff was also very friendly :)
Had an excellent lunch here! The specials offer a great variety of choices, and who doesn't like a spring to start a meal? Will be back!
We tried the lunch set at THEP for the first time! We ordered pad see eiw and avocado curry. it's Ssooooooooo delicious. Definitively come back again
Love the outdoor setup. Staff is very nice. I got the pad see eww and it was on point. The fried rice was also very well prepared.
This is a great place to come after a walk in central park. The food was delicious, great service and a beautiful interior. This is one of the best Thai restaurants I've been to.

So I really struggled with my rating for this place because it was really great but there's something about my food experience that didn't quite get me to 5-star. The atmosphere was great, the staff was very friendly (came to check in on our table multiple times), the turn around for food was quick, and we didn't have one complaint. The food was also delicious. I ordered the steamed shrimp dumplings, golden sachet, and Pad Kee Mao (drunken noodles). The shrimp dumplings and golden sachet were absolutely delicious. If I rated my food experience based off these two items alone, it would be a 5-star. I could literally eat both all day! The drunken noodles were also really good. I guess this is where I get disappointed because all of the reviews RAVED about this. Drunken noodles are my favorite dish and I am just on a long winded hunt to find the restaurant that does it the best. The noodles were a little soft for me and I was wish I had more sauce. I also wish it included a stronger taste of basil and possibly broccoli. The basil that was in the dish had no flavor, it was really dried up and that boost of flavor truly makes a difference for this dish. Now, was it good?  Definitely. But amazing? No.
Delicious volcano chicken, tom yum soup was a little too sweet. Overall good experience :)
No comment
No comment

Really good food. The chicken skewers were really good and came with a nice peanut sauce. The chicken dumplings were also pretty good. The summer rolls were great (very good with peanut sauce) and the chicken in green curry was alright. Would definitely go again.
Amazing vibes. Rocky is unbelievable! Fun and awesome!!!! I Highly recommend this place!

Visiting my two sons and their fury baby and needed a restaurant where we could sit outside. We came across Thep and saw people sitting outside. The food looked delicious. We decided to give it a try and we were very happy we did. The food was awesome, service was great, drinks were yummy, and the presentation was excellent. We are definitely coming back here when we come back for another visit!

This place was very packed so my friends and I were excited that the food was going to be good. The food was very good and I highly recommend the drunken noodles. I have to say that it was slightly spicy and the Thai iced tea was great too!
The restaurant is great. The dining environment is cool and lovely. The waitress is nice. The food is delicious and serving fast. I enjoyed the night here and would definitely recommend.
delicious food and amazing service!! The food came quickly and was in large portions. A great place to have a quick lunch with friends
great Thai place. A lot of variety of food in the menu. Great customer service and the place is really nice.
This is an amazing restaurant, and the servers are very helpful. The food was very yummy and the ambience was beautiful :)
Best thai food in nyc! We order Khao Soi, pork chop and pad see you and everything exceed expectations!! When in upper East side come here!!
Cute Thai restaurant in the UES! Spacious and not too noisy or crowded great for groups

Delicious meal on a cold and rainy day! I got the khao soi which was spicy, complex and warmed me right up . My wife got the steamed fish in banana leaves which was both healthy and tasty. We'll be right back!

Warm and friendly, quick service. Atmosphere is modern and bright, not too loud. All dishes and drinks are served in nicely curated taste. I ordered the Tom Yum soup and pad thai. Tom Yum soup was good balance of spicy and aromatic, not too fishy or intense. Pad thai was solid for the serving size, thought I prefer the drier style. Will probably order a different entree next time.
No comment

I've been to maybe 10+ Thai restaurants in NYC alone and I must say this restaurant has great attentive staff. The food was amazing, the wings are a must try. I had spring rolls to start which were absolutely amazing. I ordered Pad See Ew, while tasting delicious, portion was a little smaller compared to other restaurants but it was very fulfilling.
Very clean which is great because of COVID. Great pork chops with sticky rice and sauce. Great crispy spring rolls with sauce and pad se ew.
Great service! Loved the food as well especially the fried calamari and chicken satay. Thank you :))

Great place, excellent service, excellent food. I ordered the lunch special because I'm in a budget, and it was great! The food was fresh, well balanced and the size was very generous. It is a great place to have lunch when you want to try something different. The service was amazing, everyone was kind. The two servers were constantly paying attention to all the customers and getting feedback. They were kind and sweet. I would definitely come back again.
No comment

column3: Town of North Hempstead, Long Island, NY
column6: A MUST try!! So I found this place on Tik Tok and. I was pleased to see they had booths that promote social distancing at its finest! We were told it would be a 30 minute wait which I was glad to do so considering they have about 10 to 12 booths. We ended up  getting seated within 5 minutes of waiting which I was extremely pleased with. We were greeted, we used the contactless bar code on the table to look at the menu. We used our call button to call and order our food. The waitress was very friendly and even recommended a drink for my wife who is a bourbon drinker. We received our drinks promptly and our food came within 10 to 15 minutes! I have posted pictures of what we ordered. This was my first time trying Pad Thai and I would have it over and over again because it was DELICIOUS!!! The Crab Rangoon was THE BEST AND CREAMIEST I have ever had!!! Everything we had was very well seasoned and I honestly cannot wait to go again!! Try anything and everything because you won't regret it. FYI the severs including the bartender and the hostess were all very attentive and checked on how the food and the cocktails were!!!
Great service, even better food. Will definitely be back! Very safe and comfortable during covid.
delicious drunken noodles and crab rangoon! great place for outdoor dining during covid. tables are spaced pretty far away and waiters are great.
No comment
Great ambiance and good food! Would definitely recommend a visit. The volcano chicken was great.
No comment
No comment
Ordered the Pad Thai - absolutely delicious! I always order pad Thai and this has been one of my favorites in nyc. Can't wait to come back and eat more.
Fantastic service. Quick, friendly, delicious, and very creative and exotic menu. Will definitely be back to try more items! Great service from Pond! She's awesome!

The green curry was really good! Highly recommend it. I also got the chicken pad Thai which was great. Classic meal at a Thai restaurant. I'm just here for the free Thai tea with a review and it was good
Really cute spot, clean bathrooms. The food was really good, the curry was creamy and the beef was a little spicy but i liked it!
Nice Thai place on ues. Stopped by for an afternoon appetizer and drinks and it hit the spot! Absolutely would recommend - flavors on point, great decor, and good service!
The food here is very good. Curry is cooked just right. We also got the drunken noodles and that is also very tasty.
Dope place. Great covid precautions. The platter was delicious and had a great array of sauces and appetizers to try. Will definitely come back and try their cocktails! Highly recommend!
No comment
No comment
Great food! Great Thai tea! Very tasteful and flavorful! The Siamese fried rice and shrimp was really good.
No comment
Started with crab and chicken sachets. Delicious. Then, the Green curry was excellent. Spicy, but won't kill you. Great atmosphere and very friendly and fast staff. Definitely recommend!!
Great outdoor seating options. Excellent food and service! You can get on the waitlist on Yelp and it's a time saver.

On my exploration of Thai food, Thep has been clutch in helping me love this cuisine. Because Thep is so good. It has great outdoor seating, as well as a cozy and intimate inside with chic and classy decor. The pad thai is really good (but not great), but its all about the fried rice here. The fried rice is fantastic. They also have a fun cocktail menu which are delicious. They have a great lunch deal as well as happy hour. Thep is worth the trip to the upper east side, its worth the wait, its worth having to sit outside and freeze. It's just what you need.

I am obsessed with this restaurant! The food was delicious and the service was great! Get here early as there can be a wait but a wait well worth it. The atmosphere is chic and relaxing. The food tastes so fresh, well cooked, and hot!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: The shrimp and chicken dumplings were really good as well as the edamame I ordered the shrimp fried rice the environment is really awesome and the staff is amazing and super helpful.
Rude, unwelcoming staff who get bothered if you ask for a glass for your beer if you didn't ask for it beforehand. Food could also use some more flavors, the papaya salad was disappointing.
The food and service were good! I had the avocado massaman curry; highly recommend!! The environment is nice. I came here on a Tuesday night and there was no wait.

The restaurant was amazing. The interior design was very nice. I ordered the Green Curry and it was not too hot and had lots of flavors. I also had the Pom ice cream drink and I highly recommend!! Would def come back here again :-)
great service and I love the Thai ice tea and their curry noodle with chicken in the bone

Was excited because I saw they had gluten free menu options. I have celiac so I went into extra detail when ordering for pick up about safety precautions and cross contamination. Food absolutely poisoned me! I was sick and throwing up all night and the next day. Never going back.
Wonderful food!!  The waiters are very nice and friendly. One of the best Thai food in the city.

Visiting this establishment the first time, our wait was quite long for a Friday night as anyone could imagine. This 2nd time here for us however, Yelp made the waitlist process very easy. We waitlisted ourselves on the app, then checked in with the hostess when we got there, went to Starbucks to get hot chocolates while we waited the estimated 20-30 minutes. I got a text that our table was ready before our drinks could even cool. We get seated and service was as quick as we'd hope it would be. We were starving! We didn't have to look around (except to enjoy the ambiance) for a server, wave our hands around or anything like that to get someone's attention. The drinks were absolutely delicious! Our appetizers came out quickly and were equally as delicious as the drinks. Then the entrees came and the flavor blew our minds for the second time around! They truly know how to put a dish together. I had crispy Long Island duck with panang curry and it came with jasmine rice on the side. The duck was so crispy yet juicy/tender at the same time! It was perfect!!! The portions were great, filling for sure! Leftovers are almost guaranteed in my opinion. My best friend and I were both too full to even browse the dessert menu. I'd like to return here to try every item on the menu, if it was actually possible. I'm looking forward to my next visit for sure.

Incredible!! By far the best Thai restaurant I have been to in New York. The food is fresh and absolutely delicious. Our sever Poy was a sweetheart and so helpful when trying to decide what to eat. I will definitely be back before I leave to Arizona. AMAZING!

Awesome food with great hospitality. We ordered spring rolls, pad thai noodles,thai iced tea, fresh coconut water and drunken noodles and all of the items lived up to our expectations of exceptional thai food. Kudos to the entire team at thep thai. Five stars.
awesome food & service! We got basil fried rice, pad see ewi, ice cream and some appetizers. Love the place! Get the appetizer platter, really great!
Pineapple and coconut ice cream is the best! Awesome food and great service. The platter has everything and is nice!

The restaurant is very inviting, a great place for a quick meal and some drinks. Place looks smaller in person of course, but not stuffy. It's a modern setting with authentic food. I would come again, great for a date night.

The best Thai food in UES. Pad kee mao is my go to, love spicy food. Normally I'm always a pad thai guy but this restaurant put me on the drunken noodles. I've also done catering with them. Delicious and everyone loved it!
This place gives free thai iced tea for reviews and the decorations are so pretty! The thai iced tea is so yummy and they have vegetarian duck options!
First time here celebrating a friend's belated day of birth. Great service and great food! Would recommend the lychee Thai iced tea and the signature platter for a variety sample of goodies

The green curry with duck was so delicious. Curry had a mellow taste, not sweet and loaded with sugar like most green Currys, but you can still taste the coconut milk. The duck had fried skin, moist meat, and was deboned. Great texture. The vegetables in it were very fresh. Atmosphere is beautiful there.

Came on a Wednesday night. Started  out crowded but we were able to be seated pretty quickly. Service was good. The waitress was attentive and was knowledgeable about vegan items. It was easy to order but with the tables all full and only two waiters, the service was a  bit slow but understandable. Ordered the avocado  massaman curry which was good. Friend ordered pineapple fried rice which was also good. Would say The chive pancakes were the best and  probably would order that again. Overall decent place  to grab Thai food
The Pad Thai is decorated beautifully and the Thai iced tea is magnificent! The lunch special is so affordable. In addition the wait staff is very attentive and friendly! I will be coming back again!
Great food and service, baby friendly. We ordered pad Thai, drunken noodle and red curry beef. All are delicious, better than some places we had in Thailand.

There is little I don't like about Thep. Their vegetarian duck is amazing in all foods (for all you fellow vegetarians!) and the drunken noodle and curries are delicious. There are a lot of Thai restaurants in the area, but Thep is also the most reasonably priced. Definitely check it out!

I enjoyed my lunch at this restaurant. On the weekend at noon, there is no wait. Right when you walk in, the atmosphere has a very natural and open with with hanging plants and tall windows. The food is also very good. They give special attention to the presentation of each dish. The spiciness levels are set but I found that my dish was more on the sweeter side than spicy.
No comment
5 star. Absolutely perfect. Amazing. Beautiful. Send my regards to all the gods that had to make this beautiful food.
Amazing place! The food is delicous and the staff is nice! Social distancing is taken seriously and it feels save
Best Thai spot in the UES--I used to order from Up Thai but THEP is #1 for me now. Would recommend the avocado massaman + crab rangoons. Be sure to order on their website direct than thru Grubhub etc
No comment
No comment
No comment
It's a very neat and has a contemporary interior. The food was very well made. We ordered the pad Thai and the drunken noodles with tofu. The tofu was appropriately spicy. Thai iced tea was worth in.

Their menu was extensive with many options starting from appetizers to entrees to noodles and rice. They also had their version of pad Thai which was using vermicelli noodles giving it a different texture while keeping the classic pad thai taste. Oh also their cocktails!!!!! Super presentable and they don't skimp out on alcohol!!! RARE IN THE CITY!!
No comment
No comment
This is the best/ most affordable lunch spot for Thai food in the UES hands down! My coworkers and I go here every Thursday for Thai Thursday's. Highly recommend! Food is awesome.
Love thep's thai iced coffee! Their calamari and papaya salad tastes great! Also, waitress Pam has been really helpful and efficient with the order

Temp checks and tracing form u NYS upon arrival. Free Thai ice tea or coffee w Yelp review. Tables separated w glass. Felt safe during covid. No wait on weekday. Drinks delicious, not overly sweet. One of the best Thai food around area. Pim was our waitress, very friendly and helpful.
Food is good with a modern ambience. They offer free Thai ice tea if you write a review on yelp.
great environment! The sauage dish is very different! If you like to try something new, try that one! I really like the kosh noodle! I had a great time

Flavorful vegan options and a pleasant outdoor dining area! So nice to have a reliable place to eat healthy food outdoors on the Upper East Side. We had edamame, Ginger Joy wtih veggies, and Avocado Massaman Curry with tofu--all of it quite good. The restaurant's interior is also bright, fresh, original, and clean. This'll be our go-to place from now on when we're in the area.
Excellent service and tasty meals at a good price! Will definitely be back again! Thanks THEP Thai!
I come here for lunch frequently and always love their lunch special. The food is aways yummy and the staff are always nice and attentive.

This spot has really delicious food, and a great ambiance. The outdoor seating is very efficient, and there are heaters as well. The chicken satay and chicken pad thai are very tasty. Overall, great spot!
This is my first time at Thep and it was exceptional. From the service to the food it was absolutely amazing. Definitely 5 stars all around!!!
So glad I came here! Love the outdoor seating set up- very cozy and intimate! The hostess was super friendly and the waiters are quick and responsive. Highly recommend!!

Excellent Thai spot that tends to get overshadowed by Up Thai.  The food is excellent and the presentation is aces.  I love the Massaman Curry here.  Fairly small, but a trendier atmosphere than what you get at Up Thai.  Definitely don't overlook THEP!
Food is delicious. Exactly what you want from a neighborhood Thai restaurant. Lunch special is a very good deal
Great food, especially the avocado massaman curry and free ice tea is always nice!  The spring rolls were also excellent.

The decor drew me in but the food was amazing as well and nicely presented. We got the golden satchels as a starter and I went with the chicken massamun curry, my go-to. The chicken was soo tender. Will definitely come back!
Friendly staff and good vibes, food was superb. Solid dining environment. Clean restroom. Very good Thai iced teaa

The ambience in Thep is great. The food was excellent and best of all it came out hot. The service is very good as well. Waitress was attentive and checked on us a few times to make sure all was good. I would definitely eat at Thep again.

Loved the food! We went for a friend's birthday. Very accommodating for people with nut allergies and had many vegan/ vegetarian options. Creative and fun drinks options as well. They don't take reservations until the day of. Indoor and outdoor seating available.
Beautiful decor and reliable food. They're Thai tea is one of the best that I've had.
No comment

I would honestly do anything for this place. The most exhilarating options I could ever dream of, and the fact that it can be delivered to me through various apps is out of control. I want to eat here one day in real life because the pictures of the actual restaurant look amazing. THEP is a rare, exquisite. and precious gem that must be protected at all costs.

Came here on a Monday night and was seated quickly. The food came out relatively quickly and was nothing short of my expectations. The pineapple fried rice and vegetarian duck were both delicious and the curry powder added lots of flavor. The restaurant is also nicely decorated and created a nice and romantic ambiance.
No comment
I think they got the service figured out, or maybe it's just because it's getting colder outside and it's less busy? Either way, I've had much better experiences there lately!

Wow....a great Thai food restaurant doesn't get much better than this.  Amazing service, interesting dishes, well priced and the food couldn't have been better!   We started with the sampler platter which, while wasn't loaded with a lot of food, was a perfect starter for two people.   Everything on it was amazing and it came with 4 dipping sauces.  We then had a noodle dish that was out of this world.   There are a lot of Thai options on the Upper East Side and, so far...this is one of the best!

I come here for my lunch break. The service is fast and they are very accommodating when it comes to substituting certain things. They're lunch menu is varied but has the classics. I highly recommend this place for lunch!
Awesome lunch deal. Loved the food, enjoyed the space. Will be back! Get the red curry and spring rolls. Good for a filling meal at great price.
Cute little spot. Food is very flavorful and good! The outdoor seating was heated and the ambiance was spot on. The presentation of the food was Instagram worthy too.
This place serves great taste,it's fresh and it's so filling. I ordered this for lunch all the time and the service is super quick.

Thep Is the new Thai on the block, following in the footsteps of Up Thai just around the corner, which was very good last time I ate there. This place is good but the food was a bit heavy. I'll definitely give it a second chance and go back to Up again and compare. All in all a very nice experience but maybe it was a little late to tuck into a Massaman Curry.
Great atmosphere, quality service, and top notch food at a good price. Would recommend.

Best Thai in UES... Up Thai was the recommended Thai spot, but THEP takes the cake. When I moved to UES, I went to Up Thai, but the wait was too long and I went to the 'new Thai spot,' which was THEP. I fell in love with the decor, the yummy and healthy appetizers, and flavorful entrees. I choose THEP over all other Asian-fusion restaurants in the area. It's seriously delicious...
Great atmosphere and food! Really enjoy the service, l nice plant display, and great noodles!

Delicious foods, good service, great staff and nice ambiance! The best Wonton Soup I've ever had! Duck Salad, THEP Pad Thai and Spicy Basil Fried Rice are some of great options when dine at THEP. Don't forget to try THEP Mule. My friends and I had dinner on Saturday, May 12th. We (4 of us) didn't have reservation but the staff were very accommodating. We were very pleased and definitively recommend this place.
Service was attentive , food was very yummy, overall, I give four stars, good experience.
The absolute BEST Thai food I have ever had.  wonderful service, from the friendly greeting when we came, to the bar, to our server.  my mouth is watering in anticipation of our next trip back!
No comment

THEP is an amazing new Thai place that just opened up on the upper east side. Their service is the best I've seen in the neighborhood so far. They are attentive and have enough staff to tend to their customers. The food was tasty and had great presentation as well. THEP actually uses Thai spices in their food to give the authentic experience. Beware if you are not capable of eating spicy foods! Their lunch menu is a great value with an appetizer, soup/salad, and an entree for ~$12. Overall worth it and will come back for future lunches with my team.
Love this Turkish restaurant for eating outdoors or delivery! Great appetizers to share, lots of  choices for main courses- love their chicken specialty dishes and kebabs
Great Thai food spot with good variety. Try the chicken dumplings and the appetizer platter. You won't be disappointed. Spicy noodles FTW.

This restaurant is one of my go-to's! It's soups, noodle and curry dishes are all dependable. The service is excellent and so friendly. They also have frequent specials and lunch deals. Take advantage! They deliver as well! YUMMMY!

This place is so good. Service is outstanding. Food is beyond delicious. We had the lemongrass pork chop, shrimp pad Thai, and green curry with chicken. Everything was better than the standard Thai food you usually get. Recommend!
No comment

This place was introduced by my friend. The food was the delicious especially the calamari. Som was our host and she was very patient with us. She made sure that everything was smooth with our orders. Will definitely come back!
Som was great and efficient. Food was delicious as always. Good covid safety practices with great outdoor private seating areas, heat lamps and hand sanitizers. It's a neighborhood staple
Amazing authentic Thai, can't beat the lunch special prices either. Best pad Thai in NYC

Went here with my girlfriend on a busy Saturday night. The place was packed, but the wait wasn't long at all thanks to quick and efficient service. The atmosphere was really nice both inside and outside the restaurant. Most importantly, the food and drink was amazing quality for decent prices. Definitely the best Thai food I've had in manhattan. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a quick and delicious meal. I hope to come back soon.
Got the Penang curry - it was very good! Also recommend the crab balls. Would come back
Enjoyed the setup for covid it felt very private. Massaman curry had a nice kick to it
Great out door set up with separate cubbies! Very nice presentation and enjoyed the food
The panang curry is great! The outdoor seating is spacious and there was no wait for a table.
eating on Monday, first day of phase 2, excellent ambience, classy service, excellent food and drinks. One of upper east side finest dining stops. Must visit!
Great lunch specials! Lots of vegetarian and vegan options, and amazing service. Pad kee mao with veggies and tofu was delicious. Will be back!
No comment
No comment

Really liked this place! You can go dressed up or a little more casual, either way you will feel comfortable. Everything we had was good! I especially loved the sampler platter appetizers. And getting the pineapple fried rice is a MUST! It's served in a pineapple! Yum!!

Chill vibe, amazing furniture & light fixtures! Have to make a reservation because this place is always busy. The food is really good and service is quick. Pad Thai is a best seller and one of the best dishes. 10/10!

The food here is delicious, the ambiance is wonderful and the drinks are wonderful too. Their Thai iced tea was actually legendary. I highly recommend this place if you want authentic food and good vibes.

Consistently the best Thai food in NYC. Pad Thai + drunken noodles + shrimp steamed dumplings has been my go-to order for last 2 years. Also happy hour 5-6pm with great drinks. Amazing service and COVID friendly outdoor seating. Would highly recommend to every NYC patron.
Great Thai. Very authentic. Waitstaff is fantastic and make sure you have a good experience. The drinks are also surprisingly good!

I live in this area and I've try many different Thai restaurants.This place is definitely my favorite one. I love to eat there, the decor is very nice for a thai spot. I recently found out about their new menu. I tried the thep rice bowl and its probably my new favorite dish.
Easily the best thai on the UES! The food is wonderful, the ambiance is fantastic. Take your date or take your family!

Went here a while back but I still think about the spicy udon noodles and pad kee mao. SO GOOD. Thai food is usually vegetarian friendly, but the vegetarian duck creates so many more options. Thai coffee was new to my palate and I can safely say I'm a fan. Would definitely recommend.

New favorite Thai restaurant! I got the pineapple fried rice and it was jam packed with favor! Staff was super friendly as well. Great place for a date, my girlfriend loved the place. Oh, don't forget to get the Thai iced tea!
No comment

Best Thai restaurant ever! Taste & service & cleanliness & interior design etc everything was perfect! I personally recommend basil fried rice. We ordered two because we couldn't stop eating it. I will come here again for sure!
The best Thai restaurant in the area. Ordered crab rangoon, pad see ew, and pineapple fried rice. All were excellent. Staff exceptionally friendly. Highly recommend.

Came to this place for Saturday lunch and there were plenty of tables available. Cozy with a modern vibe. The service I got was fast and friendly. I got a Thai iced tea for a review and also ordered Pad Kee Mao, spicy udon, and chicken satay. The chicken was moist and flavorful. The noodle dishes were decent, but missing the high-heat wok flavor that is quintessential to Asian stir fried dishes.
One of my favorite Thai restaurant in Manhattan! Great ambiance and food was excellent
No comment

Very cute experience! The little pods are perfect for a fun safe dinner with friends. There was a bit of a wait but it was Friday night so expected. The food was delicious and the drinks were great. Pricing pretty average for nyc. The staff were all super friendly and quick.

In my one week trip in NY, this was definitely one of my favorite places to eat. The ambiance was incredibly well done and the food hit all the right notes. Definitely the standout was the Pad Thai w/Vegetarian Duck as well as the Tea Leaves Salad. Overall, highly recommended and would definitely come here again on a future trip!

Really great place for the price. I got the chicken koh soi and it was really good. I like that it wasn't too spicy and still flavorful. The hostess with the bob haircut was also really bubbly and came to check up on us. The place is a little tight but there's a good amount of seating and a bar Incase. They have a ton of choices and take out as well.

This place has great good and service was very attentive. Highly recommend the pannang cury and pad Thai. Their selection of cocktails is also very elaborate and diverse! We came on a Sunday night around 7:30 and didn't have to wait for very long.

Had the Khao Soi! Perfect dish for those who want noodles but with curry. So delicious and creamy with a hint of spiciness. The fried egg noodle on top really balanced out the overall chewy consistency of the dish. Loved the red onion garnish as well. The chicken was also super tender. Nice big portion to fill me up too! Beautiful place and nice service.
The Chicken Pad Thai was good and the place looks really nice. It has a chill atmosphere.
No comment
Great service, food and ambiance, would recommend! Got the Chicken PadThai for dinner and it was delicious. Friends got a variety of entree dishes and looked just as appetizing.
The staff is very professional. Excellent choice of food. The duck I had was amazing!
It was an ok experience. The drunken noodle is not that good. The noodles is too starchy. I can only taste the heat of the chili. I think the only thing my family enjoyed was the Thai tea.
Just had dinner here and it was amazing! You get all the traditional Thai dishes I love. Their drunken noodle with seafood and papaya said were my favorites! So good, definitely coming back

The food was amazing. Me and my friend came in around 5pm for dinner after exploring the MET. It wasn't too packed and we were seated instantly. Everything from the deco to the utensils were beautiful. We ordered the Avocado Massaman Curry, fried pineapple rice, and lychee tea. Both plates were delicious. The presentation of the food was also gorgeous. Id give this restaurant 5 stars if it wasn't for the below average service. I will definitely return soon.
Great Beef Drunken Noodle. Their lunch special brings so much food. The spring rolls or Gyoza are delicious. For the UES, this is a great deal. I only order Thai food in this area from them.
No comment
No comment

I ordered chicken Red curry and it was super good but very spicy. It came in the coolest little cauldron which made it fun to eat! The atmosphere is very nice and modern, i have gone here 3 or so times craving the curry!

Went here during lunch. Ordered the basil fried rice and it was amazing! It also came with a starter and either soup or salad since it was a lunch special. Will definitely come back here again to try the avocado masaman curry. Sorry I had to finish the soup while it's hot lol.
No comment
This corner restaurant goes on my list as an upper east hot spot ! Great vibe, food and drink! Plus a check in for Thai iced tea !

Loved the outdoor spacing they had with the new Covid regulations. Felt super comfortable outside in our own little area. Drinks were super classy and presentable. And we also had the coconut ice cream which came in an actual coconut. Loved the area and the ambiance. Would come again!

We were seated promptly on a Saturday evening and ordered the Khao Soi with yellow curry. The food came out quickly and our server was very attentive. We enjoyed both dishes and the portion was quite generous. The Thai ice tea was also very good. Would definitely come back again!

Delicious curry and pad Thai. Came here on a rainy day for lunch and got the red curry with chicken.. friend got the pad Thai with tofu. We split and shared and also got the Thai iced tea. Everything was cozy and delicious and I'll definitely be back!

Service was wonderful from the second we entered the door. We were seated quickly after using the waitlist feature (no wait!). The restaurant smells amazing and it's so hard to choose an entree because everything looks extraordinary. I finally settled on Kanom Jean Nam Ngeow, a noodle soup dish I've never tried while traveling in Thailand. I was pleased to see they offered Khao Soi though (a go-to dish in a Chiang Mai). The pork buns were out of this world! Also love the free Thai Tea Yelp offer.
Found this neighborhood gem while looking for a last minute dinner. Seating was super quick, staff was attentive, food was delicious and authentic. Great meal after a day putting together furniture.

Fantastic Thai spot. The best that I have had in NYC hands down. The staff was super friendly and first rate. Loud and vibrant atmosphere. Great happy hour specials before 6PM. Will definitely be back!!

I'm surprised that this restaurant has such high ratings. I came for dinner during the week and shared the sampler platter appetizer and pad see ew with duck to share. The platter was good, everything was deep fried. Pad see ew was just ok, not as much flavor as I was hoping for. The duck was cooked well though. Prices are standard for the neighborhood. I prefer Up Thai over this place.

I love this Thai restaurant. Best lunch special the food is flavorful and I l or the lychee Thai iced tea. Their pineapple fried rice is to die for presentation is everything. I also always get their Tom yum soup when I'm sick so good !!
Amazing food. Great drinks. The hostess was also amazing and took the time to make recommendations to us.
This is a very nice, well decorated restaurant with good food and ambiance. I recommend to anyone in the area.
No comment

This is now my new favorite Thai place in the city. Picked this place on a whim on my way home. It was quite busy but we were seated promptly. We were a party of 3 with 2 of us being vegan but the menu was quite accommodating to both. We opted for the veggie pancakes and spring rolls for starters, both were delicious. The veggie pancakes were so good we had to get another order. For our entrees we had the basil fried rice and vegetarian duck which was so unbelievably tasty. For not being real duck I really couldn't tell. Very flavorful. They were out of desserts that evening but we'll go back to try them and for more duck.

As soon as I walked in, I was comforted by the festive and quiet ambience. I ordered the Kanom Jean Nam Ngeow since it is not something I usually see on menus and it was just the thing I needed on a cold day. The portion is very substantial with plenty of meat included. The service  was also great and seamless.
No comment

Amazing food - we had the appetizer plate with spring rolls and dumplings.  It had 4 different sauces and all were delicious.  Perfectly balanced green papaya salad and Queen of Siam chicken basil was outstanding. 4 stars because the service is a bit inattentive.  Although the restaurant is at 25% capacity it took a half an hour for them to acknowledge us and take our order. We shared a half bottle of sake.  They only had cold sake.  Decor is ok and they have both indoor and outdoor seating.

This is a good place to come to hang out with friends. Nice environment. The dishes are good and very fresh and yummy. The service is wonderful. This is the first time I came here and will come again. The salad are fresh. All dishes I chose are delicious. Recommend!
Overall decent place.  I loved the interior!  Not all the dishes I tried were good but about half of them were pretty darn good!
This is my favorite pattaya place. Nice service and green place. Definitely I'll come back
No comment

This is an authentic Thai cuisine located in upper east side, great ambience and excellent service. I love the chicken satay and chive pancakes. Their papaya salad is the highlight of the night, crunchy, and fresh!!!!
amazing food and atmosphere all the appetizers were A one! So delicious must try, the chicken on a stick was so good and pineapple fried rice was delicious
Very COVID friendly and the food was absolutely delicious! The fried shrimp dumplings are a MUST!
Great scenery one of the best indoor/outdoor dinning experience and the appetizers were amazing
No comment
