Excellent restaurant, the food and vibe is amazing. There was a 20 min wait time for a Friday night but the service was great.
Amazing food!!!! Awalys ordered for delivery, first dine ine, great ambience and super authentic thaid food, best in the neighborhood!! Love it, would def come more oftend now!!!
This food was amazing.   Nice environment and service was great.  Will come again.     Nice deco and staff is great!
No comment

We shared chicken satay, shrimp dumplings and chicken wings. Chicken satay was juicy and sauces were well-paired. Chicken wings were crispy and the dressing was perfect! Their service was fast and everyone was very nice.
Chill, classy neighborhood Thai place. Very good food, freshly made, quality ingredients, great atmosphere and service. Would definitely come back!

stopped by for a late lunch with friends - great seating, lighting, and options. ordered drunken noodles - the dish came fast and was delicious! very spicy just as i had ordered :-) would definitely come back if i'm in the area again.
Excellent Thai restaurant in the upper east side. Would definitely recommend this restaurant over Up Thai. The avocado curry here is a must try!
The khao soi was great, tasted authentic and the broth was creamy and flavorful! The atmosphere and decor is nice as well.
Absolutely delicious food. We ordered delivery and it was fast and arrived hot.  Very impressed.
The food was great and fast but the staff could have been nicer/friendlier. Wait time was also long so make a reservation. Overall great vibe and would return....
I ordered a pork bum. The portion was good for appetizer. The skin of pork belly was crispy, which didn't make the pork belly too greasy. Overall, it's good. The Thai tea was tasty too.

We came here on a whim, and so glad that we did! We ordered Thai iced teas, drunken noodles, Tom yum, and red curry with shrimp and everything was delicious-- great quality, flavor, and portion size. Ps: The red curry comes with plenty of shrimp.
Stopped in on a cold afternoon and so glad we did. Warm and welcoming, very nice service. Lunch special can't be beat - where else can you get a small app, salad and entree for $10? Solid choice.
No comment

I tried the massaman curry with the chicken on the bone for delivery. Overall, the flavors for the curry were there, and it has a pleasant, mild spice level. The portion was a good size for the price. I found the chicken to be pretty lackluster though - it was dry and a little lacking in taste on the inside. Perhaps next I'll try something else!
Very nice place with attentive servers. One of my favorite lunch specials. The food is amazing no matter what you order. Would recommend!
Had the chicken dumplings and basil fried rice. So far the best Thai place I have ever visited.
This place rocks for the lunch special during the week - you can get a starter, soup or salad and entree for less than $15! So much value but so much yums!

This place is a cute spot for a group dinner or a couple dinner. Plenty of speating outside or in. Staff very friendly and the food delicious. Perfect amount of spiciness. Portions just the right amount. Had to wait a bit for our food and the waitress gave us 10% off of her own volition. Will definitely order/be back! The jasmine rice next to me smells amazing...
Great food and service from our waitress Pond. In fact it wasn't just great, it was spectacular!
Really yummy comforting and diff thai food. Best curry I've had in the city. Awesome ambiance too
The food was really tasty and loved the ambiance! Nice outdoor seating too! Lovely staff!
Beautiful interior, good food, and great service!! I work closeby so I come here often for their lunch special which is cheap but quality food!!
Reasonably priced, excellent Thai food in the upper east side. I got drunken noodles with chicken and they were delicious.
Very tasty food, got the spicy drunken noodle (which is SPICY so beware--I have a high spice tolerance and this was tough) and it was very flavorful. Attentive service and nice decor.

I came here with my boyfriend after a day of visiting museums in the area. We were seated quickly and the service was amazing. We both loved the food we ordered and the Thai iced tea was delicious. This is definitely one of the best Thai restraints I've been to. Price was extremely reasonable, location was easy to find, I loved the interior design and all the little details they put around the restaurant, traditional music, silverware and the vibe were all so very perfect.
Pineapple fried rice comes in a pineapple! Great service by our waitress Pond. Plenty of outside seating
Great restaurant! My wife and I have been here several times and have never been disappointed. The food is great and the service is very attentive. A great spot if you like Thai food.
No comment
Amazing Pad See Ew! Great lunch special. I have been here twice for lunch and will definitely come back.
No comment
Great delivery option.  Always good, most of the time great.  Siamese fried rice and crab Rangoon are my favorites.  This place is in our regular ordering rotation.
This place had pretty good appetizers, although portions were small. We had the Thai Fred rice with sausage and highly recommend it.
This place looks so pretty inside! Only tried their dumplings. Nothing out of this world but the fried dumplings are better than the steamed ones here.

Great food, really nice space and friendly staff. The pineapple fried rice comes in a hollow pineapple  and the curry is delicious!!! Really good lunch special and wayyyyyy better than Up Thai! Highly recommend!
Great food. Great vibes. Amazing service. I definitely recommend coming here with friends and family!!!

The restaurant has a wonderful ambience. The staff is very friendly and nice. Came for the lunch special which came with a starter, soup/salad and a entree. Got the chicken pad thai, flavor was wonderful. Definitely would come back!

Place looks stunning . Loved the decor . Service was great . Our waiter Poy was very attentive and friendly. Food did not match the expectations but was pretty good . I guess the decor set the bar too high for me . Ordered the pad kee mao . Overall a good place .

Severely overrated Thai cuisine.  Thai restaurant down the block much much better.  The only Thai Papaya salad I've ever had to burn my mouth.  Appetizer, entree and tea set me back $45....so so not worth it.  Plus, chairs are such that you cannot hang your purse on your chair;  NO WAY IM PUTTING A BAG ON THE FLOOR OF ANY RESTAURANT IN NYC...NO CRITTERS COMING HOME WITH ME.
Absolutely delicious! We always come here for the pad thai, kao soi and queen of siam basil.
Visited while in town on business for a late night dinner after a stroll in the park.   Bar service was excellent, food was as well.    Will definitely look to come back when next in town.
Really good. The food was superb. Very tasteful. Staff very attentive. Aesthetically pleasing.
Very good food and affordable. The cashew wok dish was great! Really comfy and nice interior and atmosphere!

I love this place! It has been my go to Thai place on the upper east side for years. The decor is beautiful and inviting, and it is very clean. The music isn't loud. I always order the pad see ew with chicken and it never disappoints.
I've tried many Thai foods from various places in Thailand. The taste I've got from them - Padthai and Tomyam soup are the closest taste to what I've had and remembered.
I recommend the sausage fried rice and pad thai. The service was great too!! Definitely would visit again when I'm on the upper east side!

I keep forgetting to take food pictures because as soon as the delivery arrives, the meal is a gonner. So far, I've ordered the chicken and shrimp pad thai lunch special which comes with an appetizer and I think another appetizer, and a thai iced tea, coming out to $12? Not too bad for lunch in the city! Decent delivery time and again, good food.
This my third time here. Still love it!  Ordered duck salad this time and pork rib. Yum!

I had the BEST basil fried rice of my life here!!!! It was soooo flavorful and spicy, I loved it. Their masaman curry was ok. Everything came out piping hot. I can't wait to go back, and I highly recommend this place for great Thai food.
It is a cute place and the food is very good. Portion sizes are nice and service is fast.
Great food, great dinning experience, waitlist was on point, waitress was attentive and attention to detail. I would definitely recommend this place for tourists that have a craving for Thai.

I went for lunch with my friend. It was delicious and such a good deal! For $10 I got soup, an appetizer, an entree and a Thai iced tea. I've had a lot of Thai food and I really think this might be some of the best.

I would give zero stars if I could. I'm going there every day at my lunch break with my colleagues. Today I met the rudest manager who wouldn't give me a table unless all of my colleague came first. They were literally outside and when they came in she yelled at me saying can you go at the bar and wait sir??? I will never go there again and there is another Thai between 73-74 which we tried today and they are so kind and willing to serve..
One of best Thai places in the UES. Food is fresh and delicious. Wait times can be a little long on Friday nights, but totally worth it. The THEP papaya salad is my favorite!
Great Thai restaurant with a friendly atmosphere! Friendly and fast service! Try the basil fried rice.

Had lunch here on a Saturday afternoon, besides the construction they were doing next to our table the service was good and attentive. The food was alright, I had the ginger stir-fry with seafood and it was pretty bland, didn't really tasted much of the Thai flavors. My wife had the pad-see-yu with the vegetarian duck. This was tastier and the veggie duck had a good texture to it but the noodles were a bit soggy. Our friend had a curry, I didn't taste it but she liked it.  So overall, this new place is okay, I'm sure they'll find their stride after a few more weeks.

It's my new favorite Thai restaurant to order in from. I haven't tried a ton of dishes yet but the spicy udon noodles are unique and delicious. Highly recommend if you're in mood for something spicy yet savory.

Awesome food! Will definitely visit again. All the dishes we got were fresh and tasty. They might have some special ingredients and all the food we got were spiced perfectly with multiple layers of taste. Great experience here. Will recommend the THEP Platter and Wings, as well as seasonal entries. Can't go wrong with traditional Thai dishes such as drunken noodle as well.

The UES has a plethora of great restaurants and this is one of them.  The menu is clearly labeled for people with allergies or preferences.  The food was great.  It was a little loud the night we went.  It looked like they had a large delivery business.
Excellent lunch specials with salad and appetizer.  No wait during lunch time.  Comfy outdoor seating in the shade.
Food and service was great! Had the drunken noodles with shrimp with medium spice. On the spicy side so if you can't handle your spice get mild!

I am not a big fan of mussels, but my coworker ordered them and i was pleasantly surprised. Best mussels I've ever had. The pineapple fried rice and chicken basil were perfect too. Delicious dinner, loved every bite.
Bella the super fabulous server suggested Sea Bass. Turned out to be a decent sized portion. With spicey sauce on the side I could customize the flavor, too. Duck Tamarind next time....

Great thai in upper east! The papaya salad is very fresh, and the crispy duck red curry is very flavorful. A little spice but is exactly what I 've been looking for. Will come back for the pineapple fried rice which also looks delicious.
This place is great for birthdays and kid friendly! The staff is very kind. Food is great! Great Thai place in the UES!
This place is really cute inside. I got the shrimp dumplings which were quite good and the Tom ka which was creamy and flavorful.

Small and cozy restaurant with a nice ambiance! The masaman curry will not disappoint and the added avocado is a nice touch. The pork buns were flavorful. The portions are rather large, an entree and appetizer is enough for two people. The bar has some interesting cocktails & the staff is friendly.
Great Thai- especially the pad Thai wrapped in egg...  the pork chop was a bit too hard.  The ice tea was smooth.  The ambiance is modern.  Delivery is always on point.

Food is great, line was way longer  than the yelp waitlist advertised time. We were waitlisted for 35, showed and then waited another 40 minutes. We were seated, given a free shot because the hostess was very nice. Our food came out in 5 minutes and we are fast. 20 minutes to eat... go if it's not busy

The Thep pad Thai (their signature pad Thai) was a little too sour for my taste and couldn't really taste the lemongrass flavor from the lemongrass pork chop dish. Would consider ordering take out from here!
Delicious! Recommend the Tea Leaves salad!!! Best thing we ate. The pad Thai was so good and the pad kee mao was amazing too!

Cool place! I'm a sucker for a nice interior. I saw drinks being served in coconuts with their restaurant name stamped on them, and dishes coming out in pineapples. The over all presentation of food is fab. I had the cashew king with veg, I didn't find it any different to any Thai food I've had. Tasted fine, nothing special except a ton of salt was in it and I felt it the next day. I'd come back for the atmosphere though if I'm ever in the area again.
this place has an amazing lunch special- soup/ salad and an app and an entree! the food is all delicious - especially the drunken noodles
Cute ambiance with great decor, food and drinks! Wait was quick despite a crowd and service was prompt and courteous
Love their lunch special! Get the calamari for sure, one of the few places where it's made well
This place was amazing!  Delicious food, reasonable prices.  Going back today for more!  Thanks from Vancouver, Canada.
The food was very aesthetically pleasing. Food was really good and the server sat us in earlier at the bar seating. Would come back again 5/5
Pretty decent pad Thai for a decent price. The decor is beautiful and it's a fun place to chill with friends.
Awesome food! Loved the Thai spiced Tilapia, iced tea and Tom yum soup. Definitely tastes very authentic. Recommended!

The service is good but the quality and value of their lunch special is really going down. They used to include drinks (Thai iced tea, coffee etc.) in the lunch special but now not only do they eliminate that but the portion is cut down a lot. I ordered a Pad Kee Mao and the plate is only 1/3 full and it doesn't taste as good as before. It's really a shame that I used to love this place. Now I wouldn't want to come back even for regular dining. You are better off going to other places (such as Up Thai or Spice) around the neighborhood for much better lunch specials deals.
No comment
As a Queens Thai food snob, I'm actually really into Thep's food. They serve a lot of authentic Thai food not usually found in Manhattan, and it's all really tasty.

Love this Thai place! My go-to on the upper east side for drunken noodles. The service here is lovely, the menu is fairly priced, and it has a cute little local ambiance. I'd definitely recommend it to any of my friends in the area.
Really food red curry and Thai iced tea! Nice spot for family and friends! The decor is tasteful and service is wonderful.
The food is out of control!! So delicious, the portions are very generous. We tried a bunch of stuff on the menu and everything was very tasty. If you like spicy get the red curry
I got basil fried rice, it tasted amazing. I travel to Queens for this rice really glad we found this place nearby!
Amazing food! Will come back! I had the shrimp ginger joy and it was very authentic! Would recommend to friends. Easy to go fInd
Love this place. It's my go to Thai on the UES. The pineapple fried rice is to die for.
solid Thai food, and very friendly staff. this is one of my go-to restaurants in the UES
Not authentic. Pad Thai was too sweet and the papaya salad lacked flavor. The tofu with the spicy basil sauce was good but not too spicy.

Me and a friend came here because UpThai was closed.. but NO REGRETS!! The place was very busy on Wednesday night, which is a good sign! Luckily there was one table left available for us. The food was really good authentic thai. I've had thai from just about everywhere in the city and I can confirm this is one of the best. The service was very attentive and fast. I ordered massaman curry and chive pancakes, highly recommend!! Delicious. The restaurant decor is super cute too, love the ambience. Prices are typical thai food prices, not cheap but not expensive either. Will definitely be back!
Love this place!! One of my favorites ! Everything is good food, service and ambience

The atmosphere here was nice but the place is too cramp. I had hard time to go to the ladies room because the space between each table makes it hard to walk. lol... I ordered the shrimp tom yum and shrimp tom kah, the broth was delicious but the shrimp only 2 pieces. :( pad see ew was okay, i've tried something better. but since its a new restaurant, its not too bad.
Really delicious. got the mock duck. Expensive but the portions are big. Was really crowded at 7pm but found a seat at the bar pretty quickly. Bartender is lovely.

Thep Thai is the most delicious Thai food we have had in NYC! It's not a big restaurant and it is always busy so be prepared to put your name down and wait! They only take reservations a couple of the weekdays. The food is so flavorful and the portions are big. Prices are totally affordable and reasonable. The cocktails are also excellent but I do find them expensive for the size of them and they are more expensive than most of the food. Love coming here - servers are great - they have outdoor seating on 2nd avenue and also along 75th street so there's a good chance you can sit outside when you want to during the nice weather months but inside of the restaurant has a cool vibe. By far my favorite Thai restaurant in Manhattan. We have tried a ton of their appetizers and entrees and all were amazing!

This place is very good and very clean, the lighting is very nice as well. It's open and had a nice breeze that made the experience much better. I ordered the pad Thai with chicken. It was very good and I also had a Thai iced tea which was delicious as well. This place is also vegan friendly and not in the they have salads way, it's an actual meal. I definitely recommend this place!
Great, fast service. Good food. Solid lunch special. Cute homey decor. Had the pad Thai lunch special with soup and spring rolls.

I ordered the Khao Soi and my wife ordered the cashew king with chicken. Both were delicious and portions were pretty generous  We're glad we happened upon this restaurant while we were in the area. There's outdoor seating so we were able to have our dog with us too. However during lunch outside the sun is shining directly on you so keep that in mind if you want to eat outside. Will definitely come back.

New Thai restaurant with lovely decor (the wind chimes ring softly when the wind blows and gives a lovely atmosphere).  The food is really good (for NYC- maybe I haven't found the right place yet but I find NYC a bit lacking).  Having tried their regular menu and lunch menus I really think there is a big difference-- lunch menu, which economical really doesn't show the difference in quality between Thep- and say Upthai (just a few blocks away)-- however, the regular dinner menu really stand out-- the food is fresh, flavourful and beautifully presented.  Worth a visit esp if you can sit outdoors on a nice summer evening.

Thep pad thai is not your average pad thai.  You can find dishes at Thep that are more traditional and not so commonly available in your usual Thai restaurants.  The dishes are unique and delicious.  The quality of food did not disappoint.
I had pad thai it was really good and I live the atmosphere and the decoration. The waiters were really attentive as well

Nice and cute Thai place. Drinks are quite good. We ordered two from the specialty menu. The tilapia wrapped in banana leaf is ok but not great, a bit too dry and on the spicier side for my taste and I eat very spicy. The other curry dish is quite good. Will come back again but definitely would not recommend the tilapia in banana leaf dish.

Went there this evening to get takeout.  The delightful server behind the bar not only helped me decide on my food order,  but also explained the freshness of their cocktail ingredients while I waited on my order.  I ended up having a lovely cocktail as I waited.  My takeout order was exactly as I directed and was delicious.  Top marks!  Thank you.

Loved this place! Great cocktails to start with! Coco locco is one I would recommend! Service is prompt! Coming to food, we ordered curry puffs to start with which were okay! Red curry which was amazing along with pineapple fried rice which was presented very well and tasted equally good! I am more inclined towards a 4.5 as there was lack of desserts but the extra half point for great timely service!
Delicious food and great service. We had the duck salad ( with green apples, pineapple, cherry tomatoes, romaine , lime vinaigrette ), shrimp dumplings, and chicken udon. All completely excellent.

So good. I ordered the steamed chicken dumplings, pork buns, and drunken noodles. Chicken dumplings were **amazing** the pork buns had good flavor but were a bit dry but still good. And drunken noodles were delicious and even better the next day.
The lunch special is excellent!  You get a choice of appetizer, soup or salad, drink, and meal for a very reasonable price!  Atmosphere is nice also!

I have eaten here twice, both times were amazing! The first time I had the spicy udon and tonight I had the drunken noodle. Both had amazing flavor. Definitely be prepared for a high spice level, which the menu and waitress warns you about! Great service, food, and atmosphere. The 20-30 minute wait they told us both times ended up being much less.

OMG this place is a taste of Thailand. Yes, I've been there!  Food is authentic, presentation is beautiful, and oh let's talk about the food again...damn delicious. It's a bit loud. Staff is friendly and will give you good recommendations. Papaya salad is scrumptious the AVOCADO MASSAMAN CURRY: oh my. I wish I could get this delivered to MIA!
No comment
One of the best lunch deals in the city, better than UpThai's! Delicious food and friendly waitstaff. I come here at least a few times a month. A total steal in the UES.
Just had dinner with my friend on a week night.  LOVE the vibe..very cozy, great music and exciting food!
Thep has very creative and tasty thai food with great price. Recommend to people who visits upper east side and wants to have some asian food.

Beautiful place, spacious and wow, was that some tasty food. I got the Massaman curry with chicken on the bone and the thom yum soup. Portions are extremely generous and the servers are as sweet as can be.
First time in New York. If you enjoy Thai food, this is the perfect place. Quality is outstanding! Staff is very friendly and accommodating.

Delicious thai food,  refreshing cocktails, beautiful interior, and great service. I sat at the bar this time, and Aom(check spelling) was very accomidating and on point! I had the chai pancakes, thai basil rice with vegetarian duck, and the orange blossom dessert, and I was happy with all. The thai basil rice is on the spicier side, which I loved.
Food is bland. Kati on 14th street is way better. I got the pork buns and the pork was dry.

This place was very average to me which was surprising based upon the reviews.  The setting was nice, but the service and food was lacking. None of the people we came into contact with were very friendly and the hostess acted like we were nuisances.  Moving onto the food, the chicken dumplings were a scary concoction of meat that tasted like microwaved Tyson chicken.  The pad thai was mediocre with spaghetti-like noodles and a sweeter sauce than normal.  The spring rolls were very good though and so was the presentation of the meals.  I rarely ever leave bad reviews but Thep was not great regarding service or the food.
Great environment and wonderful dishes. The waitress is very nice. I love the red curry very much! And the Chai tea is sweet.
Good food and drinks! Perfect location for happy hour plenty of great choice of food! Ambiance are so cool
Very good food.  Susi is an extremely nice and attentive waiter.  Best Tom Kha soup I have ever eaten!
Fantastic authentic Thai food. Nice was a wonderful waitress. Very helpful and friendly. The curries are amazing!!!
Love this new restaurant. It's a great neighborhood Edition. The lunch specials offer lots of food at great prices with many choices. The spicing is perfect. Can't wait to go back.
No comment

We arrived  shortly before 6 pm last Saturday and was offered an outside table right away. The inside was already filled and told to expect 20 minute wait so we accepted an outside table where there are overhead heaters. Husband ordered Siemese fried rice with chicken which he said was delicious and not spicy and I ordered Pad Thai with chicken, also delicious. Our bill totaled around $30 for two and will definitely be back.
First time in this place and I absolutely loved it ! Everything was so good! Food service drinks and everything and the prices are convenient for the lunch special!!
Worth it. Not the cheapest Thai place in the neighborhood but undeniably superior in every dish we tried. Awesome ambience for date night and group dinners with friends!

Great service at this place. Our server was prompt and helpful. We had the drunken noodle (with veggies) and green curry with veggie duck. Both were very good. We also got the Thai iced tea and coffee, which were good as well.

I have gone to many Thai restaurants on UES and only recently came here.  It's definitely one of the better options on UES.  Great lunch special.  The basil stir fry was very good as well as the chicken curry soup.  Definitely worth coming here.

Food was pretty ok, and the wait wasn't so bad for a table. Appetizer sampler was enough to share for 3 people and we ordered 2 mains: Khao Soi was flavorful and the egg noodles were perfectly al dente! Avocado curry chicken was good, but too similiar to the Khao Soi

This place has a very cool atmosphere. The staff seem nice and the food is delicious. Aesthetically pleasing decode and very friendly attitudes. Pretty popular without having to wait at least on this Thursday night. Would highly suggest.

Beautiful interior design. The service is very good. The staff is very friendly and attentive -- they refilled our water when they saw our cups were about to be empty. I ordered the pad kee mao which was extremely flavorful and the colors were popping.
Great place for a quick lunch after visiting the museums on Fifth Avenue. About a 15 minute walk. The lunch specials are a bargain and delicious.
I did not love the food at this restaurant. I found the pad thai bland and overpriced. The bartender was very friendly and the service was good.

Went to THEP last night with my mom and sister. Atmosphere was great! The wait staff was very attentive. For starters the crab Rangoon's and chicken satay were amazing. We also had pork rolls and spring rolls that were good. The Pineapple Fried Rice was very good with great presentation. The Pad Thai was good, but I didn't think it necessarily was better than your typical Pad Thai dish. Overall great experience and would go back.
This place is bomb! Stumbled upon it on my way from Sotheby's, was so fresh and the service was so fast! Definitely one of my favorite this places in the city
They were really busy but their food delivered and their staff was very helpful.  I would definitely come backm  until next time

Great! Love the atmosphere, and the wait staff was super nice and friendly. I ordered spicy udon noodles with chicken, which were awesome. Decently priced for the quality, and only a 5/10 minute wait on a Saturday night. Didn't try the cocktails, but they sounded really good. Definitely coming back!

Good thai food, the appetizers were delicious! I highly suggest this place to anyone looking for a nice dinner out with a loved one. Expect at least a 30 minute wait on the weekends, but definitely worth it in the end.

Really good service, and it's a nice place. The interior was decorated beautifully and theres soft lighting. The bathroom is clean. The food was so good. I ordered the pad see ew and it was one of the best ones I have ever eaten. The thai iced tea was also good. I would come back here.
Great service, currently waiting for the pineapple fried rice that everyone here raves about. Our waitress even let us dine in 5 minutes after the kitchen closed, thank you again!
One of the best Thai restaurants in upper east side! Tried their pad sew and pork bun and it was amazing! Definitely recommend :)

I come here most times during my lunch breaks and I'm never disappointed. First off, it's a beautiful restaurant and the atmosphere is lovely and relaxing. The service is fast, and the wait staff are very friendly and attentive. Their lunch specials are the best around, as you can get a drink, appetizer, and entree for a little over $10. I would definitely recommend anyone in the area to come in and check this place out!

We dined early evening and within 15 minutes of being seated there was a queue for tables. This is a very popular place and it's easy to see why. We both had the green chicken curry and it was delicious. In fact, one of the best I've eaten outside Thailand. Service was attentive and polite and though we sat outside, it's clear that inside has been designed as an inviting environment. We'll be back!

Wow. My friend and I happened upon this restaurant and I'm going to have to eat here every day for the rest of my life. We sat at the bar. The vibe was upbeat without being intrusive.  The decor is lovely. The bartender and the guy who took our order were both owners, and they are young, warm and enthusiastic.  The drinks we had were served in charming metal pineapples. (Sorry I'm not a millennial so I don't always think to take photos. ) I had the Spicy Udon noodles and my friend and I shared chicken satay. She had an appetizer that I want to call Rangoon but I'm not sure I'm correct.  All DELICIOUS. The noodle dish was brimming with al dente veg and soft tofu. By half way through the second drink I was drunk. That's saying a lot because I'm not a lightweight.  Prices were standard for NYC, not cheap but not high for the quality. I'd give 6 stars if I could.

Food is very good, very tasty, sometimes it might be a little too salty, but whenever points it to the server, the message is delivered. The service is good too. I think this is my most favorite thai restaurant in the city. By the way, the restaurant is cute, clean,very inviting and a little modern too.

I just can't say enough wonderful things about Thep! I live a block away and probably eat in or order for delivery at least once a week   the food is just so good here and I looovve  the vibe and everyone working here.
I'm here on vacation and had a great experience here. Waitress was very nice and friendly. The portion for the lunch menu is big enough to feed two. Over nothing to complain about.
Really like this place- food is fresh and consistently good...nice lunch or dinner spot.

Hip new spot on the UES. I was surprised at how reasonable the prices are for a new upper east side restaurant. The food was very good - I enjoyed the curry that I ordered my wife enjoyed her drunken noodles. Delicious Thai iced tea too
Great lunch today, I had the THEP wings and the Pad See Ew lunch special. Really spot on and a good value for lunch.

Good service, good food, nice atmosphere and big portions. Tried their duck salad and it was awesome! We also had honey pork rib, pork bun and fried shrimp dumpling for appetizer and everything was just so delicious. Excellent Thai food!

Went here on a Saturday night with friends, a party of 6, without a reservation and they sat us within 30 mins! The restaurant was small, but really cute and well decorated. The food and drinks were worth every penny.

My boyfriend and I had a great dinner at THEP. We sat at the outdoor space and enjoyed delicious food. Really recommend the sea bass and vegetarian duck wok. For appetizer, we had fried shrimp dumpling, honey pork rib and pork bun. Definitely going to come back soon!
No comment

Ive been here a few times for lunch and the food is consistently good. The avocado massaman curry is the right amount of spicy. The lunch menu is a great value for the neighborhood. And Peary was a friendly and attentive waitress.
Ordered in a while ago. Great food, fast delivery. I'd recommend the pad Thai with vegetable

This is my first time here. Great place good vibe. A lot of people, so if you come here on weekend, better to make a reservation. We ordered the pad thai and green curry,  i really like the pad thai, the noodle inside is special. But it's too faraway from my place_ I cannot come too often, who live uptown come and try
If you want your waiter to surprise you with their preference of food, and have zero regards as to what you request, go for this place. Will never come here again that's for sure!!
No comment
Everything was good except the pad Thai. I wish they had coconut ice cream. I was sad.
The rangoons are a MUST HAVE! Light and flaky.... not oily and had lots of filling with great flavor! Speedy, friendly service and great food!
One of the best Thai restaurants! We loved the krapow puffs, steamed chicken dumplings, pad Thai, green curry, and spicy udon. Would definitely come back!

Loved this place!! Excellent Thai food, Large portions compared to other places, and great atmosphere! Will definitely be returning! Ordered appetizers and meals and the presentation was fantastic! Customer service was great, manager was the nicest !
No comment
Food was good ! I ordered avocado masaman curry and was really good .Always look forward to visiting this place !
Love the pad Thai, super yummy. I wish they serve not sweeten Thai iced tea. Servers are nice and cute!

Everyone is right about the khao soi--it's excellent. The pineapple fried rice and pad thai are also really good, and we loved starting with the tea leaves salad last time, I highly recommend it. Drinks are good too, prices are very reasonable, and we loved getting to sit outside. This is my nice Thai place of choice in the UES.
Love this restaurant! Been here several times and it never disappoints me. Great food and atmosphere. The Pad Thai and Pad See Eiw are delicious, very tasty! The service was also very good.
Great food and service. I got the Tom kha soup and ginger joy. Both dishes were very delicious.

I thought the food and the ambiance was exquisite. The waiters were lovely and everything was very unique, from the plates and silverware to the food presentation. It was actually relatively cheap for what I expected.. I went on a sunny day with a friend, we sat outside but even fi it would be hard to do that with the upcoming cold, the inside is super cute, airy despite being small and nicely decorated!
delicious, great service, pretty decor. A bit cramped and noisy. Best to go with friends or family when noise doesn't matter

Great budget Thai restaurant with an amazing variety of dishes that are mostly vegetarian/vegan friendly.  Make sure to try the Thai Iced Tea as it is more tasteful than most!!  Also, if you plan on dining on a weekend, makes sure you join the Yelp waitlist in order to be seated in due time.  The restaurant has a great ambience that accompanies the great food, which a win in my book! (Not to mention that the portion sizes are completely up to par with the prices!)
Had the Drunken Noodles extra spicy with Shrimp. Very tasty and good sized portions! Not too much food. Price is reasonable as well and staff is friendly.

Beautiful restaurant in upper east side NY, it is right by my job and has great lunch specials ! I ordered the fried calamari with Thai soup as an appetizer and basil jasmine rice with shrimp and it was amazing ! The tea is very hot and the service is very good ! I highly recommend this Thai place . One of the best I have ever been to!
I really like the vibe of the restaurant and the service is really good. The food is good quality too.
My party of 7 was served by Pond, and we had a wonderful time! The food was great, drinks were great, and atmosphere was perfect! Thanks so much!
Enjoyed dinner.  Would prefer sweet sauce with spring rolls and spice range with pad thai
Brought my best friend here for his birthday, awesome time highly recommend, great food, better service. Drunken noodles are a+
My favorite Thai restaurant in NYC. Excellent food, service and atmosphere for an affordable price. I'd highly recommend it to anyone on the upper east side

My friend took me here from the Upper East Side, and I was pleasantly surprised y the ambience and selection of foods. The presentation was amazing! I haven't seen such gorgeous presentation in a double dollar sign restaurant. It's a busy and bustling restaurant, a testament to its quality!
Delicious!! I really like Pineapple fried rice with shrimp and Tom kha gai soup. Very Smooth and creamy.
They're really nice and have good service and amazing food. Their prices are affordable and nice setting. All the decor is nice but there's no wifi.

Great food and excellent service!! Answered all questions and offered suggestions. Loved the pad Kee mao and panang curry! As a vegetarian, they even made the dishes without fish sauce. Definitely on of the top Thai restaurants in NYC.
The drunken noodles are amazing. Very pleasantly spicy. We thoroughly enjoyed all 3 entrees (but the drunken noodles were the best). And Pond was an excellent waitress.
No comment
If you want a good spot for Thai food this is the place. Good service and the wait was pretty good. Thai tea was sooo good. I will definitely come back.

The food was so fresh and delicious! I came here after having a surgery from a nearby hospital, and I'm so glad I made the trek! The inside decorations were amazing, and the restaurant was filled at 2pm on a weekday afternoon!
Lovely place! The staff knows what they are about! Helpful and quick. The food is pretty authentic Thai! Nice to visit if you're in the neighborhood!
THEP is very nice! So was Nice, our waitress. She had great recommendations for authentic Thai food. Highly recommend the duck. The curry, YUP! Thai iced coffee. Great.
Amazing. Best Thai food on the Upper East Side...possibly one of the best in the City.
Best Thai food I've ever had and the service is awesome! Ask for the server, Nice. She's awesome. Cute outdoor seating and really hip/bohemian atmosphere.
This must be my favorite thai place in town! Definitely recommend Pad Thai and crab fired rice. Good place for a casual lunch or dinner! Look forward to trying other dishes next time.

Best Iced latte ever. Better than even starbucks! Awesome lunch special Monday to Friday for around 10 bucks. The place gets really busy so make sure to reserve a table in advance especially if you would like to sit inside. Outside seating is present but I assume it wont be an option during cold times.
First time in New York by myself and while I was wondering around I stumbled upon this place. Absolute amazing! I got the curry chicken and it was delicious. Very good discovery!
Most delicious Thai food in Manhattan! Whenever I'm in the UES I come to Thep for Thai and I am never disappointed. Our waitress, Pond, is the best!

We went back twice within weeks. Food and service is fantastic. The drink a very spicy cocktail was amazing. Will def return. I can't remember the items we ordered but we got all vegetarian items and sometimes they are hit or miss but these were all great.
Really great food if you want a good deal for lunch! I got the pad see ew with chicken and it was very flavorful!

column3: Central Business District, New Orleans, LA
column6: The ambiance was great - friendly waiters and lovely dark wood and plants. I ordered a Thai iced tea and the pineapple fried rice. Both were delicious, and the fried rice was served in a pineapple which made for beautiful presentation.
Amazing lunch special. Their Thai Ice tea is also refreshing. Lovely authentic Thai Restaurant on the Upper East Side!
No comment
Delicious food and atmosphere! Quick service and beautiful presentation. I would recommend the red curry!

Love this place! I went for the lunch special and it was so filling that I went home with left overs. The atmosphere is so nice and it's a great place to get food. Would definitely recommend for anyone craving Thai food!
I got the spicy udon noodles and they were delicious. The Thai ice tea wasn't overly sweet which was perfect.

Not only is the food great, Thep Thai Restaurant has a charming, trendy atmosphere that I really enjoyed. The Drunken Noodle dish with chicken was very yummy and something I had never tried at other Thai restaurants. I highly recommend!
Great Thai food in the UES!!! One of the best green curries I have ever had. Loved the decor and hanging plants. Will go back again!!
I like the environment of this Thai restaurant! Very chill and fancy. Also the Thai ice tea is really good!

Love this place. I've never eaten there, only had delivery but its my go when I want Thai food. The Garlic Goddess, is my favorite but I've also had their Pad Thai and Mango Salad which are equally as delicious. Delivery is always fast, sometimes too fast! Last time I ordered, I went to walk my dog quick and we got back just as the guy was arriving! Only walked halfway down the block!
Great food, excellent ambiance. We had the steamed striped bass and soup noodle. Would definitely recommend it!

This is my favourite Thai restaurant so far in nyc. The pineapple fried rice and mock duck curry are excellent; only drawback is the curry is very thick and it makes you full very quickly. The Thai milk tea is also fantastic; not too sweet, as with other places. The service was fantastic, they really go above and beyond to make sure their diners enjoy their experience. Will definitely return in the near future!

I came here for a dinner tonight with family and thought the food was pretty good. The Khao soi was my favorite and we got it with white meat off the bone. It was also large enough to share. The drunken noodles were spicier than expected but flavorful. Overall, I enjoyed the meal and would come back
Yummy. Plus outdoor seating is fun. Fabulous food and great service. From the curry to the cocktails this place is consistent and a great choice for a fun and delicious meal.
Really good food-I recommend the appetizer platter. It was pretty and yummy! Good ambiance inside as well. (Also get the thai tea)

Unique and modern interior. Tried the khao soi. Nice coconut flavor with minimal amount of spice. Two large pieces of chicken thighs that were tender. Decent Thai ice tea that's 1 dollar if you check in or complementary if you write a review. Servers were prompt and attentive. Would come back

Came here for lunch on a Sunday. The four of us were seated right away at 12. It's a beautiful restaurant. Very spacious with a nice modern decor. I got the khao soi which was a solid choice. Very good broth and tender chicken. It was very filling. Would come back again and maybe try something new.

Tried this place for the 2nd time. (Delivery). I will give most restaurants at least a second if not 3rd chance; no third chance on this one. Soup was very salty, Pad se ew was tasteless and barely a veggie to be seen. Noodles were waaaaaay over cooked. Salad was sitting on top of the HOT food making it soggy by the time I got it. Doesn't come close to their competition one block south. Sorry guys!

Amazing new place! Generous and tasty portions and the interior design is that of a much more expensive restaurant. We got our meals pretty quick and were very impressed by the plating and the dishes used at this restaurant. Our server was very nice and we will definitely be back for the lunch special as well as a nice dinner in the near future.

THEP Thai was absolutely fantastic! They provided a great fusion of classic Thai dishes with a modern twist. The go to here is, of course, the pad Thai, but the basil fried rice and green curry dishes are also extremely tasty. You truly can't go wrong with anything here!
The food and drinks is awesome and I like the food presentation as well. Nice restaurant in UES, I am sure I will come back again and again.
Highly recommend the spicy udon!! Such a unique and incredible dish. The curry dishes are very excellent too! The best Thai on UES!
This place is cozy and pretty. The food was amazing!!!! Our favorite was the shrimp steamed dumpling and pad Thai. Definitely will come back

We stopped here for a late lunch on a weekday. The lunch special is a great deal - $10-$13 for two small appetizers and a good-sized entre. The drunken noodles were very tasty (although quite spicy). Great Thai spot on the UES!
Great service and nice environment! Pad Thai and Pad See Ew are my favorite

This place was great! They had great service and food. The entire staff was attentive and kind, and added to the welcoming atmosphere. The music and ambience was also unique and trendy. The thai ice tea was also amazing!

So happy to have a Thai restaurant close to my house! The food and service is very good. The only bad thing I have to say about this place is the drinks and wine. They shouldn't be serving cocktails for $13+ with well liquor, and the bottles of wine are completely overpriced ($15+ over priced!). Grocery store wines at steakhouse prices. Very unusual to see a Thai restaurant with alcohol prices like this. They also need to offer a better selection of wine (at better prices).

So my friends and I went here to celebrate my best friend's birthday and the servers were being very RACIST, RUDE, AND INAPPROPRIATE.  One of my friends came early and asked for a table for us and the hostess told her to come back with everyone and we will have a table. When we all got there, she told us that it was not a proper reservation and took down her name and number then told us it was a 30 minute wait. So we said ok and took a walk and came back. She proceeded to say that a group was finishing up and it should be another 10 minutes.  10...20...30...40...60...90 minutes later we finally got a table after waiting for so long in the cold. Every server except for one male waiter gave us dirty looks. Now we took into notice that we were the only group of black young women in that entire resturant. The food was ok when we ate, but when it came time for the check they gave us more problems. Now we calculated everyone's part correctly and did the math more than once. They  came back to us four or five times telling us that we underpaid. WE OVER PAID THEM BY $60 AND THEY KEPT GIVING COMPLICATIONS. After we overpaid them, two of my friends went to the bathroom and two of us were sitting at the table. The same rude hostess from before came and asked us to wait at the bar because another group needed the table. By this time we were annoyed because thet were rushing us out after they had us WAITING 90 MINUTES FOR THE TABLE. The part that irritated us was that the other groups in the resturant were doing that and they werent told to move, but we had to move and we havent been there as long as they have. Before the hostess got a reply from us, she grabbed my friend's to go bag from her hand and DROPPED IT ON THE BAR. We went outside because we needed to calm down and when the rest of our group came out we left. MY FRIEND WAS LEFT CRYING BECAUSE HER BIRTHDAY DINNER WAS RUINED AND WE HAD TO SPEND MONEY ON SUCH A RUDE AND DISRESPECTFUL ESTABLISHMENT. I also feel that they were taking advantage of us because we were all 17-18 year old college students. I would recomend the food, but the costumer service was so bad that I would not recomend going here.
The Best Thai in the upper east side! great lunch special prices and always fresh food.
Favorite Thai restaurant on upper east side. Good is amazing as well as the service and love the ambience. Their cocktail selection is also tasty and impressive.
Amazing food. The lunch special was a really good deal. You can get 2 appetizers and an entree for around $10-$12. The fried rice has a lot of flavor. The drunken noodles too.
Good Service! Came here for friend's birthday. Ordered Khoi Soi. The noodle was a little sweet but in general enjoyed dinner here. But Nice experience would recommend.

Came here for the first time today after wanting to go for a while. Thep thai has a really nice atmosphere and the food was delicious as well. Especially if you're into spicy food. I'd definitely give it a try if you're in the area.
Pad kee mao with duck and sausage were delicious but pad thai just didn't taste right.
This is a great restaurant for Thai food. I love the drunken noodles and the Thai ice tea great staff and ambience too

Great ambience and amazing staff. The food is always disappointing though. Pad Thai is too sweet and there is always an after taste to every shrimp and chicken dish I've had so far like bad egg smell. The cocktails are good and inventive but after giving this place so many chances I am not inclined to eat here again

I have been waiting for forever to try this place and it was well worth the wait. THEP is my new favorite Thai spot. It's a bit pricey than your average Thai place but the food quality is so much better. In Thailand, we would get pad thai in an egg crepe on the street for $3. At THEP, you pay $26 for pad thai in an egg crepe, though it also comes with squid, gigantic prawns, and green apples. A bit pricey though it is hard to find pad thai in an egg crepe in NYC. The regular pad thai is only about $15 so we will definitely do that in the future. I also had the khao soi which was arguably better than any khao soi I had in Chiang Mai! It was creamy with tons of flavor and noodles were perfectly cooked. I was able to switch out the chicken on the bone for tofu which was fantastic. The tofu was so soft and flavorful in the broth. There isn't a ton of space here so I'd recommend making a reservation or be prepared to wait for a cramped seat but the food was quite delicious.

A solid Thai place. I had the cashew king, a sumptuous mix of peppers, pineapple, and cashew, with the vegetarian duck. The flavors were good, and when combined with rice was a delectable mix of sweet and sour.
We ordered pineapple fried rice and curry with a bottle of Thai tea. All of these dishes were very delicious. I would highly recommend this place for a lovely meal.

Great experience! Very friendly and attentive staff. The food was delicious and I've never seen pad thai made this way! It had little shaved turnip pieces in it and a crepe over it. Very interesting. The decor was very nice as well. Some beautiful chandeliers and pretty wallpaper. Would definitely return!

This is my third time being here, the feeling is still as same as the first time. This place is so awesome, lovely music and atmosphere. The menu has many options from appetizer to main dish. Also loving their spicy level which I couldn't adjust in any other thai restaurant. Absolutely love this place and will come back whenever I want to visit Thai Food.

The interior of this place is so aesthetically on point. It was also well air-conditioned and such a cool atmosphere on a hot summer day. I got the Tom yum soup and pad see ew and they were delicious. My husband got the pad kee mao and he loved it. Our server, Paery, was also very nice! Highlyyyy recommend.

It is simply one of the best thai restaurant in upper east side. well, i cant say about the whole manhattan, but if you're in this neighbourhood, look no further if youre craving for thai food. ambience is great, food is great. and it definitely feels local here. i highly recommend this place, after living in UES for 3 years now.
Amazing spot! Great service and delicious food. If you need a Thai fix this is the place to got

As far as service and quality of food, this is by far one of the best experiences I've had. The wait wasn't too long and the ambience was great. My favorite part of dinner was the lychee Thai iced tea. One of the waitresses went so far as to replace a candle that was accidentally blown out for us. Definitely hope to come again!
Really great food and great service! Didn't have to wait too long for a table or food. Had the spicy udon and it was amazing.
5 minute wait and got served very quickly. Food was really good! really good avacado massaman curry with big portions. servers were really nice. definitely going to come here again!
Our first time to this restaurant - nice decor. Good drinks and great food. The lemongrass pork chop was very juicy and well-seasoned. Pad see ew was on the point. Will definitely come back again.

My friend and I came on a Saturday night and were told we had a 45 minute wait which ended up being maybe 20 min. I got the chicken pad Thai and she got the green curry, and they were both delicious!!! We both ate for a total of $26 ($13 per meal). The atmosphere was gorgeous!
We got amazing food! There was a great ambiance at the place. The panang curry was just excellent along with the pineapple fried rice! Will recommend.
THEP is so yummy their lunch special is an amazing deal! I always try something new and am never disappointed. Their ambiance is amazing as well.
Great restaurant, I came here with a couple of my friends and both the service and food was great. I really enjoyed the short rib curry and I will definitely order it again when I come back.
The interior at this place is really cute and cozy! The food is even better and the staff is very patient and nice. We got the drunken noodles and the short rib curry which I highly recommend.

Having grown up in Cali with plenty of Thai food places to select from, I can be a bit selective when it comes to Thai food.  I generally don't judge a place from it's Pad Thai, but from either it's Larb, Pad See Ew, or Pad Woon Sen.  I came with a friend and tried the Pad See Ew.  The taste was correct, but the noodles were a bit over cooked.  They did have good service though.  Prices were a bit higher than expected but this is the UES and NYC, so...
This place had great ambiance and options! Everything came in a good pacing/timing. Hope to come back again!

Great food and quick service. I ordered the basil fried rice and the dumplings. They were both delicious. You should note that you won't be seated unless your full party is there, which I actually appreciated

I stopped by to pick up lunch to go. The decor is beautiful. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I ordered the massaman avocado curry,spring rolls, soup and a Thai iced tea. Everything was delicious I will visit again!

This is by far one of the best Thai restaurants I've visited. I came here earlier in the week during lunchtime. Their lunch special deal is great and at such a reasonable price. Their spring rolls were the smallest I've ever seen, but they were great! The thai iced tea was great with strong tea flavor. I had the massaman curry which is always my go-to Thai dish. I judge a Thai restaurant by their massaman curry, and this restaurant did not disappoint. The overall decor was great and the waitress who served us was also fantastic. Great customer service from beginning to end. I would certainly come here again. I wish I lived closer so I can order from here or visit it more often.

Not sure why my initial review got removed, but I have been here twice and the food is ok, I mostly rate it a 2 because I ordered a Papaya Salad and it was INSANELY spicy! No dish really stood out to me and as per usual for a vegetarian there was very fishy/eggy tasting pad kee mao. Green curry with chicken was good for my husband.

The food was fine, on par with the many American-Thai restaurants throughout Manhattan. The service is very efficient...actually too efficient. Dishes are removed mid-course, which begs the question: Is the kitchen short on serving pieces and glasses? The music is super loud. Not a good choice for catching up with friends. We had to speak in very loud voices to hear each other and to talk above everyone else around us speaking loudly.

Went here Friday night for dinner. Sat at the bar while we waited for a table. Lychee martini was good. For apps had the chicken satay and the spring rolls, both were good. Then had the Pad Kee Mao which was excellent and just the right amount of spice. Word to the wise - the diamond denoting Spicy on their menu are no joke. Pad Kee Mao had one diamond and was pretty spicy. The green curry had three, so I couldn't even imagine.
Great environment and nice service here. Food is good. I asked for a more spicy curry and it was superb. Overall a great experience!
No comment

One of my new favorite Thai spots in the city! Went on a Friday night, it was a bit busy. They said the wait would be 30 minutes, but they ended up seating us in 15 min. More than the food, the cocktails were my favorite part. They have a really cool menu of drinks to choose from. Highly recommend the calamari for appetizer. For entrees, we got green curry with chicken and massaman curry with chicken. Totally worth it!

Thank you for having vegan options and a lunch special! I have been here twice now and I've tried the drunken noodles and pad see ew (both with vegetables and the vegan option). The drunken noodles were pretty good, but I wasn't a fan of the pad see ew. I am used to this dish being salty and for some reason it was kind of sweet here. Maybe that is just how their recipe is, but for my tastes, I wouldn't eat that here again. Because they have a good lunch special, I'd come back and maybe try something else or have the drunken noodles again.
Absolutely love the ambiance and all of the little details from the gold serving utensils to the decor.
This place is amazing! Amazing food and good service and it's close to my place so I go often there after work with my friends. Always crowded.
Extremely fast pick up order, and the portions were a great size. The prices are great too and the food was very flavorful without being oily. I'll definitely be back.
The drinks, food, service and ambience were all terrific. Even the vegan amongst us was happy. We will be back.
Recommend this restaurant, food really delicious. The restaurant is very nice decoration, good service attitude, good food taste.
Overall, really nice experience. Sat outside, nice outdoor seating. Refreshing Thai iced tea. Creamy green curry, got it with less spice and it was delicious. Good service.
No comment

Great place. I shared the chicken pad Thai and pork belly and it was great for two people. Great combo. Peary provided great service. She was fantastic with the pace of getting the food and wine. We had a bottle of Malbec as well that paired well with the meal.
Thep is one of the best thai restaurants I've been.  I frequently order from there mostly online. Their food is really good and fresh.  I love it!
Amazing food and Authentic Thai. My new favorite spot on the upper east side. Would love to see delivery soon. Service is a little slow when dining in.

This place was good, but a little expensive so I likely won't go back. I split the chicken basil fried rice and an appetizer sampler with my girlfriend. The rice was amazing, the platter was pretty good as well, just fried dumplings, and spring rolls, etc. bill came out to $50.

The pad see ew was well seasoned and not too overbearing--safe choice for those who love noodles! Also had the Masan curry with cane with nuts, chicken, potatoes, onions and avocado which had great peanut flavor but still a light curry--great for those who don't want anything too heavy. Our server was Jane who was awesome and attentive!
Amazing food! And just loved the drinks. Very delicious and great quantity. Must visit for authentic thai.
Food was great! The sauce on the pork belly was absolutely amazing. MUST TRY. Our waitress Susie was great!
They have great food here, I Highly recommend every thing on the menu. Come here with your girlfriend or your family! You will love it !!
aesthetically pleasing interior with fantastic authentic Thai food! had the soup and papaya salad- was quite delicious.
very cute decor! love the hanging plants. Waitress was very nice and attentive. Come for lunch, they have an awesome deal :) the food is great
This is an amazing restaurant. The paid thai is very delicious. Great atmosphere and very friendly staff
Good atmosphere and wonderful wait staff. I enjoyed my time here. Quick turn around so the wait wasn't long. My server was very attentive and even suggested things to drink. It as great date spot.
Love coming here! Delicious food and outstanding service!  And they are dog friendly.
Great food- absolute favorite Thai place on the upper east. Thank you for the endless amount of vegan options! For a higher-end spot, very reasonable prices too. Love love love THEP!
Lovely setting and the waitress also was really friendly. Food was great too and I love the spice
Good food, portions were great and the service was fast and friendly. They also have lunch specials which I really liked and the decor was beautiful!
No comment
Delicious Thai food and a great atmosphere!! Everyone that works here is so friendly and I've had the best pad thai ever here!
One of the best Thai places I have ever been to :) Lively ambience and delicious food.

Yumm!! 100% going back (is tomorrow too soon?). I got my favorite app- the crab rations- and they were the best in the city. And then the madaman curry, my go to thai restaurant dish and it was delicious. If you're looking for good thai food, look no further!

Ordered takeout, came in a heartbeat and it was fresh and super delicious. BEST EVER, will order from here again and again, the UES is blessed with a new Thai restaurant  that delivers spectacular dishes and fair prices!!
Lunch special is a good deal.  Ordered the khao soi and green curry beef.  Comes with a choice of starter and soup or salad.
This food is good but the atmosphere is not so good to eat and enjoy. You can ejoy this food if you like noodles much
Went here today with four of my friends and everyone left happy. Delicious food, great service and a really good lunch special. The place is beautiful and clean.
Yummmmm great spot on the UES. Flavorful Thai great service. We were there as a big group and accommodated well.
Amazing food. Love the avocado Massaman curry. Friendly services. Definitely worth the wait.

Service is great. We were seated immediately on a Saturday night, even though they were clearly super busy. The waitstaff is genuinely welcoming and nice to be around. We've ordered online many times, they always come faster than predicted, and the one time they were just a bit late, the kind employee on the phone gave us a discount. The food is AMAZING. Wonton soup is the best I've ever had in New York, Tofu is silken to perfection, and the spicy udon is delicious. Will continue to be a customer.
Food is moderate. Shared table with a big party and get us four squeezed in a narrow space. Won't go there the next time.
I love the food and decor here. Very nice and fast service. Our party of nine was fit very well and the food was delicious! Thank you so much for a nice time and birthday celebration
This is by far the best Thai place in all of manhattan. Lunch deal to die for. Once you go you won't be able to stop going. Order any of the Curry's best ever !!!!!!

Ordered a plethora of shareable options for our table between the papaya salad, pork belly, pineapple fried rice, and pad Thai, and everything was fantastic. The sauce on the pork belly was delicious and the pineapple fried rice experience in itself was elevated with the physical pineapple serving. Hosts were great throughout and helpful in getting our seating accommodated and our needs throughout.

Went here with two friends last week and couldn't have been more impressed. We had to wait about 45 minutes, but the food was well worth it. The two hostesses were friendly and apologetic for the wait, the bartender made us some fantastic cocktails while we waited, and when we did sit down to eat, the food was absolutely fantastic. I eat Thai food often and this was up there as the best I've ever had. 5's
The food came really quickly and the waiters were attentive. I really enjoyed the avocado massaman curry, it was really light and flavorful

Most Thai spots are pretty decent. Typical, standard menu. Something was off tonight...chicken was on the rotten side and had an odd taste. Had chicken dumpling and khao soi. They need to ensure meat is fresh. Sauce in the entree was alright, but I wouldn't want to go here again.

the food was delicious , but they dont get a 4 or 5 star because the service was really mediocre. The waitress kept coming to take our order right away when we were all looking for what to get, she didn't answer our questions, then didnt come back at all for a while. Also there was no checking in on how our food was, and then she charges 20% mandatory gratuity and that she knows where it is disclaimed on the menu for 6 people, and happily points out. If only she had more knowledge of the entire menu, it would have been helpful and would have made our experience better. Please train your wait staff to educate on the menu and also to check in once or twice when the food is there.
I love this place! very good service food is always well prepared. I just wish that they closed at 4pm like they say on the the door and not 3:45
Drunken noodles and thai iced tea are great. Love the ambiance of the restaurant and the way the food is displayed. Perfect for a date night. Will definitely be back!

Our lunch at Thep was wonderful! Lovely, sunny ambience with stylish decor. The lunch special is an incredible deal offering a starter, a soup/salad, and an entree. The food was delicious and served quickly. Would definitely recommend!

Very delicious lunch- the special is such a good deal and the interior of the restaurant could not be any cuter. Our appetizers were so good (they have calamari!), as were the entrees. Would definitely recommend and come here again. 10/10!
Great service and fabulous Thai food! My first visit for lunch. Definitely on my return list.

The food here is good however it must've been the day that I went, which was on a Sunday night, it was really busy and noisy. Aside from that however, the food was great, service was on point. Took off one star due to the atmosphere.

This is a very solid choice for Thai food on the upper east. They have all the classic Thai dishes that one expects at a Thai restaurant, but also some special dishes which are not typically finds. We had a shared platter of a sampling of appetizers.  These were mostly fried and two pieces of around 5-6 apps.  This was a great way to taste a variety of things and nice way to start off the meal with drinks.  We got two separate entrees- rice and noddle dishes- both pleasantly served and top notch.  They have an extensive list of cocktails and speciality drinks as well as wine and I think beer.  Service was attentive.  The only drawback I found was that it is very very loud (crowded night although we went early and music too loud ). More mellow background music to not compete with the noise of people would be much better atmosphere.  It was difficult to relax and have a conversation at times. Also it is a bit cramped. So I would be hesitant to come back during prime evening times.  They do delivery as well and lunch specials so that's always a great option.
I love this place! Best Pad Thai in the city and the service is fantastic. We love the crispy spring rolls and their vegetarian options are great. The lunch special can't be beat!

Best delivery and thai food I've had in the states. This restaurant gives me a home away from home tastes. I continuously come back to their authentic delicious meals for a taste of Thailand. The pad si ew is outstanding and the chicken skewers are amazing. Highly recommend.

love the atmosphere here, beautiful decor! got the calamari & shrimp dumplings as an appetizer, the thai sauce is incredible!! got spicy udon noodles that were cooked to perfection with incredible flavor. will definitely be visiting whenever im in the area !!!

Love this place!!!! Creative and delicious cocktails, excellent service and the best thai food on the UES.  Favorite dishes are the pineapple fried rice, pad thai and the avocado curry! Highly recommend!

I ordered delivery from here through Caviar. I got the vegetable pad thai and the calamari as a starter. The calamari were pretty good, with a very flavorful savory batter, but I wish the sauce wasn't so spicy. The pad thai was average, with less egg, peanut, and vegetable than I would have liked. Overall, a mediocre spot for delivery, nothing special.
I absolutely love this place! We take out from here as well as come for a sit down dinner and it's fantastic every time! Best Pad Thai in NYC!
This restaurant is amazing! Great service, great food, great atmosphere. A neighborhood favorite you have to try in the upper east side! Best Thai food in this area!
Very polite staff and great vibes classy trendy decor. Pineapple fried rice is really good and drinks aren't expensive at all. Love it!

I found this place on a Tuesday afternoon simply walking by, and loved the decor. They have a communal table and great music. The lunch special is a bit large, with one appetiser, one soup/salad and one entrée, but still yummy. I loved the Thai iced tea and got two of them. The drunk noodles were delicious and just the right amount of spicy. I loved the place!
This is an amazing thai restataurant and we had a great experience with food and service. Portions were great and food was full of authentic flavours. We will be back soon!!

I have ordered delivery and been to the restaurant many times.  Tonight I picked up chicken pad Thai.  The chicken was dry bland flavorless and tasted like it has been sitting all day.  Usually it is dry but tonight is an off night. I will never bring it in again. I will re try dine in only and see.
We got the eggroll and I got pad Thai for the entree. The entree was delicious and the eggrolls were okay. Service was fast. The place is crowded and loud. pricing is okay by NYC standards.
The best in the neighborhood!!!  I've enjoyed everything I've eaten here and their takeout is equally good.

On the upper east side we must have a hundred restaurants within walking distance, and THEP is one of my favorites, of any cuisine. I eat there at least twice a week. The menu is creative and extensive, and ingredients are fresh and flavorful. The drinks menu is extensive and while I generally drink beer with Thai food, I've gotten great martinis there too, and I see some inventive cocktails coming out of the bar (which is great for socializing). The staff is extremely attentive and helpful, and the service is fast. I highly recommend this place for dinner or a friendly drink.

So much yass for this spot. I've gone back numerous times for their lunch special and I am ALWAYS pleased. Service is fantastic, food is scrumptious and I took full advantage of their outdoor seating over the summer. Highly recommend the red curry if you can handle spice
Very dependable Thai.  Pad Thai, pork buns, papaya salad, any curry dish, summer rolls all highly Recommended.  Volcano chicken sounded great, but skip this one as it's short on flavor.

We came here for my sister's birthday dinner. It was awesome, great service, we were seated on time, and the food and drinks were really good (they're not cheap with the liquor lol). Nancy, our waitress was super friendly and made sure we enjoyed our night. I give this restaurant 2 thumbs up!

Great new Thai restaurant. Atmosphere is warm and interesting. Outdoor seating available as well. The food was delicious. Great drinks as well. We were there on a Friday night and the place was packed. People were eating at the bar as well as a couple of large shared tables. Can't wait to return!

Best Thai restaurant in NYC! I've had dinner at Thep twice now and am blown away by the quality of the food, decor, and service. They really pay attention to every detail - great vibe and the food is phenomenally fresh and fragrant. Tonight we ordered the steamed mussels, veggie tom yum soup, Cashew King with veggies, and red curry with tofu. Every dish was so good we were speechless during the whole meal. We savored everything.
Hands down my favorite Thai place in the city, heavily underrated. I love the food here, and the service is excellent. Killer lunch special (12$) too!

I know-5 stars. Is it that good? Yes! We love Thai food and this is hands down the best we've had in Manhattan. This place has it all:  nice decor, attentive service, great food. We had the lunch special:  salad, apps and entree-$12pp. We had Thai salad- crisp and fresh with tangy ginger dressing, apps of spring rolls and chicken goyza-cripsy but not over-done and then the entrees, which appeared to be full sized- green chicken curry and red curry with squid. OMG- the green curry was delish. Veggies  thinly sliced and the chicken had large pieces which were juice-not stringy or rubbery. My hubby has the red curry with squid. He's never had the red curry before and he LOVED it. I tried it too and with was a great too. (now I'll have to decided and between red and green when we go out!) All good. Great value. Service nice. They even leave a bottle of water on the table for you so you can have it whenever you want. Nice touch. We'll be back to check out the rest of the menu.

Nice atmosphere, clean and not overly crowded, good food - nothing fancy here - and the service is speedy and impeccable.  The staff always had a smile and worked well together.  Portions and prices are reasonable - I hope they keep up the good work.

All staff are friendly food is good and reasonably priced. mixtures of family and youngsters and everyone seems to be having fun. Drinks are well made . Silverware is classic. But at end it is the food that will bring you back

Friendly staff, awesome food, Definitely recommend! Been here a few times! My favorite is the avocado massamam curry! I order it with boneless and extra chicken and no peanuts! Thai iced tea is amazing as well!

Was very disappointed. While they sat us as per the wait list time the service was horrible. Our main course came out before the appetizer which we ended up not having. The check was wrong as we were overcharged for what we ordered. The food was good but not worth the hassle.

Can't stop raving about this place!  The decor, service, and food were excellent.  I came here on a chilly night, but the decorations and friendly waitstaff created such a warm and inviting atmosphere.  My pad see ew was delicious and I loved the little detail on top, which shows how much thought goes into everything here.  Will definitely go out of my way to dine here again!

The best Thai food in the UES. From the ambiance to their service to the food. Everything is exceptional here. Their lunch special is the best, and they give you more food and a drink compared to Up Thai's lunch special. Everything I've tried here is delicious.
Ordered there for take out a few times and it's been delicious every time. So flavorful and comes hot. Delivery guy was nice. No issues.

I've never eaten a lot of Thai food before and have typically just stuck to Chinese so take my review with a grain of salt as it relates to the food itself. First- the restaurant is decorated very well and I really like the overall vibe. If you've eaten at the previous restaurant you'll notice how many changes they made big and small and its great. The service was very attentive throughout the meal including making sure we had water, asking about needing more drinks and checking on if we liked our dishes. I hope this continues and it isn't just a "new restaurant" approach. Its definitely a differentiator. I got the pork buns to start which were great and tasty. For my main I had the chicken goddess (or something liked that). I liked it and it was probably a pretty basic dish compared to some of the other options on the menu- all spelled out with explanations. Overall I'd definitely recommend it to try and I'm excited to have it in the neighborhood.

Atmosphere and decor are great but the food is not both times I've had it. Everything we had was disappointing. The duck cashew salad had not a single cashew in it and only three measly pieces of pineapple. The Tom Kha soup was gross and severely over salted. The Goddess Garlic dish and the Ginger Joy were bland and tasteless. The good reviews here must be for the atmosphere-not the food. You're better off going to Spice.

Went on a Friday evening and service was very fast and friendly! Ordered the Drunken Noodle and the Spicy Udon and both were delicious. Both dishes were made to order how spicy we would like them which was great as well. The vegetarian duck was excellent in my dish!

My friend and I were headed to the UES (where we used to live) to go to Up Thai, where we used to frequent, but unfortunately it had a "grade pending" which turned us away. Thep was right around the corner and we went there instead and were very impressed. The pad see ew was too sweet for my friend's taste, but I loved it, and between the two of us we ate every bite of everything. Udon noodles that I had were delicious! Great and I think better than Up Thai.
Food is very good just wish THEP could do curry without fish/oyster sauce. Service is good and the decor is absolutely beautiful.
Amazing place. Delicious food and very nice cocktails. Very tradicional Thai with an excellent service. Can't wait to go there again.
it was good food, enjoyed a good day w fam in the city. nice ambience and presentation !
Better than UpThai . Many authentic options here and great atmosphere . UpThai is for tourists and noobs.arge portions
Thep brings awesome food and strong competition for Up Thai. Its menu is a bit more extensive and pricy, but offers some new flavors that Up Thai doesn't. Try the volcano chicken if you can.
Amazing gourmet Thai food on the Upper East Side. Good vegan and vegetarian options. Highly recommended.
Pleasantly surprised!! Best Thai meal in a long time. We will definitely dine here when we're in the neighborhood .
